name: The S.W.A.T. Game
description: Based upon the mid-1970's U.S. television show S.W.A.T. (Special Weapons And Tactics). Players compete to have their SWAT teams (each player controls two) be the first to capture the fleeing culprit. Players load their teams into a truck and race to the various hideouts where the culprit lurks. The teams disembark and attempt to get to the space occupied by the culprit by exact count.

name: Les Trésors des Cités Perdues
description: Game released by Nathan in the 1980's. Be the first player to save 4 artifacts by solving your cards correctly and finding the hidden location on the board.

name: Jungle Life DVD game
description:
Sequel to the popular "Wildlife DVD Boardgame".

The setting has moved from the Serengeti to the jungle.
The concept of the game remains the same though: Answer trivia questions related to the video fragments on the DVD. But there are a few minor changes. Up to 6 people can play now, 5 Questions must be answered each round, to determine the number of spaces you can move. 2 "Danger-plates" are added.

From the publisher's website:
In this exciting DVD board game, players help their chimpanzee make his way through a jungle full of danger. Every player has his or her own chimpanzee. Answer the trivia questions correctly and You can help save your chimpanzee and his friends' jungle home.

Jungle Life can be played with entire family and was developed in collaboration with National Geographic
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., Trends UK Ltd

name: Kokkelimonke Bilde
description: The game includes 400 different picture cards with unusual objects with various uses and funtions. Players try to guess or bluff the use/function of the item in play, and write a description on a note. These descriptions plus the right answer are then read out loud, so the players try to pick the right answer among the false ones.
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Jinx
description:
Jinx is a simple dice game whereby players strive to place three of their markers in a row on the game board.

Only the roll of the dice dictates the placement of your markers. One white dice and one black dice are rolled. The spot on the board where those two numbers meet is marked with your color. If you roll the same combination in the same round, you lose all of your markers currently on the board. Get three in a row and you win the round.

Win three rounds to win the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Run, Hamster, Run!
description:
Run, Hamster, Run! is a somewhat cut-throat strategy game for two to five players.

See the following site:
http://www.invisible-city.com/games/rhrnoframe.htm

Each player is a hamster on a 5x10 conveyor belt that leads to a pit of hungry Alligators. The object of the game is to be the last hamster left in play. There are several hazards that make this challenging:


The Conveyor Belt: You must keep moving up the Conveyor Belt or you'll get dumped off the edge into...
The Alligator Pit: At the end of the Conveyor Belt is a pit with one or more hungry alligators in it. If it comes down to a battle between a hamster and an alligator, my money's on the reptile.
Other hamsters: Other hamsters may try to push you into the Alligator Pit to increase their odds of being the last one in the game. Be careful!
Fatigue: The stress of constant exertion will wear down even the heartiest hamster. You've got to stop running eventually you know...


Instead of using dice, Run, Hamster, Run! has players put chips in a bag to determine the outcome of contests. This use of chips creates a strong focus on resource allocation. As the hamsters take damage or become fatigued, they lose chips from their pool, further emphasizing the importance of careful resource usage.

name: Baffles: Intriguing Game of Words
description:
A unique Word game of skill and strategy. You unscramble words or fill-in missing letters to solve "Word Puzzlers" - and 1 of every 5 cards is a RACE card, where all players RACE to answer. The goal is to advance around the gameboard and be the first to reach the center. There are 6 categories comprising 2,100 Word Puzzlers. Three methods of play: "Official" regular game (roughly 1-2 hours playing time), "Express" (fast-paced game about 1 hour) or "Expert" (hours upon hours of play). 2 to 6 players. Ages 12 and up.

Game includes: Gameboard, 420 Puzzle cards, 6 pawns, 6 markers, die, and instructions.
publishers: Chieftain Products, Marcam International Ltd., Maruca Industries

name: Lingon, lådvin och långkalsonger
description:
"Lingon, lådvin & långkalsonger" is an entertaining game where you win or loose points based on how typically swedish you behave.

The game contains 300 questions about everything from Eurovision song contest and croqs shoes to the swedish sausage "falukorv".

The rules state some examples on how to play the game but leaves a lot to the players to decide. But the main course of the game is that a question is given about how you would act/think in a certain situation (there are also some traditional quiz questions). The players then say or write down their answers. After this points are added/subtracted according to the backside of the card. The winner is the player with the most points at the end. This player is a so called "Svensson", a typical swede.

name: Angelspaß
description:
"The fishing game" exists in many versions with many sets of rules. To give an example of one such ruleset, the simplest version of Angelspaß from Selecta Spielzeug has players load the fishing area with the 18 magnetic fish. Players then take turns fishing with the rod, with each player having two chances to catch a fish and reel it out of the box, before the next player takes a turn. The game ends once all the fish have been caught, and the player with the longest line of fish wins.

Another version of Angelspaß from slightly older players brings a die into play. On a turn, a player rolls the die before fishing. If she rolls a color, she tries to catch a fish of that color while looking in the box. Catch an "out of season" color, and you have to throw the fish back. Roll a starfish, and you choose the color; roll an octopus, and you toss one fish held by an opponent back in the sea; roll a boot, and your turn gets booted! The first player to collect five fish wins.
publishers: Bookmark Verlag, Goula, Litor, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spielzeug, Toys Pure

name: The Big Bang Theory: Trivia Party Game
description:
Be the first player to put together your Pixel Pal character (5 pieces) by answering trivia questions correctly.
Questions cover the first 7 seasons of The Big Bang Theory.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Happy Hooligan Game
description:
Happy Hooligan was a popular and influential early American comic strip by Frederick Burr Opper.

Target game. The gun fires corks at up to 8 targets, all characters from the comic strip;
Happy Hooligan
Montmorency
Gloomy Gus
Mr. Dough
The Cop
Boitram
Foidinand
Hoiman

Cover shows Happy Hooligan with a bow and arrow, attempting to shoot an apple off Flip the Dog's head.

The winner is the one with the most successful shots when you call a halt to the game session.

name: Shift
description: Shift is basically a sliding-tile puzzle for up to four players. The board is a 6x6 grid, with an extra row of 6 on each side to serve as a home base, for a total of 60 squares. Each player has 12 tiles in his color, plus an extra 11 white tiles to fill out the board. On his turn, a player makes six shifts to the puzzle, attempting to move his tiles across the board. The winner is the first person to move six of his pieces into the home base across from him. With four players, the game can also be played in partnership.

name: Früchtchen
description: A odd filler-type game with lots of little colored dice. Each player tries to harvest fruit, and the interesting mechanism is that some of the dice you roll are given to others other players, and this can help you. Of all the Fanfor games, this is one of the more approachable ones.

name: Friends & Fortunes
description: This game consists of a series of stages, each of which is a sub-game taken from game theory (ie dollar auction, tragedy of the commons, prisoner's dilemma, and coalition forming). Players are forced into "co-opetition" in order to further their position and make the most money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: JUMP: Genesis Die-Cast Messiahs vs. Cannibal Korp
description:
JUMP: Genesis Die-Cast Messiahs vs. Cannibal Korp is a strategic level conquest game that can be played solo or with up to 4 players if a second set is used.

The object of the game is to conquer the Home World(s) of the other player by using space and ground forces, and fortifications as defense. Although most of the pieces are hex tiles, special measuring sticks are included which are used in the basic game, and even more sticks for the miniatures game.

The components are actually usable in three ways. (1) As a stand alone game for 1-2 (3-4 with additional sets) player, (2) as an expansion for JUMP: Into the Unknown, or (3) as a tactical miniature game.

name: Super Passa ou Repassa
description: Super Passa ou Repassa is a game based on a tv show. It's a quiz game for teens that permits you to do a trick if you don't know how to answer the questions. The timer in this game is a kind of slider. A game for those Ages 8 and up.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Glasnost
description:
Game about peace and communications between the USSR and the Western world - the end of the Cold War.

Players take sides as either Americans or Soviets. As players move around the gameboard according to the dictates of a die, they will eventually engage in debates on specific issues. A neutral player will judge which player has the better argument and award the winning side a Peace Chip. The player and side that accumulates the target number chips (this varies with the number of players) wins.
publishers: John N. Hansen Co., Inc., Olga International

name: The Chronicles of Narnia
description:
The game based on the spellbinding BBC dramatization of the novels of C.S. Lewis

An extremely light collecting game in which players race to complete their respective set of cards, which are small pieces of a picture that depicts a scene from the TV series. Each player has his or her own scene to collect, but competition is possible by placing cards to impede your opponents.

The game's main feature of note is the interlocking wheels - you roll the die and move one wheel, which in turn rotates the larger wheel.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: News Paper
description: In News Paper up to 4 players have to fill their own page of a newspaper with headlines, articles & pictures. Looks a bit like a mixture of Extrablatt & Scrabble.

name: Foot Loose
description: Footloose is a unique game that combines physical activity with simple board game strategies. Invented by a physical education teacher, Footloose enhances both large and small motor skills, as well as color recognition. It is an ideal game for the very young game player whose energy level prohibits quiet game play. There are several variations of play that progress in difficulty.

name: Grave Danger
description:
The objective of this Roll and Move game is to be the first player to exit the graveyard. The mummy and the skeleton may send players flying off the board if they land on their spaces. Players can turn the Dial-of-Doom to trigger surprises.

From the box
Welcome to Grave Danger, the game that features a gruesome graveyard packed with all kinds of strangely weird things. Now that you're here, the first thing you'll want to do is get out. that, my friend, is how you win.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kojit-8
description: This game is completely abstract in nature. Create different scoring combinations by disk placement.

name: Bango! Bango!
description: An H-shaped plastic board has six marbles on each of the sides. Players hit the ends of the board with their Bango stick to move the marbles up the ramp. If the marble is tapped properly, it will enter the inside (cross bar) ramp leading to the center section of the game. When a player's sixth marble enters the ramp, the arrow will point to that player as the winner.

name: Best Number Game Ever!
description: This matching game uses entertaining illustrations of Lowly Worm, Huckle Cat, Hilda Hippo, Sergeant Murphy, Mr. Frumble, Bananas Gorilla, and other Busytown characters from "The Busy World of Richard Scarry" to help children understand basic math skills. The six game boards vary in degree of difficulty from the first, which teaches youngsters to count objects, to the last, which stresses number recognition. Includes rules for several different games including memory games with adding and subtracting, rolling the dice to add the numbers to fill a game board, and a fast-paced game of "tens" in which players try to collect pairs of cards that add up to 10.

name: Dizzy Spell
description: The board is 5x5 with holes which are initially covered with reversible O/X pieces, all on the O side. Then a card with letters which align with the holes is inserted in the base. The first player uncovers two letters, making sure his opponent sees them too, then replaces the plugs, X side up. Play continues with the players alternating. After the third pair of letters has been revealed, each player may guess a word every turn. To do so, announce the word, then expose the letters (from the Xs) in the correct order. If correct, the player keeps the pieces removed and those letters can no longer be used. If incorrect, remove 2 points from the guesser's score. Once all letters are X side up, continue the process but flip the pieces back to the O side. Play continues until all the pieces are back to the O side or both players decide to give up. Score 1 point per piece.

name: Guelfi e Ghibellini
description: Old style wargame set in medieval central Italy. Players are local lords (plus the Pope and the Emperor) fighting and trading for control of land and troops.

name: Mazuma
description:
You are a SpaceRacer sitting in the cockpit of a StarCruiser ready to blast off from Earth Base in the race of your life for money. Well, really it's for Mazuma... the money of the future. But to acquire any of this Interplanetary Currency you must speed to as many planets as possible.

Sound like fun? It's a cosmic blast! But it's also risky.

At any time during the race other SpaceRacers will try to beam themselves onto your StarCruiser and take over full command. To prevent this from happening you must out-maneuver these impostors without incident and be the first back to Earth Base with the right stuff.

Now if you like to speed, make predictions, cause havoc and laugh, Mazuma is the game for you.

So buckle up and hold on tight because this is one race that's Out Of This World!!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Elmo's Birthday Game
description: In this track game, players race along the path to 123 Sesame Street trying to be the first to greet Elmo at his surprise birthday party. Players start the game with 3 birthday presents. On a turn you spin the spinner and advance to the next open space of the color you spun. If the space has a picture of Elmo, you deposit 1 of your presents in the hall (there's a 3-D backdrop) of 123 Sesame Street and advance Elmo 1 space up his central path (he has batteries and giggles when he walks). Oscar the Grouch spaces move Elmo backwards. The first player to deliver all his presents, and advance to the top step of 123 Sesame Street when Elmo has reach the bottom step is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: What's Rubbish
description:
Contents: Game board, 8 recycling bins, 50 small cards, 4 litter bug cards, 4 counters, spinner, 3D bin.

Players move around the board and collect rubbish. They attempt to fill their recycling bins.

name: Feed Me!
description:
This childrens game features a plastic toy carnivorous plant whose mouth is hinged so that it slams shut. To play, players take turns placing marbles into the mouth. If the mouth remains open, your turn is over. If the mouth snaps shut, you're out of the game. The last player remaining wins.

For an advanced game players are given an equal number of red and black marbles. On a turn you roll a die and place the colored marble indicated into the mouth. If it stays open, your turn is over. If it snaps shut, you must take all the marbles in the mouth and add them to your other marbles. The winner is the first player to get rid of all their marbles.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Gladiatorerna
description:
Based on the Swedish version of the TV show "American Gladiators", where the players compete in different activities.

The game is for 2-4 players and is played out over 7 rounds, each one represented by a different minigame. In a two-player game the players take turns being the challenger or the gladiator. If the challenger defeats the gladiator in a turn they get markers/points which are used in the last turn. The winner of the last turn is the winner of the entire game.



The different minigames

Gatloppet (The Gauntlet)In the Gauntlet the challenger tries to outwit the gladiator, while the gladiator tries to predict the challenger's next move. The challenger starts the game by picking cards of two different types. They then play one card at a time, the gladiator trying to match them. The challenger gets to move forward every time the gladiator fails to predict which card the challenger played. If the challenger gets to the finish line before running out of cards, they have won the round and get points depending on how many cards they have left in hand.


Duellen (The Duel, orig. Joust)The Duel is a card based color matching game where the players simultaneously try to build ladders by combining cards with the same colored symbols on them. The game ends when one player can't continue their ladder. Points are awarded depending on how many cards are left in the player's hand, less than 5 yielding the maximum score. The challenger won't get any points if the gladiator finishes their ladder first.


Ringarna (The Rings, orig. Hang Tough)The Rings is a tactical challenge played out in six turns. The challenger must move over to the gladiator's space or reach one of the eight scoring squares by playing movement cards. The gladiator's role is to catch the challenger by ending up on their space or to prevent them from reaching the score tiles by blocking their path.


Väggen (The Wall)In the Wall the challenger tries to reach the top before time runs out or the gladiator catches them. It is played out over seven rounds. In each round the challenger calls out how many spaces they want to move in that turn. They then spin a spinner numbered 1 to 12. The challenger gets to move if the spinner shows the same number or higher. In round 4 the gladiator takes up the chase following the same movement rules but using the gladiator's spinner numbered 4 to 15. The minigame ends after seven rounds or after the challenger has either been caught or reached the top.


Rekylen (Recoil, orig. Snapback)In Recoil the challenger tries to steal markers from the game board by moving their piece to the desired color. To accomplish this they must have the correct colored card in their hand. If they don't they can chose to play the card turned face down and spin the spinner to try to get the correct color. The gladiator then tries to respond with the same colored card or by spinning the spinner to the same color in order to protect the marker. The minigame is over when the gladiator has played all of their cards.


Attackboll (Attack Ball, orig. Powerball)In Powerball the challenger tries to place cardboard chits in the receiver by balancing them on a cardboard "spoon". The gladiator has a slightly larger "spoon" with which they try to block the challenger. The minigame ends when the time runs out.


Hinderbanan (The Obstacle Course, orig. The Eliminator)The Obstacle Course is the final minigame, the winner takes it all. Players take turns trying to match symbols on a track by turning over cardboard tokens, a bit like Memory. The player with the most points from previous minigames starts and gets a number of markers equal to the difference between the players' scores. That player gets to keep turning over tokens until they fail. If they fail and have no markers remaining, the next player gets to start turning over pieces to try to match their symbols. If they do have any markers, they discard one and keep turning over tokens until they are out of markers. The player who first matches all of their symbols wins the entire game.

name: The Little Mermaid Under the Sea Card Game
description: This is a children's matching game based on the Disney film. On your turn, you try to match a card from your hand with the top card on the discard pile. Matches are made by the character picture on the card, or by the color in the card's corner. If you cannot make a match, you must draw a card. Ariel cards are wild. Playing an Ursula card forces all your opponents to draw another card. The first player to run out of cards in his or her hand wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: RoboCop VCR Game
description:
This VCR game is based on the RoboCop movies. You watch the game video (uses actual RoboCop movie footage) and get action cues to make moves. The goal of the game is to be the first to make four arrests and return to the Police Station. There is a warning sticker on the box that states "Based on the hit R-Rated move, Edited to be suitable for ages 12 and above.

When landing on a given space, the player scans the tape until the code letter from the gameboard appears. The player then watches the footage to see what happens in the game. There are 5 different locations, not including the Police Station, and these are in rotation on the tape many times over – so you don’t rewind the tape, you just scan forward to the next location when the next player happens to land on one of the special locations. Eventually, you will have to rewind it when you reach the end, but you will have skipped lots of scenes by then and when you continue playing from the beginning you still have many new scenes to resolve that haven’t been used yet.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Amazing Game Board Book
description:
A book with more than 50 games and activities for adults children.

THE AMAZING GAME BOARD BOOK
Exercise Your Brain!

More than 50 games and activities, including:

Foam Chinese Checkers Board with 60 Colorful Pegs ○ 28 Dominoes ○ United States Word Search ○ Secret Codes ○ Magnetic Checkers ○ Write-ON/Wipe-off Drawing Board with Erasable Marker ○ Mazes ○ Brain Teasers ○ 30-Piece, Two-Sided Jigsaw Puzzle ○ State That State Geography Game with Color Die ○ 7- Piece Magnetic Tangrams ○ Superstar Hangman ○ Reusable Fortune-Teller ○ 20 Questions ○ Fill-in Fiction Language Game ○ Optical Illusions ○ 84 Magnetic Tri-Za-Ic (tm) Pieces ○ Tic-Tac-Toe ○ Cosmic Science Games ○ Add-iplication Operation Math Game ○ Easy-To-Follow Game Instructions

Plus dozens of spin-off activities and built-in storage box!

GREAT FOR TRAVEL!

Written by
Shereen Gertel Rutman

Illustrated by
John Clementson

Designed by Carrie Abel

Ages 6-99
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Maze, Memory, Number, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Lethbridge On Board
description:
Check out what the Chinook winds have blown our way ... tumbling down the east coast of the rocky mountains and tangled among the the tumbleweeds, Lethbridge On Board got caught in a barbed wire fence and landed in the city!

Lethbrige On Board is a '-opoly style' property owning and trading game themed after prominent landmarks in the city of Lethbridge, Alberta, Canada.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Monopoly: Uniquely Singapore
description: This game was introduced as part of the country's "Uniquely Singapore" tourism campaign. The key difference between this and the Monopoly - Singapore edition is that instead of street names as real estate for purchase, the new board features clusters like the tourist attraction cluster - Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park etc, the shopping cluster - Marina Bay, Orchard Road, and the arts and entertainment cluster - Victoria Concert Hall, Esplanade, etc. The game also introduces two new tokens of local flavour - the Kucinta cat and the trishaw.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sesame Street 35th Anniversary Game
description: The Sesame Street 35 Years Anniversary Game is a trivia board game released by Rose Art in 2004 to celebrate the 35th Anniversary of Sesame Street. The game features two types of question cards, for "kids" and "adults". Players navigate around the circular board while answering timed questions. The "kids" questions are designed to be simpler and focus more on the more recent years of the show's history and characters or topics taught by Sesame Street. The "adult" questions tend to cover a more broad span of the show's history and characters. Questions are based mainly on characters and other "on-screen" information, and there is little attention given to behind-the-scenes or production information and history. There are multiple choice, single choice, and true or false questions. Some of the questions are accompanied by a picture of the relevant character or object.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Flocks
description: The wild and wacky game of memory and luck. Collect the most Flocks from the twenty-one different types of bird cards, but beware! This daft and daffy game also also has the Spying Spectacle Bird that allows you to look at other players' cards and the Crazy Cuckoo Bird that lets you grab someone else's Flocks.

name: Pick Out Stix
description:
"Grab a color...but don't touch the sides!"

This is a simple electronic dexterity game for all ages.
Twenty-eight plastic, chrome-plated rods are placed in holes through a conductive play field. The holes are about a quarter-inch wider than the diameter of the rods, and there are holes under the holes to keep the rods centered and vertical. A handle with conductive, spring-loaded, plier-like pincher is wired to the base unit. When the circuit is completed between the play field and the pincers, a loudish explosion sound goes off and a small light goes on. The top of the rods are slightly flattened and have a piece of tape on the flat sides.

The game consists of rolling a big die marked with the three colors, and then using the pliers to pull out a rod of that color without touching the edge of the play field hole, ala Operation. The instructions instruct players to grab the rods by the edges (non-taped) of the flattened top, I suppose to ensure a solid contact between the rod and pincher.

It's not that easy. You have to watch carefully that you're pulling the rods out exactly vertical, and there's little "feel" using the pliers to judge the force you're using. The circuit is very sensitive and doesn't let you get away with much. The explosion sound was surprisingly loud the first time I tried the game, not at all like the Operation buzzer - startled the crap out of me. Same thing apparently happened to the kid pictured on the box...

name: ConXion
description: ConXion is an abstract game using hexagonal tiles. The game is primarily for three players (it can also be played by two or six). The object is to connect the opposing sides of the board in your color with the center. Tiles must be placed so they connect to the center. Instead of placing one of their tiles, a player can rotate anyone's tile, which can change the connectivity considerably.

name: Polyp
description:
Polyp is a little like Chinese Checkers plus the expansion of polyps, who can capture enemy playing pieces (here called fishes).

Important though, that the game ends finally, when all fishes have either reached their destinations or are captured. So the winner is the one who has most of successful fishes plus captured ones.

Quite unusual are the polyps: they are 5 pieces connected together with a thin metallic chain, which enables to move only 2 fields away from each other polyp part!

name: The Christmas Game
description: Each player tries to be the first to finish his Christmas shopping. He must purchase a $1 gift, a $5 gift, a $25 gift, a $50 gift, a $100 gift and a $200 gift. The game is over when one person completes his shopping.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Animales de la Muerte
description: A free game about the size of a bookmark, given away at GenCon Indy 2006. Each player tries to earn points by killing evil zombie animals. They can pick up weapons to help them, and each turn get to move some zombies to try and kill off their opponent. Zombies will reappear at certain points at the end of each turn, providing a near endless supply of monsters.

name: Diamino
description:
French word game similar to Scrabble, but played without a board. Players place letters to form and cross words in French. There are a total of 63 letter tiles which have different values from 1 to 9, including two "devil" tiles that function as wild.

Many editions of this game have been printed in differing colors.

name: Sabotage
description:
Sabotage - "A Pocket War Game for two players"

"Sabotage is a game of securing weaponry and attacking strategic buildings, railways, bridges, etc."

Components: There is a small board (lined with felt on the bottom - a nice touch), 3 pawns of a distinct color for each player, red chips, blue chips, 2D6 and a deck of target cards.

The board consists of 3 columns of 8 spaces each. Each column has a blank space on either end (starting spaces), one blue space with a picture of a grenade, one red space with a picture of a bomb, and 4 spaces with a picture of a different target (there are 6 different targets).

You move up and down the columns according to dice rolls (each pawn staying in its column) trying to collect weapons. When two of your tokens land on matching weapon spaces, you collect a weapon - take a blue chip for a grenade and a red chip for a bomb. You collect two weapons (chips) of the appropriate color if you end your movement with all three pawns on spaces picturing the same weapon. If you land on your opponent, send them back to their start space.

Before rolling the dice on your turn, you can turn up a target card. Up to two target cards may be face up at one time. Each card shows a picture of a target and the 'cost' in weapons to successfully attack it. If you don't have the the weapons to successfully attack it, you lose all your weapons. If you 'Double land' (as described to collect weapons) on a target that is face-up, you attack it. You 'pay' the proper weapons to collect the target card. If you turn up a 'sabotage' card, you lose all of your weapons. First to collect 6 target cards wins.

name: Color Catch
description:
The Colorful chameleon is constantly changing colors. Be the first player to recognize the correct color pattern from all the player's cards wins the chameleon card. The Player with the most Chameleon cards wins.

A fast paced pattern recognition game. You'll need fast hands and an even faster eye to compete.

name: Biathlon
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Players compete in an Olympic biathlon event. Competitors from the US, France, Russia, Canada, and Italy seek to ski through the course with the fastest time while shooting accurately at three groups of targets. Each skier is rated for shooting accuracy and physical ability.

name: Het Pinkeltje Spel
description:
Who is the first to reach Pinkelotje?

Try to reach the forest at the other side and return home to Pinkelotje. Each player gets one pawn. You move your pawn by taking a "can I" card, then ask the player left of you if you may use the given card. He or she answers by saying "yes, you can" or "no, you can't". If you are not allowed to use the card, then take a "you cannot" card, and follow the directions on it. The board has some obstacles you must avoid. When you reached the forest, take your Pinkelotje picture and return home.

This game is based on the popular dutch character Pinkeltje from writer Dick Laan.

name: Top 15
description:
The goal of Top 15 is to align 15 counters ascending from 1 to 15. The quicker player wins.

Each player gets a small board with 3x 5 pits where the plastic counters will be placed face down (well mixed before). Ready, set, go! Both players are allowed to look the number of one counter and then to put it back. Only if they find the number one they may put it into a guideway to mark progress. Then they go on with number two, three etc.

To make it more difficult, players are only allowed to use one hand (the other holds the board).
This game was designed to train memory skills as well as fine-tune motor abilities.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Number
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: The Cinderella Game
description:
At the beginning the clock is set for 12 o'clock. The pawn stands at the field with the glassy shoes.

Each player takes a set of cards and lays them with un-bewitched side open at the table. The player throws the die and draws the pawn. Is the final field a good fairy he is allowed to bewitch one of his cards. He turns it so that the bewitched side is open. Is it an evil fairy one bewitched card has to be turn to the other side. The player whose cards with ball dress, a coach, horses, coachman and prince are open in front of him wins.

From the back of the box:
Take your turn to spin the spinner and see what it says for you to do. Magic the storycards with the Fairy Godmother; Unmagic the storycards with the Nasty Stepsisters. Win the heart of the Handsome Prince, or move the clock forward three hours, but beware!!! ... tick, tock, tick, tock... when midnight comes, you must Unmagic all your storycards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy

name: Fission
description: Fission is a game where players attempt to eliminate all of their opponents stones but must have at least one stone left on the board in order to win. Played on a 8x8 grid, players have interlocked groups of 12 stones each. Piece can be moved in an orthogonal or diagonal direction and do not stop until they reach either the edge of the board or hit another stone. If stopped by another stone, the moved stone and all adjacent stones are removed from the board.

name: Erstes Rechnen
description:
This game can be played in various formations. One game is played like Memory with players turning over tiles to find matching numbers. Another game has players rolling dice and selecting tiles that match the total and then filling up a player mat.

Translation of description from speldatabase.be
Six large boards each contain 10 drawings. Each time the sequence of numbers from 1 to 10 visually presented. Each card has its own theme. All 60 illustrations are also at much separate tickets.

The rulebook suggests many different ways to use this material.

As a warm-up, each player gets a playmat. The legkaartjes be dealt on the table and each player is trying to quickly collect ten cards.

Later, a lottery game played which also drawing upon the memory. The legkaartjes now lie face down in the middle. On his turn, each player now looking for tickets that fit with the player's mat.

The box also contains two regular dice. That you can use the right cards to collect. After looking dice each player a card with the same figure.

Each player who wins all ten cards can collect.

The illustrations are today but what about old fashioned charm because of their simple charm. Young children look really illustrations bearing the requisite number image is. The many game modes make this game more than once can be used.

Apparently a different game from the same-titled Erstes Rechnen.

name: The Famous Five Card Game
description: This is a children's card game based on the theme of "The Famous Five," a fictional group of English children who appear in books written by Enid Blyton. The card game is basically a rummy variation incorporating storytelling through plot lines depicted on the cards. The cards incorporate story lines from the fourth, fifth and eighth titles in the Famous Five series. The game was reissued in 1978 with new artwork on the box and cards to coincide with the appearance of a short-lived television series based on the books.

name: Goldesel
description:
"Dora, David and Dorothy are donkeys: but not any old kind of donkey, special donkeys. They are really little golden donkeys. With a bit of luck they are happy to give away some of their precious treasures. Therefore you have to have some luck and uncover the right cards..."

Players reveal tiles that instruct them to collect one of three colored donkeys. In subsequent turns, the donkeys will move from owner to owner until the "we give you coins" tile is turned up. At this point, players collect coins for any donkeys that are in front of them. The game also comes with tiles to use with "elder players." Even with the additional tiles, the game is purely chance. But children will need to interpret the new directions (ex: all donkeys move to the left).

Children learn colors, taking turns, counting to three, and simple directions (left/right).

name: Young Folks Historical Game
description: Typical Q&A game focused on American history for children. As it was made around the turn of the last century, children were actually expected to know some history, like details of the American Civil War and "recent" history, like the building of the Brooklyn Bridge.

name: UNO: Polly Pocket
description:
The usual UNO rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Rockin' Blockin' card - a special wild card that can be used in two different ways:

Rock the card: Play this card and each of your opponents must draw one card from the draw pile.

Block their cards: If the player before you plays a Wild Draw 4 card, you can instantly discard the Rockin' Blockin' card to block their card. If you do this, you don't have to draw four cards and you still get to take your turn.

name: Conscience
description:
Conscience is the fun way to learn right from wrong and help your children build the foundation to make the right choices in life!

It provides fast paced, interactive and lecture-free forum for family dialogue on issues of Crime, Violence, Drugs, Sex (via optional overlay), Education, Character and Charity which are challenging children at younger and younger ages.

Children will have fun developing their conscience and will power before and after facing difficult real life situations.

Travel paths of right and wrong with your children! Collect Gold Stars! Build Right Paths! Avoid Black Marks! Make a personal commitment to stay on the right path for life!

Will you make the right choice?
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Track Movement

name: 100 Pipers: Battle of the Clans
description:
Roll and move game from the 1960's. More info on how to play the game to follow. Game features a playing board, 4 plastic men and 2 dice.

The game is about two clan chieftains fighting for territory.

The winning player is the Chieftain whose eventual strength of territories, Clansmen and dues, defeats all other players by surviving until all the other Chieftains lose all of their territories.

It was designed and published by Marketplan for the House of Seagram, to promote Seagram's 100 Pipers brand of Scotch whisky.

name: Nun Bowling
description:
Nun Bowling, It's Sinfully Fun!

For 1 or more players

To bowl is human; the perfect game: divine.
You always knew sinning could be fun, but you never realized how much fun-until now. These STERN, ruler-armed, saintly sisters are just asking for retribution, whether you have Catholic school flashbacks or simply don't like their fashion sense. Strike back with the included 10 nun pins, ball of hellfire and 32-page book.

name: So ein Kamel
description:
Players allocate their dice to load and unload differently numbered camels.

Game ends when all camels are loaded. Players score points for individual camels and rows and columns of camels 'they have loaded'. Player with the most vp wins!

name: Monopoly: Strasbourg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Strasbourg, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wereld-Delen
description:
In this game, each player is an inhabitant of one of the continents. At the start of the game, each player will receive an assignment, which will involve visiting some location on another continent. When a player reaches his destination, he gets another assignment. The first player to complete all four assignments related to his continent wins the game.

Players travel across the board by throwing one or two dice and moving the exact amount shown. Players cannot pass each other, except on the airport spaces. If a player lands exactly on top of another player, that other player is returned to his home town. In addition, on some squares a player must draw a Route Card or an Action Card that will trigger some special effect.

The assignments represent certain questions that the player is supposed to find an answer to, such as Does apartheid exist in Latin-America? When a player completes his assignment, he receives a card which contains the answer to that question.

In the advanced version of the game, General Problems are added, which concern problems that aren’t linked to one of the continents. Each player receives two cards describing such a problem. Cards describing the solutions are distributed among the players. In addition to completing their assignments, the players also need to find the solution to their General Problems. Certain locations on the game board offer the option to ask another player for the solution card, as do certain Action Cards. (One of these locations is New York, as headquarters of the United Nations.)

The expert version of the game adds the United Nations Securtiy Council to the game. Players visiting New York can now call for a meeting of the Security Council. During such a meeting, the players vote on the positioning of UN Armies. These armies block player movement. No player can pass them (but by landing on top of them, they can be removed).

name: Digimon D-tector Card Game
description:
The DIGIMON D-TECTOR CARD GAME is an offshoot from the Digimon Collectible Card Game. The cards are compatible with the D-TECTOR digital device, but also allow a typical CCG game.
The D-TECTOR device is apparently quite rare in the USA.
The game allows players to collect and battle with Digimon. There are 4 Card types, Digimon, Digivolve, Digi-modify, and Digi-Destined. There are also 4 sub-types of Digimon, Rookie, Ultimate, Champion, & Mega. The Goal of the game is to defeat the opponent's Digimon, and gain Data Points.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spacego
description:
Spacego is a science fiction wargame in the general mold of Space Hulk, although significantly less complex. A large alien ship is approaching Earth with unknown intentions. Two to four players are heroes who enter the ship with the objective of planting explosives to destroy it. Another player is the "master" of the ship who controls the aliens and tries to prevent the heroes from carrying out their mission.

The heroes and aliens each have individual record boards to track their attributes, which can change during play. Much of the game revolves around tables of positive and negative events which get rolled on for various reasons.

Unlike in some similar games, in Spacego the hero players can attack each other as well as the aliens.

name: Pendulum Pool
description:
Players try to get their balls to holes using a unique pendulum mechanism to strike the cue ball.
Who strikes all of his balls to holes first wins the game.

name: Tempo Tempo
description:
In Tempo Tempo, the players have to match patterns to animals.

At the start of the game, each player receives a set of animal cards (cow, rabbit, dog, cheetah, hyena and ladybug). There is also a deck of pattern cards; each of these cards shows a pattern that appears on one of the animals.

The game is played in rounds. Each round, someone reveals a pattern card, then players must race to play the matching animal card. The first player to play an animal may keep the pattern card if he played the right animal; he then returns the animal card to his hand. If he played the wrong animal, both his animal card and the pattern card are discarded.

After all pattern cards have been revealed, the player who has collected the most pattern cards wins.

name: Wer hat die Kokosnuss geklaut?
description:
Objective: collect as many quality coconuts as possible
- moving by turns -
1. Preparation of the game - place all coconut tiles face down (good and bad) on dedicated fields
2. roll the die and move - if the die shows the tiger move back to your starting place
3. if you step on a coconut - pick it up and check
4. if you land on an opponent's meeple - steal a coconut and put her/him in the middle of the board (palm tree)
5. if there are only 4 or less coconuts on the board use a rolled '4' to move AND steal a coconut from a player

Die Spielidee: 2 - 4 Affen rasen auf die Lichtung und jagen nach Kokosnüssen. Dabei passiert eine ganze Menge. Der Tiger ist auch unterwegs und den mögen die Affen nicht. Wer zum Schluss die meisten Kokosnüsse (geklaut) hat, ist nicht unbedingt Sieger, denn es gibt auch faule Nüsse.

name: Pogromly
description:
A anti-semitic variant of Monopoly, self-published in 1997 in Germany by the neo-Nazis Beate Zschäpe, Uwe Mundlos and Uwe Böhnhardt, who later formed the underground terrorist group "NSU". Several copies were discovered in Zschäpe's garage in the course of a razzia against neo-Nazi activists in the city of Jena on January 28, 1998. According to newspaper articles referring to an official secret service report, it was sold by André Kapke to fellow neo-Nazis as a solidary fundraising for 100 German Marks after the trio's disappearance into illegality. Kapke, however, diverted those funds. In the framework of the NSU trial, the game is used by the prosecution as proof for Zschäpe's political committment and her alleged active involvement in the murder of 9 immigrants and 1 police officer, as well as other capital crimes supposedly carried out by the NSU.

The aim of the game is to "clean" cities (the "streets" in Monopoly) of Jews. Instead of 4 railroads, there are 4 different concentration camps. There are fields for SS and SA (chance and community chest), gasworks (waterworks), and a field depicting Hitler. A couple of dozens of copies are said to exist.

name: Nähdään kellon alla!
description:
This is a trivia game about Finland's capital city Helsinki. There are 8 categories of questions: Restaurants & Nightlife, Culture & Sports, History, Streets & Places, Buildings & Statues, Companies & Institutions, Outside Helsinki and Infrastructure & Nature.

Every player chooses a different starting place/category from where they will start to slowly travel towards the spot "Under the clock". You can choose one of the eight categories and that means that you have one more question from the chosen category than other categories, and the starting places are otherwise asymmetric too; for example, a player who's more knowledgeable in the restaurant scene might want to take the route through Eira, while someone who's used to moving about outside of the actual city centre might want to start in the district of Sörnäinen.

All question cards have a hard and an easy question. If you choose the hard question and get it right then you get to the next place and you can go on. If you choose the easy question and get it right then you get to the next place, but your turn is over. If your answer is not right, you won't get forward at all, so the only way to progress in the game is to know (or guess) the trivia correctly.

Winner is the first player to get "Under the Clock". "Nähdään kellon alla" (or, in it's full form, "Nähdään Stockan kellon alla") is a Helsinki saying and means "See you under the [Stockmann] clock". The clock in question is the overhanging clock by the main entrance of the Stockmann department store, which has been a city landmark and a well-known meeting point in Helsinki since 1965. Thematically, the players have agreed to meet each other "Under the clock" and the first one to arrive made it in time, while the others will be late.

The game is fully Finnish/Swedish bilingual on purpose, down to every single detail; this is stressed out in the rules, to emphasize Helsinki as a bilingual city with both of the official languages of Finland, Finnish and Swedish.

A version of the game set in Tampere, the second biggest city of Finland was published in 2017: Nähdään Kosken Rannassa, and one set in Turku, the former capital and now the third biggest city of Finland, in 2019; Nähdään Täl Pual Jokke.

name: 7 Missions
description: 7 Missions is a deck-building card game in the Monster Maker world setting. Players use their decks to attract allies, buy equipment, and lure monsters onto the other player. On a player's turn, he must try to get rid of as many monsters on his land as possible. The first player to reach level seven – i.e., rid seven lands of monsters – wins the game.

name: Kommissar Rex: Das Kriminalspiel für Spürnasen
description:
Rex is running through Vienna and looking for the tracks of bad guys, which he must follow. In these places you will always find instructions that you must collect for further game.
Roll the dice and move.
The winner of the game is player who resolves properly the case.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battle
description:
Battle is a small, simplified version of Battle: The Game of Strategy. The players each have six infantry and four armor units, which they secretly set up at opposite ends of a 9x12 hex grid. On a turn a player may move any or all of their pieces and can eliminate an opponent's piece by getting a greater combat value of pieces adjacent to it. Combat values are different in the three different terrain types.

The object of the game is to move a piece into the opponent's headquarters space.

This was published in GAMES Magazine, in the May/June 1981 issue. Scans of the two pages are available.

name: Tralalaa
description:
At the beginning of the game, each player secretly receives a team card. They don't know who will be their partner, so they'll have to judge everyone fairly.
At the beginning of the round, each player gets 7 cards with a piece of lyrics on them. They proceed to draft all the cards until they receive one last from their neighbor. Then, they all try to compose a short song with 5 of their cards. They can choose to use the lyrics, or to flip the card over to the "Tralalaa" card instead. When everyone is ready, players take turns singing the song they just wrote (humming, shouting or beatboxing on each card on the "Tralalaa" face), with the tune and musical genre of their choice. After each performance, other players each award one point or zero to the player who just sang. But don't be to harsh: remember, anyone can be on your team!

name: Family Game Night Book and Game Set: Scrabble, Clue, Sorry, Yahtzee
description:
In Scrabble, players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces.

In Clue, players move from room to room in a mansion to solve the mystery of: who done it, with what, and where? Players are dealt character, weapon, and location cards after the top card from each card type is secretly placed in the confidential file in the middle of the board. Players must move to a room and then make an accusation against a character saying they did it in that room with a specific weapon. The player to the left must show one of any cards accused to the accuser if in that player's hand. Through deductive reasoning each player must figure out which character, weapon, and location are in the secret file. To do this, each player must uncover what cards are in other players hands by making more and more accusations. Once a player knows what cards the other players are holding they will know what cards are in the secret file. A great game for those who enjoy reasoning and thinking things out.

In Sorry!, players race their four game pieces from Start around the board to Home. By turning over a card from the draw deck and following its instructions, players move their pieces around the game board, switch places with players, and knock opponents' pieces off the track and back to their Start position.

Yahtzee is a classic dice game played with 5 dice. Each player's turn consists of rolling the dice up to 3 times in hope of making 1 of 13 categories. Examples of categories are 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, straight, full house, etc. Each player tries to fill in a score for each category, but this is not always possible. When all players have entered a score or a zero for all 13 categories, the game ends and total scores are compared.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Switch and Signal
description: In Switch and Signal, you take the role of engineers, signalmen, switchmen, and yardmasters working together to load trains with cargo, navigate a congested railway network, and deliver cargo to the port city of Savannah, Georgia. Switches and signals are used to guide trains along routes. For every train that reaches the port, you gain victory points. You win the game by gaining at least 40 victory points, and 60 victory points is a perfect game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: WarMage: Apprentice Edition
description:
"The fragile peace between mages has always been kept by the legendary WarMage of High Bastion. From the Stone Seat, the authority of the WarMage over the mages of Elerania has been absolute and unchallenged for decades... until now.
Now the WarMage is dead, the world of mages is in chaos, and the Stone Seat stands empty--waiting for the most ambitious, most powerful mage to claim its glory..."

WarMage: Apprentice Edition is the first installment in the WarMage series, a stand-alone competitive card game in the style of Yu-Gi-Oh! or Magic: The Gathering, for two to nine players of all ages and suitable for challenging both beginners and veterans alike.
Summon your magical might and do battle against other aspiring mages, wielding communal spells from six unique disciplines of magic to launch attacks, hinder your opponents, empower yourself, and control the battlefield in a shifting, dynamic fight to be the last mage standing!

In this game, a myriad of spells from several themed disciplines of magic are drawn from a central, shared deck, and are played in a variety of ways from players' hands in an effort to defeat their opponents. In the basic game mode, the last player standing wins; several variant game modes can also be played, to change the rules of the game itself.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman: The Animated Series – Gigantik Crime Wave Game
description:
It's batman's greatest challenge yet! Help Batman match wits and do battle against a sinister evil that's plotting to take over Gotham City by storm!

Police Commissioner Gordon has turned on the Bat Signal. Its your mission to save Gotham City from the likes of the ever purrsistant Catwoman, the quacky antics of sewer dwelling The Penguin and their accomplices.

The Batman the Animated Series Gigantik game is an explosive and action-packed game. Race Batmobile play pieces through booby-trapped streets using the Batmobile shield as protection. YOU MUST seek out and capture 4 villains to win! Good luck! It's your Gigantk task to foil the purr-fect crime and to save Gotham City from certain DOOM!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cargotrain Duel
description:
Cargotrain Duel is a promotional board game which serves to promote the full game Cargotrain. The game is just a double sided sheet of paper with instructions on one side and the board on the other.

Each player manages a fleet of trains. The goal of the game is to gather most points. On a player's turn she rolls five dice. Then the players takes alternatively one dice each other, starting with the active player untill both take two. The last 5th die is a support die.

The active player moves first. She chooses wich die will be the resource die and which will be the route die. Then she takes an amount of resources equal to the sum of resource and support dice. Now she can move a train on route which corresponds to route die. In order to do that she must spend her resources in amount indicated on route fields. If a player reaches or passes through a field with factory, then

When both players have taken their turns, there is a scoring round. Each player scores the points indicated on the route fields which their trains are on.

name: Pirouette Cacahuète
description:
A card game to exerce memory. Each player in turn plays a card and either says the specified word or acts according to the specified action. The game continues until someone makes a mistake and forget the words or actions on hidden cards. Whoever has the highest number of cards wins!

Un jeu de cartes pour faire travailler sa mémoire. Chacun à son tour pose une carte et dit le mot ou fait le geste indiqué. Le jeu continue jusqu’à ce que quelqu’un se trompe et oublie les mots ou les actions des cartes cachées. Celui qui a le plus grand nombre d’« avions à réaction » gagne la partie !
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Flip Cup
description:
A typical Flip Cup game can be played any number of ways depending on how many player are participating. Each player takes one large blue cup, six small red cups, and one black chip. Shuffle the challenge cards and place them face down on the table. A challenge card will have an activity for the player to complete. For example, the classic challenge card has a player take 6 red cups and put them on the edge of the table and who ever flips all 6 over first wins. A challenge card is randomly drawn from the stack and players take turns reading the cards. It is highly encourage to discuss the goal of the card so that players understand how the challenge works. If indicated on the card, players set up cups on the table before they begin. When they are ready the opposing players simultaneously say "Let's get this flippin' party started!" and begin. The first player to finish the challenge and yells "Done!" is the winner.

For smaller groups, the player with the most wins after facing other player is the Flip Cup Champion. If there is a tie, then the two (or more) players compete against each other in a Flip Cup Championship round.

For tournament-style play, draw three cards randomly and compete in a best of three for each round. Winners advance to the next round until only tow players are left standing, competing for the Flip Cup Championship. The Championship is one card only: draw a card at random and take your best shot at the title!.

name: Vélodrome
description:
Vélodrome is a two-player cycling board game with a variant that allows playing it with three.

Every played has a deck that is composed of 24 cards, of which 14 are power cards, 6 are "bad luck" cards to be played on another player, 3 are "approved painkillers" to counter bad luck cards (1000 Bornes-like) and four are "quadrant cards" which have to be played compulsorily one in each quarter of the two-lap long. Three of the eleven power cards have two values. The player can choose whichever seems best.
The player also adds up the value of his and his opponent's last played cards to determine his move.

The player who's rider finished the race on the Vélodrome first wins the game.

name: Adult Charades
description:
A naughty party game for naughty people! An adults only version of the classic party game.

Take turns acting out things like Horny Devil, Mr. Woodcock, and The Little Man in the Boat while teammates try to guess as many answers as possible within a minute. The winning team is the team with the most correct answers after each player has performed three times.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Walking Dead
description:
An epidemic of apocalyptic proportions has swept the globe with the bite-size edition of The Walking Dead™ Trivial Pursuit®. Featuring 600 questions that cover the characters and events included in the popular comic book series, even the most ardent fans will be challenged to fight for their survival. First person to collect six cards becomes the last survivor.

Contents:

100 cards feature 600 questions

Categories include: People, Locations, Events, Issue Numbers, The Dead and Wild Card
1 Custom Die
Wedge case card holder
Instructions
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Mature / Adult, Trivia

name: Brainbox: Paris
description:
Do you know how high the Eiffel Tower is in metres? Or where Napoleon I and his wife were crowned in 1804? Find out in BrainBox Paris On-The-Go, which contains 35 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best Paris has to offer, and then some!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
publishers: Green Team Gamers, Green Team Games

name: Star Wars: Galaxy Hunt
description: Carefully remove pieces from the spring loaded play area. If you get a piece with a negative number keep it no matter what. If you get one with a positive number AND no other pieces move then keep the positive piece; otherwise discard. If other pieces jump out of the tray keep all negative and discard all positive. Highest score wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Science Fiction

name: Chronicle of the Beasts
description:
The "Classic of Mountains and Seas", formerly romanized as the Shan-hai Ching, is a Chinese classic text and a compilation of mythic geography and myth. In Chronicle of the Beasts, players try to deploy the mythical creatures in Shan-hai Ching to defeat the legendary beast Dijiang (帝江).
Chronicle of the Beasts is a microgame with only 12 cards for 2 players. In the beginning of the game, lay down all the cards on the table, and each players chooses one of the Dijiang card (value 13 or 14) as their controlled beast. Players alternates turns to perform one of the three actions:

Take one Beast card on the table into their hand as a "Tool"
Play one Tool from their hand to attack one Beast on the table
Deploy one Beast on the table to attack one of the Dijiang


You may win the game if:

you kill any one of the Beast by playing/deploying a card to bring the total attack value equal to the value of the Beast.
After all cards are played/deployed, your controlled Dijiang has higher total of attack than your opponent's.


—user summary

name: In Tents
description:
A family-friendly game where players will pass cards, match cards in their hand and in the middle while trying to avoid mother nature cards.
The game is played over a series of rounds. Players with the most matching cards of one color or of one illustration will win the round. Each Mother Nature card in their hand will subtract out one match. 1 Point is awarded for winning the round, 2 points if the player with the most matching cards did it with only Mother Nature cards. The first player to earn 5 points wins the game.
Each player is given a scorecard. The card is turned to track the number of points a player has earned.

—description from the designer

name: Magic Maths
description: Solve addition, subtraction and multiplication sums to fill your wizard board with yucky ingredients. Pick a card, solve the sum and rub the black star on the back of the card to magically reveal (and check) the answer. If it matches the number on one of your spell ingredients cards, add it to your board.

name: Granna Mushrooming in The Magic Forest
description:
Ready for a fantastic adventure? mushrooming in the magic forest is a delightful game where you follow a path riddled with animal obstacles, to gather as many mushrooms as possible. The game is started by the person who last ate mushrooms. Players follow each other in a clockwise direction. One by one, they roll the dice and then advance as many squares as they have thrown. If they find a mushroom in the mezzanine where they got with their puppets, they put it in their basket.
The game ends when a player has walked the route and returned to or crossed the start field. Then the points have to be added up.

name: CH35S
description:
CH35S is a 2-player war game of far-future combat using chess pieces as your models on the battlefield. In the game each player chooses an army, customizes it, and attempts to score the most points in the game by securing objectives and destroying their opponent’s units. The player with the most points at the end of 4 battle rounds wins the game.

This is a YMOR game. YMOR stands for Your Materials. Our Rules. It is intended that you print the electronic files of the game to play, and then use the dice, tokens, and models you already own to enjoy the game.

-description from publisher

name: Giraffes in Scarves
description:
How many scarves can you collect for your giraffe? Roll the dice, pick a card and build your giraffe in this fun counting and colour matching game. The winner is the player with the most scarves on their giraffe!

The exciting and engaging gameplay is sure to hold children's attention play after play, testing a number of different educational skills...from basic colour matching and counting to memory, strategy and turn taking. The quirky and beautifully illustrated giraffe characters are sure to provide lots of laughs too!

Designed for ages 4-7, Giraffes in Scarves offers the perfect balance between learning and fun! It can also be played by up to 6 players.

On a player's turn roll the dice and choose a card with a matching colored spot. If the card is a neck card, add it to your giraffe’s neck.

If you turn over your head card and there is no neck card on your giraffe, return it face down to the table and mix up the cards. If the head card matches your giraffe body and you have one more next cards, place the head at the top of your giraffe's neck. You can not add any more neck cards, but can continue to turn over cards on your turn.

If you turn over another player's head card and you do not have a finished giraffe, return the card face down to the table and mix up the cards. If you turn over a head card which matches another player’s giraffe body and your giraffe is already finished, place the head at the top of their giraffe. This will end their chances of adding any more scarves.

Play continues until all player’s giraffes are finished. Each player count show many scarves their giraffe is wearing.The winner is the player with he most scarves at the end of the game.

Contents:
24 neck cards
6 head cards
6 base boards
1 colour dice
1 instruction leaflet

Not suitable for children under 3 years due to small parts. Choking hazard.

name: Monopoly: Breaking Bad
description:
Players will want to “tread lightly” to buy, sell, and trade properties to be the last one standing in this risky version of Monopoly based on AMC’s hit series Breaking Bad! Familiar locations and tokens based on iconic items from the show such as Heisenberg Hat, RV, Tio’s Bell and more will take fans back through the sordid evolution of Walter White and his own capitalistic plan.

Includes:

1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Heisenberg Hat, Tio’s Bell, Money Barrel, Gas Mask, Pink Teddy Bear, RV
32 Houses renamed Tented Houses
12 Hotels renamed SuperLabs
16 Community Chest Cards renamed Heisenberg Cards
16 Chance Cards renamed Walter White Cards
Custom themed money
2 Dice
Rules

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Operation Pet Scan
description:
PRETEND YOU'RE A VET: The Operation Pet Scan game has a twist on classic Operation gameplay. Cavity Sam's dog, Rex-Ray, ate things he shouldn't have, and players need to get them out of his belly

Players use the magnet to move plastic pieces through the dog's digestive track and out the "back end" without setting off any buzzers.

—description from the publisher

name: Myth & Goal
description:
Myth & Goal is a miniatures board game of fantasy football for 1-2 players, designed by James Hewitt and Sophie Williams. In the game, each player takes control of one of many unique teams defined by classic fantasy races, such as elves, dwarves, and orcs, and faces off against each other in a sport inspired by American football. While each team features players with their own strengths and weaknesses, players also choose a focus for their team that further defines how that team functions in the game.

Players use actions with their players to attempt to either throw the ball through the goal for points, or have a player run it into the goal for even more points. The team with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Using streamlined rules, custom dice, and highly detailed plastic miniatures, Myth & Goal delivers an exciting and fast paced fantasy football experience that players won’t find anywhere else. The modular team creation ensures that every player can easily find their desired playstyle combined with their favorite classic fantasy races. Players can also use the free agent rules to build their own custom all-star teams using different combinations of players from all available teams. In addition, players can watch their teams grow and develop using the league rules or practice their strategy on their own against an AI team using the solo game rules, both included in the core game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Baby Shark Party at the Reef Game
description: Work together to get Baby, Mommy, and Daddy Shark to the party on Coral Reef. But hurry before the seaweed storm washes everything away. Roll the die and then press the button to determine how many spaces you get the move the Shark and which Shark you get to roll. But be careful, roll a seaweed and you are one step closer to ending the game.

name: Vikings of the North
description:
Times are troubled and the seas are full of enemy ships. Manning your fleet with strength, courage and knowledge. Get your ships ready for battle and head out to sea. Your goal is to conquer your opponent's land. Vikings of the North is a different and strategic board game with tactical and fast duels. With three players, the Asa gods have a finger in the pie, which makes the battles extra exciting and unpredictable. Bjørn Andreas Bull-Hansen has conquered the world with his books. The game is inspired by the books in the Jomsviking series and takes you back to the Viking Age.

Start with the first player, can do the following three steps
in this order each turn:
A. Turn over a dice in his port
B. Build a ship
C. Move a ship

The game is over when one of the players can no longer move, attack or build a ship (less than 3 dice in its port).

During the game, players get points for:
• 1 point for each opponent ship that is sunk
• 1 point for each warrior placed in the opponent's port
• 2 points for each pawn placed in the opponent's port. (The special farmers instead give 5 points if they are placed on their corresponding symbol)

After the end of the game, players also get points for:
• 1 point for each ship moved to the opponent's half of the playing field
• 1 point for each dice left by the opponent in their own port.

The player with the highest score wins!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Wizard Roll
description:
Description from the publisher:

Players take turns rolling two custom dice to try to match the pattern on their Spell Card. Each spell card is worth a varying number of points depending upon the difficulty of completion (2-5 points).

A magic wand result on a die also allows you to force an opponent to return his runes/elements to the bank, preventing them from completing their Spell Card.

First player to seven points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Sex and the City Trivia Game
description:
The first true comedy about love, sex and relationships, the HBO critically acclaimed and award-winning series SEX AND THE CITY is now a Trivia Game. The shows' six seasons of humor, glamor and friendship, not to mention cosmopolitans and designer shoes, is the basis for this unique trivia game that is anything but trivial!

Answer trivia questions, act out different scenes, collect lifestyle cards, and enjoy a night of "girl talk" in SEX AND THE CITY style!

1,000 questions about your favorite TV series.

2 or more adult players
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Malarkey
description:
From the back of the box:
Can you tell me "Sure Signs of Middle Age?"

First, roll the letter cubes, then come up with a word or key word in a phrase that begins with one of those letters and describes the category on the card you've drawn. To keep everyone in line, one player acts as the judge and listens to each and every answer.

Includes box of 200 cards, 20 letter cubes, felt pad, gavel, gavel board, and score pad.
publishers: Hersch and Company, Parker Brothers, Patch Products

name: Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game – The Cove
description: Prepare yourselves to explore the water-filled nightmares of the Cove. The mysteries of the deep seek to be explored - and revealed. The location where the Ancestor performed his pacts with the water beings - the ancient fishermen, will bring you nightmares.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Knightmare
description:
This game is based on the UK cult tv show of the same name.

Box cover says:
Chase through the Labyrinth in search of magical treasures. Cast spells and battle fiendish monsters. Solve Merlin's riddles and be the first to climb his throne.

Components:
1 Gameboard
56 Cards
4 colored plastic bases
12 item tokens
40 helm tokens
4 playing pieces
1 castle wall
1 die
1 book of riddles
1 three-dimensional castle base
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Juegos, Milton Bradley

name: Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon
description:
Players or teams must link actors to Kevin Bacon through associations in movies or TV appearances. Two 20-sided dice determine which actor you must link Kevin to. There are four hundred to choose from, with one movie listed for each as a hint. Two six-sided dice tell you how many steps you can use and how far you can move on the gameboard if you link the actors in the appropriate number of steps. Twenty "BQ" cards mix up the action by awarding extra links or allowing the other team to steal or give a hint. And a sand timer keeps it all moving along. Discover for yourself what internet users have known for years - Kevin Bacon is at the epicenter of Hollywood.

Featured on the Howard Stern Show 8/12/97.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Guinness Book of World Records Game
description: This game, based on the famous book, is different from the 1975 version. You move along the board landing on Record Spaces. Some require a simple dice roll to break; for example, on "Mostest Eating Baked Beans" you roll 3 dice (1 red and 2 white) and if the red die is the highest of the 3 dice you break the record. If, however, you land on a Longest, Shortest, or Highest Record space, you must use the "Record Maker". This is a shuffleboard device where you flick a disk down a track with numbers on it. If you set or break the record using it, the Scorekeeper writes down the number so other players will know what score to beat. When you break a record you receive the Record Card for that space - either from the Scorekeeper, or the player currently holding the card. The first player to reach the END HERE space with at least 5 Record Cards is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TacTix
description:
Impartial game played with the 4x4 board full of one kind of pieces. A player may remove one or more adjacent pieces from a row or column. The loser is the person who takes the last piece off the board.
