description: Skip-Bo card game now on the game board. Each player has his own stack place. Player moves around the board where are many special fields and tries to discard and gets rid of all cards of his pile first to win.

name: Arthur's Realm
description:
Arthur's Realm, a.k.a. Realm of Logres, is a character-driven game set upon a rich tapestry of Arthurian lore, characters and events. Players have many choices, but players need only learn a handful of simple mechanisms to begin play. This is because the game is built upon a simple "rules when you need them" principle that puts most of the rules on a handful of reference cards that need to be read only when you need to play a particular situation. Because the system is intuitive and easy to start, players don't spend time reading and memorizing rules. Instead, they just play.

In Arthur's Realm, your choices as a player impact the story of King Arthur, and each time players play the game, it tells a new and fascinating version of King Arthur's tale. The game is competitive and collaborative, with one team seeking to usurp King Arthur while the other defends Logres and King Arthur. The action in the game revolves around quests, treachery, character romance, combat and magic.

Arthur's Realm plays like a Eurogame in that players cannot be eliminated from play. It plays like an RPG in that players must collaborate and it doesn't hurt to have a good imagination. Arthur's Realm plays like a traditional American game in that at some point you'll want to smite the opponent.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Storytelling, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Fibber
description:
From the back of the box:

FIBBER! is the family fun board game with a great new twist -- when players announce what number they've rolled, how can you find out if they're telling the truth when you can't see their die? By challenging, that's how -- Just say "Are you a Fibber?" Off comes the top of their dice shaker and if they were fibbing -- whoops -- back they go; but if they were telling the truth -- then back you go!
publishers: Borras Plana S.A., Maruca Industries, Waddingtons

name: Doh Nutters
description:
Players wear a plastic elephant trunk and ears mask and try to pick up all three of their color rings to win. Although at first glance, this is reminiscent of Snifty Snakes, in Ring Around the Nosy, the silly noses are fairly rigid, and used to pick up the objects. In Snifty Snakes, the nose extensions (the snakes) are used to push the players' objects around toward their goals.
—user summary

Dohnutters a crazy, noisy, nutty game of elephantine fun!

Play the part of a crazy doughnut-loving elephant in this hilarious game of fast action fun.

Can you be the first elephant to get all your doughnuts on your trunk?

The first one is easy, the next harder and with the final doughnut tension reaches an all time high!
—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
publishers: Drumond Park Ltd., Habourdin International, Ideal Board Games, Iplay Games and Diversions, Litor, Playtoy Industries, Pressman Toy Corp., Spear's Games

name: Centurions: Jake Rockwell's Battle to Stop Dr. Terror Game
description:
Doctor Terror is up to no good and has created three phony Centurions that look exactly like Jake Rockwell. These three impostors have been sent to Earth to confuse the other Centurions while carrying out Dr. Terror's sinister plan. Only one person can stop this mad plot and save the world - you! Be the first to equip your Centurions Exo-Frame with all six assault weapon system cards and you've proven that your Centurion is the REAL Jake Rockwell!

Simple die roll and movement is used to collect the cards needed.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ensimmäinen Tietopelini
description:
From the publisher:

How many people are there in this room? Answer open-answer- questions about a child’s world in this first trivia game designed for the youngest members of the family. Large question cards make the game easier to play, and the fun animal characters will help engage the child with the questions. With an adult serving as a smart owl, the game encourages interaction between a parent and a child.

name: Crazy Rummy
description:
Crazy Rummy is a basic Rummy game with a very strange deck. It comprises a standard 52 card deck plus 2 jokers but on lower half (or crazy half) of the card is a seperate card that does not match. As an example the Ace of Spades shows the King of Hearts at the bottom and the 10 of Hearts shows the 4 of Clubs.

Each player is dealt 10 cards and as in standard Rummy you can put down melds of runs or sequences. They can be from either side but the sides cannot be mixed. When one player goes out points are scored for the cards left in the opponent's hand. Counting the standard side only, Aces count 1 point, face cards 10 points, and all other cards face value. The game is played to 200.

There are also other game suggestions included in the rulebook.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: G.I. Joe Mission: Cobra H.Q. Game
description:
Cobra Commander has drawn up secret plans to attain world domination. The G.I. Joe team is ready to take on the COBRA henchmen and get the plans. As part of the team, you must sneak through the jungle to find the hidden boats that will take you across the crocodile infested river to COBRA H.Q. Beware of booby traps and COBRA operatives along the way. You will need to defeat them before you can advance. Once you reach the island, you must secure the plans and then escape to safety. The first team member to return to their starting place with the secret plans is the winner! Congratulations, you've saved the world from the evils of COBRA!

Box Contents: Gameboard, 4 G.I. JOE pawns with plastic stands, 36 game tiles, 2 dice and the instructions.

name: The Authentic DaVinci Dilemma
description:
From the back of the box:

The Authentic Da Vinci Dilemma is an exciting new board game that tests your Da Vinci knowlege while creating a timeless masterpiece. Players are challenged to a series of Da Vinci Riddles and trivia from four categories: Earth, Air, Water and Man. The correct answers to these challenges allow players to win a piece of the puzzle, moving them one step closer toa solution and the creation of a Da Vinci Masterpiece.

name: Picco Popolino
description:
Which animal neighs, has a long mane, and wears shoes?

One player describes or imitates an animal, and the others try to guess which animal it is. When they have guessed, they must select the correct bottom from the animal cards on the table.

There are two game variants:

for age three: an older games master describes the animal and the younger players trying to grab it off the table
for age four and up: players take it in turns to draw one of the small animal counters and describe the animal to other players. if they succeed both the describer and the guesser get a point.

name: Muumipeli
description:
A children's roll and move game with memory game elements, based on the Moomin characters of Tove Jansson.

Moominpappa has lost his black top hats, and the players must help him to find them. The task is not easy, since the Moominhouse is suddenly full of black hats, not all of which belong to Moominpappa.

Players roll the dice to move their coloured, hat-shaped playing pieces on the track around the Moominhouse. When a player reaches a Moominpappa-circle she can take one of the hats from the Moominhouse and try it on her playing piece; if it fits, she can keep it (some of the hats are duds and will not fit on the playing pieces). Players can also steal hats from other players if they land in the same circle, and landing in the Hattifatteners-circle means that hats in the Moominhouse must be reshuffled.

The first player to reach Moominhouse with 2 or more hats is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Novel-based
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Viisasten kivi
description:
"A trivia quiz for the young and young at heart"

Designed by the same core team of Otila & Lindfors, this is a sort of companion game to Viisasten Kokous, but supposedly aimed at the younger crowd; which in this case means that this is a trivia game on the same general level of difficulty as Trivial Pursuit etc., compared to Viisasten Kokous which is extremely challenging to the average trivia player. The games were likely published concurrently (1987) or quite close apart, which make them among the last publications of Paletti.

The general idea of the game is to try and climb the rock on which the philosopher's stone (Viisasten Kivi) lies; this happens by picking cards and answering the questions correctly to move three spaces ahead, up to a maximum of two cards per player turn. Unlike usual trivia games, this is a bit more casual in that mixed in with the question cards are also event cards which work like event cards in a typical roll-and-move game ie. pass a turn, move ahead two, move back one etc., with flavor text. There are also blank cards which can either be used to make house questions or to be optionally mixed in the deck too, in this case a blank card simply means "pass the turn".

Includes 150 cards; 100 question cards with 5 questions each, 25 event cards and 25 blanks, in three decks with tuckboxes.

name: Simpatico
description:
From website;

"There's more than one way to the top...
Each player's turn starts with nine cards face up on the board. The object is to move as many cards as possible to the top row, where they're worth points. Players move cards by placing them on top of other cards with which they share at least two characteristics - color, creature, or quantity. Each turn consists of a quick series of moves by the same player, and the order in which you make those moves can determine whether you win or lose!"

name: The Little Engine That Could Game
description: The Little Engine That Could Game brings the inspirational story to life with brightly colored train engines, a large hill for the engines to climb, and exciting game play that is fun for everyone! Each player draws cards and moves their engines toward the hill, climbs up it while chanting, “I think I can,” and zooms down the hill with a loud, “I thought I could!” The engine who scores the most points wins. Love the book, now live the game!

name: Stop 'n Go
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Stop 'n Go is a quick action card game in which play is driven by hand-eye coordination and quick responses. Players race to be the first to get rid of their cards by matching colors and watching out for special cards: Zap, Pass, and Stop 'n Go!

name: Kłamcianka Towarzyska
description:
In a world of liars gods, angels and demons, creatures of myth and legend walk among us. Kłamcianka is a card game that simulates the start of these powerful beings in the struggle for considerable rate - angel feathers.

The form of the universe created by James Ćwiek, dozens of unique skills, special cards which place the game on its head and lots of laughter! Make truces, and then it quickly column - in the Liar universe there is nothing permanent.

What is the game? In short, the idea is to collect the largest possible amount of feathers (which icons are shown on almost every card) and most annoy other players would not have a chance with us when it comes to counting points. At the beginning of each game, each participant draws fun for yourself one of the characters and places it face "Inactive" to the top. Then all derive 7 cards on hand and starts playing

A player in his turn, he may do one of the following: attack someone, play the effect described on the card, replace one card to another (in the dark), or select the card to be in the hands of their 7 (if our budget was depleted during the game) . Each card beyond the value of the feathers (which is taken into account only at the end of the game) has a specific strength. The majority also has its effect, which we can use for example during the fight, whether or separately - consuming it his turn.
You have to combine so as to eventually collect as many feathers. For this purpose, it is certainly useful Liars title card, but it also has a hitch - yes, gives the largest amount of feathers (3), however, the player who will be at the end of most "Liars" automatically loses. Remedy this, we can only exchanging with others (hopefully take us to the card), or finding a card Liar, which cancels the harmful effects of one of the Liar

important:
the game can be purchased only in the set of the latest book Ćwiek - "Liar 2.5"
rules have been on the last few pages of "Liar 2.5

name: Family Bingo
description:
The party game Family Bingo requires dexterity, good memory, perceptiveness, and some basic knowledge. Players compete in eight different categories of activities, and the game includes 165 double-sided cards that tell players what to do.

A very important component of the game are 96 colorful wooden sticks in six colors; the game also includes 96 small number tokens and 16 big tokens. At the beginning of the game, each player receives a nice covering stand and personal bingo board. Players try to score a point by completing the task on the drawn card. The first player to do so covers a field on her bingo board with the number drawn at the beginning of the round. The tasks are very different, e.g., building a construction on time or after memorizing it, answering questions, guessing what another player is trying to visualize, guessing the color or number of sticks, throwing, stacking, and many, many more. Whoever creates a bingo first wins!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: UNO: Royal Revenge
description:
Description from the publisher:

UNO Royal Revenge presents a whole new way to play your favorite card game – complete with King’s crown, a Jester’s hat and royal scepter! Just like in classic UNO, the object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all your cards.

With the addition of a crown, jester hat, and special action cards, players get a whole new way to control the play. New Royal Revenge action cards add all new game changing moments that will have everyone on the edge of their seats.

name: The Dog Game
description:
The Dog Game is the "pawesome" family board game (with doggos)! This game asks the question dog lovers have pondered for years: "what do dogs think about?" Easy to learn and full of hilarious fun, the game begins as players compete to match doggo thoughts to crazy canine pictures. Players vote on the best answer, and whoever wins gets a doggy treat! With three possible categories to choose from, you can select Dog Thoughts, Doggo Dilemmas or Pupper Pals. Choose a Dog Thought card and everyone selects a dog picture to match. Draw a Doggo Dilemmas card and players get creative! Using Dry-Erase Cards and Markers, everyone fills in the blank on the prompt card with a silly word or phrase! Select Pupper Pals and players choose the dog that would most likely belong to the person mentioned on the card. Play The Dog Game and you could find out answers to the most pressing dog questions like: "What is the meaning of Life?""Do good and evil exist?""Who's a good boy?" Answer these doggy questions and you could win the most treats!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Paper-and-Pencil, Storytelling, Voting

name: Cyblobs
description:
Mold a blob. Plan your move. The rest is between the eyes!

First, mold the Cyblobs. The biggest and prettiest blob gets eyes and a mouth, the little blobs only one eye. Despite being formable, the Cyblobs are not very agile, they move in straight lines based on dice roll. As they encounter smaller Cyblobs, they steal an eye or eat the whole blob. But you should keep an eye on your own Cyblobs because without atleast one eye, a Cyblob is finished! The biggest Cyblob with the most eyes wins.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: NASCAR The DVD Board Game
description:
From the manufacturer's website:

NASCAR The DVD Board Game combines the excitement of racing while testing players’ knowledge of one of the world’s most popular sports. Featuring a short and long track on a double-sided board, the DVD technology brings the excitement of a real NASCAR event into the home in 5.1 surround sound!

There are 15 unique race-simulating categories narrated by legendary NASCAR drive Bobby Allison with more than 350 on-screen challenges.

What's in the box?

Double-sided game board
DVD with 350 on-screen challenges
4 miniature stock car pawns
Instruction manual
Die
Driver's note pads and pencils

name: Cosmic Voyage
description:
Cosmic Voyage is a 1-4 player cooperative game where players must work together to bring their stranded spacecraft home safely, navigating a dangerous galaxy of hazards and alien threats.

As a team, players explore the dangerous discovery zone - an ever changing and partially obscured grid of cards, carefully choosing where to explore to undertake the skill challenges on each.

Game events such as Solar Storms, Black Holes and Wormholes lurk as an ever-present threat to players both exploring and seeking refuge outside of the discovery zone. And those brave enough to venture into discovered wormholes can fight through a challenging series of tasks for even better rewards, for ever greater risks!

Players win or lose together, and must share responsibilites for keeping the ship running whilst utilising their specialisation to complete missions to help progress them toward their goal!

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Modular Board, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dino Math Tracks
description:
Prehistoric pals make this award-winning math game fun! Kids roll the dice and move their dinosaurs around a delightfully illustrated game board, reinforcing counting, addition, subtraction and place value skills. Includes game board, 16 dinosaurs, cards, number die and instructions for various levels of play.

Each player is allotted one dinosaur for each of the four tracks (the tracks are labeled 1s, 10s, 100s, and 1000s). To play, a player rolls four dice to create a 4-digit number and then moves his or her prehistoric posse to the appropriate 1s, 10s, 100s, and 1000s places. Problem-solving strategies are honed as players scurry to get all four miniature mammoths or tiny triceratops into the dino haven, ahead of the other players' thundering herds. But look out! In the race to dino utopia, it's easy to get bumped by a baby brachiosaurus!

The Dino Math Tracks game provides multiple levels of play for a variety of ages. At the simplest level (perfect for a first-grader who knows Arabic numerals and one-to-one correspondence), kids use only the place track for the 1s. Later, cards with simple problems are introduced ("Stuck in a tar pit! Move your 10s dino back two spaces!"). At the most advanced level, players might encounter a question like this: "Your 10s dinosaur forgot its pants, so it went back 15 to get them. Then it hurried forward 25. How far did it get? Move that many." Young players will find the 2-inch, spunky vinyl dinosaur playing pieces irresistible. The game offers plenty of opportunities for friendly competition and brain bending--not to mention lots of nonthreatening practice at addition and subtraction. --Julie Ubben
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number

name: Метро 2033
description:
Метро 2033, based on the novel Metro 2033 by Russian author Dmitry Glukhovsky, is dedicated to survival in the dungeons of the Moscow metro in a post-apocalyptic world.

The players in the game act as gang leaders who control those or other subway lines. The goal of the player is to make your own clan dominant. To do this requires many soldiers in the army, many resources, and many controlled stations – but the more controlled territory, the greater the threat to the welfare of a clan. And not just from other players, but also from the unknown creatures that now live invisibly in the subway alongside you.

Calculate the right strategy to survive in unfriendly world, and make an appointment with dice that define the amount of resources and the winners in the battles – and become the leader in this dark world...

Reimplemented as


Metro 2033

name: Chalet
description:
The gameboard shows a 5 streets with some government / administration buildings on it plus many plots where houses can be built. Each person tries to amass the most money by buying plots of land and either building a building there or selling the land to another player. Once a house or an appartment is built, money is made buy either selling or renting the property.

Acquiring property is either done with cash or with 2 types of loans, one of which takes 2-3 turns to get so thinking ahead is required.

You travel around the board, and can decide to buy piece of property on the space next to where your piece stops - either a plot of ground or possibly a developed piece of land. Once bought you recieve rental income from developed properties, or can later build on undeveloped land (and can sell either type to other players
or back to the bank (at a reduced price).

When moving around the board, there is a chance that random events may occur changing the values of certain properties etc.

The game ends after a pre-determined amount of time, or when all ground plots, houses, and apartments are owned. Each person then checks the total value of all his properties, subtracting any outstanding loans, and adding his cash - and the person with the most money wins.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Grow Jogos e Brinquedos

name: The Voyage of the Mayflower
description:
From the back of the box description:

Sail with the Pilgrims in 1620 across the storm-tossed Atlantic as they seek their new home in America. Make another journey next year with ships bearing new settlers and supplies for the hard-pressed colony. Storms, ice, fog, pirates and uncertainty will make for an exciting voyage as you race to land your life-saving supplies.

Designed for 1-4 players Ages 10 and up, The Voyage of the Mayflower also has a unique solo version. The 8-page Game Book includes the rules of play, the story of the voyage, life aboard ship, a list of supplies and provisions, and educational notes. Also included is a decorative frameable print of the Mayflower passenger list.

name: Das Schneemann Spiel
description:
A game deriving from the evergreen Pachisi scheme. But before the snowmen reach the finish, their 3 parts have to be assembled.

Hurray, it's snowing! Let’s build a snowman - quickly roll three snowballs for the bottom, belly and the head. Then add a hat and stick a nose and eyes into it ... and the snowman is ready!

The first player who is able to not only collect three parts of the snowman, but is able to assemble the snowman and be the first to the finish line wins this snowy game.

Ages 4 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Parlor Football Game
description:
Be the first to score four touchdowns. Each play is determined by rolling two standard dice and finding the result on a chart. Possible results are touchdowns, gains, sacks, incompletes, interceptions, fumbles, and penalties. Some of the results require the player to flip a special wooden chip, which has a "5" on one side and a "10" on the other, and is used to randomly determine yards gained or lost.

Play is tracked on a wooden board, using pegs to mark the ball and the first down mark on the field, and the current down and number of yards to go down below. Score is kept using a pencil.

The use of pegs makes it a suitable choice for travel. This game, along with others in Channel Craft's Vintage Game Series, comes in a small tin.

name: Monkeying Around
description:
From the box:

Carefully hang the monkeys on the palm tree. The more monkeys that hang, the more of a chance that the palm tree will fall and the monkeys will scatter: The first player who can hang all of his or her monkeys on the tree successfully, wins the game!

Similar to:

Monkey Business
Hanging Monkies

name: Kosherland
description:
Kosherland is a game designed for very young Jewish children that not only teaches them about colors, learning and following rules, and communication, but also important parts of their religion. The game plays just like the classic Candy Land, with the only real differences being that it has a Kosher food theme and a built-in spinner. Special events on some spaces allow the player to move to different spaces.

As with Candy Land, the first player to reach the end of the board wins.

name: Tippa Speedway
description:
Nice little family game from Sweden.

Players try to round the racetrack the fastest of all competitors.
Game is challenging for children and adults alike.
There are special rules for moving, falls, overtaking etc.
Event cards add the odd spice to gameplay.

At the end of a given time victory points are awarded.
If you play shorter games, a campaign can be played.

Excellent plastic game pawns !
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verkeersspel
description:
Contents : a special dice (with two stars), a printed board showing the map of a town with holes at the crossroads, two disks printed on both sides with different crossroads that you can fix under the board, a policeman pawn , two errand boy paws, two errand girl pawns, cards with errand orders, cards for bikes, money coins and bills.

The game is intended to teach kids the highway code. The players try to accomplish errand orders in order to win money quicker than the others, but they must respect the highway code or they will end at the hospital. The crossroads patterns can be changed quickly, and the policeman appears in a sudden to check if the bikes are in good state. The first to collect 20 euros and to get back to the concert hall wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Educational, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gulp!
description:
(User Summary.)

Gulp! is a simple card game, in the fashion of War. The cards describe a variety of marine life, and list the other cards that can be "eaten". The set of cards form a partial order: there are a few unique different apex predators that are eaten by nothing, and several instances of the Phytoplankton card that can be eaten - directly or indirectly - by all other cards.

Players each draw a card from the top of the deck: if one card eats the other, then the player claims both; if neither eat the other (or, rarely, both eat the other) then each chooses an additional card, with the winner of the next pair taking all yet-unclaimed cards. Most cards at the end of the deck wins.

name: Steuern?
description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll and Move' game
Roll the die, move and perform required actions listed on the area you land on
Optimize the money you start with by decreasing taxes, acquiring assets, increasing status
Most successful (= bonus points) player wins the game
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Men Row Chess
description:
Men Row Chess is a variant of Chess that combines Chess and Checkers.

Men Row Chess is played on an 8x10 board. Both players have 8 checkers (men) in addition to the common chess pieces.

The goal of Men Row Chess is different from the goal of the common Chess: a player wins by capturing the opponent's king or stalemating the opponent.

All chess pieces move the same as in common Chess. However, two rules are excluded from Men Row Chess: there is no castling or en passante in the game.

Checkers (Men) move forward or diagonally forward and capture the opponent's pieces by jumping over them the same way as in English Checkers, i.e. diagonally forward only. A man can capture several of the opponent's pieces in one turn.

When a checker reaches the last row it becomes a king of checkers. King of checkers can move diagonally or vertically (forward and backward) and capture diagonally, horizontally and vertically in all 8 directions by jumping over the opponent's pieces.

Ordinary checkers and kings of checkers are not forced to capture. I.e. they can stop capturing the opponent's pieces on any step (even if they could capture more pieces) or skip capturing the opponent's pieces altogether.

name: Het grote erger je wel voetbalspel
description:
During which match did Hans Kraay Jr. throw away his jacket? Which Dutch player was among the top goal scorers during the World Cup 2010?

Those are some of the over 450 questions in this football game. Test your football knowledge in general, but also of events from the very popular football show on Dutch television. Play as Wilfred Genee, René van der Gijp, Johan Derksen or Jan Boskamp and answer questions about Star players, WC football and more. And don't forget to annoy your opponents. Have a good match!

name: Get Packing!
description:
In Get Packing! Gather up to 6 players, take a Packing Board and start filling it up with the appropriate items to go on your trip. But watch out, because opponents will try to steal your items using Wild Cards. First player to fill up their Packing Board gets a certificate for a JetBlue flight out of town, so Get Packing!

Get Packing! is a game created by JetBlue sold on Amazon that includes a contest for a free flight(for a limited time when game is released).

name: Poppycock!
description:
Bit of a boff or more of a blagger? Poppycock! is the hilarious trivia game that rewards big brains and mischievous mouths. Challenge friends and family as you Poppycock! your way through a series of quiz questions. Unsure of an answer but think you can get away with bluffing? Deceive your opponents until they shout out Poppycock! Clever meets crafty in this tactical game guaranteed to make you laugh out loud.

Choose a player to answer the first question. That player rolls the dice. The player to their right reads them the question from the category shown on the dice. If the dice is blank, the player answering the question may choose whichever category they want. The question, and multiple-choice answers, are read out, without the questioner turning over the card. The answering player must declare whether they know it or don’t know it. If they don’t know it, the turn ends, the questioner turns the card over and reads out the answer, and play continues clockwise. Discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player.

If they declare they know it, the player must declare how many spaces they are playing for. The player can declare 1, 2, or 3 spaces. This represents how many spaces they will be allowed to move if they get the answer right, or if no one challenges their answer. Additionally, this number represents the number of spaces other players will be allowed to move if they correctly Poppycock! the player answering the question (i.e. if they can determine that the player is trying to bluff). Once the answering player has declared whether they know it, and how many spaces they are playing for, players take turns to say Poppycock! if they do not believe them, or Persuaded! if they do. Starting with the player to the left of the answering player, each player must declare Poppycock! or Persuaded!

If all players are Persuaded!, the answering player will move their declared number of spaces, without having to provide an answer. If any amount of players shout Poppycock!, an answer must be given by the answering player. This answer is checked by the questioner on the reverse of the card. If the answering player was correct, they move forwards their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves backwards that number of spaces. If the answering player was incorrect, they go back their declared number of spaces, while each poppycock-er moves forwards the declared number of spaces. When all moves have been resolved, discard the question card that was used and pass the dice to the next player. Proceed in a clockwise direction, with the player to the answering player’s left being the next player to roll the dice and answer a question.

name: Monopoly: My Fantasy Baseball
description: This is a version of Monopoly based on Major League Baseball Players. This version has a unique mechanism whereby the traditional property spaces start out blank and are filled with baseball players (over 100 players to choose from) as the game progresses and the game players "draft" their fantasy baseball team. The game includes 6 custom pewter pieces, including: the hot dog, the World Series Trophy, pitcher, batter, ball in glove and catcher’s mask.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wild Webber
description: In this children's dexterity game, players attempt to flip chips of their color into a moving basket shaped like a spider. The first player to flip all six chips of their color into the basket is the winner.

name: The Godfather: An Offer You Can't Refuse
description:
Description from the publisher:

Hunt for those who would take sides against the family. The Godfather: An Offer You Can't Refuse is a mafia-style, deductive party game based on the iconic film trilogy by Francis Ford Coppola that starred Marlin Brando as Don Corleone.

In this card game, players play as either members of the Corleone crime family or undercover cops trying to end the reign of the Corleones. Played out over several rounds, the tension of the game comes in trying to figure out who's on which side, and never knowing when you might receive an offer you can't refuse!
categories: Card Game, Mafia, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: PATIOS: Tapas Promo Card
description:
Flamenquín, salmorejo, Montilla wine... Typical Cordobesian dishes for your friends!

This is a new special card to be included in the Improvement deck.

Using the Tapas, you can invite another player and use one special action of their improvement cards.

-description from designer

name: Agatha Christie: Behind the Screen
description:
This is a VHS Murder Mystery game where the players try to solve the case of who killed Tyler Dudden.

The game contains a 30 minute video and 8 cards. At intervals in the video you pause and read out one side of the numbered cards. At the end of the game the players review the clues and try to solve the crime.

There is a booklet with the solutions to all the possible combinations.

name: Heximoes
description:
"the six-sided strategy game"

Heximoes includes 132 six-sided cardboard tiles. Each side has a number of dots, between one and six. As in dominoes, you make matches, but must make sure all sides line up: sixes against sixes, fives against fives, etc. In the main game, each player takes six tiles from the box. If you can not make a play, you must draw an additional tile. Play continues until one player has placed all of his tiles on the table, or until no other players can make a play. Variants, including a solitaire, are also included.

The title derives from a German phrase, meaning something ordinary. (Originally it came from a machine gun, used a lot in World War I, and was made popular because of a bestselling war novel and film of this title.) The game however is an abstract speed game. It consists of 108 cards in 9 colours, denoted "0", "8" or "15". Goal for each player is to collect the most card sets in one colour, consisting of one card of each number.

Decks of each number are separated. "0" and "15" are each shuffled, and put as two face up stack on the table. "8" cards are shared evenly among players, and put as face down stacks in front of them. Determined by numbers of players, a given number of "8" cards are revealed from each players deck, and everybody tries to match the two face up cards from the common decks with their tableau. If they find the "0" matching to one of their "8", they put it below their card. A matching "15" they put on top of their "8". Once a set is complete, it is removed into a victory point pile and another "8" from the players deck takes it place. Game ends, as soon the decks are depleted.

name: Go Diego Go! 123 Game
description:
From the Publisher:
Explore four different environments and learn basic counting with Diego! Draw number and animal tokens from the bag and match them to the correct card. Fill your card with 10 matching tokens to win! No reading required to play.

From ehow.com:
"Hasbro's Go Diego Go 123 game helps children ages 3 to 6 years learn to count using special tokens. The game also teaches children about animals and different environments. Children do not need to know how to read to play the game. The game is based on Nickelodeon's popular children's cartoon featuring Diego. Kids can play and enjoy the game with their parents and friends."
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Monty Python's Really Silly Board Game
description:
If you’re a fan of Monty Python or just plain silly, then this Really Silly Board Game will have you laughing like Ernest Scribbler as you travel the board collecting Spam. Test your knowledge of Monty Python TV and movie trivia, undertake silly challenges and explore the wickedly funny world of Monty Python.

- A board game for adults combining Monty Python trivia, charades, impressions and silly behaviour
- Features 6 characters: Gumby, Knight of Ni, Spanish Inquisitor, Mr Creosote, Lumberjack & Brian of Nazareth
- Trade Spam pieces for Quest items and complete your quest to win the game
- 400 silly questions and hilarious tasks such as ‘Who’s got the funniest silly walk?'
- An ideal break from the usual Christmas ‘bored’ game!
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Tales of Ulysse
description:
Ulysses & Co. set sail for Ithaca. What should be a short journey turns out to be an incredible adventure based on Homer's epic poem, The Odyssey. Players each take a ship through unknown seas populated by the mythical, legendary creatures and face challenges such as the Neptune's storms, the charms of the Circe and Calypso, the Cyclops, the Straits between Scylla and Charybdis and, of course, the enchanting song of the Sirens.

Includes game board, 4 ships, deck of 30 cards, dice, rule book.

Intended for Ages 5 and up.

name: Hunting and Fishing Trivia
description:
Hunting and Fishing Trivia contains thousands of questions in five categories on small game, large game, fishing, camping, boating, guns, ammo, trapping, bows and arrows, sporting safety, first aid and wildlife preservation.

From the Manufacturer
Hunting, Fishing, Camping Trivia is a fun-filled and educational game designed to entertain and challenge individuals of all ages involved in outdoor sporting activities. It is intended to provide you and your friends hours of fun at hunting or fishing camp, or at home! The game contains over one thousand seven hundred questions in five categories on Small Game, Large Game, Fishing, Camping, Boating, Guns, Ammo, Trapping, Bow and Arrows, Sporting Safety, First Aid, and Wildlife Preservation. Included are three hundred fifty cards, 1760 questions, quad-fold game board, playing pieces consisting of a die, five pawns, twenty-five poker chips and instructions.

Hunting, Fishing, Camping Trivia provides a themed experience similar to the classic Trivial Pursuit game.

name: Deltora Quest Game: The Battle to Save Deltora
description:
From the box: "The Shadow Lord has taken control of Del. You must help Lief battle the Shadow Lord's minions in order to regain the 7 gems that make up the Belt of Deltora. Restore the belt and use it's pwers to fight the Shadow Lord. If the Shadow Lord is defeated in the final battle at Del, peace will be returned to the land."

Players move around the board by dice rolling and card play, collecting Ability Points by landing on the 'speed', 'strength' and 'cleverness' spaces. Players also draw cards when they land on a 'draw card' space. These cards allow you to perform a variety of actions depending on you abilities. Most importantly they allow you to battle villains and potentially win gems. The game goes into the final battle when all of the gems have been won. Players then take turns using the gems they have collected to allow them to battle the Shadow Lord. If they defeat the Shadow Lord, they win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Sudoku Taisen 4x4: The Great Battle of Sudoku
description:
Taisen, a Japanese word for Great Battle. Now you know ... But are you ready? Are you ready for the Great Battle of Sudoku!

4x4 grid with 432 ways to play and you are the puzzle!

In Sudoku Taisen 4x4, it is much more challenging to complete your grid because you are sharing 8 squares (shared squares are called Taisen Square) with your opponent(s). Your opponents can place a number to prevent you from completing your grid. Therefore, you need to stack your opponent's number with your desired number, so you may complete your grid. Your opponents will surely do the same to you. Furthermore, additional challenge, your fate of winning also depends on your dice roll and the Taisen Card you draw.

Contents:
20 Taisen Cards
88 Chips
1 Die
1 Board (two sides)
1 Manual

Board is designed for two or four players. It can also be used for one player and three players.

Related to:

Sudoku Taisen 6x6: The Great Battle of Sudoku

name: The Play's the Thing
description:
From the back of the box:

The Setting - London, England in the year 1603.

The Players - You and your friends, all Elizabethan actors.

The Plot - Dash and duel your way around the Globe Theater board. Watch out for stage mishaps, missed cues, and even the plague while you collect scenes - plot lines, quotations, and characters - from Shakespeare's latest plays.

A Happy Ending - to win, collect and perform the most scenes. No acting necessary, unless you want to!

To Act or Not to Act - Beginners to experts can play together on these four levels.
1. Novice: You know nothing about Shakespeare's plays and just want to have fun. To "perform" a scene, simply lay down matching sets of cards, Rummy-style.
2. Apprentice: You're not familiar with a play, but want to be by the end of the game. To "perform," answer easy questions.
3. Scholar: You know the play, and want to review it or learn more about it. To "perform," answer tougher questions.
4. Actor's Choice: You love to act, but may or may not know the play well. To "perform," memorize and recite lines - with feeling! - one short scene at a time.

What's Inside -

Master Card Set: Hamlet, Julius Caesar, Romeo and Juliet
Globe Theater game board
6 Actor Playing Pieces
1 Die
Booklet with rules, background, and a recommended reading list


Expanded by:

The Play's The Thing Comedy Set

name: Calm Your Tits
description:
(A "tit" is a kind of bird in England and most of the cards depict them. Some with balls of bird food. One card has cats on it. The clear intention is adult sexual innuendo.)

—user summary

The aim of this titillating pairs game for very silly adults is to win all the cards or be the last tit standing!
Players win cards for correctly shouting "Nice tits!" or "Tough tits!" when a matching pair shows, or for having the quickest hand action when the Fat Balls appear.
Watch out when the Pussy Posse are on patrol...things could easily go tits up!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Road Warrior
description:
extrapolated from session report:

This is a 1996 Australian game by Bedford and Grigor for 2-8 players.

Each player gets a bike, car or truck. To move, you roll dice - 3 for bikes, 2 for cars, 1 dice + 2 for trucks. You can ram someone by moving on top of them, higher die wins, loser goes back a space, both cars suffer hit points equal to the opposite roll. If the mover wins, they can keep going.

If you move, you can also play an action card. These can fire missiles / guns / etc. at other cars, allow you to roll more movement dice, ignore terrain effects, etc. Unless the defender has a defense card, the attack card will specify a range (in range if vehicles are less spaces away than eg result of 2 dice) and the number of dice to roll to determine hit points. Trucks start with a lot of hit points to counter their low movement, bikes start with not many. Lose all your hit points and you can start again at half hit points, or attempt to hijack another car.

The track is about 100 spaces long, with some bridges / crossovers and 5 different terrain types. For example you need to roll multiples of 5 to move each snow space, 4 for oil spaces. There are obstacle spaces which allow you to pull an instantly applied obstacle card. These are a mix of mostly good and occasional bad events.

You can also pass and simply pick up an action card. Last car standing or first one past the finish line wins.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The MAN Game
description:
Players compete in tests of manly trivia and skills. Each player takes turns drawing a game card, which has a question or task listed on it, as well as a point value based on the difficulty. If a player completes the card successfully, he gets the point value in poker chips. If he is unsuccessful, he loses the point value from his chip count. Last man with chips at the table wins.

From the publisher: A game MEN will REALLY want to PLAY! A game of chip pitching, knot tying, football flicking, head scratching, chest thumping man fun!

Playing is as easy as opening the box and drawing a card – because real men don’t read instructions.
- Best looking man goes first.
- Draw a card and begin playing.
- Have fun. No fighting.
- Last man standing wins.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Bank On It!
description: Be the first player to reach the Tag Sale at the center of the board with enough money to buy a secret prize.

name: Scooby-Doo! Mystery Mansion Game
description: There's a monster lurking in the mystery mansion. If you're the first player to discover who it is and what they're doing to try to scare Scooby Doo and his friends, you win.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Osakepeli
description: A game about the stock market. Players buy stocks and pay customer fees. A player wins, if the other players go bankrupt. If that is not happening, the players can choose the ending time together. The stocks are sold with the prices of a randomly chosen card. The wealthiest wins.

name: Frankenwords: The Compound Word Laboratory
description:
Description from the publisher:

Frankenwords is the fast-paced matching game that puts a thrill into making new words! Stitch two words together to create new meanings and watch vocabulary come alive in amazing ways. Encouraging kids to be inventive and experiment with compound words, Frankenwords is the exciting word laboratory of electrifying play!

Here's how it works: 1. stack the cards in a grid, 2. race to be the first to find a Frankenword, 3. grab the cards a score a point!

User summary:
First player to 8 points wins. The cards have words on one side and the same words with a picture for students just learning to read on the other. Show only words, words with pictures or a mixture of both... choose according to the players' abilities.

name: Going Postal
description:
A postal delivery game where each player acts as a postal worker delivering parcels to the other players.

Turns are played simultaneously, and every player has the same 4 action cards and starts with 6 parcel delivery quota. There are 4 turns and 3 rounds in the game and the game ends by the end of the 3rd round.

In this game, as a postman, you have to deliver parcels to do your job, or else you are fired. However, you also have to obtain points in the game. At the end of 3 rounds if the 6 parcels are not delivered, you are fired from the job and lose the game. The winner by the end of three rounds is the one with the most points.

-description from publisher

name: Manara Hard Game
description:
A deck of cards, with an erotic theme, with an associated game. It has no resemblance to Manara Game but is more like a two player-in-a-group Dixit with sexually explicit art.
All players should ready a scoring pad were all the names of the players of their opposing gender are noted down. This is a boys vs girls game! The cards have 5 different backsides and are sorted in 5 piles. The active player picks a color and draws 2 cards. The opposing player also picks 2 from the same pile. The active player picks a card from the two (s)he drew. Sitting across from each other, both players make eye contact and, without speaking or gesturing, try to communicate the card the active player picked. Afters some time, both play their card. If it matches, both get 5 points. If not, they get a second chance, and if it matches now, they can earn 2 points. If it fails again, they receive 0 points. After every person has played with every other person of the opposite gender, the game ends. Points are added up, Winner (per gender!) who has the most. The "Winning couple" is entitled to act out one of there cards that gave them 5 points if the play group decides to vote for it.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: The Monster Squad Game
description: Based on the old "popular" television series, this game is a simple children's game about getting your monster squad back to their proper lair or home.
categories: Children's Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Dallas Cowboys
description:
The historic 'Dallas Cowboys and the world’s most popular board game have teamed up to create the ultimate fantasy for fans of all ages. This incredible NFL franchise has won a phenomenal five Super Bowls and its roster includes some of the greatest gridiron players of all time. Buy, sell and trade the most significant players, coaches and historic moments in the history of the Cowboys, including Michael Irvin, Randy White, Bob Lilly and Tom Landry. Get ready to wheel and deal your way to the ultimate Cowboys team of all time!

Comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens: Cowboys Cheerleader, Football, Referee’s Whistle, Quarterback, Cowboys Helmet and Linebacker.

Dimensions: 26 × 51 × 4 cm
Ages: 8+
Players: 2-6
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Summer Heights High
description:
Based on the Australian television show, in Summer Heights High: the popularity board game players must try to earn the most popularity points. Popularity points are used as a form of currency to claim (or purchase) school spaces, such as the cafeteria or classrooms. Other players are then charged points if they land on a place that has been claimed.

Players can also be sent to detention and can pick fights with other players to claim territory (decided by rolling the die).

The game is clearly a simplified version of Monopoly, with paper "popularity points" instead of money.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lovagkor
description:
Orginally published as Ismerd meg a lovagkort! ("Get to know the age of chivalry!") this Hungarian game is now available in an expanded version, sold also under the name of Lovagor - Itt te vagy a király! ("Age of chivalry - you are the King!")

Home Page: http://integraljatek.hu/html/lovagkor%20tarsasjatek.htm

name: Ad Mania
description: Advertising trivia game. There are categories for general trivia, slogans, clues (identify the subject using as few clues as possible), and brain drain (miscellaneous). Additionally, there is an "Impersonation" category in which players must act out the character, person, or product listed.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Botany Bay
description:
Gather as many Reputation Points as possible while colonising Australia and developing an economic structure; from the times of Captain Cook's landing in 1770 through to the 2000 Olympic Games.

In the 1st edition of the game an English translation of the rules is required and game components contain substantial German text.

name: Domingo
description:
Not to be confused with the Ravensburger game with the same name (look here: 3 Or More) this one is named as a cross between BINGO and Dominoes.

The tiles are square and have a number on all 4 sides. Players draw a tile and place it in their 5X5 tray. All sides must match. The first player to place 5 in a straight line wins. Included in the box are rules for a few other variations.

name: Battle Dice
description: Players start with 1000 life points, and attempt to drain their opponents while staying alive themselves. Players hit their opponents by rolling combinations of dice that match those on the card (five of a kind: 100) (pair: 10). First to run out loses. Other cards affect the number and type of dice rolled, payoffs and other effects on the game. Game can be played with a 120 card stand alone set or several single cards in addition to starter sets.

name: Save Our Bureaucrats
description:
This is a representative of this peculiarly American class of board game produced for political reasons, as a form of parody. For some reason, most instances of these games come from the right wing (another game in the same class is Capital Punishment, which is much more vitriolic in its political commentary).

The "object" of this game is to "go broke and go on Welfare with the help of government grants and boondoggles". As the player tokens go around the board, their starting money eventually dwindles to nothing, at which point they no longer receive nor pay out money (ignoring the instructions on most of the board spaces) and exclusively draw from the Welfare fund (a separate pile of money) each turn they go around the board. The game continues until the Welfare is exhausted, and the winner is then the player who got the most Welfare.

name: In Dubio Pro Reo
description: In Doubt For The Accused is a card game of guilt or innocence but has total German text on the cards.

name: Rip-Off
description:
An original card game showing "how the consumer gets ripped off". Each player is assigned one of the four categories of businesses, each of which sells goods or services costing 100, 200, 300 or 400 $. Each player starts with 1000 $. First player to amass 100 Consumer points wins.

On your turn, you roll a die. If it is 1-4, you go visit the corresponding dealer. If you rolled yourself, you pick one of the three others. If you rolled 5-6, you draw a Consumer card and then go visit a dealer of your choice. The Consumer cards give small Consumer Point bonuses or penalties, or small cash awards (up to 500 $). At the beginning of each round, all players receive 100 $ each.

Each dealer has six cards, one Catch card, two Rip-Off cards and three Good Deal cards. They are spread in front of him, face down, in any order of the dealer's choice. The consumer then decides how much he will spend (100-400 $) and forks the money over to the vendor. The dealer then rolls a die and picks up the corresponding card (left to right) from his spread; next, he chooses one of the five remaining cards. Finally, he picks up the card corresponding to the amount spent (100 $ - first card, and so on up to 400 $ - fourth card). Thus the dealer has limited control over what choice to offer to the consumer.

The consumer then draws one of the three cards proferred by the dealer (still face down). If a Good Deal, he receives 10-40 Consumer points. If a Catch, he receives half as much. If a Rip-Off, he *loses* 10 Consumer points but has the option of suing.

To sue, pay 500 $ to the Bank, then dice off against the vendor. If the consumer rolls lower, he lost the suit. If he tied or bested the vendor, he is awarded compensation depending on the margin of success. The least result is that he recovers the lost 10 CPs and is refunded the court costs by the vendor. The vendor may be forced to pay such a large penalty that he goes into debt. If your debt gets larger than 1000 $, you are bankrupt and out of the game. Whilst in debt, you cannot buy when your turn comes, but instead just draw a Consumer card. All income goes to pay off the debt.

name: Loser
description: LOSER is a party game where players move around the board based on their responses to questions about bad behavior, bad judgment, and just plain bad luck. The colors on the board and the roll of the dice add an element of "Loser's Luck" to the game. A social game with lots of embarrassing storytelling. Because we've all done things we're not proud of.

name: Richie Rich
description:
Richie Rich is based on the comics of the same name. In this board game, players assume the roles of the titular character and his friends. Their objective is to deposit jewels at the bank and return home. Standing in their way are thieves and the pranks of Richie's cousin, Reggie.

Players move their pieces along the track by rolling a die. They may move forwards or backwards. When they land on a space, they must follow the instructions on it: for example, Reggie makes players lose a turn, while short-cut spaces let players move their pieces further ahead. Thief spaces, however, stop a moving piece in its tracks and hold it there. Players must draw an Invention card each turn to obtain one with a number that matches the thief's to escape the criminal's space and continue moving.

The first player to land exactly on the Finish spot wins and ends the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cube-It
description: This is boxed version of the tradition pencil-and-paper game Cube-It that you used to play in grade school. This version has some updates include random scoring sheets that give each player different point values for specific squares on the grid as well as some cards which offer special plays.

name: Nitty Gritty
description:
Do you know what your friend, girlfriend or brother would answer to these questions??


If you could assassinate someone, who would it be?
Have you ever fantasized about a workmate?
What is your favorite alcoholic drink?
If you had to take 3 people into a bomb shelter, who would they be?
What Simpsons’ character are you most like?
If you could keep only 1 of your 5 senses, which would it be?


With questions like these, Nitty Gritty will test how well you know your best friend, lover, sister, husband or best friend's lover's sister's husband!

To play is simple - land on a category, ask your teammate a question and let them write down their answer. If you guess the answer, then you get another go. If not, pass the die to the next team!

All it takes to be a champion at Nitty Gritty is to have listened to your teammate’s boring childhood stories, put up with their opinions, know their tastes, and heard their secrets!

name: Bat Masterson
description:
This is a simple deduction game. Player's take on the roles of 'Deputies' and attempt to track down the outlaw known as "The Chief".

Six Clue cards, distributed at various locations around the board, tell you who is not The Chief. The remaining outlaws will hinder your investigation. The game is basically a race game to find all of the clues before your opponents and to drag the guilty culprit back to jail.

The game comes with large cardboard building that are placed on the board. The look of a small western town gives a little flavor to an otherwise bland game.
categories: American West, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Don: Continuing Criminal Enterprise
description:
DON: CCE is a new collectible card game that allows two players to assume the roles of the head of a Criminal Organization vying for control of a major city. The Player Don uses a wide variety of Associates and Family Members to attempt to bankrupt his opponent. In addition to henchmen, a Don may play actions directly from his hand to affect either his own Associates or his opponent’s. The Don who bankrupts his opponent’s funds is the winner.

DON: CCE is set in a timeless world of crime, containing elements from the Prohibition era through the rise of the modern mob. This fantasy world of the Mafia is simulated to allow players to battle each other in a spirit reflective of classic Gangster movies.

Player Dons use their tradable cards to generate funds, control vices and even whack their opponent’s Associates. Game rules are provided to play Sealed Deck, Double Sealed Deck and Constructed decks for use in tournament play, multiple player, and direct head to head competition. The Capo starter deck is available now. The Capo booster packs, available in Summer 2003, will add a wealth of characters, actions, and possibilities to any game of DON: CCE. The complete card set at present contains over 200 separate cards representing everything from a lowly Babbo Crew to the powerful Made Men and the infamous Penitent Wife™. The artwork is highly stylized to represent the classic gangster photos of yesteryear with hints of contemporary crime.

Using a revolutionary new game system, Dons are able to control cards in ways that other card games have never imagined. Each player’s actions control how many cards he wishes to deploy as well as how many funds he chooses to spend. In DON: CCE, each Don controls his fate through strategy, not luck.

Future expansions will add even more stylized elements of the genre, including more Law Enforcement, additional Associates, more Family members, and even more Vices for Dons to expand their “businesses”.

name: Fürsten von Burgund
description: "Abstract" wargame. Be the ruler of the most of 22 territories. You have 5 knights and 9 pages for fighting and building castles and 1 trader for building trading posts. Each round you´ll get 10 action points for several actions At the end of the game (after 20 rounds) you´ll get 20 influence points for each castle and 10 influence points for each trading post and a unknown number of influence points which you accumulated during the 20 rounds. Only the player with the highest sum of IP controls that territory. Fighting is without dice and there are only 4 pages of rules.
mechanics: Area Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Trading

name: Airport
description:
"Consider yourself the Captain of an airliner on a flight from Miami, Florida to Seattle, Washington. The object of the game is to pilot your aircraft along the airways, crossing over the cities of your choice, in route to the destination airport and be the first to complete the flight."

"This game is designed to be a realistic experience for the player, as many of the game rules are based on actual federal air regulations."

"Pilot-players pit themselves against each other and other flying odds as they strive to stay in the lead. Each pilot must be careful of thunderstorms which can unexpectedly cross their paths, just as in a real flight. Each pilot might also hit strong headwinds, severe icing or even clear air turbulence, as they fly across the country."
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Flying Nun Game
description: Merchandising of the American television show. Players each have a set of a cards and a separate track to move their pawn around. The goal is for the player to lay down all of his or her cards. The cards may be placed on the board when a player's pawn lands on the corresponding space in their track. Cards may also be played on opponent's tracks in certain circumstances.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Blockbuster Movie Game
description:
Pop a movie in your video or DVD player - then roll 'em! Players select and watch a minute-long scene from the movie.

When the producer yells, "cut!", time's up and players have to correctly answer questions about the scene they've just viewed.

The first person to travel around the game board and collect all four movie tokens wins.

Contents:

1 Game Board
6 pads of paper
6 pencils
1 die
1 60 second clapboard timer
48 "Buying Coins"
6 game pieces
24 Popcorn, candy, drink and movie tokens

You Need:

Television
VCR or DVD player
Your favorite movie
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Campaign!: The American Go Game
description: Subtitled "The American Go Game." Campaign! was published in 1961 to reflect on the War Between the States. The game board is made up of squares 18 long and 15 wide, with various "battlefields" interspersed among the blocks. Each player starts with 72 wooden discs. Each turn, a player rolls the dice and adds discs to his or her lines, attempting to surround the battlefields in order to get the points assigned to each battlefield. The battlefields are worth different points to each player, depending on the size of the battlefield and the distance from the player's home base. The back of the board includes brief descriptions of the major battles of the Civil War.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Civil War, Wargame

name: Adverteasing Junior
description: Kids will have a great time recalling well-known TV commercial characters, slogans and jingles, racing down the exciting adverteasing-land roller coaster - moving ahead with each correct answer.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: WCW Full Impact
description: WCW Full Impact, the card game that lets you be part of the action. Step into the ring and see if you have what it takes to be the best. Try to wear down your opponent and finish them off with all the moves from your favorite WCW wrestlers. But watch out! There are plenty of surprises waiting for you in this fast-paced card game.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Pittopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly type game designed for alumni, students and friends of the University of Pittsburgh.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Fraction Action
description:
A unique deck of cards designed to teach the concept of fractions using snaps and pairs. Covers percentages, decimals, and other fraction concepts. Includes a self-checking guide. Ages 6 and up

Uses the basic rules of the card game of War (flip a card, highest wins - ties flip another card with the winner getting them all). Game is played until one player has all of the cards.
publishers: Game Geste, Green Board Game Co.

name: Sex!
description:
From the box:

Each Sex! card explicitly illustrates either a foreplay activity or a sexual position. While playing one of the three Sex! card games, you and your lover use the cards to plan out one of the 100,000 possible fantasies. After building a fantasy, you both act it out.

Sex! can be played three ways. Compete to build an ultimate night of passion by playing Ultimate Fantasy, let fate decide your night with Fortune Teller, or build your fantasy while learning about your lover's likes, loves, and lusts with Lover's Libido.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Europa-Post
description:
Basically, Europa-Post seems to be a mere variant of "Journey Through Europe" with a slightly different map and topic.
You play an international messenger. You get assigned to a home city and have to deliver letters to other European capitals and major cities by using train (slowest), ship or airplane. Every ship and airline has a vehicle and you may only use it when it's in the right port/airport.
Who delivers first wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zorro
description:
In this version of Zorro, players race across a Z-shaped track to one end in order to become Zorro, then to the other to return to their hide-out. The first player to return as Zorro is the winner.

Along with the Z-shaped board track, Whitman also typeset the game instructions in the form of a Z.

The UK edition of this game was published by Chad Valley in 1962, but was entitled "Walt Disney's Zorro Race Game" - not to be confused with the almost identically named, "Walt Disney's Zorro Game" which is a totally different game.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Klee, Whitman

name: Bobs Y'r Uncle
description: A very old and simple card game. The deck consists of 54 cards. 48 of which depict different nursery rhymes: 8 nursery rhyme sets plus 6 joker cards (3 "uncle" cards and 3 "black boy" cards). There are 3 ways to win this game. You can either get rid of all your cards, or collect all "uncle" cards, or collect all of the "black boy" cards.

name: Monopoly: Arsenal
description:
Monopoly themed around the Arsenal Football Club (UK). Features many of the great players personalities and landmarks including Arsene Wenger, Tony Adams, David Seaman and more.

The classic boardgame takes on a new shape in this Arsenal edition. Featuring stars from the current squad alongside heroes from Arsenal's illustrious past and two of the club's greatest managers, this version of Monopoly requires players to accumulate wealth by aquiring stands and stadiums. Community Chest and Chance cards are replaced by Home and Away cards. It's an absolute must for all Arsenal fans!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Champions: Wildstrike
description: A Champions-based game of superhero arena-combat. Use characters provided or construct your own superheroes and then battle in an arena with a simple combat system. Includes arena map, hero cards, cardboard counters, rule booklet, in ziplock format.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Vices Trivia Card Set
description:
From the box:

This trivia card set is designed to be played as a stand alone game, or as a companion to such related games as Avalon Hill's Game of Trivia and Selchow & Richter's Trivial Pursuit.

Contains six categories

Drinking & Gluttony
Altered States
Gambling & Gaming
Saints & Sinners
Passions & Perversions
Cheap Thrills

Age - Adult
3000 Questions
Model AG1020

"Blue laws. Red lights. Royal flushes. Royal blushes. Drugs. Booze. Bad guys & dolls. Goodness! (Goodness has nothing to do with it!)"

name: Motownopoly
description: In this Monopoly variant, players buy, sell an and trade the greatest hit songs of Motown. Each game comes with a CD featuring the songs: "Shop Around", "My Girl", "Stop: In the Name of Love", "I Can't Help Myself", "I Heard it through the Grapevine" and "I want you back".
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Clifford Crazy Eights Card Game
description:
Very well-themed variation consists of 32 'cards' shaped like bones, and stored in a little plastic dog dish. There are 4 different colors, with 8 cards (1 per TV show character; Emily Elizabeth, Jetta, Cleo, T-Bone, Shackleford, Rodrigo, Charley, and Clifford) of each. Cliffords are the 8s, and they are wild.

Differences from regular crazy eights are:
- no skip/miss turns
- no pick-up 'x'
- if can't go, keep picking up bones until you can

Re-implements:

Crazy Eights
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Hit med sangen
description: Game based on a popular Danish game-show. The purpose being first to complete a series of events including drawing, singing and guessing song titles/composers of contemporary pop music. The main feature being a guessing game where the players on turn is given a word on which they should sing a song with the word included. Basically a light hearted feel good game for easy fun and entertainment on a Friday night.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Siege of Paris
description: A game inspired by the Prussian siege of Paris. The game is played on a 12x16 grid which has a fortress in the center consisting of eight circular spaces. Thirty-six attackers, eighteen from each end of the board, attempt to immobilize the eight defenders in the fortress. The defenders win by capturing all besieging soldiers and six officers. The attackers draw by entering the fortress or win by having an officer and two or three men in the fortress.

name: Kill Everything!
description:
From the back of the game:

“We could tell you all about how this is an accurate simulation of real events and warfare, how many buildings were destroyed, how much weaponry was expended. How many soldiers died, and how many civilians were accidentally killed.

But you are probably not interested.

I will tell you that this game includes naval, aerial, and ground forces. As well as nuclear bombs, killer satellites, and labor camps. 2 to 4 players can play at the same time, and lots of fun can be had by all, because the intent of this game is to…

KILL EVERYTHING!
The friendly game of genocidal warfare”

Two to four island maps are attached together, then populated Risk-style. From then on units are purchased and combat is made in the same vein as Axis & Allies. Elements that make this game stand out from other war games include the ability loot territories they own to gather immediate production funds, but at the cost of turning that land into a wasteland which produces no further resources as well as the ability to bribe units not to attack. More typical elements include generals which improve troops attacks, research and development of new technology, and fortifications like cities, labor camps and the run-of-the-mill fortress.

Game comes with four map sheets, (attachable in multiple ways) two war boards, (folding for hidden deployment of troops in battle) and a pile of cut-out chits, money, and stand up buildings and generals.
categories: Economic, Environmental, Humor, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Hendrik Van Loon's Wide World Game
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to complete the trip around the world from San Francisco to Manila, by steamer and airplane. The game featured metal airplanes and steamships which served as the playing pieces that were moved between the two cities.

Hendrik Van Loon was a famous Dutch-born American writer who authored over 30 books.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Nautical, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Die Kinder-Uni. Das Spiel
description: Das Kinder-Uni is a popular range of children's books in Germany. Thomas Fackler has designed this game from the book to build on its success.

name: Tank Trap
description: One of 9 games released by the Helen of Toy Game Company that graced many a comic book from the late 50's into the early 80's. Tank Trap was a classic Helen of Toy War Game that featured 3D G.I. Toy Soldiers by GIANT, a large "Battlefield" Playmat, and among other accessories, the infamous "Exploding Tanks." The game had 64 COMBAT MEN and 6 TANKS (3 olive green, 3 gray) set up on the 12 1/2" x 25 1/2" BATTLEFIELD. Tanks consisted of two hard plastic halves which were held together by rubber band tension and were triggered by the slightest touch. Note that later Helen of Toy Ads offered a "Free Chess Game" premium (actually just a printed piece of paper - you cut the pieces out yourself), promised 48 hours processing time, and claimed to be shipped in "Handsome Simulated Book Form" (actually just a flat, plain white, cardboard box.

name: Chasse
description:
Players take turns trying to remove their pieces from a square board resembling a checker board with the difference being a 4x4 squre in the center of the board. Movement is the same as in checkers, though a die is used, and jumps are compulsory. If you can manage to get your own pieces onto the four corners of the center square section, you may remove all the pieces in you back row, thereby winning the game. Alternately you can win by manuevering your last four pieces to the corners of the center square section.

High production value makes this abstract strategy game an interestting aquisition. Rules and equiptment to play Chasse are included in the box with Kassle.

name: Supergroup
description:
Designed by record industry professionals, Supergroup plays with all the excitement of the real record business. You can become an overnight sensation or work your way up the hard way; either way the goal is the same...you want to be a superstar!

Just as real musicians do, you start off by forming your own group and "Paying Dues" -- playing those dumb gigs that are the first step to being discovered.

Once your group becomes established you go "On The Road", getting valuable experience. At the same time you start cutting demo records which you hope will attract an agent and a recording company.

Once you get yourself that agent he helps get your recording contract and you're ready to start working "Studio Gigs" -- right there in front of the microphones, you begin cutting discs that will send you "On The Charts".

Then it's a race to the "Top Ten" with the winner walking off with the prized gold record.

Anyone can come up with the right combination of talent and luck that will take them from obscurity to stardom. The more you get into Supergroup, the more you'll dig it!

name: Sleepy Time
description:
Sleepy Time is a very basic game for young children Ages 4 - 8. You have a hand of 4 animal cards and 4 animal cards to choose from on the table (face up). The object is to find a pair of matching animals and put them to bed in your cardboard sleeping area of 6 beds. You must make a match with a card from your hand and a card on the table - you can not 'put to bed' pairs from within your hand. If you are unable to make a pair, you discard a card face up to the table. The first player to put six pairs of animals to bed first, wins.
This game is easy to teach and moves very quickly to keep very young players engaged.

name: Galactic Conquest
description:
A very unusual game of space exploration and combat with no board or pieces, managed by a "game-master." The game-master lays out a system and assigns resources.
