Players spend resource points to build ships, increase technology, take control of systems. All movement is plotted on paper, and the game-master then carries out ship orders, letting players know if their ships come into contact with each other, or what sorts of systems they encounter.

Includes: 19 page rulebook, reference table card
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Never Say Die
description:
The object of this game is to win as many chips as possible. Three special six-sided dice are used; each dice has three red letters (an "L," a "C," and an "R") along with three black dots. Players start with three chips. Each rolls the dice (never any more dice than chips) and distributes chips according to the roll, either to the player on the left, the center (pot), the player on the right, or no action if a black dot is rolled. Play continues clockwise. Players without chips can stay in the game because the rolls of others may give them some chips (hence the name of the game), but must pass on their roll.

Never Say Die, published in 1959, was republished almost exactly in 1992 as LCR. There are two rules in Never Say Die that are missing in LCR. First, players may permanently "retire" any number of chips over three that they own as individual winnings. Second, the winner of the pot in Never Say Die is the player who holds the last chip not in the pot and who rolls a "C." It's possible that a player will hold the last two or even the last three chips not in the pot; in this case she may be fortunate enough to roll nothing but "C's" and work all her chips to the center to win. If the player holding the last chip rolls a dot, she keeps rolling until she gets a letter. The winner starts the next game.

This boxed game included a plastic dice cup (with snap-on lid), three dice, 24 large chips, and instructions.

Re-implemented by:

LCR
publishers: Peter Pan Playthings, Phillips Publishers, Inc.

name: Three Kingdoms in Ancient China
description:
2 in 1. "Five Tigers in Three Kingdoms Age 2" and "Challenges of Kung-Ming Against the North".

"Five Tigers in Three Kingdoms Age 2" is a new edition of "Five Tigers in Three Kingdoms Age" which was published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) by Sho-Kikaku in 1990.
"Five Tigers in Three Kingdoms Age 2" consists of 164 pieces, a 59 x 42 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 6 pages of rules (in Japanese). The Chinese continent is printed in a map. Player numbers are five to seven and playing time is 1-4 hours. Players become lords of kingdoms in Ancient China.

"Challenges of Kung-Ming Against the North" consists of 88 pieces, a 59 x 42 cm map (printed in Japanese) and 8 pages of rules (in Japanese). "Challenges of Kung-Ming Against the North" covers the battles between Shu and Wei in A.D.223-234. Turn length is a year. An unit is five thousands soldiers. Player numbers are two and playing time is 2-3 hours.

name: Jungle
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #54.

2 to 6 Indian prices fight for the control of a small region.

name: Valgkamp
description: This is a political game in which you and your party tries to win an election using every means possible.

name: The Cocoo's
description:
The Cocoos contains several different games. They are about collecting sets of 4 Cards. the Cards have two different sides. One is kind of green and the other light red. Each card has Cocoos in 4 different sizes and in 4 different colors. The basic principle is that a card has different cocoos on each side. This means if there is a red Cocoo in size 4 on one side, there is certainly not a red cocoo and no cocoo in size 4 on the other side.
You start picking cards from the table, and as you can see one side of the card you can guess which card helps you most in collecting a set.
It is a quite tricky game.

name: Wer fürchtet sich vorm schwarzen Mann
description:
Beer and pretzel game. One player (A) gets one black figure, the other player (B) 6 figures in different colors.

Object of the game is:
- For player A: To catch all the colored Figures
- For player B: To bring at least one figure to the other side of the board.

Player A gets a die (D6) with two black sides and one orange side.
Player B gets a die (D6) with 6 different colors, matching his figures..

Player A starts rolling the die. If he rolls black he can move his figure one space (front, side, back). If he lands on a space with a colored figure, he catches this figure. This figure is then placed on a space in the goal line, blocking it. If he rolls orange and has already captured a figure he can change the position of one of his captured figures on the goal line.

Player B moves the playing piece according to the rolled color on the die. He may move one space forward or to the side. If there is a figure on the space on he landed on, he pushes this figure one space further.

Easy, fast, fun.

name: Spelet om Sveriges städer
description:
Each player asks another player for a city card, and if he has it he has to hand it over. The goal is to complete as many sets as possible (each set corresponds to a county, and contains a varying number of cities).

The game is, in fact, a re-implementation of The Game of Authors with the added twist that the number of towns is not the same in each "family" (county).

name: Seventh Armored Division: Red Typhoon ‘95
description:
SBG-24 Seventh Armored Division (1987) (JPY 4800)

Subtitled “Self Defense Force Series-01” and “Red Typhoon ‘95”.

One mapsheet, 504 counters, four PACs (two identical), a Series Rulebook (12 pgs) and an Exclusive Rulebook (24 pgs). There looks to be one basic scenario only.

Unit sizes range from platoon through company for the Japanese, with exclusively battalions for the Soviets. Turns are 6 hours and run the first seven days of the invasion (28).

name: Hurry Up
description: The shipyard is a very busy place, and everyone is in a big hurry. How many crates can you stack before quitting time? Using the hand crane, place the crates in a single stack, one on top of the other. If a crate falls off the stack, your turn is over. Meanwhile, the other players are trying to stop you. If they roll a six on the die, it's quitting time and your turn is over.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hometown Monopoly: Bloomington
description: Monopoly using a person's hometown (in this case, Bloomington, IN) as the theme. From the back of the rules, "...consultation with attorneys representing Parker Brother avoided patent and copyright infringement..."
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Trivial Pursuit: Edicion Olimpica [Spanish]
description:
This is a master game, complete with board. The instructions and questions are entirely in Spanish and cover the 1992 Olympics in Barcelona.
Categories are:
Futbol y Baloncesto
Paises y Lugares Olimpicos
Otros Deportes Olimpicos
Deportes Olimpicos Basicos
Vips y Personajes
Historia y Noticias del Deporte

name: Volcano
description:
Ash Sunday's "Volcano" describes itself as "A board game odyssey to the May 18th eruption of Mount St. Helens." A short history of the 1980 eruption is provided.

The game itself is a race from Toutle to Cougar and to the Crater Observation Point, then back again. Pyroclastic flows, mud flows, road blocks, and bureaucracies all serve to deter the players along their route.

Players may choose to remove the "Big Eruption!" card from the deck that eliminates its drawer.

name: Spots
description:
Spots is a card game in which two or more players will make change from a pool of cards. Scoring is handicapped based on the difference between the total of a player's starting cards and the lowest total of the opponent's starting cards.

Players put one card from their hand into the pool, taking cards with a total value equal to or greater into their score pile. The player with the lowest score after all cards have been played wins.

Spots was designed to be a card-based version of Pennywise. It was first published in the Origins 2000 preregistration book.

name: Civil War Pigs
description: This light-hearted game adapts the War with Plastic Infantry Guys (P.I.G.s) rule system to the period of the American Civil War. Cavalry, cannon, and morale rules, as well as scouts and period weapons are all included. The game is published as a booklet of rules only, so players must supply their own 1/32 scale plastic army men. Civil War Pigs is designed for two or more players, ages ten and up. Got a bag of plastic Civil War army guys and you've got a game!
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Humor, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dr. Futsch
description:
Dr. Futsch is Alex Randolph's version of Sleuth, a simple deduction cardgame. The goal of the game is to find the infamous master of disguise, Dr. Futsch. There are 8 distinct disguise items and Dr. Futsch randomly chooses 3 of them for his disguise. Other players try to guess who Dr. Futsch is from 56 possible choices.
One year later published as Disguise (same graphics).

Re-implemented by
Das lustige Detektivspiel für Kinder

name: Containment
description:
"Containment" is a game played between pro-nuclear and anti-nuclear factions. Pro-nuclear players try to go "on line" and produce electricity; anti-nuclear players try to shut down the reactor and switch to alternate forms of energy production. A reactor in the center of the board moves either towards or away from meltdown as the game progresses, depending on the players' actions.

"Containment" may be played on three levels: a Basic game that is purely luck driven, a Standard game that uses arguments and counterarguments (given on the game board) in the nuclear power debate to influence game play, and an Advanced game that calls on the players to evaluate and rank their own arguments as well as those of their opponents.

The game is obviously inspired by the events at the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in 1979, as one of the arguments given on the game board explicitly mentions TMI. The box cover artwork is also very evocative of TMI.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Megacorp
description: In a manner slightly reminiscent of Milton Bradley's game of "Life", two to six players choose whether to follow a path of self-employment and eventual sellout to Megacorp, or a university program that leads them to employment with Megacorp. However, both paths eventually converge and lead the players onto the path of a corporate takeover. When all players have reached either the "Pyramid" or the "Over Budget" squares, the player with the greatest total of Common Stock Shares becomes the Chief Executive Officer of Megacorp and wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spacelab
description:
The aim of the game is to build a spacelab from several components. The players compete to bring up the most modules. Therefore they need to buy launch pads, rockets or the shuttle and the components itself.
There are different types of rockets that vary in their ability to carry one or more modules and how much weight they can accept. Rockets can be used only once, whereas the shuttle is reusable.
The game ends when one of the players picks the last module, rocket or extra card. The player with the most money (earned by successful installed modules) wins.
The components are very well done for a self-published game, the first edition held 211 copies.

name: Stops: American Edition
description:
STOPS is an acronym for states, territories or provinces.
The STOPS AMERICAN EDITION has 51 STOPS (or 51 possible answers), the names of the 50 states and Washington, DC, all of which are printed directly on the colorful, dynamic game board. STOPS provides you with a clue, and you try to identify the STOP.

From an official report:

"The award-winning trivia game that is challenging without being frustrating. Featuring a variety of questions that vary in difficulty, STOPS© is a game that can be played by geography experts and novices at the same time. The questions range from obscure facts that might be more suited to Jeopardy, to easier fare about landmarks, capitals and more. Testers gave high marks to the design of the board, and the simple directions. Many of the teachers at the testing centers told us that they believed STOPS© would make a great tool in their classrooms."
THE NATIONAL PARENTING CENTER, 1998 Spring Report

name: Celtic Knot
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

A race game with a twist for two to four players, played with a printable board and 6 nickels, dimes, quarters, and pennies.

Object: To get your pieces from the corners of the board to the exit at the center.

On your turn, select a square with one or more of your coins in it. Flip all of those coins, counting heads as one point and tails as two points. Take the sum of your flips and move your coins in the chosen square that many spaces away from it. You must use your full movement on each coin. If your coins land on a square occupied by an opponent’s coin, take another turn to move those same coins. If your coins land on a vacant square, your turn ends. If your coins land on the center diamond, remove them from the board. This ends your turn.

Winning: The first player with no pieces left on the board wins.

name: OK Corral
description:
"A Gun-Fighter Card Game for 2-8 Players."

Each player is dealt five cards. On one turn a player draws the top card from the draw pile or the top card from the discard pile if there is one. A player may display a Bullet card from one’s hand or add the next card on one’s own sequence of Turn, Reach, Draw, Aim and Fire cards. Otherwise, the player must end the turn by discarding. After completing one’s own sequence, the player may use subsequent turns to use the Bullet cards to eliminate the other players one at a time. A player who is the target of another player’s Bullet may avoid elimination by discarding a Miss or Ricochet card. Playing a Distract card forces the targeted player to skip a turn. Play continues until the winner remains.

The game also contains some optional rules.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Take That

name: City Go: The Big City Discovery Game
description:
From the box:
City Go, The Big City Discovery Game is a great way to discover New York City's many treasures! Are you ready to search & find, draw & rhyme; do a little dance and sing some songs? Along the way, you'll find pianos and violins, planets and playgrounds, skyscrapers and skaters, jewels, dinosaurs, clocks, sculptures and more! As you play City Go, you get to travel through the fabulous City Go Map filled with over 100 original illustrations, drawn just for you! We've included museums, landmarks, performance venues, sporting arenas, parks, bridges and much more! The game involves risk, chance, guts, imagination and a good sense of humor! Players must first locate the illustration(s) on the city map and then perform the task. You score points for all of the tasks you do and whoever has the most points when Sam is freed wins!
City Go is for Ages 8 and up.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Quiz Wiz Challenger
description: Compete against your family, your friends with Quiz Wiz Challenger. The competitive question and answer game that up to four people can play at the same time! It can be played in two different ways. In Game 1, all players who answer the question correctly score points. In Game 2, a race against time, only the first player to answer the question correctly scores. In both versions, the first player to score 5 points wins the round. Comes with a computerized quiz book that plugs into the unit and is compatible with all Quiz Wiz Cartridge/Quiz books.

name: Table Top Football
description:
From the publisher:

"Although table top football is a game universally played in schools across the land, there has been a distinct lack of uniformity in rule interpretation between districts. Until now. We humbly present the definitive word on the subject, illustrated with a potpourri of wild graphics and packaged with a hand-stitched cowhide finger football."

This is a 30-page booklet with rules for at least three different variants of the old student staple, flicking a miniature football across a table. The miniature leather football provided is excellent. (We used to use matchbooks when I was young: open the matchbook and stand it up for field goal attempts.)

name: Gourmet Challenge
description:
Trivial Pursuit with questions about food.

You get a game board, 1000 cards each with 5 questions, 'cake' counters (colored disks to collect like the cheeses in TP), a dice.

The categories are 'Histories and Nationalities', 'Etiquette and Customs', 'Gourmets Delight', 'Wines and Beverages', and 'Ingredients and Preparations'

Move around the board, answer the questions you land on, collect one of each cake layer. Thats it.
publishers: Carievale Productions, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Cranium New York Booster Pack
description:
Cranium New York Booster Pack is a 45-card expansion to Cranium. It was created to raise money for the September 11th Fund. All cards pertain to New York City in some way, requiring players to impersonate famous New Yorkers, remember New York history, and draw and sculpt New York landmarks. The set contains 12 Star Performer cards and 11 cards each in the Creative Cat, Data Head, and Word Worm categories.

Expands:

Cranium
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Miamiopoly
description:
The Game Includes:

Tokens:
Alarm Clock, Pencil, Gym Shoe, Bicycle, Graduation Cap

Board Spaces:
Roudebush Hall, McGuffey Hall, Goggin Ice Arena, Ozzie's, High Street, Beta Bells, Western Campus

Cards:
Recite the Fight Song or Lose One Turn.

Parking in Faculty Parking! Pay $50.

Graduation Fee! Pay $25 for each Year of Credit and $100 for each Diploma.

Miami vs. UC. Advance to Yager Stadium.

Beta Bells Chime 2 o'clock. You are late for class! Advance immediately to McGuffey Hall.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Lance
description:
From the author:

"The rise of feudalism saw the continuation and subsequent peak in the rise of the armored cavalryman as masters of the battlefield. Most systems were centered around this element of the army. Battles such as Hastings tended to confirm their supremacy. By the fourteenth century there appeared in various nations trained infantrymen in numbers greater than previously hitherto. Battles such as Courtrai and Crecy were the first of many battles in which the infantry were to play increasingly decisive roles. Thus we see how the feudal system of castles and knights gave way to missiles and trained infantry. By 1500 gunpowder weapons were establishing a supremacy of their own, subsequent armies became balanced professional forces which are outside the scope of these rules."

Lance is a set of medieval 25mm miniature gaming rules that provides melee and ranged weapon attacks, terrain effects, leader rules, visibility and detection, unit formations, and morale.
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battle of the Monsters
description: Battle of the Monsters is a set of several games that can be played using the trading cards included in the Weird n' Wild Creatures collectors set. Weird n' Wild Creatures is a set of colorful data cards covering monsters of nature and mythology. The creatures on the data cards are also depicted on trading cards which list values for attack, defense, and life, which are used to play the Battle of the Monsters games. Some cards also list special powers. The games that can be played with the cards range from the very simple (a war variant where cards and drawn and attack values are compared) to the strategic.

name: Satellite Shoot
description:
This game has the same mechanics as the classic Battleship game, but it's the "Space Travel" version.

The board is separated by a cardboard stand-up divider, and the cardboard spaceship counters are placed on the board in the same way as Battleship.

Some very nice retro 60's artwork on the cover and board divider.
publishers: Gay Toy, Gazebo Games UK Ltd., Heritage Toy & Game Co. Ltd., Russimco Games, Theydon Games

name: World Traveler
description: From the box- World Traveler is an educational board game which expands the players' knowledge of the world. The object of the game is for players to complete their world travels while encountering obstacles and adventures along the way. Two to six players can play the game. The player to finish first is the winner, but other players can continue until they finish their world travels.

name: Get Up and Go
description:
From back of box:

Don't just sit there...Play!!

Draw a card. Did you get an Astronaut? A Ballerina? WOW! An ALLIGATOR!
GET UP & GO! Be an over-active alligator for 20 seconds! Put up your arms to make pretend alligator jaws. Open up wide and jump in the swamp for a quick swim. Wiggle and Wag! Stomp and Chomp! You were a great alligator! Other players will award you points for your perfect performance!

Contents:
55 Game Cards
24 Scoring Tiles
Sand Timer
Game Rules

name: Charmed: The Source
description:
Alternate name: Charmed La Source

The Source is the dominant Power of Evil. It strives to install its Reign of Terror over the World. It leads its hoards of demons in its attempt to enslave humanity. Only one obstacle blocks its path. It must eliminate the Halliwell sisters and take hold of their powers. When Prue died, the Source was certain it had overcome the Power of the 3; but now the sisters are three again and their powers are strengthened. The source can no longer send lesser demons against them: it must personally intervene to put an end to the Halliwell Sisters. Phoebe, Piper and Paige must once again out wit the Forces of Evil itself.

The Source is a games based on characters and themes from the latest seasons of the television series "Charmed". You play the main characters Piper, Phoebe, Paige and Cole in their battle against the Source. You must unmask the Source's lieutenants and eliminate them before you can face the Lord of Evil. Beware! You must work fast lest the source finds a way to overcome the Power of the 3 and win the Game!

name: Disney's Gummi Bears Giant Card Game
description: The 40 cards are placed face down. Players take turn revealing four cards. If two cards match, the two matching cards are placed next to the player; if three cards match, two of the matching cards are placed next to the player; and if four cards match, the player automatically wins the game. If a player uncovers two Duke Igthorn cards, that player may steal a pair for any player and add them to his or her pile with the two Duke cards. The winner is the player with the most pairs when all the cards have been revealed.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Save the Forest Ecology Game
description:
Take a walk in the woods and help the animals! What an important walk! Follow the path and see the rabbit jump, the bee buzz, the frog croak. Who can find the most animals? If you can find a tin can, bag or bottle cap, pick it up! Keeping the forest clean adds points to your score at the end of the trip.

Save the Forest teaches children about animals and their habitats, and gives a strong message about keeping the environment clean and respecting nature while having fun.

name: Gargoyles & Goblins
description: The board contains some hidden electronics which when two adjacent spaces are pressed will either cause the "Core Master" to light up and make noise - or not. Players move around the board and attack each other whenever they get next to another player by pressing down on both figures. If the "Core Master" goes off, then the defending player is removed from the board. Game continues until all but one player is wiped out. The surface of the board can rotate to a number of different positions so that the pattern of which spaces are active and which are not can be changed between games.

name: Nature Trail Game
description: Try to be the first player to collect a set of 8 "friendly" tiles, while avoiding "danger" tiles. If you do get a "danger" tile, you can get rid of it by drawing a "person" tile. The "friendly" tiles include the Butterfly, Snail, Frog, Owl, and Daffodil tiles. The "danger" tiles include the Tin Cans, Car Fumes, and Broken Bottles tiles. No reading is required to play the game.

name: Ramesses' War
description:
From the Publisher's Web Site:

Ramesses' War is a two player board game covering the ancient war between Egypt and the Hittite Empire. During the later stages of the Hittite Empire, circa 1400 BC to 1250 BC, the Hittite Empire had recovered from a period of weakness where it had been on constant warfare with the Arzawa and Mittani states. By 1290 BC the Hittites had managed to conquer Arzawa entirely and had captured the Mitanni capital, though elements of the Mittani people still resisted the further advances of the Hittites. Further, the Hittites had moved into the northern Palestinian region and had come to dominate Syria. This led to friction between the Hittites and the Egyptian, who themselves held large parts of Palestine and had ruled there for more than two centuries. Historically the showdown between these two powers culminated in the battle at Kadesh, initiated by Ramesses who had rallied Egyptian military might in order to directly challenge further Hittite expansion.

Ramesses' War is an easy to play two player game that lets you revisit that ancient conflict. However, the map provided expands the conflict to also encompass the various regional powers. Troy, an ally of the Hittites, plus Lukka, the Mittani and Ahhiyawa (Most probably the Hittite name for the Mycenaean Greeks), as well as providing units for an Arzawan rebellion and troops for each Palestinian city state.

The Ramesses' War Includes:

2 piece, 17" × 22" color game map
37 Full-Color Hittite Counters
9 Full-Color Trojan Counters
8 Full-Color Arzawan Counters
4 Full-Color Lukka Counters
11 Full-Color Ahhiyawa Counters
37 Full-Color Egyptian Counters
7 Full-Color Mittani Counters
23 Assorted Full-Color Palestinian Counters
Game Rules
D10
4½" × 5¾" × 1½" Game Box

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Heroes in a Halfshell Card Game
description: Players have to collect four matching or one each of the four Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles characters, to be first to take a shell. When the first shell is taken, all the other players try to quickly take a shell too. The player who fails to take a shell must cross out a "TURTLES" letter beside his name on the score sheet. The winner is the last player with "TURTLES" letters remaining on his scoresheet.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: AMIGO, Casper, International Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: The Christmas Wars
description: This game uses The Critter System (popularized in "Critter Commandos") and provides all the materials you need to simulate the battles of "The Battle for Christmas Present." Includes stat cards for all troops, as well as blast templates and cardstock heroes for all troops.

name: Clobber
description: The chase game with a crazy kicker, Mr. Clobber. Mr. Clobber has clobber-action so you can whack your opponents around the track...hop on a "safe" and you can't be clobbered back! Last one home is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Racing

name: Moviestar
description:
This is a boardgame for a German TV-channel called Pro 7.
Game with 1100 questions on movies and actors.

name: Kellogg's Professional Ice Hockey
description:
From the rules page:

"If you don't know or understand ice hockey, this game will teach you. If you do know ice hockey, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

This is a one-page insert that came with a Kellogg's product (Pop-Tarts, I believe) and, despite the name of the publisher, is not a computer game. Play results are determined by drawing cards from a standard deck of cards, instead of using dice.

This is just one in a series of about 6 sports games distributed this way.

name: Income
description: Players move on the board to buy consumer goods and property to increase their standard of living, and invest in stocks, bonds, raw materials, and precious metals. At the end of the game, players are ranked according to their money and standard of living, and the player with the lowest product of both ranks, wins.

name: Referendum
description: With the use of a die roll to move a pawn on the three routes of the board (local, regional and national), each player representing a social group, tries to establish an organized movement in order to propose a referendum, then tries to collect the necessary signatures and finally attempts to get approval for that referendum from the all of the other players. The first player or group of players who succeeds win the game.

name: Questionary
description:
From the publisher's website...

The basic concept is very simple. You pick a card that has a word on it. Your team has to guess the word within 90 seconds by asking you any question and as many questions as they like. But the catch is, you can only answer in 'Yes' and 'No'. A few more answers like ‘May be’ or ‘I don’t know’ are allowed for obvious reasons. If your team cracks the word, it wins and rolls a dice to move its pawn on the scoreboard. There are bonus points for difficult words! Words have been very carefully selected to have fun & challenge together.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cat's Pajamas
description:
From The Box:

"Time for beddie-bye! Have no fear, even at night, when the lights are off, you can play a game of Cat's Pajamas because the cards GLOW IN THE DARK!

And turning the lights on and off are actually part of the game! See if you can match the most sets of sleepy kitties. Each one has its own unique glow in the dark pattern printed on either their jammies or their blankie.

Remember to check your sheets for BED BUGS. They can creep up on you and take one of your matched pairs. And that nasty ALARM CLOCK will stir up a startle and force a re-deal that will totally interrupt your sleep!"

name: Motoring
description:
A circa 1930's English Spears board game.

Roll the dice and move your markers on the bright artwork board, to simulate taking a trip through the countryside. Various events can occur during your trip, depending on where you land.

The goal is to be the first to reach the center position, the family picnic spot.

Plain markers, but a nice board with great bright graphics for the era. And the early edition comes in a beautiful period box with a great painting of a car on the cover.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Letter Hold 'em
description:
A Word Game for Poker Players

This is a challenging contest that will have you reaching for your chips AND your dictionary! This game follows the same basic structure as Texas Hold ‘em (combine the cards in your hand with the face-up cards in the “flop” to make the strongest poker hand), only the playing cards also have letters on them. You must use your cards to spell a word, and then make the best possible poker hand using only the cards in the word.
publishers: Lone Shark Games, On The Spot Games

name: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
description:
This game was designed by Sid Sackson for Alfred A. Knopf.

The basic game is in principle a roll and move with players trying to get through the factory. The dice have been replaced with numbered cards. There are numerous special spaces on the board along the way to represent events in the book.

The illustrations are whimsical and very brightly colored.

name: Aces at Dawn
description:
In August of 1914, the airplane had barely made its tenth anniversary, and had only just become a weapon of war. The Italians had used air power (if it could be called that) in North Africa in 1911, and Louis Blériot’s famous trip across the English Channel was still a fresh memory.

The Great War was a time of heroes and villains, a war where everyone knew who was fighting whom and for what cause. Both sides had their great victories, huge defeats and plenty of trench foot. While this game is designed to simulate the greatest battles over the trenches of the World War I battlefield, we should not forget that men and women died for their beliefs and for their countries. Heroes were born of this combat on both sides.

At no other time in our warring history has there been such a change as the airplane. Not only did combat change forever once our soldiers were airborne, but a whole generation became enamored of this newest weapon in our military arsenal. Even into the twenty-first century, the romance and joys of those first years in the air evoke the deepest respect for these new knights, these men of the airways.
Aces at Dawn is a game of quasi-historical combat in the skies. Set at the turn of the century, the game models the man-to-man combat of the World-War I flying ace and his dreaded enemies. As with all Majestic Twelve games, Aces at Dawn is fun and easy to play, works with any line of miniatures, and encourages players to use their imagination and have fun, which is the way wargaming is supposed to be.

With 36 planes at your disposal and a fully-customizable points system, you can build existing planes we haven't included and also try out designs that you think would have wreaked havoc in the skies of France.

The flexibility of the system allows players to recreate the man-to-man air jousting at the turn of the twentieth century. A simple combat and maneuver system means you can dispense with complicated maneuver charts and intricately detailed plane record-keeping. What’s left on the board is just plain fun.

The ZIP file includes both full-color and printer-friendly PDF versions of the rulebook.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Millennium: Das Jahrtausendspiel
description:
“Millennium – the millennium game” (as it would be literally - and rather silly - translated into English) is a memory game with a twist meets a historical trivia game. The game board shows an event, an important person or anything characteristic for each decade from 10 to 2000 (with the exception of 500, 1000 and 1500) represented in nice comic art as well as text and arranged in a huge spiral covering almost the complete board.
At the beginning of the game, the players cover 10 of the decades one by one with cardboard disks numbered from 1 to 10, while reading out the year and the accompanying text. E.g. “10 Emperor Augustus”, “1060 William the Conqueror”, “1190 The third Crusade” or “1770 The USA”.
Each player then gets ten transparent plastic chips. The goal of the game is to get rid of these chips by correctly remembering the events etc. under the numbered cardboard disks. In each turn, initially the player rolls a d12. Then he has to repeat the decade and the text under the corresponding disk. Only if he succeeds, he may return one chip to the box and replace the disk on a new decade; in any case, the next player gets to roll the die. The 11 and 12 on the die have special functions:
When rolling 11, the player may place one of his chips on a cardboard disk of his choice. The next player who rolls the corresponding number has to take this chip before trying to remember what is underneath.
When rolling 12, the player asks the player with the most chips left to remember what is under a disk of his choice. If the other player succeeds, he may place one of his chips on the disk and replace the disk, otherwise, the first player has to solve the task. If he does not succeed either, the player with the most chips may give him one of his chips.
Apart from the material described, Millennium contains a small almanac (30 pg.) with a short description of each decades event, person etc.

name: Giant Dice
description: A set of giant dice are rolled and depending on the type of arithmetic operations allowed in the game, players do math involving the numbers to match corresponding numbers on their sheet. The first player to get a row of 4 or 5 numbers wins.

name: Milk and Cheese's Stupid Little Boardgame!
description:
A boardgame built on the manic humor of Evan Dorkin's Milk and Cheese, Dairy Products Gone Bad!
A simple roll and move game that was free in an issue of Wizard in 1995. Funny if you are a fan of the characters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vegas
description:
Vegas is a simple card game which simulates a slot machine.

There are 3 packs of 18 cards for the 3 windows of the slot machine.

Players bid an amount of money on two or three equal motifs showing up. The winning rates are not the same for every motif, because the 6 motifs are not evenly distributed in the 3 packs of cards.
publishers: AG Müller (AGMüller), Berliner Spielkarten, Dal Negro, NFFX Design

name: Equals
description:
From the publisher's website:

The card game for people who love numbers (or wish they did).

EQUALS is designed to help students learn to think mathematically. Young children (7-8) might start with a simple 3-card hand like 3 + 2. The game adjusts easily to different ages and abilities. For example, here's a 7-card hand where the target number was 2: 1 2 ÷ 4 8 x 8. Notice the use of multi-digit numbers as well as a fraction. Parentheses can also be used and for serious students of mathematics the "Order of Operations" principle can be followed. There is also a solitaire version of EQUALS.

name: Big Bird's Special Delivery
description:
From the box cover:
Picture matching fun with Big Bird & His Friends

Big Bird's got a lot of mail to deliver and he sure could use your help! All your favorite Sesame Street characters are waiting by their mailbox. Spin the spinner and travel around the neighborhood delivering mail, mailing letters in the big blue mailbox, and picking more letters to deliver! Do you have a letter for Elmo, or maybe Ernie? To win, be the first player to deliver all of your letters to your Sesame Street friends!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Shopping Game
description:
Players wheel their trolley around a supermarket collecting four different items: cheese, beans, bread, fruit. The first player to the checkout with one of each item still in their trolley is the winner.

A simple roll-die-and-move game with the added element of items to collect, and the added frustration of sometimes loosing them again.

Box Tagline: "Be the first to fill your trolley as you move round the supermarket in this exciting race game".

name: Math Dash
description:
Kids will be challenged by the fast pace of Crossword Math whether they are accomplished math whizzes or are building confidence with basic math skills. Includes 150 math tiles, game board, score pad, and guide.
Everyone takes three tiles and starts building math equations.
The first person to run out of tiles says “Take three more!”
The crossword-style puzzle can be rearranged at any time.
Use the last tile and win!
For 2-8 players.

name: Vabanque
description:
This is a game for ages 12 and up. the box contains a board, 12 small pawns, 12 large pawns, 3 turntables and 24 cards.

The board shows 6 colored rows, with each 18 fields. The rows are placed parallel to one another on the board. Two start and two destination fields are located on the ends of each row.

The turntables have each a different amount of fields. The first one only shows values from 1 to 3. The second one shows the values 3, 5, 7, 9 and several times 0. The third one can be used to try to double the number of fields your pawns can move.

There are 3 categories of cards : joker, super joker and stop cards.

For starters, each player gets 4 pawns (2 small and 2 large)of one color and 4 cards (2 joker, 1 super joker and 1 stop card). The pawns are placed on their start fields.

On your turn you can turn one of the two turntables with numbers. You can move one of your pawns accordingly. If you want to, you can turn the third turntable and try to double the distance your pawn can move.

A field can never contain more than one pawn. You can leap over your pawns.

If there are pawns on the fields parallel to the one where a large pawn is landing, the pawns on the parallel fields have to restart. Little pawns can never cause a restart to other pawns.

You can influence the course of the game by using the cards. Playing a joker befor you turn one of the turntables will double your result. The superjoker can be played after you have turned one of the turntables to double the result. The stop card can be used to stop one of the other players during his turn, but only when that player didn't play a joker or superjoker.

The game ends as soon as one of players has placed his 4 pawns on his destination fields.

name: Pop-Cheks
description:
From the box: "Pop-Cheks is a new and exciting way of playing checkers, using the "Pop-o-matic""

A six-sided die inside of the pop-o-matic bubble tells which color gets to go next. In this fashion, players may lose their turn or get multiple turns in a row.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Jumbo, Kohner Bros., Peter Pan Playthings

name: Hexchess
description:
Hexchess is a game of chess for 2 to 3 players played with standard chess pieces, but on a 6-sided hexagonal board.
With two players, pieces are set up in opposing corners; with three in alternating corners.

There are 3 different end games the players decide on before the game starts:

One King is captured by the winner, the third player earns a draw
One King is checkmated by one or both opponents. The defeated pieces to not move, but can be captured. The two remaining players continue
Similar to 2, except the defeated pieces cannot be captured.


The pieces move as similarly to regular chess pieces as possible:

The King moves one space.
The Queen moves along a row or chain.
The Bishop moves along a chain.
The Rook moves along a row.
The Knight moves two spaces up and one over.
The Pawn move along a row one space at a time.


A chain is a line of hexagons of the same color.
A row is a line of different colored hexagons sharing a common side.

name: Disney Princess: Dream Journey
description:
A DVD boardgame from the makers of Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game

Become Snow White, Sleeping Beauty, Jasmine, Ariel, Belle or Cinderella and relive some of the greatest princess moments.

Be the first to reach the happily ever after castle and get to wear the Disney Princess Tiara.

Includes:


DVD
Remote Control
Game Board
Tokens
Tiara
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Snoopy Card Game
description: The Snoopy Card Game board consists of eight popular Peanuts characters--Charlie Brown, Sally, Lucy, Schroeder, Peppermint Patty, Woodstock, Franklin and Linus. Players try to march along the paw-print path to the finish by matching cards from their hands with the characters on the board. By collecting "scoring bowls" players move one, two, three or four spaces at a time. Each round ends with players drawing a card from the player to their right. Amongst the various character cards are eight "Snoopy Ha-Ha" cards which serve as dead spots in your hand since none of them can match the characters on the board. First player to reach the finish is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Kat'bouille
description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher: "Game of observation and speed.
Being able to observe even in a hurry... An important trait if you want to be the first to get 4 identical cards !"

name: P.U. The Guessing Game of Smells
description:
From the Publisher:
P.U! The Guessing Game of Smells! TM is a new concept in board games. It involves the player using their sense of smell to move around the board. The theme of the game is a race to the finish around through the village of Odorville. Players evade traps set by with a lively the naughty skunk StinkySmellsTM who makes the players smell different smells as they move around the board.

Odorville is made up of different venues where people today encounter smell. Rigorous market testing among kids and parents help identify the venues. The game starts out at a farm and then proceeds to the beach, garbage dump, laundry, candle shops, restaurants, outdoors, garages and ends at the carnival. The board is littered with over 300 elements of smell. Another innovative idea on the board is a changing path which changes according to the landscape the player is currently on. In the farm the player is on a dirt track which changes to grass in the maze, sand on the beach till it ends in cobble stones at the carnival. The best part of the game is not the board or the lovable characters but the scratch and sniff smell cards.

The game comes with 45 cards – 30 of them with smell and 15 cards that have no smell but require the player to identify things that smell on the board. The smell cards are broken in to 3 categories – good, bad and mystery. The game comes with smells like skunk, manure, peppermint, BBQ sauce, popcorn etc. Additional refill packs can be purchased with different smells or different themes.

name: Weinlese auf Hierro
description:
All players plan their actions simultaneously in their mind. The goal is to move the meeple over the board after 60 seconds of thinking time has gone by. First the player with the highest down-written number has to show his solution. If he can solve he gets as many points as he wrote down. Each player has to show his solution to get the points. If the solution is false, he will get the points of the worst solution.

The points will be added and after 6 rounds there will be a winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Who Am I?
description:
"I was a Book of Mormon prophet who raised the Title of Liberty. Who Am I? I gathered the songs for the first hymnbook of the Church. Who Am I? I told people that a flood would cover the earth if they didn’t repent. Who Am I? Do you know the answers? If you do, raise your hand. If you don’t, you soon will with this fun new game for the whole family.
Four Games in One! Younger children will love playing the “Match Game.” Older kids will have fun with the “Fill in the Blank” or “Who Am I” games. Even adults can get in on the fun by acting out the answers in the “Guess Who I Am” game. No matter who you are, you’ll just love playing Who Am I?"

name: Girl Talk Secret Diary
description:
This is Golden game #5058, Girl Talk Secret Diary, 1991.

"Have you ever wanted to find out someone else's secrets without having to tell your own? That's exactly what you can do if you win at Secret Diary."

Object is to be the first player to collect 12 Calendar Cards -- one for each month of the year. If you do, you'll get to read the Personal & Confidential secrets of your friends, while yours may remain a secret -- if you wish.

name: Monkey Race
description:
Each player choose a pole and inserts its plain end into the base of the same color. He then positions a monkey so that the stick between its hands rests on the fourth knob from the bottom.

The youngest player throws the die and the others follow in turn. Move your monkey as many steps as dots - green up, red down.

The monkey which reaches the top of the pole first is the winner !

name: Barnyard Bedlam
description: Each player is assigned an animal. Then, each player takes a turn to lay down cards. When matching cards are played, make either your own animal noise (young children) or that of an opponent (older children). Contains 6 animal cards and 48 game cards. Different sets of rules for age appropriate play.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Cricket Card Game
description:
K Cricket consists of 50 cards: 17 Bowling cards and 33 Batting cards, each showing a particular type of delivery e.g. Good Length, Bouncer, Cut, Hook. Play consists of the bowling player playing a card and the batting player trying to match it with a scoring or defensive stroke. If the batting player has only a dismissal to match the ball bowled, he must play it and his batsman is out.

The game is played in six-ball overs, the bowling player drawing a new hand after each over while the batting player continues with the hand they were initially dealt but draws to refill his hand after each ball bowled.

Players can play an agreed number of overs or a full 10-wicket innings each.

name: Skylark
description: Object is to fill your nest card circle with matching colored birds. Match the colored sides on the three dice with three rolls to obtain one bird of the same color.

name: Cheese Please
description:
In this memory game, known both as Cheese Please and La Fromagerie, the players' mice attempt to drag large pieces of cheese to their hole. In order to move a mouse, you must correctly recall which mouse is sitting on which piece of cheese. Of course, there is a cat lurking about....

Ages 4 and up.

Piatnik 641497 (not to be confused with Cheeeese Please, by Rudi Hoffmann)

name: Short Circuit: The Computer Energy Game
description:
Short Circuit, the game where players using Strategic Planning, Timing and Luck, accumulate and acquire energy. Software, and money, which, when used in conjunction with their computers, interact throughout the period of play to create an exciting climax where one player (or in the case of a Partnership Play, a pair) triumphs.

Although some players accumulate more rapidly than others, the game is designed to permit "out of luck" players the chance to recover and possibly win the game.

A number of strategies may be employed while playing. These strategies will become apparent to players as they experience the Challenge of Short Circuit!

name: Pickel the Pirate
description:
Pickel the Pirate, A Treasure Map to Knowledge, is a board game that teaches while it entertains. Let's find the treasure of knowledge together!

With each roll of the die, you'll make your way through the treasure map where you can win a treasure, lose a treasure, or just have fun learning along the way. Categories include math, spelling, rhymes, time, the alphabet, and things about your friends.

name: Curious George Adventures:  Joins the Circus
description:
2 distinct games in each box. The first is for 2 -4 players Ages 4 and up. That game has its own board and is basically a go around the path trying to join the circus first by matching colors.

The second game with its own board on the reverse side is also for 2-4 players Ages 7 and up and requires that the players go around the Big Top following simple directions in order to get extra turns, or special moves along the way.

Game includes one two-sided game board, one yellow hat, 4 tally cards, 4 pawns 30 tokens and 40 cards.

name: Character Clues
description:
This easy-to-play game is a unique way to bring the whole family together for a fun time of fellowship, learning the operational definitions of character qualities, and encouraging the development of these vital qualities in each others’ lives.

The set includes instructions, two types of cards, and a resource booklet in a sturdy case.

name: Caddyshack Trivia Game
description:
From the publisher:

Tee off at the Bushwood Country Club with CADDYSHACK Trivia. It’s golf with a CADDYSHACK twist!

Do you know…
How much the final bet was on the big match?
What college Danny wants to attend?
What time the Caddies are allowed to use the pool on Caddy Day?

“Stop thinking, let things happen, and be the ball.”

Play a round-or two-of CADDYSHACK trivia with over 1,000 trivia questions, but don’t let the loudmouth club members, dancing gophers, or the floating doodie distract you! Remember, in the immortal words of Ty Webb, “Me winning isn't. You do.”

Ages 13+
2+ players or teams
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Dartex
description:
Subtitled: The Thrilling Card Game Based on Popular Darts

This simple 52-card game published in England allows players to compete in a game of darts. Sized the same as a pack of standard playing cards with a rules sheet included.

name: Hannah Montana Girl Talk
description:
From Hasbro:

Grab your girlfriends and take center stage in this fun, interactive game! Spin the wheel to answer a question, tell a secret or perform a silly stunt – just like Hannah Montana would do! Ask each other fun questions and see what you know about the Hannah Montana show. Will you tell the truth or complete a dare? Your friends are the judges, so have a blast! Score the most points and be the winner as you discover cool stuff about your friends!

Game includes plastic game tray, cardboard wheel assembly with 2-piece spinner knob, 3 anchor pegs, 3 twist locks, 96 Hannah Montana secret cards and instructions.
For 2-4 players.

Ages 8 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: MB Juegos, MB Spellen, MB spill, Milton Bradley

name: Who's the Richest?
description:
Aim: To be the richest to travel around the world. When one of the players run out of money, the game is over. The winner will be the one with the most money and property.

Players choose a coloured plane to represent themselves, and start out with a specific sum of money. They take turns to spin the arrow dice for the number of squares that their planes may fly on the board. Players have the option to build their house on the country squares they land on, but they can do this for free if they spin the arrow dice and it lands on "Free" (located on a different circle from the one used for movement). If players land on a space which already has property built, rent is to be paid to the house owner.

The game is similar in some ways to Monopoly, but with more options. In addition, it plays more quickly than Monopoly due to the endgame condition which requires only one player to run out of money before the winner is determined.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Economic, Travel

name: Nowe Zagadki Smoka Obiboka
description:
"New Riddles of Lazybones the Dragon" - as the title translates to English - is a sequel of Zagadki Smoka Obiboka, based on the same rules as the first part.

It is a children trivia game. It contains 135 new cards with rhymed riddles on one side and pictures showing the answer on the other. For correct answers players get tokens with appropriate drawings on. The owner of most tokens wins.

The cards from both games can be mixed together.

Predecessor:

Zagadki Smoka Obiboka

name: Charles Goren's Advanced Bridge for One
description:
Chas. H. Goren's Advanced Bridge For One offers two (2) challenging Solitaire games for bridge players.

Part of Milton Bradley's FINE EDITION, Advanced Bridge For One includes two (2) separate deck of color coded cards, a scoring pad, a large folded vinyl playing mat, and a single instruction sheet titled "FURTHER SUGGESTIONS ON BIDDING AND SCORING IN ADVANCED BRIDGE FOR ONE".

Suggestion sheet includes one portion for the Standard Game and one for the Advanced Game. Brief instructions for East - West Card Play LEADING and DISCARDING are also included on the vinyl mat.

name: Have I Got News For You
description:
Board game, for two or more players, based on long running British TV series about the week's news. The tagline of the game is "The Best Board Game Ever - Allegedly".

The different quiz cards represent the different rounds on the show.
publishers: Hat Trick International Limited, Susan Prescot Games

name: Matchless: A Bible and Nature Game
description:
Matchless is a bible and nature card game - reinforcing knowledge of both God's Written Word and the beauty of nature.

Players must outwit their opponents and be the only player to remain matchless! Simple yet challenging, Matchless can be played again and again. The game is fresh every time.

For 3 or more players Ages 6 and up.

name: Wer hat Vorfahrt?
description: Pictured in Games We Play, the players move their trucks around the board to the variable fire locations.

name: Mad Marbles
description:
Game comes in a 14 1/2" x 14 1/2" x 2 1/2" box.

The orange plastic gameboard (similar dimensions to the box) resembles a square with rounded corners & concave sides. Each corner has a plastic 'gate' which is used to trap marbles & score points.

Each turn, marbles are introduced one at a time into a rotating transparent plastic chamber which occupies the center of the gameboard. As they roll wildly and with great speed around the board players attempt to trap them with their plastic gate. Although it is possible to squeeze more marbles behind the gate, there are only enough small depressions to safely hold three at any one time. There are eight marbles per turn - seven white (worth 1 point) and a single red marble worth 6 points which is always introduced into the rotating chamber last. At the end of each turn scores are tallied and the next player spins the central chamber.

The first player to reach 12 points wins.

name: Qbiczu
description:
Taken from Qbic toys homepage:

Played by 2 players or 2 teams, each taking a turn to fill one of 27 potential spaces in a 3x3x3 cube.

The placeholders are represented by balls, normally 14 black and 13 orange.

The objective is to place 3 balls of the same colour in a row or column scoring a point for each unique vertical, horizontal or diagonal row (including internally through the cube)

QbicZu is won by the player achieving the MOST “3 in a row” and not simply the first “3 in a row” .

name: Stop
description: Stop: the big traffic game is a game where you role a dice and move along a track with traffic situations. You have to search the matching sign. But these are reverse in the middle of the board. So you will need memory skill to remember the tile of the spot you land on.

name: St. John's On Board
description: St. John's On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Newfoundland, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Boys and Girls Club.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Euro-Tour
description:
"MAN Super Truck: Mit dem Truck durch Europa - By truck through Europe"

This is a promo game for the German MAN truck company.

Players are truck drivers starting in Munich, Germany with the task to deliver cargo to five European cities. The five destinations are drawn randomly from the deck at the beginning of the game and kept secret; players can freely decide the order in which they visit their destinations and on the way, they may be helped or hindered by event cards. The first player to visit all five destinations and get back to Munich wins.

The game board is a map of Europe from the '80s and includes the national vehicle codes for the then existing European countries.

name: Cluster Buster
description:
Explained in Gladstone's Games to Go, Cluster Buster is an abstract strategy game played with a cluster of objects (usually). Players remove objects from the clusters in an attempt to avoid removing the last object.

From Gladstone’s Games to Go:

Divide and conquer is clearly the key strategy for this game, but the more players you’ve got-and the more objects you play with-the more challenging you’ll find it. The setup of Cluster Buster can be as much fun as the play itself if you move beyond coins and use a colorful variety of playing pieces: You begin by creating a crazy mosaic, then erase it as the game goes on!

name: UNO: Red Sox 07 World Series Champions
description:
This themed version of Uno features the second World Series championship won by the Boston Red Sox this decade (2007).

This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Sweep" card.

name: Timberland
description:
Timberland is a Treehouse-meets-Volcano game for 2-4 players. Players perform Treehouse actions on shared pieces scattered about a Volcano board until they collect enough points to win. Themewise, think of this as cultivating hardwood trees, and then sending out logging crews to harvest the fully grown trees, thinning out the forest over time.

The rules are available on the IcehouseGames Wiki.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

name: Scouting
description:
11 sets of 4 cards each have to be played to gain as many points as possible by making up various scoring combinations.
This can be done by:
- making up the total of "12"
- playing cards of the same number
- playing runs and/or sequences
- playing the Baden Powell card
- being the last player in the round

Game ends after several rounds until a player has a total score of 30 points.
One of the most demanding games of the Pepys series regarding the rules, and very special because 11 can play without using a second deck of cards !

The educational aspect of the Scouting theme is accompanied by extensive description of the subjects of the cards on the last pages of the rules booklet.

As usual with this publisher printing quality and graphic artwork is outstanding.

name: Scrabble The Shrek Edition
description:
Scrabble The Shrek Edition is a themed Scrabble game around DreamWorks's Shrek series. The game features various characters from the Shrek series on the board as bonus zones.

The game is unique from regular Scrabble by the way it is shaped. Instead of being square, the board is shaped around Shrek's head, including a rounded bottom and top, with two rounded antenna by the sides of his head. There is also special rules that give bonuses for spelling words related to the Shrek series such as "Donkey," "Fiona," and "Shrek."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Apples to Apples Junior: Jewish Edition
description:
This is a version of Apples to Apples designed for kids, with cards optimized for middle-school aged children (Ages 9 and up). The subject material of the cards focuses on Jewish history, religion, and culture.

The game consists of two decks of cards: Things and Descriptions. Each turn, the current referee selects a Description and players try to pick, from the cards in their hands, the Things that best match that Description. The referee then chooses the Thing that appeals most and awards the card to the player who played it. The unusual combinations of Things and Descriptions are humorous to the extreme, and will quickly have the entire room in an uproar. Once a player has won a pre-determined number of cards, that player wins.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Religious, Word Game
publishers: Jewish Educational Toys, Out of the Box Publishing

name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht: Das 3-Dreh-Spiel
description:
The board has a hexagonal basic area on which 5 levels are put together to a pyramid.
The segments of the pyramid can be turned during the game.
It is important to bring 3 or 4 own pawns out of the game.
A pawn is taken out of the game when there is only one pawn on a level.

Contents:
1 board
60 pawns
1 die

name: 16 Memories
description:
16 Memories is a memory game with 3 different ways to play and 7 different tile sets to play with. Although the three game variants are different, they all give you 1 minute to memorize what's printed on 16 different tiles, then test your ability to remember what's on each tile after they've been flipped face down.

The first variant has players bid to the right to try to recall what's on each face-down tile. The second variant has players move a shared pawn along the tiles, tying to recall what's on the tile the pawn lands on. The third variant has all players write down what they can remember, then comparing answers.

16 Memories is a game for two to four players, although you could probably play it with five. 16 Memories uses a pawn, a die, a one minute timer, a custom board, and a custom set of tiles. A four-player game takes about 5 minutes to play. 16 Memories is appropriate for Ages 7 and up, but all the players should be age-peers (A parent against several children would have an unfair advantage.).
categories: Deduction, Educational, Memory, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rapunzel
description:
Contents:
board, 4 princes, 30 braid tiles, 1 die

In the German fairy tale 4 princes stand at the bottom of the tower and shout up to the window: "Rapunzel, let down your hair!" The braid that grows fastest has the best chance to take the princess in his arms.

The players roll and move around Rapunzel's tower. Whenever they reach or pass the starting field, they collect two or one braid stone(s). The goal is to be the first one to collect six stones and reach the starting field again. If a player has more than six pieces, he/she can use his/her surplus to add points to his/her die roll.

name: Siege By Number
description:
A tactical battle game for up to four players, using tiles to form the gameboard, and coins ("armies") and pawns ("commanders") as playing pieces. Dice are used to determine how far pieces can move, while the coin values determine the outcome of the one-on-one battles that take place in the game. The objective of the game is to move your Commander onto another player’s Home Base tile.

Rules can be found on the piecepack wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Avengers Assemble
description: A game based on the Avengers superheroes from the Marvel Universe. The game is played using three custom decks which are shared by both players: the Foe Deck, Plot Deck, and Hero Deck. The players attempt to defeat Foes by playing Hero cards having a higher total value than the Foe Meld, a total of the values of the current Foe card and three Plot cards. The first player to defeat five Foes is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Print & Play

name: Monopoly: Tallinn
description: The Estonian version of classic Monopoly. Each block on the map represents a famous location in Tallinn, Estonia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bible 20 Questions
description:
From the Game box: Bible 20 Questions is the fast-paced game where players work together to identify people, places and things from the world's most important book. It's great for beginners and Bible scholars alike.

During each round, one player is the clue giver and the other players try to uncover the secret identity. Each clue that's read reveals more hints -- the fewer clues you need, the farther you advance!

Bible 20 Questions is great for families and perfect for Bible study groups. It helps children, teens, and parents recall and discuss important subjects from the scriptures. It's the perfect way to see how much you know about the Bible, and to learn more too!

name: Wordt Vervolgd
description:
Wordt Vervolgd (English: "to be continued") is a dominoes-like game based on the popular eighties Dutch TV-show about comics and cartoons with the same name.
The game consists of a board and 76 cards.
Each player starts with 7 cards. Each card has a picture from a comic book. Each turn a player tries to add as many cards as possible to the cards already on the board. Two cards match if the skyline behind the characters matches. During the game a comic "story" will appear. The first player without any cards left is the winner.

Artwork is by Dutch cartoonist Uco Egmond.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Seven League Boots
description:
A simple children's game in which players collect counters and deliver them to the middle of the board. To do this, players play 'footwear' cards which allow movement across various terrain spaces. The Seven League Boots of the title allow movement across any terrain.

The first player to get their counters to the middle is the winner.

Re-published by Tactic as Taika Kengät.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Cyber Scopes
description:
Imagine how strange the world would look if everything was upside down. Well, that’s exactly the illusion Cyber Scopes™ glasses create! Families and friends will have loads of fun watching each other try to complete challenges while wearing the disorienting goggles.

A Cyber Scopes set includes a pair of special glasses, game board, 16 puzzle pieces, 7 puzzle cards, 1 foam ball, dice, a pen and two timers. Players compete to make their way around the game board as quickly as possible by completing tasks wearing the Cyber Scopes. Tasks range from putting together a puzzle to catching a ball in the air to reading a single word.

While the tasks may initially sound easy, they become a whole lot more difficult when the world is turned upside down by the Cyber Scopes! These distinct glasses put a new spin on the board game that will provide hours of laughter and entertainment for adults and children alike.

Additional features:

* Fun and not overly competitive
* Easy-to-follow instructions
* Appropriate for all ages

name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Torino City (Italy).
You will race near Mole Antonelliana and ancient Castles inside the city.

This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

name: Warstone
description:
Warstone, a collectible card game that adds the unique dimension of Warstone marbles to a game that includes the appeal of card collecting and strategic thinking. The marbles add elements of manual dexterity and sharp-shooting skills to the game, which as far as the marbles are concerned, can be played for keeps or not.

Home Page: http://www.warstone.com/
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Pyramid Card
description:
This is the card game from Japan. It is published and played like President from standard deck. (information from www.Pagat.com)

The cards in this game are not same as standard deck. Number1 has 1 card, Number2 has 2 cards, Number3 has 3 cards and so on until Number13 that has 13 cards.

Component
- 91 number cards
- 9 blank cards
- 1 rules sheet (Japanese language)

For more information about President visit at PAGAT from this link http://www.pagat.com/climbing/asshole.html

Similar to:

The Great Dalmuti

name: Das Syndikat
description: A "humorous", simple game where players invest in underworld assets (drugs, extortion, vice, girls) and roll for success. Depending on the die roll, various things may happen- get henchmen, steal from other player etc. The player who controls one trade completely wins, or the player owing most of the city squares when the city has been taken completely.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of 31
description:
A normal deck of cards is used. All the aces through sixs are removed and placed into their appropriate stacks. Players take turns removing one card and keeping a running total of the pips. The first player to take a card that makes the running total go past 31 loses!

This is an old con man's game. Con men have spent years studying the game to get some easy money. If you are offered a game of 31 from a complete and total stranger, don't take it... you're not going to win!

name: Murder Mystery Evening: The Porthole Affair
description:
Host your own murder mystery evening. An "investigator" narrates the action on CD, which directs the play and sets the mood for a unique dinner party experience. Includes: invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

Similar to other murdery mystery games, though in this dinner party style game the action is more scripted. One player takes the part of the investigator, who narrates the story along with a CD that directs play and sets the mood.

This particular game takes place on the RMS Olympic, the sister ship of the infamous RMS Titanic.

Includes: CD, invitations, host instruction booklet, character booklets, name tags, and themed recipes.

name: Kofferpacken
description:
From the publisher:

The children find a magic suitcase, hidden in an old attic and they are eager to discover what they can do with it . Their surprise is enormous when they find that they can pack anything they want in it. They have a great idea for a game. Pack the bag, with plenty of room for imagination. Who will be the first to pack all their things into the suitcase?
8 Cards with a question mark allow the players to put in what ever they want.

Tin box game from HABA

name: Martial World: Trainers Edition
description:
So you are looking for a new type of card game. Maybe you want a to give a great gift, or the kids are way too active and you want to give them something new to do. Maybe you are a student, or a teacher or maybe you just enjoy most everything about the Martial Arts.

Well...

Welcome to Martial World's advanced "Trainers Edition" card game. "World Arts On Playing Cards"

As most, who are familiar with our games know, Martial World is an American style strategy game, which challenges players to win martial arts based sparring matches, using technique based "micro messaged" collectible cards. These combat strategy card games combine point-trick mechanics with card-capturing mechanics for deck building purposes. We call the deck building process "Building Your Form".

Each game box is designed for 2 to 5 players, intended for anyone ages 7 and up, comes with a single magnifying glass, (for a limited time) and no martial arts experience is necessary. Games are easy to learn, easy to develop flexible strategies, and average 90 minutes to establish a winner.

The fun is how cleverly the combination of multiple forms of martial arts technique terms, combine into round robin melees of attacks, blocks, and counter maneuvers. Here's how. Players spar in rounds which are initiated by the role of the dice and the round winners keeps the technique cards to add to their form. Another fun feature for players who are not sparring is that they may enjoy the micro messages which, for the white belt levels, display each school's core principals and values. You may even be surprised that most of these messages can be applied to every day life. So playing has good life benefits.

Ultimately our novel mechanics, embedded surprises, and our school based narrative features, provide players the opportunity to experience the many benefits of martial arts without the Epson salt. All may play and enjoy.

Designer's Note: All of our games are designed based on the history of real martial arts and may include many of each school's or style's myths. However folks, this is a game. Let's be honest, the only way to truly learn any form of Martial Arts is to do research and depending on your ideals, you will find a style which appeals you. Besides that, we are a USA based company and our games are made in America. We were originally published in 1992 but needed a lot of work. We kept pushing and in 2011 we were nominated for the Gaming Genius Awards as the best new card game. We were finalists but needed many upgrades. So we upgraded everything. Lastly we are members of our local gaming group CABS and have a membership with the Patent Tested Parent Approved association.

We welcome all feedback and recommendations. You may also zoom in to all of our pictures for samples of hidden surprises...

name: Disney's The Jungle Book 2 Animal Noises
description:
Two family card games in one box.

Game 1. Animal Noises: Turn over the cards and react very quickly by making the chosen animal noise. The first person to get rid of all their cards wins the game.

Game 2. Quartet: Collect 4 cards of the same family as quickly as possible.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Official Von Erich Family World Class Championship Wrestling Game
description:
The Official VON ERICH FAMILY World Class Championship Wrestling Game is a fast paced exciting game where the players seek victory by pinning the opponent after having weakened him through various holds, blows and take downs. You play cards that reduce your opponent's endurance while at the same time move your wrestler playing pieces on the game board to gain the greatest advantage of the ropes and turnbuckles. This movement becomes critical in Tag Team matches. Once your opponent's endurance is reduced you may attempt a pin. Your opponent can try to break the pin once for each count, if he doesn't you've won, proving you have what it takes to be a VON ERICH FAMILY World Class Champion!

COMPONENTS: The game comes with everything needed for play: a pair of dice, a gameboard, a scoreboard with four sets of scoring pegs, a deck of action cards, eight wrestler cards describing the abilities of the eight wrestlers, eight matching wrestler playing pieces with four plastic stands and a complete, easy to understand set of rules.

name: Pinhigh: The Family Golf Game
description: From the box: "The object of Pinhigh is to play the golf course in the lowest possible number of strokes by using skill and judgment to select the correct club for each stroke (as determined by using the 'stroke and distance chart'), and moving the 'Golfers' position on the board, after spinning the 'quality of stroke wheel'."

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Family Guy Travel Edition
description:
Prove how much you know about Family Guy™ wherever you go! With 600 questions ranging in difficulty from Easy, Medium and Hard, will you be top dog with the most knowledge? It’s freakin’ sweet!

Travel-sized game includes six categories of questions featuring: The Griffins, Around Town, Gags, Quotable, Wha-? and The Road To. . ., in addition to a custom die and Trivial Pursuit wedge for easy storage and on-the-go fun!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sod Buster
description: A Game of Farm Management. A roll and move game, players collect farm equipment, land and crops. Players plant crops and harvest them for money.

name: Grüne Welle
description: The game board represents a four lane road. The players place car cards which have to match an adjacent card in color or number.
