There are various obstacle cards, like ducks crossing the road, traffic lights etc., and helping cards such as tow trucks etc. The first player to reach the finish line wins the game.

name: System Vector
description:
System Vector is a game where players take the roles of 4 similar colonies that have been separated by war. Years have gone by and while the Colonies tried to cover up history, they rediscover their need to explore the stars.
The game takes place during this time, re-exploring the stars, building planets and defending against growing conflict.

The game features 4 colonies and 1 Pirate clan (optional). It is complete with 24 System cards to explore, Player Reference Cards, 46 units for each player, and Terraform and Population tokens. As well as the optional Pirate units on 1 more card.

Printing, cutting and mounting time: 1.5 hours (Mounted with self-adhesive Foamy sheets)

The players will manage Fleet, Ore resources and create colonies on other worlds, as well as battle over frontiers.
The game requires at least 4 dice to play. Resources may be kept track on paper, but it is suggested to use a token system (like Poker Chips) in order to do this.

Note:
System Vector was designed to be printed using Photos, and all printables are 4x6 inches, and are high-resolution. This keeps ink costs down, and makes things easy to carry and store. Overall I got all my cards, units and tokens printed at the Albertson's Kodak kiosk, and spent under $10.00 for all of it.
categories: Economic, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Twisted Po-Ke-No
description:
It's all in the luck of the cards!

Each player places a chip on their Po-Ke-No board as cards are drawn and called out, hoping to be the first player to get a straight line, 4 corners, center or even a cover all. Just when a player thinks he is going to win-OUCH-someone draws a joker, One-Eyed Jack, Ace of Spades or even a Two, now everything changes and the game is totally TWISTED.

This zany variation of the original Po-Ke-No Game will provide endless hours of family fun! Easy to learn and easy to play, Twisted Po-Ke-No is fun, wacky and a delightfully different game.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Pass the Word
description:
From the publisher:

A fast-paced spelling game
Learn to spell with this fast-moving word game. Race against the timer to put together a word, but try to be quick, as when the time runs out, the letters have to be passed on to the next player.

name: Marvel Superstars TCG
description:
CANCELLED GAME



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Marvel Superstars TCG will not enter production. This entry currently serves as a placeholder for the announced item and will likely later be removed.




Marvel Superstars TCG is a new game based on the Marvel Universe as envisioned by the movies. This is first time that the movies, including Iron Man, Hulk, Fantastic Four, the X-Men Trilogy, the Blade Trilogy and others, will interact with each other in a Marvel game.

A Starter Deck will be the first release, followed a few weeks later by the Booster Packs. Approximately 300 cards will be released in the first set.

Each player chooses to become a classic Marvel hero or villain, then constructs a team to defeat the opponent.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Australian Football League
description:
Australian Football League (AFL) version of Monopoly.

All 20 AFL clubs have been spread over the first 7 groups of properties. The two most expensive properties are the most important cups.

In order, from Go: Western Australia, The Allies, South Australia, Victoria, Collingwood Magpies, Fremantle Dockers, Melbourne Demons, Adelaide Crows, Richmond Tigers, Geelong Cats, St Kilda Saints, Hawthorn Hawks, Sydney Swans, Port Adelaide Power, Western Bulldogs, West Coast Eagles, Brisbane Lions, Essendon Bombers, Carlton Blues, Kangeroos, The Ansett Australia Cup, and Premiership Cup.

The Railroads are stadiums: MCG, Colonial Stadium, SCG, and Football Park.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Winning Moves Australia Pty Ltd

name: Störrischer Esel
description: Simple dice-rolling game for children. 24 donkey tiles are laid out on the table. The players roll a die and move forward, flipping open the tile they land on. The tiles contain numbers: -3,-2,-1,0,+1,+2 or +3, so the player can move forward or backward again. The first player to exactly reach the last tile is the winner.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: MB Spellen, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Run Chase
description: A new table game of cricket. A stats based cricket game from the early 1980s developed in England by Eamon Bloomfield and published by Games Unlimited, Ltd. Contains complete English County sides from 1981 and 1982, and rules for 40 over (Sunday League) games, and guidelines on how to play a one day World Cup.

name: The Art of Children's Conversation
description:
Turn off the screens and enjoy communication...

The Art of Conversation for Children is the perfect way for children to become great communicators, learn about other people, better understand themselves, all as they enjoy great times and strengthen bonds with family and friends. Everyone wins!

The Art of Conversation for Children helps children:

Make friends and be friends.
Speak well and with confidence.
Listen with interest and understanding.
Share ideas and feelings in a safe, non-judgemental setting that facilitates communication.
Learn about living and gain insights from others.
Put their complex and developing ideas into words.
Get to know families and friends, old and new.
Discuss effectively and respect the views of others.
Develop compassion for and interest in others.
Accept that differences need not create conflict.



Perfect for many occasions, the informative 16 page communication booklet provides guidelines and many variations on The Art of Conversation for Children, including a solo version.

The 104 cards provide 200 conversation topics, carefully created and tested to promote and stimulate communication, plus 4 blank cards for children to personalize.

The Art of Conversation for Children is fun for everyone and is also a highly effective therapeutic and educational resource for families, therapists, counselors, teachers, speech pathologists, language teachers, coaches, church leaders and more.

There are 9 ways to play. There are competitive/scoring options included.

name: Monopoly: Fryslân
description: The famous Monopoly game. This Monopoly theme is of the Dutch region Friesland (Fryslân). Buy, sell and trade streets of places in this region.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Bravo
description:
Each player places six "answer" cards face-down in front of him/her. A "question" card is flipped open, and the players now have to search for (or remember) where their corresponding answer card is. The first player to find it, hits a plastic hand in the center of the table. The hand flips down into the middle of the center piece. The player whose hand is at the bottom scores a point.
Question and answer cards are actually pictures. There are two sets: Animals and jobs.

name: Passing The Bar
description:
From the publisher's website:
"As law students and lawyers already know, students preparing for the bar exam must learn an extensive amount of tedious material from standardized lectures and practice questions that are repetitive and monotonous. Passing the Bar will allow students to learn the graduate material required to pass the national state monitored bar exam in an enjoyable setting, and is also fun for students and trained professionals to test their skills."

name: Albiorix
description:
Albiorix is an Icehouse game in which two players attempt to emerge victorious from a civil war of ideologies on ancient Mars.

The game is played with two stashes (one per player) on a 5x5 board. Each player starts with a varied collection of playing pieces comprised of two Icehouse pyramids, and one single Icehouse 3-pip pyramid. This singleton acts much like the king in Chess as controlling your opponent's singleton is the condition for victory in Albiorix.

You are able to move a piece if the topmost pyramid is in your color OR if the piece contains a pyramid identical to your current singleton. Direction and range of movement is dependent on the sizes of the two pyramids that make up the piece, with higher value pieces loosely corresponding to larger freedom of movement. Capturing does not occur in a traditional sense, but instead the two pieces involved (captor and prisoner) remain on the board and are re-structured according to the acting player's whim [provided the two newly formed pieces consist of no more than two pyramids and the topmost pyramids are not larger than the bottom pyramids].

When both singleton pieces are your color, you win.

Albiorix was designed by Don Sheldon and placed 3rd in the Icehouse Games Design Competition, Summer 2008.

name: Drover's Dilemma
description:
Drover's Dilemma is a game for all ages, the idea of the game - whether playing as singles or as partners - that your drover travels a total of 1000km. Not only do you try to get your drover to travel the 1000km as soon as possible whilst overcoming various obstacles, but you try to hinder your opposition drovers' progress as much as possible along the way.

The 1000km is to be travelled by the following method:
8 x 50km (400km) : Sheep Station to stockyards.
4 x 60km (240km) : Sheep Station to spelling paddocks.
2 x 80km (160km) : Sheep Station to nearest waterhole.
2 x 100km (200km) : Sheep Station to shearing sheds.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Das Traumschiff
description: A new game that is using a Traumschiff theme (Das Traumschiff is a German TV series). Each player draws five destinations that he/she has to visit. When a player reaches one of his/her destinations, he/she has to answer a question from the card (a die roll determines which one). If the player answers correctly, he/she has another move; if not, he/she has to try again next turn. On certain fields, "neutral" question are asked. When a player has reached all five of his/her destinations, he/she moves to a common target field and back to Hamburg from there. The first player to arrive in Hamburg is the winner.

name: Cars: Luigi's Tire Tower Game
description:
Luigi needs help stacking his new shipment of Lightyear Tires. Try and stack all the tires without letting them fall!

In this game, players take turns adding rubber tires to a stack, either with their hands or with the included hook. Players win either by not knocking the tower over, or by being the one to place the last tire on the stack.

name: Ampparin Eskari Kirjaimet ja sanat
description: Learn with Ampparin - a fun way to prepare for the start of school! Let's learn to write includes 4 exciting games: found Ampparin together with the children learning the letters gradually form simple words. There are three difficulty levels. Suitable for one or more players. Learn the alphabet and put the letters in the correct order. Suitable for 1-2 players. Make a rally as many words as 10 letters - time 2 minutes! For each letter you get from your point, and the most points wins the game. Suitable for two or more players. Beep! Players raise the letters from the bag as quickly as possible and try to make their word, with a minimum of three letters. He who first succeeds in this, to shout "beep!". Who will be the formation of the first three words? Suitable for two or more players.

name: Ide a Szfinxet
description:
Who makes good use for his Syllable Cards and can answer the questions of Sphinx has a good chance to be first to arrive at The Fountain of Knowledge. This quiz game mixes the baser elements of a really indoor game, such as the knowledge, good lock, taking a risk, maneuvering and the logic.
The players drawing cards from a pack containing 484 syllable cards should endeavor to lay out shorter or longer words which determine the advance, according to their scores. These scores can be grown if the answer for one of the questions is correct or decreased if not, after each move.

name: LRC Card Game
description:
The players are U.S. Navy Aviation Electronics Technician "A" (AT "A") School students. Students are learning basic electronics. This game could be used for punctuation or enrichment. It would not be used to teach the objectives, but it could be used to practice and sharpen skills after the students had learned the concepts and principles. Students who had mastered the material presented in the class might play the game for enrichment while the instructor worked with those who needed more help. The entire class might be permitted to play and sharpen their skills.

LRC is played like rummy. The object of the game is to get a run of three cards and a run of four cards that meet the following requirements depending on the level of play selected:

name: Lexico LV-ENG
description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: Sword & Scepter
description:
A strategic fantasy adventure of quests and treasures, battles and diplomacy. Be the first to establish your domain by reuniting the realms of man and beast.

The map is randomly generated using 25 tiles which contain various terrains (or domains): mountains, forests, deserts and seas. Each player receives one pawn (gold, silver, black or white in color). All pawns begin the adventure at the village.

The village is surrounded by 4 ancient ruins which contain various treasures (again randomly generated by shuffling and arranging Treasure Cards at the beginning of the game.

Each player must land on an "undiscovered" ruin for their first turn. A player is assigned one of the 4 domains listed above based upon the ruin they discover on this turn.

The other 20 tiles on the map are called realms. They are controlled by colonies of mythical men and beasts. Each player's domain consists of 5 realms.

A player must scout each of these realms to receive quests for specific treasures (these, too, are randomly generated by arranging cards at the start of the game). A player takes control of a realm by completing its quest. The first player to control all 5 realms in their domain wins the game.

Game play is enhanced by the fact that each treasure has a power that a player may use to their own advantage for as long as they possess it. Players may also trade with and battle each other for the treasures they need to complete their quests.

name: Rally
description:
From the website of the publisher: little magnetic strategy game with theme sports: RALLY.

Travel pocket game for two players in which the goal is to be the first to move your three playing pieces ("race cars") to the other side of "town". Each of the cars is numbered and you have to get your cars across in reverse order. You either move one car horizontally or vertically. If your opponent ends next to one of your cars, then you can move it to one of the four garage boxes and take its place.

name: Pasha
description:
Pasha a family game that can be played parents against children, or boys against girls, et c. Players take a card and it has a mission. This can be something they must do (e.g., give the best imitation of the cry of an animal) or something they must know (e.g., the parents need to give four names of children in the same class as their child) or something they have done in the past (the person who last emptied the dishwasher). The winner of the mission gets a piece of furniture that you can place on the game board. If you collect the right piece of furniture you win the game and you get a reward (for example you choose the television program this evening, you get breakfast on your bed the next day,...)

From the website of the publisher:

THE 1st game to tackle family life! The children play with or against the parents in a passionate combination of laugher and challenges of all types!


The only game that’s played as a family only!
Funny questions and challenges suitable for young children: motivating for the children and passionate for the parents!
Amusing and educational challenges.
Family discussions and memories.
Challenges for teams or for individuals
The winner of the game becomes the Head of the Family!
A game board with an illustration of a house, the symbol of the family.
The 1st board game constructed in lenticular format, helping to visualize the idea that parents AND children can win!
A game designed by Monsieur Z, with the small details that children enjoy! (pencils, magnet, furniture to assemble)
A large magnetic frame to display the winner’s prize and photo!
mechanics: Role Playing, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Math Bingo
description: Your bingo boards contain 9 simple mathematical exercises (in addition and subtraction). You claim the announced number by being the first to finding a matching exercise on one of your boards to which the number is the answer, claiming the number tile and covering the matched exercise on the board. The first player to cover an entire game board wins.

name: Googly
description:
GOOGLY is a card game that simulate the game-flow of an actual cricket match (the instruction manual states the game is "all the form and thrills of cricket without the Rain Stopped Play notices)."

The game itself consists of 98 colorfully designed cards: 48 Batting Cards with blue backs and 50 bowling cards with green backs.

Gameplay begins by separating the 50 bowling cards from the 48 batting cards. From the bowling deck a number of individual bowler piles are created (i.e., 5 piles if 5 bowlers are indicated by the defensive player). The batting cards are then shuffled and split into 2 piles (1 for each batsman), then the 1st batsman flips a card from his pile. If a 2, 4, or 6 is played, the score is recorded and the 1st batsman continues play. If a 1 or 3 is played, the score is recorded and the play moves to the 2nd batsman. If a "How’s That" card is played, the defensive player flip the top card from the "active bowler" pile (i.e., the pile designated as the bowler for the current over) and scores the result (i.e., run out, stumped, Not out, Leg-bye, etc.). Batting cards are reshuffled every three overs; bowling cards are reshuffled every five overs.

The game flow and rules closely follows the real game of cricket - an over consists of 6 bowled balls (cards) plus extras, batsman change sides after each over, 10 wickets taken constitute an inning, etc. As with the real cricket, the goal of the game is to outscore your opponent over two innings.

(description based on text included in the rule book)

name: Artistico
description:
The game consists of a large base which has four square columns inside. The "mom" piece is put on top of this. The circus artist pieces are dealt out to the players.
The active player turns a knob at the side of the base. Two of the columns come out on top, lifting mom up. The player then carefully inserts a circus artist between the columns (under mom). The next player does the same, lifting the circus artist and mom up, etc. The last player to add an artist without mom falling down scores a point. The player with most points after 5 rounds is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Mis Pecados... El juego de la verdad
description:
In this game you have to say if its true or not, some sex related actions printed in the cards.
Depending on each card you'll have to drink a beer, change your place to someone else, move forward to the score table, etc.

For example a couple cards:

"I've never seen porn" If you say True, you have to drink, if you say False, you don't have to answer next question.

"I've never cheated on someone" If you say True, move 1 forward, if you say false, tell us with who and when!!!

name: Shake Shake
description:
Shake Shake is a board game using three-dimensional tetromino blocks.

On a turn, place one of your blocks onto the playing area, keeping in mind that the circular plate will shake once you're finished, so you need to place it with care. Blocks must be placed to fill the bottom row first; if you don't have a block to fill the bottom row, you can place a block on the top row. If the next player can fill this empty space, they must do so. If one or more blocks tumble off the plate on your turn, set them aside next to you.

The game ends one of two ways: Either a player knocks off three or more blocks at once, or everyone has placed all of their blocks. In either case, score points to see who wins. To do so, view the tower from above and count the number of blocks in your color that are visible, then subtract 1 point for each dropped block in your possession. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Educational, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Stacking and Balancing, Worker Placement

name: WFF: The Beginner's Game of Modern Logic
description:
The WFF games (Shake-a-WFF and Count-a-WFF) are the first two in a series of 21 games called WFF 'N Proof. The two WFF games are concerned with the construction of WFFs (well formed formulas). A WFF (pronounced "woof") is a expression in a system of mathematical logic that is roughly equivalent to a sentence in English prose. In the WFF games, certain sequences of letters are considered WFFs, and players attempt to arrange an increasing number of letter dice to create ever-longer true sentences, or WFFs.

In Shake-a-WFF, the two players practice recognition and construction of WFFs. Players use six capital-letter dice, six small-letter dice, and a Shake-a-WFF playing mat (one mat each). Each player begins with three dice, and seeks to create a WFF using the letters they've rolled. Each round, players add or subtract a die from their shaking set according to whether they successfully created a WFF in the previous round or not. The first player to create a WFF with eight dice wins the game.

In Count-a-WFF, two or more players simultaneously view the same set of rolled dice to try to create the longest single WFF from the letters rolled. Each player attempts to maximize their score for a specified number of plays; the player with the highest score wins.

The game includes 12 special lettered dice, 2 Shake-a-WFF player mats, and a 78-page rules and examples manual.

name: La marcha sobre Madrid
description:
La marcha sobre Madrid is a wargame portraying the advance of Nationalist forces from Andalucia to Madrid during the first stages of the Spanish Civil War. The object of this advance was to take the Spanish capital and put a rapid end to the war before the Republican forces could reorganize. The advance failed in the last moment and Spain was doomed to three long years of a cruel civil war.

The game is simple to play and portrays the usual mechanics used in the old 70's enriched with a few interesting twists.

Game components are a 4-piece puzzle-like map, a 12-page rulebook and 320 counters (two of them blanks).

name: Weet Wat Je Eet
description:
From the back cover:

Theme
Weet Wat Je Eet is a quiz game in wich the fascinating world of nutrition is discovered. With the elements brainteasers, facts, jokes, pratical advice and etiquette this is a game about food and drink playable by all.

Gameplay
Quizgame. Trow a dice and answer the question corresponding with the number on the dice. A correct answer wins the puzzlepart.

Goal
Filling the menu with the five different puzzleparts.

name: Lab-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

GENTLE, INTELLIGENT, FAMILY-FRIENDLY... MEET THE LABRADOR RETRIEVER!

"Labs", as they are affectionately known, are the most popular dog breed in the world. Originally from Newfoundland, Labs worked alongside fishermen and were bred primarily to perform as efficient retrievers of game. They have great desire to please, a characteristic that allows them to excel as guide dogs and in law enforcement. Kind to children, friendly to people and other animals, energetic, Labs will play fetch for hours or lie quietly on the family room floor as a pillow for the kids.

LAB-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE LABS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO LABS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or marching in the Dog Parade! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Red Rover
description:
Product Description
Learn about colors, numbers, letters, and shapes with the Red Rover Game from Mattel. This electronic interactive game challenges up to four players aged 3 years and older to find the bone marked with the correct sticker depending on the color, the number, the shape, or the letter. The friendly "voice" of Red Rover guides players through game play and encourages learning during the process.

name: Urban Myth: Funsize Crime Edition
description:
Urban Myth Funsize Crime Edition puts the record straight on criminal urban myths! The challenge of Urban Myth is to differentiate between fact and modern folklore - between what you thought you knew and what you have heard as gospel truth from a trusted friend. Vote on urban crime myths to win cards and be the first player to complete a crime scene picture puzzle, using your card backs to win!

* Collect cards to build a picture of a crime scene
* The first player to complete their scene wins the game
* All new crime edtion
* The game with a twist
* The truth is here!

Contents of Urban Myth Funsize Crime Edition:

* 100 Playing Cards
* 6 Answer Cards
* Players Guide

name: Monopoly: Firefighters Edition
description: Edition of Monopoly with a Firefighters theme. The traditional properties are replaced by locations such as Firefighting Freeway, Forcible Entry Way and Incident Command Post Place.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kanzler-Schlacht
description:
Goal: Become cancellor (or prime minister) collecting the majority of all votes

Each Player represents an election campaign manager of a political party.
Phase I During 10 ballots you try to win as many votes/seats as possible using a set of cards, once more drawn at the beginning of each ballot.
Phase 2 The final round represents the election of the cancellor.
A First all players may try to form coalitions - for max. 5 min. Players get a new set of socalled impact-cards;
B Each player declares in public, which of the candidates should get his votes.
C Thereafter impact-cards are played - as strongful modifieers.
D Evaluate the victorious parties
mechanics: Open Drafting, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Coffee Talk
description:
The Joy of Conversation Game

Turn over a “Topic Card” and then everyone has 45 seconds to write down whatever they can think of about in relation to the topic; topics range from New York City to Jay Leno to Google to Las Vegas. When time is up, players move their coffee beans up their respective containers (boards) based on the number of original ideas they had. To change a topic: “Cream it” and move on. To have the other players to accept your offbeat answers: Sweeten them up with a “Sugar Packet”... and you score.

Contents: 300 topics, 10 Instant Coffee Cards, 12 Sugar Packets, 12 Creamer Packets, 6 Coffee Beans, 6 Individual Coffee Cup Scoring Boards, 6 Score Pads and a 45 second Sand Timer.

name: Golden Trivia Game: Major League Baseball Edition
description:
Knock your opponent out of the box as you compete for points by answering trivia questions in six categories: Hitting, Pitching, FranchiseFacts, All-Stars and Awards, Post-Season Play and Names and Numbers. Select the category and point value of your choice as you duel against fellow baseball buffs in an effort to clinch the trivia pennant. A must for followers of the American pastime everywhere, so...Play Ball!

The object is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering questions.

name: Double Draughts
description:
This is a game in the checkers/draughts family played on an 8x8 board, using 24 pieces aside.

This game originated from asking two simple question regarding Anglo-America checkers: First, why is only half the spaces used? Second, what would happen if you used all 64 spaces of a checkerboard?

End result is a game in the checkers/draughts family which tries to remain true to regular checkers, also accounts for the full use of the board. Checkers move as they do normally, but they also jump both diagonally and orthogonally. In addition, the King piece gains mobility to be like a King in chess.

Edit: Please note the PDF rules do not show orthogonal capture moves for Checker pieces. They do capture that way, in addition to diagonal.

Editi 2: Playable on Tabletopia in this collection:
https://tabletopia.com/games/alquerque-and-friends

name: Chaotic Connections
description: Chaotic Connections a game in which players are building routes to connect various US cities. The connections are placed by playing Chaos Cards which can be used to add road tiles to the board in multiples of 100 mile increments. The number of miles vary from car to car. Other chaos cards allow to to create roadblocks forcing players to find a new routes, to create connections allowing players to bypass a city or curve cards which can have larger impact such as making players re-arrange cities on the board. The first player to connect all his cities wins.

name: Das Spiel mit der Krake
description:
Objective: collect/gain as many tiles/chips with quality fishes
as possible
- moving by turns
1. players place their meeples on the board (circle) - youngest one starts
2. turn a tile (fish is shown)- try to catch it by
3. rolling the dice - move your meeple (forewards or backwards)
4. or move the octopus - to block the loot
5. pick up the loot - if accessible
6. flip over another tile/fish - later on 2 tiles at once
7. game ends if no tiles are available
Player with high score (most valuable fishes) wins

name: Kennst Du Österreich?
description:
"Do You know Austria" in English
A game that will bring closer the geography of Austria. There are 3 game modes.
The first is similar to Domino: Who was the first to create all of its 10 local brands, wins. For this, a starting location is determined on the rail system, and from there are other brands created. Those who can not create a brand draws
new brand card.

The second variant is the round trip, where player roll the dice starting from a starting location must approach it the 10 local brands, which have been drawn. Each one comes forward as many stations as it has rolled. Player who visits first all the stations and returned to the residence, wins.

The third variant is similar to the first, but you must connect the route with a ticket placemarks.

Contents:

1 game board,
92 local brand-cards,
1 set of tickets,
6 playing pieces,
1 dice
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Travel

name: Ilmatsalu linnuretk
description:
From the box:

This game can be played by all players in all ages - adults, young and children from agre 5 and up. Goal is to educate about birds and to get familiarized with their world.
The game starter set comes with 30 bird cards, which later hopefully can be expanded by new bird decks, so that all players could have more fun.

Players in different age can choose a difficulty level by their knowledge of birds before the game or can start with the easiest setting and enjoy how easy it is to later know birds by their song, looks and local names and memorize them. For that reason we believe the game is perfect for schools as a tool in education. The knowledge from the game will easily go over to the nature since the pictures on the cards are real life.

Why is it called Ilmatsalu bird adventure? Because Ilmatsalu in Tartumaa is one of the most densely bird populated are in main land Estonia and a favorite place for a bird tourists. Hopefully all local players later can take a real walk there as well and test their knowledge.

Game is played by moving around the forest (game board) and collecting information tokens for birds. Certain places ask questions and answering them, lets you keep the card. First one to collect certain number is the winner.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Racing, Trivia

name: Das 6600 Fragen-Quiz
description:
Objective: be the first to gain 8 different coloured chips
- acting by turn -
due to (limited) no. of meeples you have to build teams if more than 6 players are participating
roll the die, move your meeple - landing on a coloured space (outer ring only) your left neighbour has to draw a (colour corresponding) card and challenges you with a question - appropiate your previous roll ==> '6' = free choice - out of following terms:
miscellaneous, history & politics, nature/enviroment, heaven & earth, technique & science, stort/games, fairy tales & sagas (incl. movies, music, riddles), arts & culture;
if your answer is correct you may throw the die again.

name: Sternenschweif: Zauberhafte Verwandlung
description:
The objective is to locate six items that will enable to transorm Star pony into a unicorn.
49 cards are laid out face down on the game board, and the stall is being prepared. Plyer roll the dice and move either horizontally or vertically and in the target field he may uncover an adjacent tile. Player may continue her turn if she opens an item she doesn't have yet, but if she opens Buddy the dog she loses everything opened this turn.

Who has 6 different items and find also a stall cards may try to open the barn and win the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Novel-based
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: I Toscanacci
description:
I Toscanacci is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides an entertaining journey to discover the characters, culture and sights of Tuscany. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Geography & Nature
Art & Culture
History
Food & Wine
Sports & Tradition
Famous People

name: Paper Trails: Pirates!
description:
50 tear-off sheets in each Paper Trails pad make this an ideal travel game. Each game combines the luck of the dice and strategy in the attempt to reach the destination before your opponent. Find the ultimate treasure in the PIRATES! edition. Each Paper Trails includes a 50-sheet Game Pad, a Pencil and Die.

Sail forth from your home point seeking buried treasure. Players roll dice to see how far they sail. An bad roll results in damage. Once each player reaches buried treasure, they must dig it up. The first player to reach their home port with all the buried treasure wins the game.

name: Flaggen und Länder
description:
A simple trivia game where players need to know the countries to flags they see and be able to locate the country on the world map.

Players take turns naming a country of which they are shown a flag on a card. If they name the country correctly and can point to it on the world map, they can choose to claim the card as a point and pass the turn to the next player. Alternatively, they can choose to play for a second point by answering 3 of 5 multiple-choice questions concerning this country correctly. If they answer fewer than 3 questions correctly, they get 0 points this round.

name: Monopoly: Konstanz
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Konstanz, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Het Huis Anubis: De weg der verdoemden
description: Adventurous and challenging! Dare to go on an adventure without fear on the road of the reprobates. Find your own special powercard by using your cards very smart. Beware! You will see only the cards from your opponenents and they see your cards. In order to know which cards you held you try to ask smart questions as much as possible. When you've found your powercards turn your summary so only you can see them and than you can go directly to the road of the reprobates. If you are the first who enters the road of the reprobates, you win the game.

name: Soccer Replay: The Best Of Europe
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game includes the following 20 top European teams from various years:

- A.C. Milan (1963)
- Ajax Amsterdam (1972)
- Arsenal (1971)
- Bayern Munich (1974)
- Benfica (1962)
- Celtic (1967)
- Everton (1985)
- Internazionale (1964)
- Leeds United (1974)
- Liverpool (1977)
- K.V. Mechelen (1988)
- Manchester United (1956)
- Newcastle United (1951)
- Nottingham Forest (1978)
- P.S.V. Eindhoven (1988)
- Rangers (1976)
- Real Madrid (1960)
- Tottenham Hotspur (1961)
- West Ham United (1965)
- Wolverhampton Wanderers (1960)

name: Save the Animals
description: Race around the board to get your animals to the safety of the reserve, but be careful to avoid the hazards as you go. Will help build awareness of animal conservation. Each player takes a turn throwing their dice and moves one of their animals the appropriate number of spaces. When you land on a space, follow the instructions written on the space. The first player to get all their family of animals to safety is the winner.

name: Old MacDonald Farm Game
description:
The game consists of 4 playing boards, 1 spinner and animal dice. The object of the game ia to be the first to fill Old MacDonald’s farm with animals.

Each player is glven a playing board and presses out the animal pieces. The youngest player spins the arrow on the spinner and if it points to Old MacOonald then he/she throws the dice snd fits the appropriate animal into his/her playing board. If the arrow points to the tractor or farm house then the play moves clockwise to tha next player in turn. The first player to collect all hls/hsr animals is the winner.

Young players may play without the spinner and just use the dice, collecting animals either randomly or in the sequence of the song.
Older players may extend the playing tlme of the game by using the spinner and collecting tha animals in the sequence of the song.

This game is similar to the same publisher's game Old MacDonald's Farm Game, but this game uses special dice and a spinner, not just a spinner.

name: Raamat
description: There is a book with over 800 trivia-questions in its pages and a dice. Player rolls dice and turns as many pages as the die indicates. Then he must answer the question. After 10 questions the correct answers are counted as a points. Player who has the most correct answers is the winner

name: Sindzse szeme
description:
The game is based on a hungarian adventure novel with the same title. The players start from Katmandu, and finish at the secret monastery of Khangpa. During the game the players have to gather several items (including yaks and sherpas) which are needed to win the game.
In addition to the (special) dice the game has 200 quiz cards, and many fate cards with story elements from the novel.
The box of the game contains the original novel too.

name: Fox & Rabbits
description:
Cheeky rabbits race around the field, hiding behind bushes to outwit the sharp-eyed fox.

A roll and move, players choose three rabbits of the same colour and place them on one corner of the field on the START hole.

1. The starting player throws the dice and does two things in the following order:
a)Moves the fox to the sector of the centre circle corresponding to the number,
b)Moves one of his Rabbits in a clockwise direction on the track.

E.G. If a 2 were thrown, the player first moves the Fox onto sector 2; secondly, he moves one of his rabbits two places in a clockwise direction.

2. If the fox can "see" any rabbits in that sector of the board, they must go back to their START hole.

3. If a rabbit is in the same sector as the fox BUT is behind a bush, then it is hidden from view and does not go back to START.

4. Play moves in a clockwise direction.

5. On their first three turns, each player must bring out all three of their rabbits. If a rabbit is sent back to his START hole, it must be brought out onto the track on the player's next turn.

6. Any number of Rabbits may occupy the same space on the track.

7. If a six is thrown the player may have an extra turn.

8. A player does not have to throw the exact number to get a rabbit HOME.

The same rules apply for a two or three player game.

name: Monster Memo
description:
This is not a Memory game variation but it does require a good memory to win.

Each player takes a board on which there are a number of circles. Five of these circles show a Pancake Monster. Each player has a quantity of Pancake Tiles and these are placed on your board. The Pancake Monsters must be covered carefully so that the Monster cannot be seen.

in a turn, a player may lift up a Pancake Tile from the player on his left. If it does not reveal a Pancake Monster, the tile is taken and put on your own board. You may then continue your turn by taking a Pancake Tile from the board of the next player to your left. And so on, until a Pancake Monster is revealed. The tile must be replaced and the turn is over. Now the next player can play accordingly.

You need a good memory because it is bad to reveal a monster and as they get revealed and recovered, players should get some idea of which tile not to look under.

The first person to completely fill their board with Pancake Tiles, wins.

name: Flohspiele
description:
A variant of Tiddlywinks. Three games are described.

Game 1: Normal Tiddlywinks.

Game 2. Place the board flat across the empty box. Each player has six small counters and one big one. A counter is flipped towards the target board which is mostly green but also a slaller white area and a hole in the centre. Each counter can only be flipped once. If you miss the target you score nothing with that counter. If you can get a counter on to the board, score as follows:
Green = 25 points
White = 50 points
In the hole = 100 points.
Play 6 turns each and the one with the best score wins.

Game 3: Use the Goal board. Stand it up on two supports so that it is vertical. Now take turns to flick a counter through the hole. Each goal scored is recorded. After an agreed time or number of turns, the player with the most goals wins.

name: Stop It!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the fast-playing, five-suited card game Stop It! players battle to lay down all of their cards. There are no set turns. Whoever has the next card in numerical and color sequence is the one who plays. With careful planning, you can run the table – but don't get cocky. Opponents can stop gameplay by claiming a "Stop It!" card and start a new run of their own.

name: Monopoly: Valencia
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Valencia, in Spain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dicecapades Dice-T
description:
From the publisher's website:

Dicecapades! Dice-T is the fast-paced, dice-rolling, crossword game where spelling words and lots of luck=win! Try completing as many of your crosswords with your rolled dice. The more crosswords you can complete, the more points you will score! You might get lucky and get some bonus points and wild spaces, or you might have to swap cards with an opponent! Players of all skill levels can compete and win as you try to sell two- to five-letter words.

Easy to learn, challenging to win, Dicecapades! Dice-T is the ultimate friend and family word game that'll keep everyone on their toes!

In the game, players will get 12 dice and 3 "Dice-T" cards. The cards have crosswords on them, bonus points, or game modifiers. Players try to complete the crosswords by rolling their dice and using the available letters. Play is simultaneous.

The first player to complete all their crosswords scores the points on their cards. After 10 rounds, the game is over and the player with the highest points wins.

name: Batman Gotham City In Danger!
description:
The central computer's codes have been hacked and are circulating freely in the city. Batman is trying to recover them, but he is not alone... Who will take control of the city? As they move about the board, players must take different kinds of action. They must also face and outsmart villains like Clayface, Firefly and Mr. Freeze and attempt to avoid surprise explosions...

Aim of the Game: To recovers codes to obtain two coded keys and gain access to the Gotham City central computer to take control of it. The first player to do so wins.

Box contains:
- 40 playing cards
- 32 tokens(16 codes, 8 bombs, 8 coded keys)
- 4 playing pieces (characters)
- 2 dice (characters)
- 1 six-figure die
- Game rules
- 20-sticker sheet
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Duudsonit Lautapeli
description:
Duudsonit Lautapeli is a Finnish board game were you are one of the Dudesons' and try to gather as much publicity as you can. Duudsonit (The Dudesons) are Finnish Ostrobotnian equivalent to Jackass.

Basically this is a card game with the point scoring board. The player who gets through the board first is the winner.

In the game you play several episodes, which consist of player turns. In your turn you have four choices: Play A card, change a card, heal one body part or pass. When you pass, you are out until the end of the current episode. At the end of the episode player/players with the most publicity gets to go forward two spaces in the board. The player/players with second most publicity gets to go forward one space. The episode ends when every player passes or is unable to play cards.

There are three types of cards in the deck: prank, stunt and hassle cards. Hassle cards cause some kind of events to happen. You get publicity either by making pranks or stunts. Making pranks causes injuries to chosen player and gives you publicity. Making Stunts gives you both the publicity and the injury.

There is three types of injuries (two each): Leg, hand and bodily injuries. Getting injuries might unable you from playing certain cards. Injuries are taken randomly from the bag and positioned in the players personal player board. If you have all six injuries, you are sent to hospital and you are out until the end of the episode.

name: G.I. Commander 1939-1945
description:
World War II land combat with military miniatures.
"World War II - The Way It Really Was!"

G.I. Commander was designed primarily for use with microscale (1:285/1:300) models, but with the minor modifications indicated in the rules, it can be used with HO scale equipment. It can even be used with board game equipment.

The heart of the game lies in the data section. Here you will find information in detail unmatched anywhere [...] But G.I. Commander is much more than just a collection of data. The rules have been designed, tested and revised to produce a game that is as playable as it is accurate. Wherever possible, bookkeeping has been eliminated, and you will find that your main struggle is with your opponent, not with the procedures!

Here, condensed in one book, is more information than is normally found in more expensive volumes. With G.I. Commander, you can experience all the dynamic and multifaceted possibilities of World War II, from Normandy to New Guinea, Archangel to Alamein.

A4 rulebook, 30 pages of basic rules, 25 of ddvanced rules, and 20 pages of data tables. Game scale: 1" = 50 yards, 1 turn = 5 minutes. Unit scale: micro-scale (1:285/1:300) = 1:1 for vehicles and guns and 1 base : 1 squad for infantry, HO scale (1:72) = 1 base : 1 platoon (vehicle, gun, infantry).

name: De Ramplassang
description:
Players strive to become the surrogate of Luxembourg's national comic superhero: Superjhemp. To do so, they must fulfill missions and take control of Luxembourg's cantons by proving their knowledge about Luxembourg's history and present.

In this trivia game, every player draws a secret mission card at the start of the game. This tells the player which cantons (pairs of spaces on the map) have to be controlled by the player in order to win.

Players traverse the map from north to south. Every time they land on one space, a card from that space is drawn and a random trivia question is asked. If the player knows the answer, he can put a marker on the space. If both spaces from one canton are marked, the player controls that canton. It is possible for players to wrest control of a half or full canton away from a player controlling them.

name: Großer Spielezauber
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Who will be thrilled to enter this big wonderland of games? In Großer Spielezauber, both very small ones and their parents will find ten different games with easy rules and a short playing time, such as a picture bingo, color die game, memory game, domino, stacking game, look-closely game, and many more. Their gradually increasing degree of difficulty and the caringly designed game material will provide long lasting play fun.

name: Smack Down
description:
Juego de tablero para varios jugadores inspirado en el wrestling, en concreto en la WWE, editado y creado en España.
Cada jugador representa un luchador, y debe lograr ser el único que quede con puntos de vida sobre el ring.
Para ello usaran cartas que podrán usar para atacar o defenderse.


Inspired by wrestling, specifically WWE, edited and created in Spain.

Each player takes a fighter, an energy marker, and 50 random cards. In turn a player will take a card and roll a die to advance. When all players are in the ring, a player may start a fight against an opponent. Cards are used to attack or defend. The game ends when there is only one player with energy.

name: Metacell: Genesis – The Card Game
description:
Exciting mix of strategy and luck, a 2-4 person, fast paced card game that has unique characters with powerful abilities.

In Metacell: Genesis you take the role of one of humanities last defenders who are training to battle a scientific abomination that was created by our hunger for answers on the nature of reality. Battle your friends and learn the skills you'll need to survive!

Quick match making game play and activated player powers, with sudden game endings and complex scoring system creates a dynamic game that can either be a drawn out head to head or quick sudden duel. The rules include a 2p vs. 2p teams mode, as well as modes for 2, 3, or 4 players to play independently. Awesome variability in play makes it a game with plenty of replay value.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Det Realistiske Travspill
description:
A roll-and-move game for 2-8 people.
Players agree on how much monney each player gets at the start of the game.

Every player bets on which horse they want to race and then race their horse on the racing-track. If two or more players want to race the same horse, players draw which player gets to race the horse of choice.
Horse 1-4 starts on starting-line 1, and horse 5-8 on starting-line 2. All horses use the same goal-line. As a compensation for starting on starting-line 2, the last four horses get one extra die-roll during the race. The race runs for two rounds around the track.

It's not allowed to pass the horse in front of you in the same track. You have to pass horses by changing the track and pass on the inside or outside. It's only allowed to change track acording to the arrows on the gameboard. So sometimes you'll be blocked from using a good die-roll.

Around the track you'll find spots in diferent colors. Each color have their own special-effect.
Yellow: Double-spot.
Red: Miss the next move, and other horses may pass in the same track (there may be two horses in the red spot).
Green: Double the amount of your next die-roll.
Blue: Use only one die next die-roll.
Black: At the next die-roll, move forward only if getting dice of same value. Unless two-of-a-kind, move backwards in the same track according to the die-roll (you are not limited by other horses behind you).

The first player to pass the goal-line after two rounds wins the race and receives the money in the pot and from each player the same amount of money the winning player put on his horse before the race. Maximum bid on a horse is 500.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Race Track
description:
Race Track is basically a roll die and move game with a few extras. There are 12 jigsaw type two lane track sections which can be used to make over a dozen different circuits.
There is a "weather" spinner to determine if conditions are wet or dry and players have a token to indicate whether they have wet or dry tyres on. There are two dice, one "slow" die with 1-3 on and one "fast" die with 4-6 on. If their tyres match the weather conditions they use the fast die, if not the slow die.
There are a number of squares on the circuit, which, if landed on require player to draw one on 50 Chance cards and follow the instructions thereon.

name: X-Men
description:
Publisher's Description:

Be the first to get your X-Team to the X-Mansion! There's danger in the air! Juggernaut, that unstoppable engine of destruction, is roaming about the X-Mansion. Professor X's life is at risk. He telepathically calls his X-Men to the rescue. However, they are already on a mission to prevent Magneto from enrolling the Morlocks and their leader, Callisto, into his deadly plans. Help the X-Men stop the villains and restore safety to the X-Mansion.

X-Men was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is in the Pachisi/Sorry family. Each player has four markers. A roll of 4 is needed to get a marker on the start space. After that, they must enter a track and make their way around to their color of ladder They must then make their way up the ladder and roll the exact number to land on the X-Mansion. Along the way, if they land on another player's marker, they may either send it back to the start or take another turn. Spaces marked with villains move the marker backward or cause loss of a turn. The first player to land all four markers on the X-Mansion wins.

name: Skattjakten
description:
A strategic kids game with the goal to get the treasure at the bottom of the sea.

The game is set up by setting three boards on top of each other and each players sets his/her pawns in position. By strategically decide which die (as these have different numbers) to roll the player will try to move into the holes in the current layer. When all holes are filled, the current layer is removed along with all pawns that are not in a hole. The last layer contains only one hole, which leads to the treasure.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Puppy Dogs From Space
description:
Puppy Dogs From Space is a fast playing card game for 3-6 players where each player tries to assemble their team before the other puppy dog factions can. Players must balance getting their puppies assembled while also preventing opponents from doing the same with cards like ” flea infestation”, “the cone of shame”, or “the dinosaur bone”. Each puppy also has their own special power that can be used to help their faction accomplish it's mission.

Each player has the same 9 puppies and powers. Players take their 9 puppies and shuffle 20 random cards from the 120 core cards to create their own draw deck. This will randomize the cards from the core deck and the order their 9 puppies come out in play. No two games are the same.

name: Feirmeoir
description:
Feirmeoir is a simulation of the Irish Potato famine in game form. The object of the game is to build the greatest family by accumulating the most points by the end of the game (or beating
your previous single player high score). The year is 1844 and you are a young Irish couple. You have just been given your first plot of land as a wedding gift from your parents. There are many
plots for sale, so be sure to pick the best spot! Your parents and neighbors can help you out by building your first two room Peat House, but from then on you are on your own. The nearby
village will provide you with all you need to start your own farm, and hopefully a family. Make sure you prepare well, there is no telling what hardships await you!
categories: Animals, Economic, Educational, Farming, Print & Play
mechanics: Enclosure, Hand Management, Simulation, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: FC Barcelona
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Barcelona, a famous Soccer Club in Spain
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Eleven Force, Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Ratz Fatz Fantasy: Mau Mau
description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Fantasy

name: Hello Kitty Fjärilsspelet
description:
In the Nordic Hello Kitty adaption Fjärilsspelet ("Hello Kitty - the Butterfly Game" in English) players take on the role of cute kittens trying to catch butterflies. The mechanic is basically roll-and-move, and if you land on a spot with a butterfly, you roll a colored dice; if any of the colors on the side rolled match any of the colors of the butterfly you catch the little creature. You can also land on a spot with a flower, making one of you caught butterflies to escape to a field in the middle of the board. By landing on a spot with a butterfly net you get to catch a butterfly from the field. Finally, if landing on a spot with a bee, you can move to any spot on the board.

The game ends when all butterflies are caught. The player with the most butterflies matching the color of the bow in Kitty's hair is the winner.

Comes with four different Hello Kitty miniatures; red, green, yellow, and pink.

The game is also called Sommerfuglespillet (in Norwegian), Sommerfuglspillet (in Danish), and Perhospeli (in Finnish) respectively on the Nordic edition box cover.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: I Spy In a Flash Card Game
description:
I Spy In a Flash Card Game is a matching game where players compete to most quickly match pictures on the cards in their hand with pictures on a group of shared cards.

The cards in this game have pictures of a number of different objects. The same objects appear on all cards, but most objects on each card a silhouettes, with only two being actual pictures. At the start of the game, cards are dealt evenly to all players. Each player then turns up three cards to serve as his or her hand. Each player then turns up a fourth card into the center of the table. Players look at these cards and try to match one of the objects (silhouettes don't count) with one of the objects on a card in their hands. The card can then be played on top of the middle card, as quickly as possible. Players may play on any card in the middle, not only their own. Newly played cards cover the old ones, thus constantly giving other players new objects to match. Once all three cards in a player's hand are played, three more cards are drawn for a new hand. The first player to play all his or her cards onto the center cards wins the game.

name: Desafío Extremo
description:
This is an educational game to think and easy mechanics, wich are based on questions and answers. We must get to the place where the challenge lies for each player who randomly received a letter of challenge.This show you the objects you will need have before departure to your challenge. But to move your figure you need energy and this energy it´s won with the correct answers to the questions of the letters

Spanish description:
Un juego al estilo del trivial (Porque es de ir respondiendo preguntas), pero más atractivo al tener que buscar cierto equipo y luego llegar a un punto del mundo según la "misión" que te tocase
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Verhexter Hexenbesen
description:
You start the game with the enchanted witch broom. For this game, it's important to listen and react quickly, because the broom emits several sounds that are associated with different destinations.
Based on the destination cards and the enchanted witch broom you can play several different games of your choice where you can help Bibi Blocksberg break the enchantment of her broom.

name: 999 Games trakteert!
description:
999 Games made this 25th anniversary gift pack in 2015. When purchasing any game by 999 Games, you would receive this as a gift.

It contains the following items:
- a mini-expansion for CATAN (Catan: 999 Games 25 jaar Expansion)
- a try-out game of Carcassonne
- a mini game of SET
- a promo game of Ghost Blitz
- a try-out game of Absacker
- a (cardboard) try-out game of Qwirkle
- a 54 piece puzzle
- cash-back coupon book for all of the above

The box has the text "999 Games trakteert!" on it, which mean "999 Games treats!", as in a birthday treat.

name: Mouse Drop Game
description:
Similar to Tumblin' Monkeys but there are sticks in 4 colors and die has 2 bonus multicolor sides.
First drop the mice to the cheese tower with full of sticks.
Take turns to roll the die and remove the stick of the same color rolled. You get all mice what drop during Your turn.

The player with the fewest mice when they've all dropped is the winner.

name: Puzzle Dice
description: Puzzle Dice is a quick playing abstract game for two players in which the players draft dice from an open display over 12 rounds and place them on their individual player boards with 6x6 spaces. The dice come in 6 different colors and as they are rolled before the drafting can have values between 1 and 6. The aim of the game is to create lines, rows and diagonals of dice in which each color and or each number is unique. Sacrificing the scoring potential for a line, row or diagonal (by placing a duplicate color or number) gains that player a wild die which in a later round can be placed instead of a drafted die from the display. After both players have filled up their boards all lines, rows and diagonals that fulfill these criteria are scored and the player with the highest score wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Number, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Anatolian Fleet
description:
Anatolian Fleet is a simulation game of modern day combat for control of the eastern Mediterranean and the Black Sea-Balkan sub-theatre by Naval Task groups. NATO, Russian and Turkish Fleets are pitted against each other and the other minor navies of the region. You must form your ships into Task Forces and attempt to cripple the enemy’s capital ships, carriers, and submarines. Your air assets must be carefully assigned to defensive and offensive missions. Most important, you must protect your supply and replenishment ships, or your fleet will be unable to maintain combat effectiveness.

Each 8-hour game turn is broken into 3 distinct phases (sub, surface, and air) and each player takes turns choosing which phase they wish to conduct. Ex. if the NATO player chooses "Air", they conduct all bombing, shipping strikes, anti-sub, and interception actions for all their aircraft.

Players also use their units to attempt to "detect" enemy forces so that an attack can be made. Ships and aircraft are always detected once a unit moves close enough to them, but players have to roll to try to detect subs.

Optional rules include nuclear weapons and logistics.

Anatolian Fleet is a comprehensive simulation of the myriad elements involved in modern naval command and control. From Technical Term Game Company Anatolian Fleet continues the line of naval games originally from Victory Games Fleet Series.

name: Oíd Mortales
description:
Put yourself in place of the greatest heroes and commanders of Argentina's history and free this land with honor, wisdom and strategy. Oid Mortales el grito sagrado. LIBERTAD!

Oíd Mortales is a trivia game with strategy combat in a board. Players will have to manage tokens, playing infantry and artillery cards which will fight in surprise trivia, where be the expert historian is not necessarily good. The tactic board gives an expansion to the game far beyond questions and answers, where movement and intelligent use of resources is important as the battle itself.

Each player will take the side of the "Patriotas" and the other the "Realista´s" side. During the game the players draw cards and put or move the battalions on the map in relation to the action points (AP) obtained in the die roll.

Each team will have 4 commanders that have special fight habilities, one of them will be the Gold Commander.

The dice roll give action points (AP) to the players. The actions cost from 2 AP to 6 AP, depending on the type of action. For example take an artillery card cost 2 AP but an event card cost 6 AP.

When a unit is next to an enemy unit, the player can attack. Each artillery or reinforcement card, wich are used to attack, include an historical trivia. The attacker increase or decrease his AP by answering de question.

The first player who eliminate the enemy Gold Commander enemy wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Block 2 Block
description:
Block 2 Block was designed with players and customization in mind. There are many variant rule sets which make the game a new yet familiar experience. We invite you to come join the community of players and enjoy.

Players roll dice to determine how many blocks they can place on tiles at various tiers. As the tiles are revealed and claimed, new tiers worth more points open up and players can start revealing and claiming tiles there. Different tiles have different powers, some let you remove blocks from other tiles, some remove tiles completely, and some move or switch tiles in different tiers.

The ultimate goal is to accrue the most points, through skillful use of tile powers, wise investments, and some luck with the die.

name: Värvet: Det Sociala Spelet
description: Värvet: Det Sociala Spelet (eng. "The Task: The Social Game") is a socializing party game. In the beginning of each players round they draw a card, on each card there is a descrition of a personality trait. The players will then discuss which of the players this trait best applies. After all the players has agreed, a new card can be drawn. There is no winner, or loser, in this game, but a co-operation to select which player will get each of the cards.

name: Beer Pong Dice
description:
No Table - No Problem
The famous drinking game without table.

Each team throw the dice up to five times to get a doublet.
If successful the current team marks the "cup" as a hit by turning another dice on the appropriate site. First team who have hit all "cups" wins.

name: Memory Chees
description: Memory Chees is a children's game. The players put all the pieces on the board, and then throw the dice. The player that rolled the die tries to take one piece of the same color as the die is showing. The player that first collect most of one of the four color pieces are the winner.

name: The Agenda Game
description:
The Agenda Game, published in 2014, focuses on control of recent political issues, rather than the contest for electoral votes. It is a very slick and highly accessorized package, with a game board, seven large Agendas with platform planks to be achieved, plastic stands for these cards, corresponding player tokens, seven decks of action cards (Propaganda, Smoke and Mirrors, "Dog Whistle", Media, Scandal, Talking Points, and Politica), a deck of money cards, two decks of vote cards, plastic discs for each agenda, plastic bars with sliders to record % of public support for each agenda, a pen for marking the Agenda cards, a microfiber cloth for erasing markings, and an hourglass timer.

Each faction card has a seven-point agenda. The board includes three spaces called Agenda Buttons, and when a player lands on one of these, he may enact as many plank boxes on his platform as his resources permit at the time. The winner is the first to achieve an agreed upon number of platform planks.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ramble
description:
The object of the game is for each player to visit two Lakes & Tarns, two Mountains & Fells and two Places of Interest before returning to their starting position before any other player.

Along the way players learn about this fascinating part of the UK whilst testing their map skills and local knowledge.

Fences add a tactical element to the game as players try to obstruct their opponents from making progress on their ramble, while the use of both dice adds a portion of luck! Ramble cards add unexpected problems and challenges into your adventure, putting a player’s best-laid plans to the test.

This is essentially a throw dice and move game with a few bells and whistles.
The game consists of a 26x26 gridded map of the Lake District, 5 decks of cards (Mountains & Fells, Lakes & Tarns, Places of Interest, Ramble and Gate), 18 fences, coloured counters and 2 dice, one red, one white.
Each player is initially allocated two each of the Mountains & Fells, Lakes & Tarns and Places of Interest cards. The winner is the first to visit each of their allocated destinations and return to the start.
Movement is governed by the dice, the red die determining NS movement and the white die determining EW movement. The Ramble cards help/hinder movement, sometimes depending on the answer to a question.

name: Lis: Gra Karciana
description:
Lis: Gra Karciana is a card game created based on the comic book "Lis" published by Wydawnictwo Sol Invictus. Its action takes place in the today Poland and derive from such genres as criminal, thriller or superhero.

The are 66 cards in the deck, which will cause the gameplay to be full of twists and turns. On each of them there are illustrations kept in the style of the comic book "Lis". In the "Lis: Gra Karciana" players will be able to play as one of four comic book characters, which must collect the appropriate goals.

There are different type of cards: character, goal and action cards. Each player receives 1 character card face down, 1 goal card and 3 action cards. All remaining cards are mixed together and shuffled. In your turn you can do 2 moves from the following ones: draw a card, play an action card, discard 2 cards from your hand to draw 1 card from the discard pile. The card hand limit is 7 cards.

At any moment if another player is playing an action card, you can block its effect by saying "stop" and discarding one goal card from your hand. Other players can block your "stop" by doing the same.

You win immediately if at any point you manage to collect 4 out of 5 goal cards matching (giving 3 points) your character. If nobody was able to collect 4 dedicated goal cards, the game ends after the turn of the player which drew the last card from the deck. In this case the players will sum the points gained from the goal cards based on the scoring from their character cards. The player with the biggest score wins.

name: Cowboys and Indians Card Game
description: This is a set of 36 cards (4 Tomahawk, 4 Six Shooter, 14 Indian, 14 Cowboy) in which players are trying to win all the cards. They do this by flipping over cards and indicating "Indian" or "Cowboy" as they are turned over. If a player turns over a Tomahawk card and their opponent has flipped over a "Cowboy" or "Six Shooter" card they then take the opponents pile. Conversely, if a player turns over a "Six Shooter" card and their opponent has flipped over an "Indian" or "Tomahawk" card they take the opponents pile. First player to take all their opponents cards is the winner.

name: At the Movies
description:
From publisher website:
"So you think you're a movie buff? This will test even the most die hard of movie fans, providing hours of fun for you and your friends."

From game rulebook:

"The object of the game is to be the first team to move their player piece around the game board from DEBUT to BLOCKBUSTER HIT. A team advances around the game board by correctly guessing the name of the movie from the movie quotes and clues provided. You move more quickly around the board by guessing the name of the movie using fewer of the quotes and clues provided."

Contains over 1800 movie quotes over 600 movies in 5 movie genres: Comedy, Chick Flicks, Drama, Action/Adventure, and Thriller
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Wickie: Denken of doen
description:
A boardgame in the theme of Wickie the Viking.
Eric the Terrible has stolen the valuables of the people of the town of Flake. He hid them on his treasure island. Wickie and Halvar are on a mission to retrieve them.
In the game you play with Wickie ("intelligence" - 1 and 2 moves) or with Halvar ("brute force" - 1 up to 4 moves). They move across the five areas of the island.
Wickie moves slower across the island, but if he can remember the part of the treasure (number of coins) on the card, he is certain of getting that part of the treasure.
Halvar moves faster across the island, but needs an adequate weapon (viking card of the same color) to collect the treasures of the area he is in.
We play until we have retrieved the entire treasure Eric the Terrible has stolen. Amongst the players, the one that has retrieved the most of the treasure gains the most honour.

name: Watch Yo Mouth!
description: Watch Yo Mouth! contains a bunch of mouthguards and dozens of phrases on cards that you will find extremely challenging to say while sporting a mouthguard. Can you communicate clearly enough that others will guess what you're trying to say?

name: Spillet om Klatremus og de andre dyrene i Hakkebakkeskogen
description: The players are in a race through the woods to get to Papa Bears birthday party. On their way, all the players gather gingerbread and have to stay clear of the Fox. If the Fox catches you, you have to give him the gingerbreads you´ve collected, unless you amongst the ordinary gingerbreads have gingerbread with extra pepper, then the Fox don´t want them and you get to keep them. The player with the most gingerbread wins.

name: Shimmer and Shine: Genie Friends Forever Game
description:
Shimmer and Shine Genie Friends Forever Game is based on an excitingly-new, animated preschool series on Nick Jr.

Players join in on magical adventures that sometimes don't go quite as planned!
It's up to the three girls to work collaboratively to solve problems as they discover their way and learn from their mistakes

The game encourages counting and social interaction. No reading required
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Lucid: Morpheus Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb

Lucid is a card game where players battle the night using their dreams against the nightmares of their opponents to be the last asleep.

Lucid is a deck of Tarot-sized cards, where players battle the night using their dreams against the nightmares of their opponents to be the last dreamer asleep.

But...
