Lucid combines the elements of fast-paced game-play, stunning art, and subtle strategies into a competitive experience unlike anything else. It can be learned in one game and you can be stabbing your friends in the back like a master, by your third. But in the end, the dice decide your fate.

name: Boarding Party
description:
Boarding Party is a family game suitable for age 9 and above. The game may be easy to learn but it is no easy task to master and packs with lots of fun! Players may build and upgrade their ships, send them to war and capture treasure ships. They will go through and have to make strategic and tactical decisions every turn. The more ships and upgrades you have, the more damage you do but often also the hardest you will get hit as your ships become more lucrative for other player to plunder. The player gains influential point as he acquires, attacks and plunder ships and other pirates that roam the waters of Caribbean!

In Boarding Party, there are 2 game scenarios, 1 draw pile, 1 event pile, 1 discard pile and each player has a fleet of ships. You start the game by drawing a hand of 4 cards and each turn you may draw 2 cards from either draw piles and play up to 3 cards on your hand. Each player assumes the role of a pirate captain with a unique ability. Balance comes from trying to increase your influence by expanding your fleet or attacking or protecting them from rival pirates. The player or faction with the most number of Ships and Upgrades in play when the game ends wins the game.

The 1st scenario (2-7 players), pitches all pirates against each other in the quest to dominate the Caribbean Sea and be the king of Pirates in the Caribbean. Meanwhile the 2nd scenario (5-7 players), players are divided into 3 factions, most with hidden identity and contribute to respective faction to gain influence and control of the Caribbean Sea by the end of the game.

Boarding Party is designed to be easy to learn and hard to master. It features 130 pieces of high quality illustrated cards thus being highly portable, easy to setup and durable while delivering an exciting gaming experience anytime anywhere
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Blank Marry Kill: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
description: An Kickstarter-exclusive 18-card booster pack for Blank Marry Kill.

name: Auktionsquiz
description:
All questions are for sale. Tease your opponents by increasing the bid and win the auction of your favourite categories.

In Auktionsquiz all questions are for sale. Whomever bid the highest on one of the 10 categories, wins the chance to answer a question in the category and can win 1 point on a correct answer.

The players have a limited amount to bid in the auctions, so you have to think fast and bid smart. Should you bid on a category to drive up the prices for the other players? Should you have play cool and only bid on the categories you like? Categories that are popular will be expensive, while other categories will be cheap.

All players receive a number of auction cards, which can be used to play for double points, steal questions from other players, or get points when opponents answer a question correctly.

The winner of Auctionsquiz is the player with most points when all the auctions have ended.

name: Nordwind (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: This will be my first Fan-Expansion for T.I.M.E Stories based on the Viking Age.

name: FC Kip Feestspel
description:
A simple cardgame based on a Dutch comedy series.

Players have to match numbers or colors to the discard pile. The first to have an empty hand wins the game. Some cards instruct players to take more cards or skip turns.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Star Wars Trivia Card Game
description:
Are you a Jedi Master? How much do you really know about Star Wars?

This galactic quiz game is the perfect way to put your powers to the test and show off your Star Wars knowledge.

Trivia based on episodes I-VI

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: The BFG
description:
Join Sophie and The BFG on their adventures across the world saving England from nasty giants, with the help of her Majester the Queenie! Visit London, Giant country and of course, the Queen’s Palace, as one of six original playing pieces. Will you have a phizzwizard or a trogglehumper? Will you pay for the bus and taxi? Will you collect snozzcumber and frobscottle? This duper squiffling monopoly game brings the magical new movie into your own home!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Diggity Dogs
description: A card collection game where players attempt to adopt the most dogs by gathering cards representing what each dog needs. The adoptable dogs are on cardboard stand-ups; each has icons denoting its three wants (a bone, a bowl, a stick, etc.). Players take turn asking other players for cards in an attempt to match all three of a dog's wants to collect that dog. If the player has that item, they must give it to the asker; if not, the asker draws from the pile. The game ends when all dogs have been adopted and the player with the most dogs wins. 2014 Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Gold Seal.

name: Ramasjang: Mysteriet
description:
Board game version of the popular Danish TV children show "Ramasjang Mysteriet" where kids help Kristian solve crimes comitted by one of the usual suspects.

Help each other find out which of the 7 well known Ramasjang bad guys is guilty by finding evidence and investigate leads. As the game progress, try to guess who committed the crime. The winner is the who has accumulated most liquorice pipe (Danish candy) points at the end of the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Monopoly: P&O Cruises
description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Welcome to the special P&O Cruises edition of Monopoly.
Whatever you dream of from your holiday, P&O Cruises provide. An escape from routine? Without doubt. A resort that offers every luxury you can think of? A destination that is every bit as exciting and memorable as the amazing and unforgettable places you visit? It's a done deal. The ships of our fleet offer it all, and then some.

Each of our ships is a world in herself, a world of luxury, of fine dining, world-class entertainment and blissful relaxation. Whichever ship you step aboard, you'll feel your horizon expanding with the endless possibilities for sheer delight on offer at every turn. A world where your meals are lovingly crafted by our Food Heroes, and your entertainment is provided in a theatre that's state of the art(s). Where you can unwind with a massage in our relaxing spa. And where your view is ever fascinating and ever changing.

If only there was a phrase that perfectly captured all those perfect little moments you'll experience on a P&O Cruises holiday. Ah, yes...

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Amsterdam / Guernsey
LIGHT BLUE
??? / ??? / ???
PINK
??? / ??? / ???
ORANGE
??? / ??? / ???
RED
Stockholm / ??? / ???
YELLOW
??? / ??? / ???
GREEN
San Francisco / Dubai / ???
DARK BLUE
Sydney / Hong Kong
STATIONS
??? / ??? / ??? / Market Café with Eric Lanlard
UTILITIES
??? / ???
TAXES
??? / ???
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Captain’s Chest / Ship’s Luck
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jr. RangerLand North American Animal Tracks Matching Game
description:
Memory challenge card game for 1 or more players ages 4+. 48 cards comprising 24 pairs of matching animal and tracks.

The cards are a unique take on matching. Each pair of “matching” cards comprises a North American animal card and animal tracks / footprints card (that references back to the animal card).

name: Life Coach
description: A party game where you find answers to life's big and small questions. One player presents a problem and the other players choose the best answer from cards in their hands.

name: Warhammer: Annual 2002
description:
Warhammer: Annual 2002 is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 144-page softcover book is a compilation of the best Warhammer articles from the pages of White Dwarf Magazine and the Games Workshop web site, plus much revised and previously unpublished material.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Go5
description:
Go5 contains a 49-card deck in which the cards each have a number, color, and pattern on them. Players start the game with seven cards in hand.

On a turn, a player draws a card from the deck, then places cards down in sets of at least three — with a set consisting of cards with the same number, the same color, or the same pattern — or adds cards to an existing set of theirs. (For the first play, a player must lay down a set of exactly three cards with no jokers. After this, the player is free to play single cards and other sets, using jokers in sets as well.)

You can replace an existing non-joker card in another player's set with one of your cards in hand as long as you use the exchanged card immediately. At the end of your turn, if you have fewer than five cards in hand, you can pick up the top card of the discard pile, then fill your hand to five from the deck.

If a player has a set of five cards, which can contain at most one joker, the player calls "Go5", and the round ends, with everyone scoring points for the cards in front of them and losing points for cards still in hand. If you can use the top card of the discard pile for a "Go5", you can grab the card even if it's not your turn, and the round ends.

Players play a number of rounds until someone passes a predetermined point threshold.

name: Robot Wars: Coding Strategy Game
description:
The Concept
In the game, players will be commanding their robots using the cards given. The game starts with Instruction cards where we introduce basic commands in simple code. Slowly game moves to resource cards on which bigger code with generic syntax is written. Robots will be executing these codes sequentially just in the way computers execute programs. The cards are written in Java but readable as simple English.

Anyone who can read and understand English can easily read and follow these codes, thus making it easy for kids and adults to learn programming. There are complicated code cards which will be used in strategy level, which are explained well in the rule book.

The Story
C.E.L.E.B (Command Executing Laser Equipped Bot) was developed by S.A.I.L (Secret Artificial Intelligence Lab) for military for war purposes. As the name says he can execute his human partner's commands and shoot enemies with the laser from his chest.

As a part of S.A.I.L's training program to choose the Commanding Officers for the bots, players are being tested against their logic and strategy in the artificial war zone. Shoot Cards will be distributed equally to all the players. First player starts the game by picking up the top card of Instructions deck and moves his robot according to the command on his Instruction card. If he gets to move to a new grid on the board using this card, he can collect the top card of Resources deck. When it is first players turn again he can choose between playing his resource and picking up a new instruction. As the game goes on, you will collect more resources and strategize your game better. As the robot moves on war zone it will collect important resource codes for it's partner which will help him strategize in the war. The player who reaches the middle of war zone first will be promoted as Commanding Officer. But you need to shoot at least one enemy robot before getting there.

Components
The game box contains

- 1 Game board (AKA) War zone
- A deck of Instruction Cards(codes)
- A deck of Resource Cards
- A deck of Shoot Cards
- A rule book
- 4 C.E.L.E.B game markers

name: NFL Rush Zone Flick 'n Kick
description:
NFL Rush Zone Flick 'n Kick is a dexterity game based on the kicking game in American football. Licensed by the NFL it contains 32 cardboard footballs representing each team in the National Football League.
Players take turns flicking their football toward a set of goalposts.
There are two different ways to play;

1. R-U-S-H
Players match every kick, flick for flick, and spell defeat for your opponents. (A bit like H-O-R-S-E in basketball).

2. Longest Kick
Attempt record breaking flicks in this competition to see who has the biggest leg.

—description from the publisher

name: Lo sgranocchia colori di Pop
description: It is a simple game for children based on association. Every player has to find cards of dinosaurs and coloured food of same colors. When it happens it is possible to take a coloured piece of dinosaurs to build it. First player who have a complete coloured dinosaur will win.

name: Soirée Escape Game: Prison' scape
description:
Trapped in a prison, you have an accomplice outside who gives you clues by smartphone. 60 enigmas approx. to solve by yourself or in teams. No game master.
—description from the publisher

The box contains a rulebook with 6 scenarios and the solutions, 10 envelopes, 60 enigma cards, a newspaper (Prison News), a planning guards and a map of the prison.

name: PenSylvania
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In PenSylvania, manage the rustic logging village of Sylvania, which lies on the edge of the forest. The forest is rife with resources to use to develop the village, sell down the river, or protect your livestock. In this competitive resource management game, will you be able to both take care of the town and sell goods down the river for the highest score?

On your Turn:

Roll the dice and then rank them from largest to smallest,
Then either choose the two highest dice or the three lowest; the other players get to use the set you didn’t pick.
Use the dice you picked (or were dealt) for various actions, such as: exploring deeper into the forest, hauling logs out of the forest, selling goods down the river, buying the tools you need, placing fences in your pasture, or constructing buildings.

Buildings make your work more efficient, and fences make sure you can raise valuable livestock. But of course, it is not all hard work in Sylvania: the annual bonfire is coming up and it is a festival the entire village works towards. Bonuses await for those who help out with preparations!

PenSylvania requires five standard six-sided dice. Components include one player sheet per player

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, City Building, Dice, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, I Cut, You Choose, Income, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil

name: What's Your Number?
description:
Reveal what your friends really think about the questionable things you’ve always wondered about.

Your friend secretly rates how they feel about one of 216 topics on a scale of 1-100. All other players then guess that players rating: aka their “number.”

Your friend’s number is revealed at the end of the round and everyone learns who knows that friend best… and what they really think about their topic.

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel Avengers Hero Rush Game
description:
Any fan of the superheroes in the Marvel universe will love this fast-paced board game featuring Hulk, black Panther, and Iron Man. It's going to take speedy moves and fast thinking to be the ultimate hero in this game. Move hero timers from one flip zone to another as directed by your villain move cards. Don't let the sand run out on your turn. Get a hero right or hero left card without a timer running out and you score an Avengers token. Three tokens and you score a victory! Features three plastic figures with sand timers—black Panther, Iron Man, and Hulk! Recommended for two to four players, ages six and up.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Real-time

name: Mammoth Maths
description: Move your caveman around the board, solve the maths problems to collect stone rings on your mammoth's trunk, then race back to the cave to win the game.

name: DC HeroClix: Icons Starter Set
description:
This collectible miniatures game, featuring DC Comics characters, uses the same system as previous HeroClix components, based on the Mage Knight system.

Pre-painted miniatures are mounted on bases, within which a dial stores the figures' statistics and abilities so that there is little or no record-keeping off-table.

As it can integrate with other DC and Marvel HeroClix games, it can act as an expansion to those games even though it is a stand-alone game.

There are 60 versions of DC characters in the DC HeroClix: Icons set.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures

name: Impractical Jokers the Game
description:
Think you've got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now's your chance to put yourself to the test. In this three part game players first try and pull off challenges in front of unsuspecting guests. Once the gag is up, players then face off in a charades-like card game to see who can match the most awkward one liners in response to funny scenarios. The night's biggest loser is subject to a surprise punishment of epic proportions.

—description from the publisher

In the first part of this party game, each player is given a card that issues them some sort of awkward and funny challenge to complete in front of an unsuspecting person (nothing dangerous, gross or illegal, all challenges are silly and require no physical contact). The second phase of the game has players receiving cards with a scenario and the other players respond to this scenario with pre-written one-liners on cards of their own. Points are tallied from both phases and a loser is declared-- whoever has the least amount of points-- and this losing player receives a card that delivers them some sort of silly "punishment".

Note: This edition was a Walgreen exclusive.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: インヴァージョン (!nversion)
description:
インヴァージョン (!nversion) is a trick-taking card game from Japan. The game has five suits (Crown being added as the fifth), and plays through as normal trick-taker, with players following the lead suit if they can. However, cards are played in a line, and if successive cards total to 11, the suit inverts. The second card becomes the lead suit. For example, the 10 of Spades has been played in the line. If a 1 of Hearts is now played, Hearts becomes the lead.
—user summary

name: FCK CDL KLL
description:
FCK CDL KLL is a card game of brains and silliness where you find yourself searching for a sharkpig having sex with a pregnant angel or a unicorn killing a yellow snowman or a former president cuddling with the devil.

On a 3x3 tableau of 9 cards, players attempt to create a "Perfect 9" by playing 3 horizontal Trifectas and 3 vertical Trifectas - a Trifecta being 3 cards in a row or column containing the same character. There are 3 "suits" of card FCK, CDL, and KLL and 11 different characters.

A Horizontal Trifecta must have all three suits of card (FCK+CDL+KLL) and a Vertical Trifecta must have all the same suit (i.e., KLL+KLL+KLL)

Each round player may either switch 1 card from the middle tableau of 9 cards to their own tableau of 9 cards or add 9 more cards to the middle.

Additional turns may be gained by achieving a "Holy Trifecta" in which the same two characters appear three times in a row.

FCK cards can be used to switch cards from tableaus of their opponents.

name: Race Across the USA
description: Players race across the USA to be the first to visit six states, answer geography questions, then get back to their home states to win the game! Players can use the game board for clues to answer questions and win state cards. Questions are geared to each player’s own grade level, so kids 8 and up from different grades can play together on an even field.

name: Scatterbones
description:
Have you ever thrown your bones like dice? You could try it in Scatterbones.
Scatterbones is a bone throwing and die rolling fun game for two players. Each player tries to assemble their skeleton while preventing the opponent from doing the same.

Game play:

Each player throws a tombstone to determine which colour their skeleton must have - black or red. Both players can play for the same colour.
Player 1 rolls their 6 skeleton parts (the bones). If a ribcage in the correct colour can be found all other parts in the same colour can be connected to it.
Player 2 does the same with his bones. Both players must start with a ribcage, otherwise they have to rattle all the bones again in their next turn.
Each play picks up the left bones and the die and rolls them together. If a missing part is shown on the die, it can be added to the skeleton. But there is also the colour changing side and the scatter side. Both mean the player has to start again. If the opponent already has the wanted part, the active play may choose to steal it from the opponent.
The first player to finish their skeleton wins the game. So the game can be over in 2 minutes if luck is on your side.

name: Personal Space: The Archival Moon
description:
The Archival Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Archival Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 6:00-7:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Museum of All Time
Local Cuisine: Breadloafers

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

Dennis Montaggi
Gracie Sintonia
Lino Emitirlo
Sara Coestrellas
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Konario
description:
Train your brain with KONARIO! A super fun game for the whole family. Collect pairs with the help of taste, smell, touch, sight and hearing. When all the senses are activated at once, things happen in the brain.

When it's your turn, take a cube and turn it over. Taste, smell, look, feel or listen depending on the type of cube it is. It is important to get pairs together with two identical cubes. If you get a pair, it's your turn again, otherwise the turn goes to the next player. The one who has the most pairs when the cubes on the table are finished wins.

—user summary

name: Micro Monster Factory
description:
You are one of two mad scientists who started a lab in the sewers. Send your Minion to buy body parts and do the dastardly deed to create the most hideously cute monster your evil genius mind comes up with.

Use your Minion to buy Monster parts by moving to adjacent spaces on the parts shop and paying for that part using your funds. Bribe, take advantage and create a Monster on the action space on the parts shop. Use your Monster's ability to manipulate part's prices.
The game ends when a player creates 4 Monsters, each player will then reveal their agenda to score points. Players will also receive bonus points for completing objectives.

Originally made for the 2021 1-card contest. The players share 1 card in which they get to fill in their monster parts, creations and abilities.
mechanics: Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Worker Placement

name: Gefährliche Rätsel: Sherlock in Not
description:
Are you brave enough to face the dangerous puzzles? For these brain teasers you not only need brains, but also nerves made of steel. The dangerous puzzles are varied brain teasers in a total of 55 nerve-wracking bites.

The famous master detective Sherlock Holmes is in danger! His opponent Professor Moriarty has prepared 55 diabolical tests for him - should Holmes fail, nothing less than his life is at stake. This puzzle box will make all Sherlock fans sweat.
Moriarty's disturbing words are as follows: “I hereby challenge you, Holmes! Get hold of me, otherwise I'll scare the world. And rest assured: every time you fail, there are consequences! ”So slip into the role of the ingenious master detective and try to solve the tricky puzzles to save your skin. Sounds like an escape game? It is! The puzzles are at least as exciting, but not quite as time-consuming as an entire escape room game. The perfect pastime for everyone who doesn't have time for an entire escape game.

Players pick a card, and read question, you must answer it correctly or sit out the next round. This is an escape room game type game and is governed by time. The person that answers the most questions right is the winner in 30-60 minutes.

name: Perfect Holiday
description:
Come along and enjoy the fun! In Perfect Holiday you and your family are on vacation and you compete against other players to have the best time ever. Set your goals, buy tickets, visit locations, and plan your trip around this perfect resort island! Earn points by carrying out activities and by completing tours in 6 rounds.

In this set collection game, you try to collect as many activity cards as possible. You score bonus points for activities in the same colour, and you can also score points for making selfies, but only if you have made a selfie in at least four locations. Every round you have 5 action points you can use to:
1. travel between locations;
2. do a one-day activity;
3. start a multiple day activity;
4. completing a multiple day activity;
5. taking a selfie.

Some activities cost money, which you can get at the hotel. But beware, there are also event cards that can ruin your plans: it might be too hot to do everything you planned, or it is raining cats and dogs and you have to stay inside.

The player who scores the most points wins the game.

name: Zabójczo wciągające: Śledztwo
description:
Zabójczo wciągające: Śledztwo is a party card game in which you can witness, compose a crime story or solve puzzles as part of the investigative team! Each role is equally important and each role is guaranteed to be fun! Feel the atmosphere and emotions of criminal puzzles while playing with your friends. Who will find the right track first, solve the mystery and be the winner?

The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

The game ends when one of the players correctly guesses the story made up by the one who draw the card.


Śledztwo to towarzyska gra karciana, w której możesz być świadkiem, układać historię zbrodni lub rozwiązywać zagadki jako członek zespołu śledczych! Każda rola jest równie ważna i każda gwarantuje świetną zabawę! Poczuj klimat i emocje kryminalnych zagadek podczas rozgrywek ze znajomymi. Kto pierwszy wpadnie na prawidłowy trop, rozwiąże zagadkę i okaże się zwycięzcą?Gracze muszą odgadnąć zbrodnię, pytając, zgadując i bawiąc się.

Gra kończy się, gdy jeden z graczy poprawnie odgadnie historię wymyśloną przez tego, który dobrał kartę.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: D-Spirits Trading Card Game
description:
D-Spirits is a fast paced Trading Card Game. It is designed to mitigate the luck you find in TCGs. The game feature 2 deck, allowing you to draw the type of card you really need at any given moment during the game.

Each of the 160 original spirits have game-bending effects that make each game different.

Taking inspiration from other "monster catcher" card games, players (or "D-Tectives" as they are called) take turn summoning "D-Spirits" to playing field. The D-Spirits can then attack on another or their opponent, to inflict damage.

Uniquely, each D-Spirit, has an SP value & when a player's D-Spirit is defeated, that player loses that much SP.
Each player starts with 5000 SP & the goal is to reduce your opponent's SP to 0.

name: Charadspelet för barn
description:
Charadspelet för barn is a charade game for kids. Each round one player draw one orange and one purple card from the two decks. On each card there is a picture. On the orange cards there is characters, eg ghost, trumpet player, waiter. On the purple card there is a chore, eg brush teeth, waves, is at the cinema. The player will try to show with movements what the pictures show. The other players try to guess. The player that first guess the whole solution will roll the number die and do cross off that many stars on their board. So does also the player that did the charade. If no one guessed right before the hourglass is empty no star are crossed over. The turn gets clockwise on to the next player.

The first player to cross off the last space on their board is the winner.

If your playing with older kids there is also three words on the cards that can be used instead. To determine which words to use there is two dice to roll.
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Communication Limits, Dice Rolling

name: Tribal
description:
Tribal is inspired by Patience, but it's not a solo game! Observation and strategy are key elements.
Follow the wise African's advice: "Ask your ennemi for advice and do the opposite! "

Just like Patience, make cards piles by alternating colors to complete your sacred piles (from 1 to 9). You play with your cards as well as with your opponent's: steal theirs or give them some to take the advantage and slow them down.

The first one to complete their 4 sacred piles wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This game is very similar to what is called "Zankpatiencen" (quarrel patiences) in German Patience rulebooks or to Russian Bank.

name: AdvenTourist
description:
In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like entertainment, gastronomy) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

name: Can Can Coming!
description:
In the animal world, canned food is an unprecedented boom! In Can Can Coming!, you become the president of a canned food manufacturer and aim to announce an attractive product line-up with the help of animals. However, the co-operation of other companies is essential for product development. Control the market by announcing collaborative products that benefit each other (or only you), gain popularity, and aim to be company of the year.

During the game, you play cards between players, with those players sharing the benefits of a card. Some cards activate various effects when put in play; others bonuses when calculating scores.

name: Flykten från spökslottet
description:
Hide in a mystic castle and try to avoid all ghosts, who has decided to find all intruders.

In this ghostly adventure family game, one of the players (the intruder) hide somewhere in the castle... the other players are the ghosts who tries to locate the intruder.
All players can gather points up to the very end... to find out who won.

The Intruder puts on the cardboard glasses, so that the other players can't see where the intruder's eyes are looking. He chooses one field inside the castle and one on the graveyard... and writes it down. The hour glass is activated, and the ghosts need to find the intruder.
Ghosts use "Castle cards", asking the intruder: "are you somewhere in this region?".
While it goes on, it is about collecting points - either for not being found, or for "being close".

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Szmugler
description:
At the beginning of the game, place the Smuggler token in the center of the board. It is a neutral token. If he takes a wound from any source, he is killed.

After the Battle (after all effects have been resolved), if a player has a unit linked to a Smuggler tile, he may shuffle an Instant tile from any opponent's tile discard pile into his token pile.

Note: When playing with the Smuggler, it is advised that players pick up tokens from a single pile or piles arranged in draw order, so as not to affect the drawing of a tile with a different back.

This mini-expansion was distributed in a welcome bag for the participants of Portalcon 23, which took place at the Silesian Stadium in Chorzów.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Timeline：中国近现代史篇 (Timeline: China Modern History)
description:
Timeline series aims to combine playing and learning together.

Timeline: China Modern History is a card game. Each card depicts an invention on both sides, with the year in which that invention was created on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

Note: This game can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

—description from the publisher

name: Blok Ekipa: Szacun na rejonie
description:
There are five participants in the game Blok Ekipa: Szacun na rejonie. The game consists of as many rounds as there are players, and each round is divided into 4 stages:


Stage 1: Robbing LosersThe game begins by showing the Loser from the deck. Then we use Losers Detectors. Whoever sees Loser on it shouts "Loser" and takes the card. This is how you get your first Respects, which determine your victory.


Stage 2: Fighting for goodsThe first 4 cards from the Goods deck are revealed and trade takes place. If one player is interested in the purchase - he pays the fee and takes the "shopping" (not necessarily legal). If there are more Participants willing, the "Robbing Losers" takes place again, but only with the use of the Losers Detectors. Whoever wins gets the "stuff". However, you should beware of the Ginger Snitch hidden in the cards. He will quickly inform the City Guard about shady business and bring inspection...


Stage 3: InspectionThis is where a participant playing the City Guard comes into action. It may select a delinquent to be inspected and reviewed. If the participant does not have anything suspicious on him, compensation is paid and the contents of the pocket are cashed. However, if he has a shady product, the City Guard confiscates it and returns it to the owner without any profit. Of course, you can try to bribe uniformed officers with a bribe, but they don't have to agree to it!


Stage 4: TradeNow it's time to count profits and exchange cash for Respects at the rate of 1 PLN = 1 Respect. As we know, their number will determine the victory. After all transactions are closed, the roles are switched: all characters move one player further (including the City Guard).

The cycle repeats for as many rounds as there are players (5 pawns are available). After the rounds are over, the exchange takes place and all accumulated Respects are counted. Who has the most? Who really "rules the area"? Just open the box to find out.

name: Twister Air
description:
No mat? That's right! Take moves from the mat to the screen with the Twister Air game! In this app-enabled Twister game, the party moves onto a player's smart device. This fun party game includes 8 colorful Twister Air bands and a device stand that works for any smartphone or tablet. To get started, download the Twister Air app and set a smart device in the included stand. Then players put the bands on their wrists and ankles, and they're ready for action! As the music plays, players move their body to match their bands to the colored spots on screen. Reach, swipe, clap, and strike crazy poses. The more spots hit, the higher the score. Earn the most points to win! Or play solo and try to beat a past record.

MATCH BANDS TO SPOTS ON SCREEN: Players reach, clap, swipe, and pose to the beat as they scramble to match their wrist and ankle bands to the colored spots on screen. Earn points for every spot hit

RACK UP POINTS AND WIN: Choose from VS., Teams, and Solo modes. Compete against a friend or team in a shared screen face-off—the side with the most points wins! Or play solo and try to beat a personal best

8 COLORFUL BANDS AND DEVICE STAND: Includes 2 sets of 4 stretchy, one-size-fits-all Twister Air bands for ankles and wrists, plus an adjustable stand that holds a smart device during play

Contents
4 Twister Air Wrist Bands
4 Twister Air Ankle Bands
Device Stand with clip, base, and post
Game Rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Score-and-Reset Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Friends: Guess the card
description: A guessing game with funny themes. Try to guess the next card you’ll draw, immerse yourself in the world of Friends, with this game that uses all the codes of the series: humor, fun and its little crazyside.

name: 三つ星動物園 (Three Star Zoo)
description:
In Three Star Zoo, you place animals in cages from 1 to 12, roll the dice, and if your animal is in the cage with the correct number of stars, you can get coins or take coins from other players depending on the effect. If you get coins, you can expand your zoo by placing new animals, and finally, the person who collects three "stars," a sign of excellence, will win the "three-star" zoo.

—user summary

name: Silent Night, Deadly Night: The Game
description:
Based on the classic 1984 horror film Silent Night, Deadly Night.

The game takes place on a board of 6*8 squares. The killer follows a path on the board, moving every turn depending on a dice roll. Up to four players must prevent the killer from reaching the last square of the board.

The players also move depending on a dice roll, but they don't have to follow a path. Their goal is to go to specific locations in order to gear up and try to slow down the killer, until they are ready to face him.
categories: Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Puppies or Pizza
description:
The party game of impossible choices!

We've all had to choose between 2 terrible things: "Would you rather...?". But this one is full of all GREAT things. And you and your group have to vote on what you can't live without.

Puppies or Pizza can be played multiple ways, but the easiest is to draw cards, set them up on the board in a tournament-style bracket, and vote on each set until you only have 1 card left.

Simple, right? Uh...have you ever tried to decide where to eat with more than 3 people? Impossible. It's like that, only with higher stakes...

The perfect game to get to know people better, play in larger groups, or for a casual conversation night. Though we should warn you that discussions can get heated.

name: Cho-Han Trick-Taking Game
description:
Cho-Han Trick-Taking Game is a game based on Dinghan Tori-tei, a japanese gambling game that was a combination of Ding-han gambling (which was played with dice) and Toriso-tei , and it quickly took over Japan. However, as the people started gambling and stopped working, Nobunaga Oda felt a sense of crisis and issued a ban on Chohantori-tei, causing him to disappear.

Now revisited in Cho-Han Trick-Taking Game, the game was able to be revived in modern times, as it was only played for a short period of time and very little documentation remains. Everyone, please be careful not to get too absorbed in the game.

name: Election L-Game
description:
Based on his abstract L-Game, this is a themed election simulation game by the same designer, Edward de Bono, using a British general election as a model.

While the original L-Game can be played with the pieces and board which are the same dimensions as the original, this game adds descriptions and effects to the 16 board spaces which influence the standing of political parties on an included "Poll Indicator" chart.

At the end of each player's move, the uncovered spaces on the board influence the standings of the two Main Parties (players) and the non-player Other Parties. For example, if the "Diplomatic or military success" space is left uncovered then the government party gains 1% in the polls at the end of their move, while the the opposition party would lose 1%.

Unlike the original L-Game, this version does not end if a player is unable to make a move. Instead the game ends after a time limit, fixed number of turns or if the "Snap election" space is left uncovered the active player chooses to end the game. At this point the support for the non-player Other Parties is subtracted from that of the leading Main Party to determine the winner.

name: Captain Wonder Cape
description:
What would the world be without toilet paper ?! After all, even superheroes have to go to the bathroom! Of course, it can happen that the paper gets tangled in your own superhero costume. Suddenly your fluttering cape is getting longer, but unfortunately it is no longer completely pure.

In Captain Wonder Cape, you play a dual role: As Captain Wonder Cape, each of you tries to pull the longest possible cape (i.e., strip of toilet paper) out of the box without ripping it — but you also have to give Professor P. a chance to perform dirty tricks on the strip of toilet paper.

Take on this delicate challenge, and whoever has drawn the longest toilet paper strip wins the game...and the title "Captain toilet brush".

—description from the publisher

name: SuperMarket Psycho
description:
Supermarket Psycho confronts you with the real life horror of supermarket stress. Will you be the first to snap and - to the other player’s amusement - go crazy. And will you make them pay in the ensuing food fight?

A cardgame of sorts.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Memory

name: Euro Disneyland
description:
Object of the game:
To collect four different souvenirs from your day at Eurodisneyland Park and be the first player to join Mickey's Victory Parade on Main Street.
The souvenirs include a pair of Mickey Mouse ears, balloons, a teddy bear and a souvenir shopping bag.
The souvenirs you collect will fit onto your playing piece.
You can collect them in any order, but you must collect the souvenir shopping bag first.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Milton the Monster
description: Simple children's game based on the TV cartoon. Spin-and-move two pieces across the board and be the first to get both tokens to Horror Hill. Sabotage your friends along the way by landing on the same space as them and sending them backwards. But be careful, sometimes sending someone backwards can come back to bite you.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Tumble Bumble Game
description:
"THEY TUMBLE DOWN, IT'S A FUNNY SIGHT
TRYING TO FIND THE HOLE THAT'S RIGHT!"

From the box:

The Bumbles tumble down the slides onto the rink. Over and over they go ... all going for the one open hole in the center. PLOPP!! You land in the hole and score! Beware of the side holes, though, because if you land in them, you'll lose points. First player to get a score of (10) wins this hilarious game!

The 13" plastic circular gameboard has a small knob at the center which is attached to an incomplete platform that can rotate beneath the playing surface. There are four symmetrically positioned large holes in the central area of the playing surface; the underlying platform prevents any more than one of these from being open at any particular time. There are four similarly sized holes towards the perimeter of the rink. In each quadrant around the perimeter of the board there is an area for scoring and a small hole to secure individual bumble slides.

Players take turns to spin the platform. When the platform is spun, players attempt to land their bumble in the hole. Bumbles are introduced into the rink from player's slides. If a bumble successfully finds a central hole that is open, that player scores a point for the round. Any bumbles landing in the holes located near the perimeter of the rink lose a point for their player.

The first player to reach ten points is the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Paul de Leeuw Onvoorspelbaar
description:
In this partygame, the players have to collect ball-shaped croquettes. A typical Dutch snack. Players can earn them by Singing, guessing lyrics, drawing and acting.
Every turn the players can answer the question and win a 'bitterbal.' When a player has 5 ball-shaped croquettes, he/she trades them for a noodle snack. The noodle snacks can't be taken away by the other players.
The player who reaches the middle of the board and has the most noodle snacks and ball-shaped croquettes wins the game.

It's from the Dutch TV host: Paul de Leeuw
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Flowers
description:
Create your own flowerbed, there are reds, yellows, whites and blues! But watch out for goats, lawnmowers, tornadoes ... and the wickedness of your opponents!
The aim of the game is to win the game by planting 6 flowers of the same color first in your flowerbed.

PREPARATION and VICTORY
Shuffle the deck and place it face down in the center of the table.
During the game, the discard pile (cards played) and the market area will be placed on the sides of the deck
(where you will find the flowers you have caught and which cannot be used in your flower bed).
The youngest player starts the game by drawing the top card.
The game ends when a player completes his flowerbed with six FLOWERS of the same color. If there are no more cards to draw: take all the cards from the discards, from the market and from ALL the warehouses, mix them and continue the game, repeat this operation until there is a winner.

Each player during his turn can only perform ONE action from the following:

- Draw a card from the deck showing it to everyone, if the card is the first flower to be drawn, it must be placed in front of it, forming its own flowerbed, otherwise if the flower is of a different color from the one planted in its row, it must be positioned in the market area.
If you lose one or all the flowers in your flowerbed, due to GOAT or LAWNMOWER cards, you can continue with different flowers from the previous one, by fishing or buying it on the market at the cost of 3 COINS.
The other Moneta, Lawnmower and Goat cards must be placed next to your flowerbed to form a row that we will call the warehouse, and played whenever you want, in a subsequent turn, when you decide not to draw a card.
If you draw a TORNADO card it must be played immediately.

- Use a card from your warehouse: GOAT or GRASS CUTTER to eat flowers from your opponents or COINS to buy a FLOWER card from the market.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading

name: Back to the Future: Card Game
description:
Join forces to get the Delorean to 88MPH and go back to the future! Clear all the Paradoxes by using Flux Energy. The problem is, all players are playing from the future and cannot communicate, you can only send signals!

Players need to work together to clear the Paradoxes by laying Flux Energy cards with different values to fulfill each Paradox objective, clearing it from the time continuum.

Each Paradox has a unique problem that must be fixed. Decode the paradox card and find out how to solve them. Once the requirements of the Paradox are met the Delorean is able to move to that space.

You must lay a card on your turn. You can play a card even if it does not help to fix a Paradox or if you cannot go or choose not to go you can reveal the next Paradox in the line. However this causes another Paradox to appear in the future!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Matching, Open Drafting

name: Super Bowl
description: An American Football simulation.

name: Verbatim
description:
From the back of the box:

Verbatim gives new meaning to word games. It's a classic spelling game with a big difference. The difference is you only have one each of the 26 letters of the alphabet to work with. Each player takes a turn and tries to complete a word of five letters or more by adding a new letter to the letters already on the board. Complete the word and score. Now you are eligible for the Bonus Round: Spell as many new words as you can in 60 seconds using only the letters of the accepted word and increase your score.

Contains:

One classically designed game board
26 letter cubes
One letter rack
One-minute timer
Instructions

name: Kalevi kaardimängud
description:
Kalev's cardgames

Contents:
72 cards numbered with 1-20 + 2 bonus cards
40 candies

Players must collect candies and for every candy they have to give one or several cards, so that the number of the card or the sum or subtraction of cards numbers gives you the sequential number of the candy.
(For example for the first candy player may play card "1" or cards "8"-"7"=1 or cards "4"+"13"-"10"-"6"=1)
In his turn player may do as many moves as many cards he has.
There are different gamevariants with and without candies.

name: Slow As a Sloth
description:
Slow and steady wins the race in Slow As A Sloth – the fun-packed quiz game where the aim is to be the slowest of them all!

A great family game where its the lowest and the slowest that wins the prize, players have to pick the answers with the lowest values to avoid accumulating points.

Designed for 2 or more players, Slow As A Sloth features 50 question cards where the answers are all designated numbers, and players should aim to accumulate the lowest scores possible to win the game. The game set includes 6 sloths to be used as player markers plus a felt game board to mark your (slow!) progress.

—description from the publishers

name: Disney Frozen: Snow Adventure
description:
In the kingdom Arendelle live two princesses: Elsa and Anna. The older princess Elsa has the power to rule over snow and ice. When people learn about her unusual gift, they consider her a witch. So Elsa decides to run away, causing an eternal winter. Anna embarks on a great search for her sister. She is accompanied by Kristoff, who knows all the secrets of the mountain trails, his loyal reindeer Sven, and the funny snowman Olaf. Will they reach the ice castle of Elsa, or will the harsh winter thwart their plans?

Each player chooses one of the characters - Anna, Kristoff, Sven or Olaf. They all have various special abilities like doubling the pips on the die or adding an additional pip to the die, or rerolling a die.
There are two parts to this board game. First, you roll a die and climb through the icy mountains to reach the rushing river. On the way, you must deal with the river's strong current, icy gales and an avalanche! Then to cross the river, you and the other players must collect five ice tokens. If you fail to do that, you all loose and the winter wins.
The second part is where you must continue on your own. Tell a short story, sing a song or draw a character to reach the castle and win the game!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Variable Player Powers

name: Collision!
description: Race your cars around a track by rolling the dice and moving the number rolled. If you are passing an opponents car and have rolled doubles, your opponents car gets bumped of the track and is out of the game. The object is to be the last person with at least one car still on the track.

name: Timon
description:
Timon - the bewitched steering wheel - is a simple dice game in which players try to capture a counter from each opponent to win the game. This is done by moving your opponents' pieces across the spokes of a nautical wheel to a capture spot on your "own" spoke. Movement is determined by rolling 2 dice, one to determine which color can be moved, the other for range. Rolling your own color or the neutral white allows you can move any piece of your opponents. The rules include a variation that permits blocking by stacking pieces on top of each other, hiding the pieces underneath.

A pleasant and simple dice game entry in the Edition Perlhuhn range, played on an interesting and atmospheric board with luck being a major factor.

1 year later described in Reinhold Wittig's SPIELECOLLECTION No. 1 Spiele zur Schatzinsel (1988)
as "Das verflixte Steuerrad".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Celebrity Edition – Bite-Size
description:
An expansion for Trivial Pursuit with 600 new questions about celebrities. Also playable without the game board, using the special starred dice included in the box.


This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: World War Z: Card Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

A zombie outbreak has gripped the entire world. In World War Z: Card Game you want to be the first to secure your home continent against the zombie threat by using weapons and soldiers, including special Elite Forces. Draw cards from the deck to defend your continent with these allies, or with sets of weapon cards, including vicious axes, crowbars, and lobos. Use powerful Raging Zombies to prevent your opponents from reaching their goal. Survive the pandemic and reclaim your continent from the Zs to win the game!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies

name: Trimau: Grand Tour
description:
Trimau: Grand Tour is a game for 2–6 players.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

On your turn, play a card that matches the current card, or draw a card, and play that one if you can or want to.

When playing a card you can either play “Single Play”, by playing a card where the marked of the three lanes matches the current card. Then you move the marker if possible.

After a Single Play, you can if you wish “Attack”. If the next player cannot play, you may take another turn. If he can, you must draw 2 cards.

Or you can play “Double Play”, by playing a card where the two unmarked lanes match the current cards, then moving the marker and take another turn.

—description from the designer

name: Sombrero!
description:
Sombrero! is a skill party game in which you must flip and catch the spinning sombrero. Compete against your opponents with fun and entertaining challenges. The Sombrero! move : Place your sombrero (a plastic disc) on the edge of a table. Flip your sombrero into the air with the hand of your choice. Try to catch your sombrero while it’s spinning in the air. Put your sombrero back on the table and read the word written out loud to complete your move.
16 different challenges propose to play in 1 v. 1, 2 v. 2 or all-together.

name: Karen
description:
In Karen, you attempt to fool others into thinking that your review is an actual one-star review.

In more detail, each round one player takes the role of host and reads one of three types of review cards: What's Being Reviewed, Fill in the Blanks, or Write the Review. The host reads out the review or the partial review or the product to be reviewed, then they write the product, the missing words, or the review on a sheet of paper, while everyone else makes up a product, missing words, or review that sounds plausible.

The host then reads out the all the written answers, and whoever votes for the real answer scores a point, while whoever's fake answer receives a vote also scores a point. For every five points, you lose one of your stars, and whoever is first reduced from five stars to one star wins.

name: Inga
description:
You select a party from amongst 50 characters. The object is to get 10 life-strength chips before the other players. You need a mix of characters, as certain human characters cannot go out at night, and vampire players cannot go out during the day.

The eighth in Grapac Japan's series of games under the label "Aeronaut". They are meant to be very fast playing (around 15-30 minutes). They all come in a file-type holder, with the inside of the file being the game board, and all of the components attached to the ring-binder in bags and pouches.

name: T.E.G. de los Negocios
description: A new version of T.E.G. (a popular game in Argentina, similar to Risk), but instead of armies you fight with companies. Each of the 4 to 8 players has a secret objective (destroy another player, occupy certain countries, etc.) or the common objective of occupy 30 countries. The number of dice rolled to attack depends on the number of countries that share a resource type (electronics, government, natural resources, etc.) and not the number of armies in the country. The game can be won in 4 different ways and the length is variable. It also has new elements such as financial market, players tables, consolidation of power´s cards and power factors icons.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling, Negotiation

name: The M.U.S.C.L.E. Mega-Match Game
description:
Have your M.U.S.C.L.E. characters battle against each other.
M.U.S.C.L.E Stands for "Millions of Unusually Small Creatures Lurking Everywhere."

A battle arena for your Muscles, with ten muscles!
Objective: Knock out all your opponent's muscles.

Playing the Game
1. Each player spins to see who goes first. The player who spins the higher number goes first.
2. Players take turns spinning the spinner and moving their M.U.S.C.L.E. creatures.
3. On each turn, a player spins the spinner, and them moves 1 or more of his creatures the same total number of spaces as the number just spun. A player can divide up his total move among as many creatures as he likes.
4. A player can move his creatures forward, backward, sideways, or diagonally in any combination.
5. A player can have up to 2 creatures on the same space at one time. You can move through a space with 2 of your creatures on it, but you can't stop there.

COMBAT
1. When you move one (or two) of you creatures onto a space occupied by one (or two) of your opponent's creatures, you begin a Combat.
2. During Combat, each player in turn spins the spinner once for each creature he/she has in battle.
3. After both players have spun, the one with the most "M's" wins the Combat and gets to knock over 1 or 2 of the opposing creatures.
4. Once knocked over, the defeated creatures are out of the game. Players leave defeated creatures lying on the arena, but those creatures are not counted as occupying space, and may be moved around as necessary to make room for more Combat.
5. If both players spin the same number of "M's," the battle is a tie and will continue after the player takes his/her turn moving.
6. Once each player has had one chance to do battle on every space where his/her creatures are in Combat, it becomes the next player's turn to move. This player takes his/her turn moving even if there was a tie in the battle or if both players still have creatures standing on the same space after the battle.
7. Play continues for the rest of the game with one player taking a turn moving, then a Combat round (if there are any Combat situations on the board), then the other player takes his/her turn moving, and so on.
8. You can be involved in any number of Combats at one time.
9. The last player with one or more M.U.S.C.L.E. creatures left standing wins the game!

There are stickers! You get a whole sheet of stickers with which you can decorate your arena as well as your muscles.

name: Clash
description: You have 7 pieces with digits from 1 to 7. Try to win the opponents "7." You do this by clashing (4 playing pieces meet at a corner). The higher sum of digits there wins. The winner can move one of the digits from the opponent to another place on the board. Some obstacles on the board make it difficult to move your pieces.
publishers: Croner, Peter Pan Playthings, Playtoy Industries, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Secret Agenda
description: Each player takes a card putting on his forehead, which dictates a secret agenda such as 'insult me!' or 'talk dirty to me!' or 'keep interrupting me!' or 'ask me really personal questions!'. They will then talk on a given topic like shopping or my favorite food, and try to act out the agendas of their partners to them. Points are given to whoever manages to guess their hidden agendas correctly.

name: Sabrina the Teenage Witch
description: To win, be the first player to collect the number of points you need to complete your personal "read me" profile. How? Move around the board through Sabrina's school and her house, collecting points from board spaces, the book cards, and by performing Sabrina's magic.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Via Bavaria
description: Walk along the road with other Bavarians and try to be the first to complete ten goals. The other players will surely try to stop you as soon as they can...

name: All Change
description:
From Box Lid: Catch the train at any station and get two passengers in a carriage - but beware! The train moves and the guard may shout All Change!
A captivating game full of fun and elementary strategy for Ages 6 and up

name: The Mystery of the Scream
description:
This game is positioned as a family game it allows players to portray police detectives investigating the robbery or thieves who steal art. The game includes 36 cards that teach the players about different artwork.

The game is inspired by the theft of Munch's Scream, because of this the game has stirred some controversy

name: Captain Scarlet Game
description:
Waddington's Captain Scarlet Game - The fight with the Mysterons.

Based on Gerry Anderson's TV series "Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons".
Licensed by Century 21 Merchandising Ltd.

Important people in Europe, as in the rest of the world, are under the constant threat of the Mysterons. A Conference has been called - to take place on the southern border of Yugoslavia - to which Heads of Government must be brought from four Regional Bases. Spectrum Patrol Cars, under the command of Captain Scarlet, Captain Blue, Captain Ochre and Lt. Green are assigned to this task.

After completing this assignment... the Conference decides to send new and detailed defence plans to places all over the Continent. It will require several separate journeys and each one must end at Durness, Scotland... where a plane waits to take information to Cloudbase.
It is the duty of Captain Scarlet and his colleagues to take a convoy along this route and get at least one Patrol Car through to Durness. The Mysterons, will of course, try to destroy the plans.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pokémon Champion Island DVD Board Game
description:
From the publisher:

Test your wits in fast-paced Pokemon trivia games that will challenge even the most expert Trainers. Collect wild Pokemon, train with renowned professors and battle your way through the Academies of Kanto, Johto and Hoenn. The 3D island is teeming with Pokemon encounters, challenging puzzles and mini-games. Head-to-head competition, on-screen scoring and collectible Pokemon disks make for an adventure you won't soon forget!

Pokémon Champion Island DVD Board Game Includes:

Champion Island game board
DVD with game content
4 player pawns
60 (standard edition) or 100 (special edition) wild Pokemon disks with storage pouch
13 trained Pokemon disks
12 Academy crests
1 movement die
categories: Fantasy, Memory, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: NBAopoly
description:
NBAopoly is a Monopoly variant with a basketball theme. Players buy NBA franchises, unlike in Monopoly, you do not have to land on a team square to purchase it. Instead of paying in play money when landing on an opponents property square, you pay in points. If you land on a square that an opponent has placed in Receivership (similar to Mortgage in Monopoly) you can claim the property for free. The major difference from Monopoly is that the game has a strict time limit of 48 minutes at which point the game ends immediately and the player with the most points is the winner.

This game was an officially licensed product of the NBA.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: NFL American Football Card Game
description:
From the back of the box

American Football is one if Britain's fastest growing televised sports. Now you can bring all the razzmatazz and excitement of the NFL into your own front room - without the bruises.

Players aim to get rid of all their cards - but watch out, just as you are about to play the winning card there may be an interception.'

Starting with a first down card players take it in turns to try and play cards in sequence (1st down, 20 yard, 10 yard, Touchdown or 1st down, 40 yard, 50 yard punt). They may either play a sequential card featuring the team of the card before it or play another 1st down card featuring a different team. If a player cannot go they must exchange one card with the draw pile. Interception cards can be used as wild cards. The first person to play all their cards wins.

These jumbo cards feature the official illustrations representing five of the most famous teams from the football league in the 1980's: The Chicago Bears, The Washington Redskins, The Miami Dolphins, The Dallas Cowboys and The Pittsburgh Steelers.

name: Bio-Trio
description: Rows of three fruits are the aim of the game! Strawberries, grapes and pears are depicted either in a square, a circle or a triangle in yellow, blue or red. The tiles are heaped face-down and each player draws three tiles. In your turn you place one of your tiles on the board to complete a row of three either of the same fruit or the same color or the same background shape. Each completed row of three earns you a chip, and of course you can complete more than one row with one tile and use rows already placed as part of a new row. When all spaces on the board are filled you win with most chips.

name: Spirelli
description:
Card game from the "Dubbel en Dwars" series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides!

In Spirelli, you try to identify the colour of the wanted spirelli as soon as possible.

Two cards are visible: one card showing 'spirelli' in eight different colours, and another one telling you which 'spirelli' you should be looking for: the second from the bottom, the fourth from the top, etc. The first player that comes up with the correct color keeps the spirelli card.

When the stack of cards runs out, the player with the most cards wins the game.

name: "Not Another One!"
description:
“Not Another One!” is a light print and play dice game where all players use the same dice rolls and same grids.

On a turn, roll the single dice and write the result into your grid. You have to roll the dice 9 times in order to fill the grid arranging the numbers so that, when added together in vertical and horizontal lines, you match the target numbers in the circles.
If you’re successful you get 5 minus points, but if your sum stands above or below the target number then you receive penalty points.

The player who has the least amount of points after three rounds is the winner!

All you need to play is:
x1 dice
Print out of the board for each player
Pen or Pencil

name: Guinness World Records: Challenges
description: In Guinness World Records Challenges, you can test both your knowledge of the Guinness World Records as well as the skill of your fellow players by challenging them to physical tests.

name: If you had to...
description: Convince the judge your card is the worst and win a point.

name: Odd Ball
description:
Object: Be the first player to collect, then discard seven cards of the same color suit. Score points for each round that you play.

Another rummy game from Awesome Games. On the roll of an odd number, players can trade their cards in the hopes of collecting seven cards of the same color. Specialty cards can help you, hurt your opponents, and even cause them to miss a turn. First to collect and discard a set of seven gets the chance to roll two dice to determine their score for the round. All other players roll one die. First player to 25 points wins.

The Play: Roll the dice on your turn. Roll odd and continue play...roll even and lose your turn. Duels develop as players frantically try to roll odd numbers to gain control. Stun your opponents with action cards, force them to drop cards that you may need or take them all by swapping your hand for theirs! Everyone scores points in a round. Score 25 or more to win. You can lose rounds and still win the game!

It's so odd...it's got to be Odd Ball!

name: Chug-A-Lug
description:
OBJECT OF THE GAME:
CHUG-A-LUG is an exciting adult game of skill and fortune for two to six players. CHUG-A-LUG tests your drinking skill as well as your ability to cope with unusual and hilarious situations.

name: Possumopoly: A Small Capital Game
description:
A Monopoly knock off based on the TV show "THE RED GREEN SHOW".

The player tokens are little outboard boats the houses and hotels have been replaced with Duct Tape and outhouses.

A nice knock off with the possum lodge theme.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Snipe It
description:
From the publisher:

Quick, can you name a flavor of ice cream? Vanilla, chocolate, strawberry... you know tons of answers but can you be the last person to buzz in with a correct answer before the timer runs out? This game turns the concept of "sniping" a bid on eBay into the hottest new game around. With hundreds of questions and a random timer that changes every round, the fun will never stop with Snipe It! For 2 to 4 players Ages 8 and up

name: Boolean
description:
Boolean is an abstract strategy game that uses the concepts of Boolean Logic to play. At first created as a learning tool by College Professor Edu Jacober, Boolean was published in 2011 by Ceilikan Jogos. It is now out of print.

Boolean is actually a game system and comes with two distinct sets of rules. The board represent a logic circuit with boolean operations that can be changed by playing cards on the game board.

Basic rules: Players are either black or white (0 or 1) and, by setting the logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: a) buy a card, b)play a card. Circuit inputs are driven by a FIFO line

Advanced rules: Players are also either black or white and, by setting logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: A) buy a card, b) play a card, c) feed a free input with a piece from your score track. Circuit inputs are copied from gameboard latches existent on more valuable locations in the gameboard.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Знаменитость
description:
"Znamenitost" means Celebrity in Russian. It's a quiz game with a unique mechanic that provides infinite questions, and you don't need a game master to play it.

There are 4 different kinds of decks (24 cards per deck, 96 total).
1. Facts: each card represents a fact from a biography (for example, "She wrote a book", "Something is named after her", "She was imprisoned", etc.).
2. Professions, such as "politician", "actor", "soldier", etc.
3. Alphabet: each card is a letter, which should be the first letter of someone's name, surname, pseudonym, or nick name.
4. Countries, such as "USA", "Germany", or "Russia".

Each round one of the players chooses a deck, reveals the top card and reads its text aloud. Then everybody tries to name a famous person that matches the task of the card. The fastest player reveals the top card of one of the remaining decks, and now the players try to name the person who matches two criteria, and so on.

For example, if the cards "C" and "She wrote a book" were revealed, it's possible to name Julius Caesar, Winston Churchill, Clive Barker, or any other person with the first "C" in his/her name (or surname, or nickname) and known as an author. If nobody could name a person after the next card was revealed, than the player who had correctly named the previous person wins a round. You cannot reveal more than 4 cards (one per deck): if someone has managed to name a person with 4 cards, he wins that round.

The game is played till one of the decks is depleted.

Contents:
96 cards (24 per deck)
2 blank cards for your own tasks
rules

name: Would You Rather Picture Card Game
description: A card-based version of the classic game. Form a custom "would you rather" question by pairing up two illustrated dilemma cards from your hand. Guess how your opponent will answer your custom question and, if you're right, you'll score a point. The first player to five points wins.

name: Last Man Standing
description:
Each player chooses one of eight characters that spoof popular spy/action-movie characters or actors: James Blonde, Emma Shell, Austin Flowers, Indiana Smith, Jackie Chang, Dirty Larry, Shift, or Arnold Weissenmeiner. They wander around a sort of super-generic indoor area with corridors, rooms, and safes (somebody's HQ? no villains are in evidence), trying to wipe each other out with their character abilities and the weapons and specials they find in the safes. Obviously enough, the last man (or woman, or team) standing wins. Reminiscent of "Frag," but with more complicated mechanisms.

The modular boards are square grids on the same scale as most of Jolly Roger's other games; in fact, the boards for "Orcs at the Gates" and "Maul of America" can be used with this game.

Approximate playing time is totally arbitrary; it will vary depending on the number of players, the size of the playing area, and so forth. Two hours at least matches the standard length of Jolly Roger's timed games.

Online Play


Ludoholic (no longer available)
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Relic Raiders: Treasure of the Lost Pyramid
description: An innovative 3-D pop-up game (no assembly required), in which each player has to discover what the treasure at the top of the pyramid is. Players can actually physically move the pathways on the 3-D game board to either improve their own route or hinder their opponents' route.
publishers: Basic Concepts, Crown & Andrews Ltd., Giochi Preziosi

name: Illegal
description: An ironic card game themed on making as much cash any way possible. The box has text in German, English & French, but only contained rules in German.

name: Kipin Kapin Kurre
description: Each player has a squirrel with a wheelbarrow, trying to get to the island and pick up nuts that match his cards. By rolling a die, players move their squirrels and also the bridges leading to the island. When a squirrel reaches the island, it gets to pick up nuts from the tree. After picking up a maximum of two nuts the squirrel has to run back home to store the nuts. First player to collect five nuts that match his cards wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der Weg zum Erfolg
description:
Loriot was a cartoonist called Bernhard Victor (Vicco) Christoph Carl von Bülow (www.loriot.de/) and this game published by ASS features his name and cartoon prominently on the box cover, with the title only in small print below.

The game (The Way To Success) has a simple progression up the pyramid of business to the top. Players roll dice, draw event cards and try to knock each other off the pile. A poor variant on Malefiz and evidently an exercise in promotion for Loriot.

name: Cars: Tractor Tipping Game
description:
From the Manufacturer:
The Disney/Pixar movie, CARS, introduces original and lovable characters that kids will love, and with the Tractor Tipping board game, kids can recreate the fun of a favorite pastime in Radiator Springs, tractor tipping. Players race around the pasture board scaring tractors, being careful not to wake up Frank the Combine or they will lose points and have to go back to the starting line. Each tractor tips over to reveal points beneath each of them! The first person to collect seven points wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tour of London
description: Players move around a circular track, collecting "souvenir" cards if they pass tourist attractions corresponding to the destination cards that were dealt to them at the start of the game. The winner is the first to get back to the hotel with one of each type of souvenir, but since the ones they pick up may contain duplicates, players will need to swap souvenirs with each other. If they land on suitable spaces they can do so without the other player's consent.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Run to Win
description:
The game is played in two phases: the Primary and the General Election. In the Primary a player scores five points every time one’s pawn passes the National Recognition space; ten points by landing on it.

When a player reaches a target number of votes (the number varies with the number of players), the player moves onto the General Election phase. A player wins a state’s votes by landing on the space that represents that state. A player must forfeit a state to another player when landing on a state one already owns.

The first player to score a plurality of Electoral Votes wins.

name: Vier auf einen Streich
description:
Vier aug einen streich combines elements from the card game Memory and the chip game Connect Four.

The game consists of a deck of 16 cards with various simple images, 16 chips with corresponding images, a bag and a rule sheet.

The cards are placed face-down on a table in a 4x4 grid and the chips are placed in the bag. Players take turns drawing chips out of the bag and attempt to turn over the card with the same image as indicated on the chip. If the image on the card does not match the image on the chip, the card is flipped back over and the chip is returned to the bag. If the images match, the chip is placed on the card.
