The winner is the person who places the chip on a card that creates a row horizontally, vertically or diagonally of 4 consecutive cards with chips on them.

name: Let's Make A Deal
description: Based on the game show hosted by Monty Hall, this version has a large modular stage which simulates the Doors, Curtains, and Boxes. Each player takes turns as emcee, encouraging others to take worthless items instead of prizes which are hidden from view. Whoever has the most winnings at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Modular Board, Simulation

name: The Wizard of Oz Yellow Brick Road Game
description: Players (represented by Dorothy, the Scarecrow, the Tin Man and the Cowardly Lion) move along the yellow brick road according to cards they draw. Four wishes are be collected along the way: the ruby slippers, the medal of courage, a heart and a diploma. When a player has a full set, they may reach the end and be allowed to go back to the great state of Kansas.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mobby
description:
The three small whales play in the ocean day after day. Since they all want to become big and strong they have a huge hunger, so which one of them can snatch most food cubes in the end?

This is a simple children's game where you move the whales to collect colorful food cubes.

From the back of the box:

Mobby and his friends want to become big and strong, so they're always hungry. Roll the correct colors to help the little whales get some tasty food!

Ages 3 and up

name: EmotrionsOnCards
description:
EmotrionsOnCards is a strategy card game for all ages that belongs to the Emotrions line of games, which also includes board games (soon) and digital games (in development phase). The main feature of the Emotrions line is that it introduces the issue of Emotional Intelligence into a sector traditionally focused on the development of analytical intelligence.

EmotrionsOnCards is a really entertaining and addictive game. It's also easy to learn due to its few and consistent rules. There's a conscious balance between a distillate simplicity, which makes it possible for everybody to play in a more relaxed - "light" - manner, and a depth of game which will satisfy the classic strategy game hard players.

In EmotrionsOnCards, the cards, called emotrions, represent the basic human feelings: love, hatred, joy, sadness, fury, indecision... Some emotrions score points, others take them away. And they keep intermingling in your hand, when playing each trick, and even when you win!

It is very powerful as a strategy game. The miracle lays in its innovative logic, with negative and positive playing cards.

With only 36 cards and some minimal rules you'll be able to unfold many complex and shady situations. And you can also play different games with the same set of cards, such as The Pareo Game.

Strategy, psychology and luck
EmotrionsOnCards sets off from a Standard style featuring a careful balance between Strategy, Psychology and Luck. But you may just as well alter this balance with The Winner's Options, to suit the winner of the previous hand. Thus, the most "psychological" players will prefer a more uncertain style, and the lovers of sheer strategy will demand a more analytical style. The possibility of modulating the game allows players with different profiles to enjoy, and feel the game as just right for them.

Philosophy
All the game is a carefully made metaphor on how we manage our emotions, and other people's, in everyday life. As you try to master the strategy, you'll learn that in order to win in the long run (the game), it is always necessary to consider the effects of a particular battle (stake/trick), even if it means losing it.

The ultimate goal of the game is to make us reflect on the fact that in real life there's no such thing as obviously good or bad situations, but more or less complex positions in which the thin line between success and failure relies on our managing little things. It is possible to win, even if we get a bad hand.

name: Strip Checkers
description:
A game of checkers for consulting adults. There are 12 black checkers for the man and 12 red checkers for the lady. Each checker has a small picture with a piece of clothing, and accessory, etc. When a piece is taken from the board, the corresponding article is removed from the player.

Players must get three knickers or underpants pieces to force the removal of the item. You do not have to remove an item if it is being covered by another, until you remove the covering item.

Comes with a large, fuzzy black and red checkerboard.
publishers: (Unknown), Baron/Scott, Boxer Games, Cathay, Executive Games, Matscot

name: Schützt unseren Teich!
description:
Everybody get together and help save the pond!

In this semi-cooperative, educational game, players try to save the lake from the digger.

Each player has to fill his pond with 8 animals, two of each kind. Meanwhile, the digger (consisting of 8 puzzle tiles) is approaching.

On his turn, the player has to roll a die. If he rolls one of the four animal symbols (or the shamrock as a joker), he is allowed to add the corresponding animal to his pond. If he rolls the digger symbol however, he has to add one puzzle tile to the digger.

Instead of adding an animal to the own lake, a player can put one of the 8 "stop stones" in front of the digger.

If the digger is finished before the 8 stop stones are placed, all players lose.
If the 8 stop stones are placed before the digger is finished, the game continues until one player has filled his pond with all 8 animals. The first player to fill his pond wins.

name: The Three Musketeers
description:
This game dates back to at least 1861, when it was published by John Jaques & Son as The Royal Garrison Game. It is an extension of The Siege Game, a.k.a. German Tactics which itself seems descended from Fox and Geese. In this game, 17 points of its 67-point game board are set aside as a garrison. Three officers begin play in the garrison, and fifty attackers begin play on all the remaining points of the board. Officers can move in any direction along any lines and jump over attackers to remove them from the board; attackers move only along vertical or diagonal lines towards the garrison and cannot capture officers, but instead merely try to swarm the garrison. To win, the attackers must occupy every point in the garrison, while the officers must capture enough attackers to make such occupation impossible.

This game has been known in English-speaking countries by a number of names, including Officers and Sepoys, The Royal Garrison, The Three Guardsmen, The Three Musketeers, Yellow Peril, and Bataan: The Battle of the Philippines!. In continental Europe it has usually been known as some variation of Belagerungsspiel “Siege Game” or Festungspiel “Fortress Game” and was sometimes published together with its immediate ancestor under the same name.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fighting, Novel-based, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement
publishers: (Public Domain), (Unknown), Ami Play, Carlit, John Jaques of London, Jos. Scholz, L. P. Septímio, Milton Bradley, Somerville Ltd., Spear's Games, The Game Crafter, LLC, Three Guardsmen Publishing Co.

name: Monster Rancher
description:
Monster Rancher is a collectible card game in which players battle each other with 60 card decks of monster cards, event cards, and battle cards. When a player wins a battle, he or she earns a Fame Counter. The first player to have three fame Counters wins.

There are 99 cards in the basic set and 33 foil versions of the rare cards that can be obtained from 2-player starter decks, theme decks, and booster packs. The starter deck comes with a 60-card deck, a set of fame counters, a playmat, and rules.

Online Play


CCG Workshop (no longer available)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme

name: Auditective
description:
From the box:

Auditective
Play with sounds

In this new, innovative "lotto" game, you will explore a whole world of sounds, some familiar and some not so familiar. By playing Auditective, you will soon be able to identify the fine distinctions that differentiate more than 50 sounds from one another.

At home or while traveling, both children and adults can discover their soundscape while playing together.

End quote from box.

This game comes with a CD of various sounds of a wide variety of musical instruments, two identical decks of 50 cards picturing different musical instruments, and a sheet with rules for six game and pictures and a brief description of 50 musical instruments.

The "rules" of the games are more like suggestions. Players are encouraged to create their own games with their own rules.

name: Official Pro Football League Quarterback Game
description: Both sides play out four 15 minute quarters in real time under standard American football scoring rules. Strategy is limited to the offensive player choosing whether to run or pass on each play. The game's spinner drives most of the action.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bowl-A-Strike
description:
An action game of bowling, fun for the entire family.

Bring the thrills and excitement of bowling into your home!

Similar games:

Spare Time Bowling
Bowling Dice
Bowl and Score

name: Hello Kitty Best Friends Game
description:
Game components:

Game Board,
54 Hello Kitty Question Cards,
4 Playing Pieces w/ Plastic Stands,
Spinner,
Best Friends Certificates Notepad,
320 Stickers &
Box

The game is set in Kitty’s neighborhood and the friends get together for a slumber party at Hello Kitty’s house.

On the way to the party, players spin and land on “Make A Wish”, “Your Favorite Quote” and other spaces.

When a player lands on a Friendship space, they draw a card that asks a Friendship, Hello Kitty Says or Dear Diary question.

Example:
- Friendship = "Ask the player to your right, "What's your favorite outfit?" Collect a sticker!"
- All Play = "I think the most special thing about me is... Collect a sticker from each player!"
- Hello Kitty Says = "The best way to be happy is to make a friend happy. Give yourself a sticker!"
- Dear Diary = "If I could make one dream come true, it would be... Give yourself a sticker!"

With each question, the player learns something special about another player and collects a sticker for her Best Friends Certificate.

The first player to reach Hello Kitty’s house with two stickers from each player wins. There are 54 special Hello Kitty playing cards.

This game encourages communication and learning about each other. It is fun and it is also a language development game.

name: Medieval Risk
description:
This is an unofficial variant of Risk where players struggle for control of medieval Europe.

It introduces new types of units such as navies, artillery and castles.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection

name: Beetlejuice Bone to Pick Game
description:
Bone To Pick Balancing Game.

Ages 5 and up and for 2-4 players.

1990 GEFFEN FILM Co. and Canada Games Company Limited.

Object: It's a bone-a-fide challenge to see how many bones you can balance on Beetlejuice without causing them to spill, if you do you'll lose your head.

Contains:

- Instructions
- Balancing Beetlejuice figure
- Bone-yard bone container and stand
- 24 bones in three sizes
- Boney finger spinner &
- 12 Beetlejuice head tokens
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dominox
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

Dominox is played on a standard Chess/Checkers board using a standard set of Domino tiles. Only tiles with 0 to 6 dots are used. One player is designated 'white' while the other is 'black.' The players take turn placing tiles on the board, starting with the player who is dealt the lowest numbered double-tile, who must place this a his first move.

Tiles are placed according to the following restrictions:

* A tile must be placed such that it spans two squares (i.e., one half of the tile is on a black square and the other half is on a white).
* No two tiles can share a square.
* If a tile is placed next to another tile, the number of dots on the touching tile-end(s) must match that of its (their) neighbour. If a tile-end is next to several other tile-ends, only one of these need to match.

When there are no un-drawn tiles left and two passes in a row occur (i.e., both players pass), the game ends. At this point, the unfilled areas on the board are scored: Each connected unfilled area on the board counts to the color that is in majority in that area. If there is the same number of black and white squares, no player gets points for the area.

The player with the most points wins.

name: Dotty Dragon
description: "Dotty Dragon has gone too far now. So his Aunt Dragolina has cast a spell and lots of colored spots have appeared on his face. Poor Dotty! How is he going to get rid of these spots? Only with the help of two children who simply place Dotty Dragon in the middle, and off they go! If they throw the matching color on the colored dice they can make the dragon's spots disappear. Because Dotty's colorful spots can easily be pushed through to the other side of the vertical game display and Dotty is quickly rid of his spots."

name: Hoo Hey How
description:
Hoo Hey How is a Chinese dice game with similarities to Crown and Anchor dice. This gambling game consists of three dice with six different pictures on their sides and a paper board marked with the same six pictures for stakes to be placed on them. This board could be self-drawn but you can get printed boards together with the dice nowadays.

The name, Hoo Hey How, is derived from the Hokkien names of three of the things that usually appear on the dice = a fish (Hoo), a prawn (Hey) and a king crab (How). However, modern dice tend to show ordinary crabs.

Dobree, in the 1950s, described the objects commonly depicted on the dice: a fish, a prawn, a king crab, a flower, a butterfly, a beautiful lady. But he also noted that other pictures could also appear: a cat, a mouse, a cock, a centipede, a tiger, an elephant, a gourd, three coins (Chinese cash).

Today, the dice tend to show more standard pictures and the selection of pictures is standardized for the region where they originate too. For example, the dice in Malaysia and Singapore (and I assume Hong Kong, where many of them are made) depict a fish, a prawn, a crab, a Chinese coin, a gourd and a cockerel. Thai Hoo Hey How dice (called Nam Tou Bu Bak [please excuse my bad transliteration]) have a tiger instead of a coin, as do dice from the Malaysian state of Sabah, but the Sabah dice show the head of the tiger rather than the whole animal. In Vietnam, they are called Bau Cua Tom Ca and often played at the new year: the distinguishing feature is a stag instead of a coin. Another feature is that the dice may be made of cardboard.

Many variants are possible, some that do not even feature the Hoo, Hey or How, so I don't know what they would be called. From Penang in Malaysia, I have dice that feature an elephant, a rabbit, a butterfly, a snake, a centipede and a flower. In Singapore, some older dice I have feature mahjong dragons together with symbols of political parties from the 1950s.

To play, one player takes the role of banker and the others are punters. Players stake money on the betting board and the dice are cast (either under cover or into a porcelain bowl). Punters are paid an equivalent amount that they staked, the number of times their picture appears on the dice (e.g. if someone bet on the fish and it appears twice, the punter gets back twice their stake).

This game is similar to The Game of Crown and Anchor.

name: Bullspit
description: Bull Spit is the PBR version of the classic bluffing game. Like Liar's Dice and dollar poker, the key is to bluff what cards are in your hand, and what you say you are discarding. "Take the Bull by the Horns" and watch out for those jokers as you bid and bluff your way to victory!

name: Flea Circus
description:
THE MAGNETIC-ACTION GAME YOU ITCH TO PLAY!

Thrill to the sway pole ride! Marvel at the great barbell toss! Wonder at the tight wire unicycle ride ...and more! Ten big-time circus acts!

Each player attempts to make their mad magnetic fleas do five out of a possible ten circus tricks as shown on the Trick Cards - four of nine 'standard' tricks, plus the Grand Finale. The faster and better the tricks are performed, the more points a player scores.

The Champion Flea Trainer is the player who attains the highest score for the five tricks.

This three dimensional game comes in an oversized box with thematic plastic components that require assembly.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: I have ...
description:
"The game of quick reading and fast talking!"

A game for children aged 5 and up, to strengthen reading vocabulary and build letter recognition.

The first player reads the "I have" statement from the front of their card: "I have a snake" - then flips over the card and reads, "Who has a ...?" (eg a turtle).

Players race to be first to play an "I have a turtle" card onto the "Who has a turtle?" card. The first player to do this then flips their card and reads out the new "Who has a ..." question.

The game comes with 2 sets of 24 animal cards. It can be played by 2 with one set or by 3 or 4 with both the supplied sets.

name: Oh Scrud!
description: A real-time card game in which players race to make words from the cards in their hand, while trying to stop their opponents from doing the same.

name: Arvaa Nimi
description:
The "Guess the Name Game"

There's a plastic-coated, metallic gameboard with the alphabet printed on both sides, and two sets of small magnetic frames, each with 7 black and 3 red, as well as eight small decks of cards, which are boys' and girls' names divided in four levels of difficulty.

The game can be played by either 2 players or 2 teams of roughly equal capacity; therefore, there is no upper limit to the number of players except practicality. First, players must decide if they play a certain level of difficulty, certain gender, or if they want a random game with all the cards shuffled together. The board is set upright between the two teams on two plastic feet and then both teams reveal a card for themselves only. They must then use the magnetic frames to mark all the letters appearing in the name - red frames are used to denote letters that appear in the name more than once.

The gameboard is then turned the other way around and now the actual game begins, with the two teams competing in who is the quickest to guess the other team's name. (It must be agreed in advance whether all names that fit the given letters are allowed, or only the particular one in the card.)

The winning team gets the card as a point, and the first team to get 10 cards is the winner.

name: Lifeline
description:
Translated from the box (in Danish):

An exciting strategy game for the whole family!

With your pieces of obstruction you try to conquer as many number fields as possible, while trying to prevent your opponents in acquiring too many points with their conquering at the same time. The winner is the player who first reaches a specific number of points.

Lifeline demands tactical thinking and luck with the dice! Take some chances be conquering the large numbers, and look out for your life tokens - if you lose them all, you are out of the game!
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Death Stacks
description:
This game uses 24 checkers with 12 in each color and a checker board or a 6 by 6 grid as the game only uses the middle 36 squares of a typical 8 by 8 checker board. Each player places his checkers in the back row of his side of the board. The game turns alternate between the two players. The number of checkers in a stack determines the distance that a stack may move. Moves can be made in any of the eight corresponding directions and cannot be blocked by stacks situated in the path of the move. All moves are done in a straight line unless the move would extend through 6 by 6 grid formation, in which case the move is reflected by the edge of the 6 by 6 grid like a mirror. A stack belongs to the player whose piece is on top. It might be noted that the arrangement and order of the pieces within a stack can never be altered except by continued stacking. Captured stacks always remain on the board and become part of the stack must be included in the count for the new movement distance. A player may use his turn to place a stack on top of another one of his own stacks. During a turn a player has the option of moving one of his stacks or only its top portion which may include any number of pieces and may leave behind a stack also composed of any number of pieces. The height of the new divided stack determines the new movement distance.

In 2005, the "Too-Tall Rule" or variant was introduced. This rule states that at the beginning of a turn that any player's stacks taller than four pieces must be divided. Failure to comply with this rule causes a player to lose a turn.

The game can be classified as a variant of Sid Sackson's Focus.

http://www.stevecobb.com/Death%20Stacks%20--%20game%20instru...

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Death_Stacks

name: Grandmama's Improved Game of Riddles
description: Simple party game, whoever answers the most riddles wins. Example: What word is that to which, if you add a syllable, will make is shorter? Answer: Short.

name: Futebol S.A.
description:
In this game players act as technical/owner of football clubs.
Buying the best players and putting them on the field in the best way to defeat their opponents. So recruiting new fans for his club.

name: Isabelle & Isabeau
description:
Isabelle & Isabeau takes us back to the Mediaeval days when knights were bold and princesses charming! Bit like "families", but the dice make the difference.

Basic Rules:

In this game, you try to win as if you were playing a game of "pure" families - indeed you need to build two families of six similar cards to win. But the dice make things interesting.

There are 3 of them: the first is a Character die that denotes either you or one of your opponents, and the other two are Action dice. Typical actions are: draw a card, place a card, discard a card, steal a card from an opponent, swap hands with an opponent, roll again etc etc.

When it is your turn you roll the dice. You will perform one of the actions on the Action dice, knowing that the other one must be carried out by the person shown on the Character die. You choose who is going to do what, and in what order.

Isabelle & Isabeau game doesn't require any grand strategies, but the game mechanism conjures up some interesting combinations.
You may discard most of your hand only to swap it immediately with another player. You may may need to choose between the lesser of two evils yourself. Memory plays an important role: knowing who has which cards in their hand can be vital. And jokers and "veto" cards add some extra twists and turns.

In short, this is a quick, fun game with lots of "mediaeval" illustrations. Oh, and did you get the pun in the title? No? Time to brush up on your French grammar, then...
Isabelle and Isabeau has just been released in mainland Europe, and will be available shortly in the UK. See www.isimat.fr for details or contact muellbauer@lycos.com
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Pocket Ungame: Kids
description:
This is a slimmed down version of Ungame with new material created for children. This is a non-competitive game that encourages conversation and communication. The game comes in a pocket-sized box and has different questions than previous versions of the board game. (The cards can also be used with the board game.)

Examples of Pocket Ungame Kids Version material:

Frank must do chores before he can play. How do you feel about doing chores ?

Joni wants Charlie to play a game with her. What game do you like to play?

Tara refuses to enter the contest because she doesn't like to lose. Say something about losing.

Kevin was tempted to cheat on a test. If you have ever cheated, tell about it.

name: Goliat
description:
In the village were Goliat and his friends live, Torsby, the people aren't happy. The four elements have deserted them. It is your task to defeat them and bring order back to your village.

Contents:
1 board game
1 dice
4 playing pieces
4 element pieces
45 cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flower Power
description:
“Party Game. Relive the 60s or experience them for the first time.”

The players move down the game track and collect tokens reflecting the following types of experiences: Sex, Drugs, Rock & Roll, Political Activism, and Self Actualization. A separate game track represents a “Vietnam War Tour of Duty.” A player wins the game by having the highest scores in the most of the five experience areas.

name: Zulu Spears Solo
description:
"Solo variant of Zulu Spears Card game. Simulates a battle between Zulu & British Troops. To be played on British side."

The game uses two custom decks of cards, one deck for each side. The British deck is the same as the two player game, but the Zulu deck uses a different composition of cards.

The player seeks to hold out until the Zulu retreat. The player loses if all British soldiers are killed.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Chomp
description: Chomp is a two-player abstract combinatorial game played on a game board that is described as a rectangular "chocolate bar" made up of smaller square blocks or cells. Each turn the players take turns removing a section that consists of all the blocks to the right and below of the chosen location. The top left block is considered to be "poison". The player who takes this block loses the game.

name: Transformers (Revenge of the Fallen) Missile Mania
description:
The game comes with 8 Transformer pawns (4 Autobots and 4 Decepticons), 8 plastic bases, 2 plastic missiles, and 2 "More than Meets the Eye" dice. The pawns must be assembled before the game is played. The pawns consist of cardboard standups that can be flipped between "Robot" and "Vehicle" mode. There are 2 different ways to play the game -- one is a very simple dexterity game, while the Advanced game adds movement, die-rolling, and a couple of other wrinkles.

In the Basic game, players line up their Transformers in a row, one pawn on each base, about 1 missile length apart and about 4 missile lengths from the other player's Transformers. The players simultaneously slide their missiles across the floor or table, trying to knock down the other player's units. The first one to knock down all 4 opposing units wins.

In the Advanced game, the sequence of play is as follows:

1. Each player may convert one unit between Robot and Vehicle mode. Only units in Vehicle mode can move.
2 Each player rolls his special die, which he first secretly sets to Robot or Vehicle mode. If he has no units in a mode, he can't use it. The die results allow movement, extra shots, protection from enemy shots, or repair of a previously hit unit.
3. The players slide their missiles, trying to knock over enemy units. They must slide from behind their closest unit to the other side. Based on the die results, a player may shoot once, twice, or not at all.
4. First one to knock over all the enemy units at once wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shalom
description:
A Bible themed Monopoly-like boardgame.

The main idea of this game is, to enhance the knowledge of the background, the bible is setteled in.

The Players buy places with their Ressources, like Sheep and Camels, built wells or townwalls and earn money, if other players visit these.

Eventcards are given in the Categories "New Testament" and "Old Testament" and provide, in addition to the gamerules, always a Bibleverse.

name: Monopoly: National Trust Edition
description:
A version of Monopoly in which the usual properties have been replaced with National Trust properties including Snowdonia, the Giant's Causeway, Cheshire's Lyme Park (where Colin Firth's Mr Darcy emerged dripping from the lake) and 20 Forthlin Road, Liverpool (the childhood home of Sir Paul McCartney).

The railway stations have been replaced by beaches, the utilities have become farmers' markets and the National Trust's green energy scheme, and the Chance and Community Chest cards have a heritage and conservation twist.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Threes
description:
Traditionally a gambling game, also known as Tripps.

It is played with five dice.

Play:

Each player antes.

Taking turns they throw the 5 dice (or remaining dice).

The object of the game is to score the lowest amount by adding up the values of all five dice but counting 3s as zeroes.

- Each player rolls all five dice.
- Then they set aside the dice the player wishes to keep.
- A player can keep as many as he wants, but must keep at least one die in each roll.
- Once a dice is set aside it may not be rolled again.

The best possible score 0 by rolling all threes, however, if a player rolls all 6;s, it is called 'Shooting the Moon' and they instantly win.

After each person has rolled, the lowest score wins the pot. If there is a tie, then all yied players ante an additional amount and play again.

The winner rolls first in the next game..

name: I Spy Road Game
description:
Each card has 4 different objects to spot.

Find one object on a card and you discard it into your pile and draw another.

Pick new cards until the deck of 52 cards and 2 jokers is used up.

The winner is the one who spotted the the most objects and has the largest card pile.

name: Lieselotte teilt aus
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Lieselotte the cow's dream has come true. Finally she is allowed to help the mailman deliver the mail – but it is not so easy as the pile of parcels is very heavy and wobbly. And before she can deliver anything, she must first find the chicken that is to receive the parcel. Who can help Lieselotte deliver the parcel to the right chicken without anything falling off?

In Lieselotte teilt aus, the cow is ready to deliver the mail and the parcel tiles indicate which chicken receives which package. The players must carefully push the cow with its load to a mailbox and look to see whether the right chicken lives there. Naturally the load may not fall off in the process. When a parcel is successfully delivered, the player may keep the parcel and the associated tile. Collect the most packages, and you win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Grandma's Game of Riddles
description:
McLoughlin had had high sales with their Grandmama series of game and Milton Bradley decided that it should grab a share.

Players have to answer the riddles correctly to score points. Naturally, the game was seen as educational, a prime attribute in the years just before the 20th century began.

name: Conni und die Tiere
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Hooray! Conni and her friends visit the zoo today where they'll meet animals from around the world and possibly even get to feed the meerkats. In Conni und die Tiere, the players search with Conni for the different animals, but somehow the animals aren't always where you expect them to be. Where the giraffe once stood, now there's a parrot flying around! Whoever best remembers where the animals are (and were) has an edge in this game.

name: Category Challenge
description: Roll well, and answer enough challenges correctly to reach the Omega first. When on a category space, roll the letter die, and give a single answer the fits the category and begins with the letter rolled. land a challenge space and roll a dice to select the letter from the card and give two answers that fit the category and begin with the challenge letter. Or land on a Challenge Square, and choose to challenge another player or try yourself. and earn the bonus move.

name: Goblin Hunters
description:
Goblin Hunters is a fast paced push-your-luck style card game combined with set collection and a betting mechanic for 2 to 4 players and is played within 10 to 15 minutes. Goblin Hunters comes with multiple character cards to choose from, each character comes with their own special ability, which can be used once per turn when they go hunting to give you an added advantage.

The Search deck contains 3 types of cards: Goblin Cards, Wound Cards and Goblin/Wound Cards. Try to collect as many goblins as possible without taking too many wounds. While also trying to collect sets of goblins to gain extra bonuses.

This is not the only way to score bonus points, you can bet on the results of the other adventurers, risking your hard earned goblins points for more bonus goblin points. It's a high risk with a high rewards. So the next time your in the tavern healing from your wounds and mouthing off about who the best Goblin Hunter is, make sure you can put your money were your mouth is and bet on your fellow adventurers.

The goal, to be the best Goblin Hunter in the land by capturing 20 goblins first.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Himekishi Nigete
description:
姫騎士逃ゲテ~ (Himekishi Nigete) is a partnership game by the game designer entaku_P. It translates as "Princess Knight, run away?".

In the game, one of the players plays the Princess Knight to escape, and the other players play the Orcs, teaming up to catch the princess. Players draft action cards and the Orc team members work cooperatively but in silence. So it becomes difficult to select the right cards to win. Players need to draft cards and read each other's thoughts well to win.

Publisher summary:
"プレイヤーは1人と姫騎士と3人のオークに分かれて、それぞれの陣営の勝利を目指します。
最終的に姫騎士が捕まるとオーク陣営の勝利、姫騎士が逃げ切ると姫騎士の勝利になります。
プレイヤーはアクションカードをドラフトして、それぞれ1枚のカードを選びます。それぞれ勝つためにはオーク陣営はカードを介した無言の連携が、姫騎士は不利を脱する的確な読みが求められます。"

name: Lexomachies
description:
The game contains 300 cards - crosswords. It' s something between battleship and crossword puzzle, where you guess letters and words of your opponent to solve the crossword.
Highly competitive game which combines knowledge with brightness!

name: Munchkin Zipper Pull
description:
From publisher's website:

This contents five rubber Munchkin zipper pulls in a small plastic bag.

Official Rule: You may reroll a die once per game per zipper pull attached to a bag or item of clothing you are wearing. You can only reroll each roll once. You must actually zip (or unzip) that zipper to reroll the die, so please consider your zipper pull placement carefully!

name: Eye Dentify
description:
Lets play "I SPY"!
Remember the well known freestyle game “I SPY”? Well, this one is even better!
Create a pile- illustrations side down.
Flip and reveal the top card from the pile and place it next to it.
The new card revealed shows a certain shape or color.
Try to identify that shape or color within the illustration!
Spotted it? Point it out to the rest of the players and win the card!
The winner with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner!

How to play?


Flip and reveal the top card from the pile and place it next to it– illustrations side up.
A new card is revealed shows a certain shape or color. Try to identify that shape or color within the illustration!
Spotted it? Point to out to the rest of the players and win the card!

name: Muumin kirjainpeli ABC
description:
An educational game where children learn the letters of alphabet with familiar Moomin characters. There are seven difficulty levels which can be adjusted to match the skills of children. Contains letter tiles, player boards, dice, and game rules.

This is basically a memory game. On your turn you flip a tile, check whether it fits on your player board, then either collect cover a letter on your player board or flip the tile back. First player to cover all letters on their player board is the winner.

Easiest level is just finding matching letter pairs. More advanced variants include matching lowercase letters to uppercase letters, or matching a picture to starting letter of the picture.

name: Anomaly (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: A TIME Agent is missing somewhere in a shuttered amusement park in 1953. Beyond the tilt-a-whirl, an evil presence lurks, trapping those who travel through the fabric of time within the ages they visit. Will you be able to rescue the TIME Agent before time is frozen for good?

name: Texas Roll 'Em
description: If you like poker, you'll love Texas Roll 'Em! In this fast-moving and easy game, roll dice and form the best hand you can to win the point. The first player to five points wins the game! Bright red, white, and blue dice in an easy-to-roll and easy-to-read 16mm size. Take your poker game on the road with Texas Roll 'Em!

name: Street Masters: New Challengers
description:
This expansion promotes 6 previously released allies and rivals to full fighters. Each of these 6 new fighters comes with their own 25 card decks and 11 card Hero Story deck to compliment their new storyline as a playable fighter in the game.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Ничего человеческого Мини
description:
The year is 2025, and it's been a long time since the robots have taken over the Earth. Now it's time to pass the final test to prove that you have nothing but oil in your veins and no trace of humanity left, and there's no better way to do this than to demonstrate your perfect memory!

Your goal in Are You a Human? is to guess the three characteristics of the cards. Guess card features and score points in a way that boosts player interaction, forces you to assess the risks, and makes everyone involved in the exciting process. Pass the captcha of the nasty robots!

Contain 48 Memory cards and 3 Short Circuit cards instead of 64 and 6 cards in standard version.

name: Star Wars: Stay on Target
description:
The Death Star exhaust port is only two metres wide but the Rebel Fleet must make a direct hit in order to destroy the Death Star! As leader of your fleet, organize your crews, and make your attack runs.

The aim of the game is to successfully complete Attack Runs to earn Target Points. Each player has a defense value they use to deflect Imperial attacks on their path to the Exhaust Port. They can even call on Obi-Wan Kenobi for help. Players who have earned four or more Target Points from previous Attack Runs can finally take aim and try to destroy the Death Star. The first player to do this is the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Easy Peasy Lemon Squeaky
description:
In the party game Easy Peasy Lemon Squeaky, players have to react quickly! You either get a challenge or a question: Who can do ten push-ups first? In what decade was Maradona born? Who can be the first to take a selfie of themselves with a yellow object? How deep is the lowest point on earth? Whoever knows the answer or completed the challenge first must squeak with a lemon, gaining themselves a lemon wedge. Whoever completes their lemon first wins!

Easy peasy? No way: there are additional nasties waiting on special cards that you can foist on your fellow players!

name: Host Your Own Pub Quiz
description: Host Your Own Pub Quiz is played over eight rounds with both teams answering the questions at the same time from eight given categories. Including bonus points for playing their Joker, the team with the most points after the eight rounds will win the game.

name: Horse Stakes
description: Very simple game in a fold up plastic case. Bets are placed, then the dealer of the race shuffles the horse cards and places them out in front of their color. First to the end wins. Collect your money. Keep racing till someone is broke.

name: Arctic Survival
description: Arctic Survival is about using your instincts to prevail in the coldest and most remote place on earth. The object is to make it safely to your igloo before your opponent can make it safely to theirs. In the way are treacherous moving ice floes, with icebergs and thin ice blocking your path. Lurking within are friendly and unfriendly Orca whales and smart penguins that can guide the way across the ice floes. Once across, unfriendly polar bears, wolves and many other types of arctic wildlife confront you as you try to reach the safety and comfort of the igloo waiting across this vast ever changing environment.

name: Party, Party, Party!
description:
Come on everyone, the party has started! Race to fill your handbag with fun accessories and be the first to join your friends on the dance floor!

Game includes: Four 3-D handbags. 28 picture cards. 8 character pieces and stands. Dice and instructions.

Ages 5 - 9

2-4 players.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Things in My House
description: Each player has a house and an attic and tries to find all the matching rooms. The first to do so is the winner. The houses are filled with familiar objects and depict daily activities that are sure to stimulate verbalization and imaginative play.

name: Famous 500 Mile Race Game
description:
Each player chooses a car or group of cars he wishes to win.
Spin the spinner to move the 33 cars along the track. If you land on a square marked Crash or Mechanical Trouble, spin the spinner to see which car it affects and it is removed from the board. If a Pit Stop is indicated the car must move back 2 spaces. If more than 4 cars occupy certain spaces there is a crash. Otherwise if 4 cars occupy a space all other cars behind them must stop. The first car that crosses the finish line wins.
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

name: Bamse: 4 i rad
description:
Swedish children's game, based around the popular comic Bamse. A dice-rolling game with modular (although not variable) boards, where the object is to get four pieces in a row, in a Bingo like fashion.

Players take turn rolling the two dice, covering (if possible) the target space with a jar of "dunderhonung". White is a wild color and players can then choose freely in which column to place their jar.

The components are all made of thick, sturdy wood.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice

name: Kentucky Derby
description:
This is a self-contained game with no loose components to get lost. The thin cardboard board is glued inside the bottom of the small box (box measures 7"x10.5"x0.75"). There are five race horses, named for famous ones (Whirlaway, Citation, Twenty Grand, Seabiscuit, and Gallant Fox). The tiny plastic horses each fit in slots cut out of the 'board' which allows them to slide down the race track. They start at a column labeled Post, then travel through Quarter, Half, Three-Quarter, Mile, and Stretch, to reach the Finish. A built-in spinner has two labeled areas for each horse. Here are the rules printed on the board: "All horses are lined up in POST position. Each player selects a horse to race. He spins in turn, then advances the horse indicated on the spinner, whether or not it is his horse, to the next position. When spinner stops on a line, spin does not count. The first horse to reach FINISH is the winner."

There are actually several different versions of this game published in varying decades with horses from that particular time period represented. In addition, some versions have a different number of horses (up to seven) represented. Finally, instead of having horses inserted into tracks, some later versions have horse playing pieces on a similar inlaid board.

Re-implemented by:

Kentucky Derby

name: Czerwona Rtęć
description: Spy game about searching a red mercury substance. Every player controls secret agents from CIA, KGB, Mossad or Jihad organization. They explore laboratory, attack each others and try to capture a red mercury substance.

name: Pidä Muumi katolla
description: A simple Moomin-themed dexterity game, where players use a contraption to lift a Moomintroll disc higher and higher, inserting new pieces in the bottom of the tower. When the tower topples, everybody but the player responsible scores a point. Play until you reach the target score.

name: King Down: Shadow & Spirit
description: This new black (shadow army) and white (spirit army) expansion contains two complete King Down armies. This expansion also includes the Keepers of the King expansion miniatures and chess booster miniatures for the shadow and spirit army.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Friends Wheel of Mayhem Game
description:
Lets Play Wheel of Mayhem! Feel the confusion IRL and see why Chandler called it, "...the best game ever!" As featured on Friends, the game has all the original wacky instructions with trivia based on the show. This game tests you on your Friends trivia in ways you didn’t think were possible. Pick a Wicked Wango card? You might have to recite the Friends theme song from memory! Continue up the Ladder of Chance until you get to the Golden Mud Hut.

—description from the publisher

name: Disney Princess Enchanted Dream Ball
description:
Put on a tiara and prepare for the fairest ball of all! Become your favorite Disney Princess, from Belle to Ariel, Cinderella to Snow White. With the help of pixie dust from Tinker Bell, gather all the items you need for the ball: a gown, shoes, flowers, jewelry, and meet your prince in waiting. Once you're ready, you'll need Tinker Bell's wand to set off for the ball, where all your dreams will come true.

The object of the game is being the first Disney Princess to get ready for the Dream Ball by collecting all of her tokens and Tinker Bell’s Magic Wand.
On each turn, players roll the die. Most sides of the die show the icons of the categories of the things you need for the ball. If the die shows one of the categories containing something you need, then randomly turn over one token from that category. If the token shows an item that is for your Princess, then you get to collect it. Take the token and place it in front of you, face up. If the token shows an item that belongs to another Princess, then show the other players the
token and leave it there, face up for all to see.
If the die shows a category from which you already have a token, then do not turn over any tokens this round. If the die shows Tinker Bell, you can take Tinker Bell’s Magic Wand from the player who holds it. You get to keep the Wand until someone else rolls Tinker Bell. When you roll Tinker Bell, you can:
- take one of your Princess tokens that is already face up
- turn over a new token in any category and take it if it’s yours
- draw a Pixie Dust Card.

If you turn over a Pixie Dust Card with the image of one of the categories, you can turn over the tokens in that category until you find what your Princess needs.
Once you have collected all 5 of your tokens, you’ll need Tinker Bell’s Magic Wand to be the first Princess to get to the Enchanted Dream Ball
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Beardos
description: Are you a facial hair aficionado? Do you think you know famous beards? Well then, this is your chance to impress! Players are given clues, one at a time, from the player wearing the beard card. The quicker you guess the famous beard, the more points you'll score. Can you Name That Beard?

name: Willy Maykit
description:
Willy Maykit is just an average guy. You'd probably like him. But Willy has a problem. He let his friend, Betty Woent, drag him to the shopping mall on Black Friday, and that giant coffee-like drink has run right through him. If he doesn't find a restroom pronto, he may have a rather uncomfortable accident.

In this game, you all play a different version of Will in alternate worlds, who are all suffering from the same dilemma at the same time - the desperate need to pee while stuck in a busy shopping mall. You're okay with karmically throwing another you under the bus if it's going to get you to the restroom sooner. It's all very existential.

Will Maykit is a casual "take that" card game, where you'll be managing your (Bladder) Control. You don't want to run out of Control. That's when you have an Accident. In a public place. Embarrassing.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Duel Masters
description:
Join aspiring duelist Shobu and his friends in this special Monopoly edition. All your favorite characters and creatures are included as you move around the board to build up your Duel Masters deck. Collect creatures and spells from all of the five civilizations to become the best duelist in the game!

You can play the standard Monopoly game, buying and selling creatures and properties, or you can add the special gameplay to make this adventure even more exciting.

Contents:
· 6 Collectible Duel Masters Tokens! Shobu, Mimi, Knight, Hakuoh, Kyoshiro, Rekuta
· Gameboard
· 28 Title Deed cards
· 16 Creatures cards
· 16 Spells cards
· 6 Duel Masters character tokens
· 1 pack of Duel Masters Monopoly money
· 32 houses
· 12 hotels
· 2 standard dice
· Instructions
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Are you Smarter Than a 5th Grader? Card Game
description: Now you can be part of the game show where every question is from a grade school textbook and the answers are elementary. Play at home with this super-smart game that allows you to "peek," "cheat" and "copy" to see if you're smarter than a 5th grader. Game set comes with 500 grade school questions, a die, a pad and a CD that lets you play the game on your CD player, on your MP3 and in the car, too. All the contents are packed in a metal lunch box for easy carrying.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Diablo
description:
Diablo is a two-player game played with two dice and unlimited black and green checkers on a checkerboard of any even size. The number of sides on each of the dice is equal to half the length of the board. For example, if playing on a 6x6
board, the dice will be 3-sided. The board is initially populated with stacks of height one, distributed in a checkered pattern. A player wins when all of their opponent’s checkers have been removed from the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Super-Wissens-Quiz
description: The players have to collect 8 knowledge chips of every color. The chips are rewarded for answering one of 6600 questions out of 8 different fields of knowledge. Those fields include trivia, fairy tales & myths, technology & science, heaven & earth, history & politics, nature & environment, sports & games and art & culture.

name: Suburban Dispute
description:
The year is 1931. In a suburb of the city of Chicago, prohibition is in full bloom and honest people violate more and more laws. Gangster syndicates spread and become larger, and speakeasies open in dark alleys. This illegal activity has now spread out to the smaller suburbs. It's now your turn to make the best of the situation for your family's sake. Will you become a gangster king, or do you think the stock market will go up after the great stock market crash a few years ago so that you will become a wealthy businessman? Gangsters and upper class people will clash in this board game. Will money win over weapons, or it will be the opposite? Form alliances with your neighbors, build up your arsenal of money or weapons, and let the game run its course.

In Suburban Dispute you fight your neighbors for the simple reason that you don't like them. The game includes three levels, starting quietly with annoying missions like stealing your neighbor's morning paper or milk, but each level you go up, the worse it gets. In the end, you will be conducting drive-by shootings and burning down your neighbors' houses.

The game board features a street down the middle, in addition to the score board, and each player places his house next to the street, with a maximum of three neighbors on each side of the street. The players can choose to be either gangsters or members of the upper class before the game starts, and based on what they choose, they receive specific traits that will help them through the gameplay.

Players then take turns drawing special mission cards and rolling a die in order to see whether they succeed with the mission. If the missions succeed, players gain either money or points, depending on the mission level; if the mission fails, then the police come to arrest them, and they lose either points or money, depending on the mission level. During gameplay, players also have the option of drawing special cards specific for gangster and the upper class which will, in most cases, be helpful in order to get closer to the end goal, which is to either collect 60 points, earn 15,000, or be the last player standing.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Stampin'
description:
Stampin' is a game approved by the U.S. Postal Service. The object is to collect sets of four stamps. You'll need to "wheel and deal" to get the cards you need. And, you'll need to manage your cash flow so that you can buy stamps, as well as win auctions along the way.
The game comes with a book about stamp collecting, and has many pictures of actual stamps in game play.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Менеджер
description:
Economic game. Buy properties (hotels, restaurants, theaters, trading firms, industry), build subsidiary and enterprise, collect rent from fellow players. Repeat as necessary until everyone else is bankrupt.

Players take turns in order, with the initial player determined by chance before the game. A typical turn begins with the rolling of the dice and advancing their piece clockwise around the board the corresponding number of squares.

If a player lands on Surprise or Notice, they draw the top card from the respective pile and obey its instructions. If the player lands on an unowned property, whether hotel, restaurant, or industry, he can buy the property for its listed purchase price. If he declines this purchase, the property is auctioned off by the bank to the highest bidder. If the property landed on is already owned and unmortgaged, he must pay the owner a given rent, the price dependent on whether the property is part of a set or its level of development. If a player rolls doubles, he rolls again after completing his turn. Three sets of doubles in a row, however, land the player in stock exchange.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Big Roll Bingo
description: It’s Hello Kitty and friends in a kids’ first bingo game. Oversized dice reveal the letter and a picture. If you can find a match on your card, place a token there. Be the first player to cover 5 squares in a row to win. Includes an extra die and rules for older players. For 2 to 6 players, ages 4 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mashin' Max Game
description:
You have to stay on your toes to win the Mashin’ Max Game! You have to hurry and scurry around the board as fast as you can and gather as many berries as you can while you’re doing it. But you’ve got to protect your critters from Mashin’ Max, because he thinks mashing critters is silly fun – and you lose all your berries if he mashes one of yours! He spins and slams and you can only win by dodging his big fists!

On your turn, you will make sure Max's arm is raised, then pull back a snail lever on side of the board that makes him spin about and then slam his fist down. If it lands on a space with a creature, that player's creature is removed from play and their collected berries are returned to the berry pile. Each space on the board also has a number and pictures of berries. The number is for movement and depending on the number of berries pictured determines how many you take from the berry pile. So, if the fist landed on a 2 when you sent Max spinning, you would move any of your characters that many spaces. After you have finished moving count the number of berries on that space and put them into your stump and play passes to the next player. The game ends when the berry pile is empty or all of a player's critters have been mashed by Max and the player with the most berries wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seven Deadly Sins
description:
Seven Deadly Sins can be best describe as a New Age Snake-and-Ladders with Attitude. The board comprises a winding & overlapping path divided into seven different incarnations -Killer, then Thief, Liar, Servant, Lover, Healer, and finally Prophet. Players must race from Creation to Nirvana through the incarnations while collecting money, Mojo, cards and other elements along the way. Some cards, Wicca Cards, can be used to cast spells so as to advance yourself or to retard the progress of others, other cards provide protection. To win you must be first to reach Nirvana with at least 50 units of Mojo.

Takes around 20 mins per player (therefore 3 player games take approximately 60 mins). Some of the content is too much for young children, thus the game's 13+ rating.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bamboozle
description:
From the box:

Bamboozle - The Hide and Seek game with McKeever and the Colonel as seen on NBC TV.

The game board is a symmetric 'battlefield', each side containing 6 huts connected by pathways. A Grey path separates the Red and Blue sides of the board.

Each player starts the game with eight pieces: two marked 1 (which move one space per turn), three marked 2 (which move two spaces) and three marked 3 (which move three spaces). These are also the victory point values of the pieces.

A screen is placed between the two sides and each player places their eight 'men' into one of the six huts (some huts may be left empty). Once all pieces are placed, the screen is removed and the game begins.

On his turn, a player may 'start' a piece (by moving it from a hut) or move an active piece the number of spaces equal to it's value. If a piece can reach an opponent by exact count, the opponent's piece is captured and removed from the game. If a piece reaches a hut, the opponent MUST start a piece from the hut on his next turn (if a piece is hidden there).

The game ends when one player moves 10 points worth of pieces across the Grey center path or, if both players have less than 10, all of his pieces (they highest total wins).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: And Now For Something Completely Different... The Board Game
description:
The game plays like Snake & Ladders on Spam.

Players line their markers on the “It’s” starting space, roll the die, move forward and try to reach the last space, an illustration of the Python foot. Should a marker land on certain spaces (rose stems and very long, Terry Gilliam-cartoon-like, winding arms), it goes backwards or forwards a certain number of spaces. A pretty simple, straightforward fare up until now, right? Right!
Now the Pythonian fun begins... Several spaces along the track are special and come in three different varieties: Task, Trivia and Character Type.

Task spaces require the active player to draw a Task card and perform the task described on it (e.g. Explain your theory on spontaneous combustion in which must be included goats, a kettle, Venus, a jelly babies and a sock with a hole in it). The other players then vote on the active player’s performance and, should the vote be positive, he gets an Award card (more on them later).

Trivia spaces require another player other than the active player do draw a Trivia card and read the Python-related question on it. If the answer is correct, another Award card is given.

Character types spaces have, well... character types on them (e.g. Canadian lumberjack, Spanish waiter, etc.) which the active player must take on as a persona until his next turn. If the other players decide he didn’t put in enough of an effort, they can just move his marker back to the starting space...

Finally, the Award cards. Apart from some flavor, most of these cards serve no other purpose other than being able to display your proud array of awards. The ones that do have game text on them require the player to perform some sort of task until the end of the game to keep the award.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Kratz Die Kurve
description:
A board game designed by two employees of Robert Bosch (automotive parts supplier). Players race through the countryside trying to be the first to arrive at the finish. The board contains various terrain like mountain passes, dry deserts, and crowded cities. Players must equip their car with various BOSCH systems (ABS, stability control, etc.) in order to pass through these areas most effectively.

The game was published a year later (2001) by Piatnik with all of the BOSCH-specific notation removed.

name: Let's Go Sailing
description:
From the box:

You are a sailing crew taking your Sailboat from Home Dock to the Island Port. When you get safely there, celebrate a great day of sailing by breaking out rations of milk and cookies. Then it's hoist anchor and set sail for home again.

Sailing is a challenge, demanding the best effort from everyone on crew. Everyone's contribution is valued. Each of us has a supply of Action Cards that we share with each other. We use them to advance the boat, negotiate Strong Currents and High Winds, while trying to avoid Rocks and Reefs. In each game, the location of the Reefs is different. We must keep a Seadog's eye out for potential Breakdowns that could ground us. Save the Coast Guard cards in case we need to be rescued. Or else we could end up being adrift at sea!

name: So ein Mist!
description:
Light but quite enjoyable roll-and-move game about a farmers work.

Players try to get their work done by moving around the farm and placing their work-chips at the matching location. If other players are met you may pass some of your work to them. Score spare time points for having all your work done. Whoever scores a certain amount of spare time points wins the game.

A variant is playing with hidden work-chips. Good memory necessary!

name: Tyrannosaurus Rocks
description: A spring-loaded dexterity game in which the object is to carefully place bones on the dinosaur without setting him off.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Prehistoric

name: Vegas 21
description: Vegas 21 BlackJack Dice Game. This is the exciting casino card game now in the form of dice! Play the odds with these sparkly dice and convenient score pad.

name: Triple Flips 2: Monsters
description:
Triple Flips 2 includes Curse of the Pyramid, Vampire Attack, and Escape the Evil Castle.


Curse of the Pyramid is a race game for 1 player. You mark half the dice numbers as belonging to the mummy, then roll the die. If the mummy's numbers get rolled, he moves toward the goal; if not, then you move the actual number rolled. Of course, your path is substantially longer than his. You also are required to change the mummy's numbers each turn.



Vampire Attack lets 2-4 players attempt to bite each other. On your turn, roll the die, then move orthogonally with up to one 90° turn per move, in an attempt to sidle up to another player. Once you get orthogonally adjacent to an opponent, roll again. A 1 (appropriately, the big, red pip) means you've bitten them and they're out of the game.



Escape the Evil Castle is a spiteful race game for 2-4 players. Players traverse a linear path toward the goal, advancing the roll of a die each turn. However, your roll also moves Dracula, whom you can move in either direction. If you move Dracula onto an opponent, she must move her pawn back to the 0%, 25%, 50%, or 75% mark.

name: Toronto in a box
description:
This is another Monopoly variant themed around the city of Toronto.

From the back of the box:
Buy property, build a skyline, trade the skyline for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough - but add a traffic jam, property taxes, and a dive into Lake Ontario and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Fine Art Game
description: Players place their pawns on a board set to resemble the floor of an art museum. Each space is adjacent to a stack of cards with pictures of famous paintings. On a player's turn, he rolls a die and moves a Museum guide about the board. If he lands on a space occupied by your piece, you collect one piece of art (and a point) and may ask a trivia question of the player who moved the Guide (for more points). Player with the most points when three painting stacks are exhausted is the winner.

name: Telly Addicts
description:
Board game version of Noel Edmond's UK Trivia TV series "Telly Addicts."

Answer questions on specialist subject by moving around your chosen department - Soaps & Sagas, Top of the Pops, Guess Who, Comedy, Children's TV, Comedy, News or Sci-Fi.

Be the first player to get each of "your star tokens" back to the remote control. Only then can you take the Star Challenge and become champion Telly Addict.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Jackpot
description:
A pick-6 lottery game in boardgame form. Players choose ten of 49 Lotto numbers at the start of the game. They have the opportunity to purchase more numbers as they land on the numbered spaces of the game board, which also correspond to several mini-games and the opportunity to win or lose money. Players try to purchase possessions with their winnings, for the object is to have the highest total value in possessions at the end of the game. (Cash does not count.) The game ends when a player matches all six Lotto numbers drawn, plus a Super Number consisting of two rolls of a special die. That player wins the Jackpot and may then spend his winnings on as many possessions as he likes.

Ages 10 and up
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Chit-Pull System, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bargain Hunt: The Game
description: This game is based on a popular BBC game show entitled ‘Bargain Hunt. ’ Players buy antiques from the Antiques Fair and try to sell them for a profit at auction utilizing Auction Event cards and the luck of the dice.

name: Big Trouble
description: Electronic talking Pop-o-Matic Trouble bubble "tells" you whether to discard or add cards to your hand with colorful lights and fun sound effects. Be the first player to discard your hand of cards and win the game! Includes Trouble bubble and deck of cards.

name: Guest Host
description: Players guess the identity of a mystery guest (fictional or real life) from a deck of 500 cards featuring 3,000 questions. A correct answer moves the player one space closer to the winning guest host desk. Box cover has a photo of Ed McMahon.

name: Skiers
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players attempt to get down the ski slope in the fastest time possible. The slope is a string of connected spaces, each of which is rated for difficulty. You must choose between "normal" and "risky" movement. A die roll determines the success of each move. Ski for the US, Russia, Canada, France, or Italy.

name: Travel the World
description:
Draw travel tickets or postcards and use the travel spinner (by air, sea or land) to visit the countries drawn. The first player to visit all their countries and get back to their starting point wins.

The tickets name countries, the postcards name a county's capital and shows a scene from that country.

Teaches familiarity with the world map, country locations and national capitals.

4 games are described. One using tickets to show destinations, one using postcards for destinations, a "pairs" style of game, and postcard/flash card quiz.

Ages 5 and up
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Two Up
description:
One of Australia's many contributions to the world of gambling. The game is conducted in a flat circle of approximately 20 feet (6 metres) or larger. The only equipment required (aside from materials for tracking bets) is two coins (by tradition pre-decimal pennies), and a flat piece of wood called the "kip" approximately 8 inches in length which has holes carved in it to fit the coins neatly but loosely enough for the coins to come out when tossed.

The game is run by a "boxer", who calls the first "potato" (one of the players around the circle) in to toss the coins. The spinner wagers an amount of their choice on either "heads" or "tails". Other players around the ring can then also bet on either "heads" or "tails". .

Once all bets are taken, the boxer calls "no more bets", and the player tosses the coins in the air using the kip. To be a valid throw, they must go above the head height of the spinner, be rotating sufficiently and land entirely in the ring - if they do not the boxer calls "barred" and the throw is retaken. Ideally the call must occur before the coins settle.

If the coins land both on the same face, the round ends and non-spinning player's bets are paid off, with people who bet on the same face as that landed winning. A new round of non-spinner bets is then taken before the spinner throws again.

If the coins come up with one tail and one head, the spinner spins again. If 5 "odds" come up, all players lose and a new spinner is selected.

If the spinner throws his nominated face three times before either 5 "odds" being thrown in a row, or a spin with both coins being the opposite face, the spinner wins and is paid at 7.5 to 1 (in most modern games).

name: Musée Mystère
description:
A game released by the Musée Français de la Carte à Jouer, to coincide with an exhibition of Bruno Faidutti's games.

The game consists of just 36 cards. During a game, each player will have one of six possible special powers, and a hand of 12 cards valued from 1 to 7.

Each round the players will be competing for one of six cards, representing 'artifacts' in the museum. The players will simultaneously choose one of the cards in their hand, reveal, and then simultaneously choose a second card. Barring the use of a special powers card, the player with the higher total from the two cards wins.

The game is basically a pure bluffing game, with a little bit of special abilities to mix things up a bit.

name: Monopoly: Le Havre
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Le Havre, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Toulouse
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Toulouse, in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Suomi Filmi Elokuva Tietopeli
description: A nostalgic quiz game for everyone who loves old Finnish films. The game includes 400 questions cards from different areas of the Finnish film, some of the cards are also illustrated.

name: Dino Dice
description:
The Dice, Dinos & Bingo Game.

Becky's in trouble. Rex is playing with a ball. Roll the dice and see what the dinos are up to now! Match the two dice to a square on your bingo board, then mark that square with a dino footprint. Will you be a wizard at finding the lizard? Roll "Dino Dash", and you forfeit a dino footprint. The first to mark four squares in the corners or four squares in a row wins! (from back of box)

name: Dachshund-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

PROUD, CLEVER, AFFECTIONATE, AMUSING... MEET THE DACHSHUND!

The Dachshund is a lively breed with a friendly personality and a keen sense of smell. Known for their long and low bodies, they are one of the most popular dog breeds. The name "dachshund" is of German origin and literally means "badger dog", from Dachs "badger" and Hund "dog". First bred in the early 1600’s in Germany, the breed became popular in the U.S. during the early 1900’s. They are loveable, playful companions, and an ideal pet for many homes!

DACHSHUND-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE DACHSHUNDS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent buy buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO DACHSHUNDS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show or going in for vaccinations! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Mark My Words
description:
The game is played on a grid mat. After the initial first letters are laid on the grid surface, each additional letter added to the game must create one or more new words. Words may be ‘read’ from top to bottom, right to left and zigzag, as long as they are touching in sequence. The tiles must also connect on some part of the neighbouring side which is not always easy because the tiles are cut in various shapes and sizes.

Players must 'mark' (write down) all words they discover during the game. Depending upon the agreed game rules, a point is given for each new word. The player with the highest number of points wins the game.

name: Angry Birds: Mega Fling
description:
This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Build, launch and destroy with an exciting skill-and-action game based on the best-selling digital app Angry Birds! Players draw a mission card and build the structure shown before their opponents launch an Angry Bird in an attempt to knock it – and the pigs – down to win points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: Moi Président
description:
Imagine that you are players in a democratic country.

Each player takes a voting card. The oldest player is the first President. They take the President card and chooses their Minister by placing the Minister card in front of the player of their choice. The same player may be Minister more than once during the game. The other players act as the People.

The deck of cards is placed in the middle of the player, 4 are revealed and the cards closest to the deck is the most valuable, descending in value to the 4th card.

At the top of the deck, there's a symbol at the corners of the card, corresponding with one of the phrases on the President card. The President reads the cards to all players, for example: "what would I like to bring to the desert with me?". The other players place their Voting cards (facedown) on each one of the 4 faceup objects.

The Voting Cards are then turned over to reveal the votes. Players score by correctly guessing which card the President chose. The Minister wins a point if they also chose the same card as the President. Each player who is not the Minister, can score an additional point if they guessed the Minister's card as well (if they both chose the same card and you voted for it, you get 2 points! If the Minister and President each chose a separate card, you only win a point if you guessed one or the other). The President scores up to 3 points, 1 point per non-Minister player that guesses his card.

At the end of the round, the 4 faceup cards are placed at the bottom of the deck. The new President is the player sitting to the left of the current President. The game is played for as many rounds as each player is President twice (in a 3 or 4 player game) or each player acts as the President once (5 or 6 player game). The person with the most points wins! In case of a tie, both (or several) players share the victory!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Autarcha
description:
Join the dynamic action embedded in the turbulent times of World War II. The heroic struggle, full of sacrifices and tough decisions will make even you fail to notice how much you consume climate unpredictable clashes on the battlefield. Take on the role of an all-powerful commander and lead your troops on the way to victory.

Autarcha is an innovative strategy, which compete with each other two parties to the conflict. Rich in variants of tactical gameplay makes every time we experience a meeting with the game again. Enhanced combat system and countless possibilities are distinguishing features of the product. Trust us and let yourself be drawn into a new world of Autarcha.

The game takes place on the board, on which are marked various landscape elements: land, forest, mountains, rivers and cities. The board is perforated by transport links, such as road and rail. Each of these elements can be used in the game: Rail and road allow faster transport, forest and mountains hide the army and the cause that they are difficult to destroy, and the water stops, eg. Armor or artillery, which they can not overcome these obstacles. It depends on the player how to use elements of the board.

Most important is the general staff - in most scenarios, the destruction ensures victory. It represents the player and can give orders to the other four types of units:

Infantry - cheap unit with a relatively small range. Easy to recruit and rapid implementation to fight.
Sappers - a specialized unit performing special operations, eg. Putting min, which in turn are invisible to the enemy
Panzer - unit with a high cost, but high mobility in the field and long range.
