Artillery - a unit of positional far, code coverage.
Branches can attack at a distance in their moves during the turn.

The game is included economic aspect, each player can build infantry and sappers in the city and armored units and artillery in our factory.

The game can be started in a simple way - choose the same set of units for each player, set them on the board and start the fight.

name: Emoji Twist!
description: Emoji Twist! requires concentration, quick reactions, and a sharp eye. To play, a deck of cards featuring various emojis are scattered across the table. Someone will flick the spinner to determine the symbol that players are looking for that round, then everyone races to accurately count how many of these symbols they see. Whoever thinks they have the right answer snaps their fingers, and if correct, they gain points. After a set number of rounds, whoever has the most points wins!

name: F in Exams
description: Based on the uproarious funny “F in Exams” book series, this game uses real test answers from the books that’ll make players laugh while they determine the correct answers. Players use the poker chips provided to earn points for correct answers but they should be careful – if they choose the wrong answer they will lose a chip!

name: Wackelbrücke
description: Players are knights on their way to a castle where a princess and a treasure awaits them. To get there they have to cross a "wobbly bridge" (Wackelbrücke). The bridge consists of several tiles which rest on two pillars each. Two dragons dwell in the river beneath the bridge. Every now and then (determined by a dice roll) the dragons bump into the pillars causing them to collapse. Thus, more and more bridge tiles will become unstable and players have to carefully choose their path across the bridge.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Medieval
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reminiscing: The Movie Edition
description: Remembering the movies of the 1940's through 1990's. Be the first player or team to score over 30 points by naming the correct answers to flashback questions and by relating stories from your own personal past.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, TDC Games, Inc.

name: Spin Circus
description:
Welcome to the big artists' evening! You will have to wow the public with the best acrobatics on the Ferris wheel. The first player to reach the end of the star-studded round will become the star of the evening.

Can you work together with the acrobats to be the star of the show?

Roll the acrobat dice to know which acrobat to play with.
Move the acrobat clip on the wheel, the wheel will spin and tell you which numbers to use to move your piece … and someone’s else!
Carry out your act and advance, or backtrack on the stage!


Reach the end of the track first to get a standing ovation!

—description from the publisher

name: One Piece: Adventure Island
description:
One Piece is a Straw Hat Pirate Showdown game that has 3 play modes: Child, Story and Crew Battle. From 8 years old.

Use Cards and Dice to advance through the Islands of the Grand Line and complete missions and become the King of the Pirates

STORY MODE

Relive all the adventures of the Straw Hat Crew in this cooperative mode, but beware of the pirates and Marines who will do anything to plunder your ship and capture you. Drop Crocodile in Alabasta, destroy CP9, face the crew of Big Mom or Kaido ...

THE BATTLE BETWEEN CREW MODE

Each player plays one of 12 pirate crews and sets out to conquer the many islands of the One Piece world. Will you be the fastest to control territories, find as many treasures as possible on the islands, carry out your missions and beat your many enemies? Beware of other crews, Marines, 7 Corsairs, Supernovae and 4 Emperors who could at any time put an end to your dreams of piracy.

Who will be the Pirate Lord?
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Pirates
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Grow A Million
description:
The basis for the game is a bet between the players about who can earn 1 Million "Hemp-Franks" and leave to an nice island first. This goal has to be accomplished by growing Marihuana and selling it.

Every player has a so called "Hemperium" (a cardboard), which represents her growroom. Different items/people (cards) will be played on it and so be related to it. During the game players roll a die and walk around a track on the main playing board representing one year. Every now and then they pass a mark to harvest their grown cannabis and after a whole round (year) they have to pay their workers. Depending on the field they land on one of four actions has to be performed.

name: CrossWord: The New York Times Sunday Puzzle Game
description:
From the box:

Analyze the Sunday crossword clues, try to decide which ones their opponents don't know, then challenge them to fill in those answers. Go on the offensive with clue selections for your opponent to solve, then be part of the action as the grid fills up, points accumulate, and defensive play takes over. It's non-stop excitement until the last few open squares, when anyone can come from behind to win CrossWord!

name: All In
description:
A small and simple betting game with high quality bits. The box/container is a small-scale dice tower.

From the Manufacturer:

Risk it all on a roll!

It's a game of numbers and nerves as you deal, duel and deceive your way to the winner's circle! Players use cards, dice and chips to predict the value of a chosen card, one to 13. Then the betting and bluffing begins. The player closest to the actual number wins the round and the chips in the pot. Don't have enough chips to meet a bet? It's time to go All In and ante up your stash of chips. The player with the most chips at the end is the winner. This easy to learn game is part poker, part prediction and part pure luck!

name: Cinema
description: Cinema is a team game of associations where the question cards contain pictures from scenes, titles and things used in a particular film. How many of the same words associated with a particular card will you think of as your teammates?
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Armada
description:
Up to 4 captains try to lead their ships into their harbor. But there is some danger of being bombed. And the wind has to blow in the right direction...
This is one of the big boxes of Clipper. It contains beautiful material, such as ships and windroses.
publishers: Capiépa Éditeur: Jeux Éducatifs, Clipper, F.X. Schmid, Miro Company

name: Folko-Boks
description:
Folko-Boks is a boxing-themed abstract pure strategy game. The game lasts 10 rounds in a ring of 36 squares, randomly initialized with numbered chits. In each round, players move their boxers like a chess knight, removing the numbered marker from the square they left. The boxer who moves onto a higher numbered square wins that round. Being unable to move causes a knockout loss.

Folko-Boks was included as a free game in issue 4 of the Polish board gaming magazine Świat Gier Planszowych ("World of Boardgames") published December 2007.

The game acknowledges some inspiration from an earlier game by Sid Sackson, probably Paper Boxing.
There is a somewhat similar game Joust on an 8x8 grid.

name: Disney Wheel of Fortune
description:
From the manufacturer:

Combine the puzzle-solving fun of Wheel of Fortune with the magic of Disney-Pixar movies and you get a game that's entertaining for the whole family. Spin the Mickey Mouse wheel, then ask for a letter to the puzzle. Categories include: Heroes and Heroines, Villains, Movie Titles, Song Titles and more. Collect Disney dollars for uncovering letters and solving the puzzles.
categories: Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Word Game

name: The Simpsons Board Game
description:
The object of the game is to win!

Winning the game varies depending on which character you are playing.

If you are Homer, you win the game by saving enough money, 750 Bucks, to buy a new (well, nearly new) Cadillac Convertible. Then you must get back home by an exact dice roll.

If you are Marge, you win the game by saving enough money, 750 Bucks, to afford a day in health and beauty farm including hairdo, beauty make-over and manicure. Then you must get back home by an exact dice roll.

If you are Lisa, you win the game by saving enough money, 750 Bucks, to buy a real pony. Then you must get back home by an exact dice roll.

If you are Bart, you win the game by saving enough money, 750 Bucks, to buy a giant Krusty the Clown Robot, a Radioactive Man, skateboard, a deluxe catapult, a spy camera, a jiffy squirt ring, a Space Mutant Video Game, anty-gravity boots and a real tatto. Then you must get back home by an exact dice roll.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Viinipeli
description:
Viinipeli is a game for two teams. Both teams try to fill up their own wine cellars with as valuable wines as possible. To win the desired wine cards teams have to answer correctly to trivia questions about wines and to win fun challenges.

The game includes:

Game board
250 cards (125 red wine cards and 125 white wine cards)
6 wine tokens
1 die
1 pawn
A 30 second hourglass
1 wine review memo
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Sacramento
description: Players have four "cowboys" which they move across the board, according to dice rolls. Under one of them they have hidden gold which they want to get to the bank (at the other end of the board) safely. Other players try to steal the gold by getting on the same field on the board.

name: Zombie Close
description:
A Zombie strategy game for 3 or more players, where the person who survives the longest wins.

Each player controls 1 Human and 3 Zombies. Aim of the game is to be the last Human to survive the Zombie attack. Each player takes turns to run from the shuffling Zombies, then each takes turns to move their Zombies to try and corner and bite the other players' Humans. Humans generally move a fixed number of 6 speaces, whilst Zombies move according to a dice roll (1-6). Get bitten as a Human and you still have 5 turns - or until you get bitten again if sooner - until you become a Zombie yourself. Cards take it beyond a basic roll 'n' move, with positive (for yourself) and negative (for others) special effects.

There are various cards that can either help or hinder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flip Frog
description:
The game could be described as amphibian tiddlywinks. Players press down and then release the tail of a plastic frog sending it skyward. The goal is to be the first to get all three of your frogs into the pond.

Similar to:

Frog Game

name: Bacon-Opoly
description: Baconmania is in full swing. The average American eats 18 pounds of bacon per year. Yep, and Americans consume 1.7 billion pounds a year. Whoa!?talk about bringing home the bacon! Some folks appreciate bacon so much they accessorize with bacon earrings or bacon tattoos. Skin yourself up and you can apply a bacon bandage. Tired of that new car smell? Get one of those bacon strip car deodorizers. Bacon is not just for breakfast anymore! Buy your favorite bacon delicacies then collect Pounds of Pork and trade them in for Smokehouses and up the rent. It's all lip smackin' good fun until someone gets sent to BURNT and is out of the game. Who knows? You may soon be praising the Lard and wrapping everything in bacon. Whether you like yours with eggs, on a BLT, or on a stick and covered in chocolate, this is the game for you!
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Logo: What Am I?
description:
Logo: What Am I? is a "no-questions" version of The Logo Board Game. Players describe, draw and guess the brands and products shown on the cards. The first player or team to reach the centre of the board wins.

This edition is designed to be a little more child friendly and as such has a lower suggested age.

name: Civil War Game
description:
Learningames offer a new and exciting way to have fun while learning about the Civil War. Through these innovative and easy-to-play games players master important information about historical events and geographical areas. A valuable experience for young and old, novice or expert, Learningames are unique, informative, and always enjoyable.

In the basic game players win cards by locating and naming the event or area on the numbered playing board or by correctly challenging incorrect answers. The game winner is the player with the most cards.
categories: American Civil War, Educational, Trivia, Wargame

name: Search Diver
description:
"Search Diver is a microgame involving dive planning and underwater search. Two players compete to be the first to locate a specific search target such as a drowning victim or a boat wreck. Players must plan their dives to maximize their chances of locating the target without violating dive safety guidelines."

Part of the Microgame Design Contest 2002.

name: Swap! (2-10p)
description: Players are trying to get rid of their cards playing cards matching the color of the last played card. There are special cards to change the color, swap your hand of cards with another player or rotate hands of all players. When Läiskis card is played other players must slam their hand on the discard pile as quick as possible.

name: Gefahr über Sunnydale
description: "Gefahr über Sunnydale" (Sunnydale in Danger) is an adventure game based on the television series "Buffy the Vampire Slayer". One player battles as the great master the other players who use 5 of 6 heroes (Buffy, Xander, Willow, Giles, Oz and Riley), each with his own special ability. The great master chooses secretly one of 4 scenarios, which determines amongst other things the boss monster (Master, Spike, Wilkins III or Adam). The game has 2 phases. Phase A is the investigation phase, where the heroes move through the town of Sunnydale to find 5 pieces of evidence about the boss monster while battling hordes of minor monsters. Battles are fought with rolling dice and comparing strength and stamina. When the heroes have found who the opponent is and where he lives, phase B - the confrontation phase- starts, which is played on the backside of the board and consists of one battle between the heroes and the boss monster and his surviving adjutants.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Alice in Wonderland
description:
Each player chooses a character, each of which are double-sided. One side is BIG in which case you move forward, and the other side is SMALL, in which case you move backwards.
Players move up the board similar to Snakes & Ladders but with the added excitement of extras like the Looking Glass & the Jabberwocky square.

Contents

1 x Playing Board
6 x Double-sided counters
1 x Looking glass counter
1 x Die
1 x Die cup
Rules in box lid ( English, French & Dutch)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Disney Princess Pop-Up Magic Cinderella's Coach Game
description:
From the Publisher: "Join Cinderella and Prince Charming on a magical journey in this Pop-Up Magic Cinderella's Coach game! The gameboard for this Disney-themed game has a beautiful coach for imagining Cinderella as she travels to the ball. You can play the game as either Cinderella or Prince Charming, and move along the path with spins of the spinner. Connect the board to other Pop-Up Magic games (other games sold separately) for a longer path and even more magic. Friend tokens can help you move even farther down the path, and if you reach the enchanted Finish stone on the board, you win!"

It is a spin-and-move race to the finish, with an added memory mechanism, as the player attempts to uncover their "Friend Tokens."

name: Eeny, meeny, moo, where will I find you?
description:
Farm animals play hide & seek. Who wants to help search for them? Two entertaining game ideas provide diverse educational opportunities. Eagle eyes and an elephant’s memory win this farm theme hide & seek game. Two amusing memory games.

—description from the publisher

name: Chart Wars
description:
"It is dawn. Enemy forces can be heard assembling over the ridge to the south. Your commander has ordered you to hold your position at all cost. You feel that if you can only knock out the enemy armor before it spots your positions, you will stand a chance of surviving to see evening chow. ..."

Sounds pretty wargamish, doesn't it, but don't let this fool you. This game attempts to add some humor to the wargame genre. For example, the "How to Play" section has this to say about the game's VP (Victory Point) track: "If you find the VP track too confusing you may keep track of your VP on a piece of scratch paper. Players who have already figured this out on their own gain 1 extra VP." And there's this in the "Errata" section: "Illustration #12 is not an M4A3E8 Sherman. It appears to be a large dog."

In spite of these and numerous other examples of humor the game itself is an OK effort. It actually is fun to play. (The playing time is a guess.)

Bloomsburg, PA-based DIPCo first released this in the same box with the game "Space Waste" as a signed and numbered limited edition "DIPCo Double."

name: Astronaut
description:
Card game from the early 1960s based on the Moon Race with realistic paintings including Sputnik, Telstar, Mercury and Vostok capsules and rather more fanciful ones of a moon mission.

Contents
4 sets of 7 cards representing stages of the mission
4 substitute Stage cards
2 Reserve Astronaut cards
2 Illness cards
3 Delay cards
5 "General Interest" cards (weaker Delay cards)
rules

Players race to lay down the seven stage cards in order, using substitute and reserve cards if necessary, and hindered by illness cards picked up and delay cards passed by the player on the right. Game end comes when a player reaches the moon (stage 7), and victory points come from the number of genuine stage cards played.

name: Trick & Treat!
description:
It's time for some Halloween mischief. The parents pick the tricks and everyone tries to accumulate the treats. Who will be able to get the most candy?

The deck contains 90 number cards in 6 suits and 16 trick cards. The number cards are dealt out to the players. Players take turns choosing the "tricks" -- rules for different types of card tricks. Rules include the One-Shot (everyone plays a card simultaneously and the highest card gets points), the Center (everyone plays a card simultaneously and everything except the high and low cards gets points), and the Single Color (players play cards once around following suit if possible with the highest card in the led suit getting points). Play continues until all cards have been played. Whoever accumulates the most points wins!

name: Batalj
description:
Batalj. This Swedish Alga game is essentially a newer version of the old Alga game Attack, which probably is related to L'Attaque. Therefore Batalj could be considered a "cousin" of Stratego. Designed by Count Sigvard Bernadotte, an uncle of H M King Carl XVI Gustaf of Sweden, and illustrated by Lars-Olof Jerhammar.

In the game you try to defeat your opponents army with your own. You only see the back of your opponents pieces so you don't know what piece is where. You try to use your stronger pieces to defeat your opponents weaker ones while protecting your weak ones. .

Differences between Stratego and Batalj:

-Batalj has 48 (2*24) pieces on a 64 square grid (8*8). Only the first 3 rows are filled in the initial setup.
-Instead of 'Bombs' Batalj has 'Cannon'. Cannons can only be defeated by the value 3 piece (Corporal).
-There are no 'Scouts' and the unit mix in general is slightly different.
-There are no 'lakes' nor any other obstructions on the board.
-Striking is mandatory and happens immediately when a player moves a piece to a square directly in front (but not on the sides or back) of an opposing piece. A victorious striking piece does not occupy the opponent's space.
-There are no 'Flags'; winner is the first player to either eliminate or block all opposing pieces. In case of an impasse, the value of remaining pieces on both sides is counted and the higher total wins.

name: Coups d'un soir
description:
30 girls, rated from 1 to 10 depending on their physical appearance, the higher the value, the higher the requirement in four categories: class, masculinity, morality and success.

Players have three types of card: Arguments, Joker or Bitch Slap.

The first ones can be played only during your turn. others can be played at any time.

Combine enough of class, masculinity, morality or success to accumulate conquest, score points and become the king of the evening ...

The game can be played over 30 to 60 minutes.

name: The Sopranos Trivia Game
description: Now you can test your knowledge of THE SOPRANOS, HBO's critically-acclaimed mob drama. 1,000 trivia questions will challenge you on your program knowledge and "Mob Speak" too. Place bets on which questions you and your friends can answer correctly. Five levels of difficulty make it easy for even casual viewers to play against the most seasoned fans of THE SOPRANOS. It's trivia. Redefined.
categories: Mafia, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Klabats
description: In the middle of the table is a plastic piece consisting of four sort of hammers. One player is the reader, reading out a question. Each player has to write the answer on her hammer as quickly as possible. Then the hammer will fold in and answers will be compared. The one who was the quickest -that is who has the lowest folded in hammer- will win if the given answer was correct.

name: Beleaguered Castle
description:
Beleagued Castle is a solitaire card game played with a standard deck of 52 playing cards. It is also called Laying Seige or Sham battle.

Rules.

First the player removes the four aces from the pack and places them face up in a column in the center of the table to form the foundations.

Then the remainder of the deck is shuffled and a column of four cards is dealt to the left of the aces, followed by a column to the right of the aces.

Succeeding columns are dealt on these successively, each column overlapping the last until the whole pack is dealt. This forms eights rows of six cards in each.

The object of the game is to build on the foundations in suit sequence up to the kings. The cards available for play are those at the far ends of each row. They can be built directly onto the foundations or packed onto another available cards in descending order of rank, irrespective of suit.

When one row is emptied, it can be filled with any available card. There are thus always eight available cards for play.

This game is quick to play but with many failures which can be frustrating.

Variations.

Siegecraft

This allows an extra cell for nay card to be placed on it the assist in uncovering key cards, making it easier. The cell can only accomodate one card.

name: Viaje por España
description: Viaje por España is a game where you have to travel through Spain while visiting several cities in a certain order. It's an educational game for kids, where they learn Spain's geography while playing.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sticky Situations
description:
Sticky Situations (presented by Focus on the Family) is a fast-paced kids board game the whole family will enjoy. Positive values and good decisions are reinforced in the midst of surprise, laughter, and exciting game play.

Stars McGee straight from the million-selling McGee and Me! video series.

Features a full color action gameboard with sinkholes, twisters, and runaway trains.

Includes 100 Sticky Situation cards, 15 True riches cards, 6 playing pieces, and 1 die. Ages 6 and up

name: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation Boardgame – Crime Game & Booster Pack #1
description:
This is the first expansion pack for CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game including a new 12 sided die for new gameplay.

Expands:

CSI: Crime Scene Investigation – The Board Game
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
publishers: Competo / Marektoy, Editrice Giochi, Piatnik, Specialty Board Games, Inc.

name: Size Matters
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Hilarious Fun as player's compete to determine the longest, fattest, thickest, and generally the biggest things in life. For four or more players or teams. Ages 13 to adult.

Contains:
400 Big Questions
200 Game Cards
28 Voting Cards
4 Gigantic Pawns
& 1 Extremely Long Game Board

name: Cannibal Eyes
description:
An old legend tells of great warriors who ate their enemies’ eyes to acquire their power. Cannibal Eyes is built on this motif: the more eyes you collect, the more powerful you become.

Despite the cannibal theme, the game is very abstract. Moving your skulls and positioning their mouths next to the eyes of your opponents' skull you are able to eat their eyes.

The first player to seize and swallow four eyes wins.

name: Sam the villain
description:
In Sam the Villain, all the players are the police and we have to catch the thief before he commits his last 4 robberies and scapes to a lost island with all his loot.
Cooperation game.
Each player roll his dice and has 1 minute to find his object in the board, if he find it, then can help the rest of the players to find their own objects, but using only words to describe the situation.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition

name: Cranium Sounds of the Seashore
description:
From the publisher:


Explore the seashore and match the sounds
Enjoy a unique twist on a classic kids game
Create shining moments while building skills
Hold the Magic Seashell to your ear for clues
Two ways to play: matching and memory


Whisk your child away on a trip to the seashore with this exciting matching and memory game.

Hold the one-of-a-kind Magic Seashell to your ear and hear familiar seashore sounds like the bark of a seal or the horn of a friendly boat. Then match each sound with a picture on a shell card, practicing memory skills as you work together to uncover the buried treasure.

Crafted to reinforce matching, memory, and sound-recognition skills, Sounds of the Seashore rewards every successful turn with a "Way to go!" or "You did it!"

And the rewards keep coming as the game can be played two ways -- a beginner listen-and-match version or an advanced memory game for older kids
-- making it great for kids to play as they grow or for kids of different ages to play.

What's in the box?
Sounds of the Seashore includes the Magic Seashell and base, the game mat, and 13 shell cards.

name: Gribbit
description: In this children's dexterity game, a player rotates a handle to spin bees past frogs which can be snapped closed by other players. Players keep the bees who made it past the frogs. The player with the most bees wins.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Flinke Flosse
description: This is a simple game of quick counting and memory for children. Six dice, each with some sides showing fish and some just water are rolled. The first player to place their hand over the tile with the correct number of fish on it wins a glitter fish. But there are two tiles for each number with different backs, one has a whole net the other a net with a hole. You only get a glitter fish if you identify the tile without a hole in the net. The winner is the player with most glitter fish at the end
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Nautical, Number

name: Quarterback
description:
QUARTERBACK is a strategy game for 2 players or teams from age 10. Each player acts as the coach of an American Football Team using his skills and his players to outwit his opponent and score a touch down.

The playing board is a 10 x 10 grid on which the teams are deployed.

Each team comprises the following players:
1 Quarterback
4 Blockers
2 Squarebacks and 2 Dummy Squarebacks
2 Roundbacks and 2 Dummy Roundbacks
2 Tribacks and 2 Dummy Tribacks
each of which has certain movement ability and the ability to influence the player in their are of the board in which he is located. A "ball" is used to indicate how play is progressing.

The aim of the game is:

Offense - to score as many points as possible within four quarters, by scoring touchdowns (points range from 12 to 20 dependent on where on the scoring line the ball crosses - the nearer the central posts the better). a touchdown must be scored within nine turns otherwise the play ends and the Offense scores 0 points.

defense - to stop the Offense from scoring a touchdown.

name: Jack And The Beanstalk
description:
Mid-sixties Marvin Glass offering from Schaper for two players only.

The modular 'board' consists of a high quality hollow green plastic beanstalk about 18" high with a fluffy white cloud surrounding the top, concealing the 'sleeping' giant. A sequence of ten small holes spirals from bottom to top of the beanstalk on each side. Each of the holes is one of three shapes and these accommodate the stems of the plastic leaves players must insert in the correct sequence from bottom to top.

To start the game, all beanstalk leaves are placed inside the hollow beanstalk through a slot situated on each side. There is a sliding apparatus at the base of the beanstalk which allows each player access to a single leaf on their turn.

The plastic beanstalk leaves come in 3 colors - green, gold & black. The green leaves have stems that will only fit into specific beanstalk holes and must be replaced inside the beanstalk if they do not match the next in the sequence. Gold leaves are universal and fit into any beanstalk hole. Black leaves are useless and are immediately replaced through a slot.

The first player to complete the sequence of leaves in order wins the game. When a leaf is placed in the final hole at the top of the beanstalk, a spring mechanism is triggered which causes the 'sleeping' giant to pop up.

name: Dobbelschat
description: In this children's game the players collect treasure cards of different values by rolling dice.

name: Homecoming Audition
description: If you think you know southern gospel music trivia, gather your friends around the game "Homecoming Audition: Will You Be There?" The winner is the first one to arrive - via bus- at the Gaither Studios for a Homecoming audition.

name: Méditations Foireuses
description:
Méditations foireuses is the game that ends well when it ends badly.

The principle is accessible to everyone: you must end sentences, which you are given at the start of the game, in the most borked way possible!
All of this is in a spirit of pure parody of proverbs, sayings and other more or less deep thoughts...
An example dedicated to lovers of le droit de perdre (the publisher): "nothing is used to accept defeat... except when we win for nothing."
4 rules are proposed with the game:

respect nothing
play with a single card in hand
takes time to guess which player wrote each maxim
invent phrases by starting with the end!



In short, you find a original, crazy game, ideal for raucous evenings and/or a surprising gift. It fits into your pocket and adapts to all opportunities! Méditations Foireuses contains 55 cards and comes in its cardboard case.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Le Droit de Perdre

name: Adventureland Game
description: This game is based on the Jungle Cruise ride at Disneyland. Starting at the dock and using a spinner, players move their boats along the rivers (arrow paths) of the ride. Each player has three pink cards depicting various animals or landmarks that they need to photograph. When a player lands on a Camera Space, he draws a white card, and, if its picture matches one of the pictures he needs, he has taken a successful photo and keeps the card. The first player to take all three of his photos and return to the dock wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Parker Brothers

name: Booty
description:
Your objective is to land on the jackpots scattered around the board - both neutral and belonging to other players - take the tokens contained within, and exit through one of four starting squares with no fewer than 25 tokens in your possession. Easy right?

Wrong! Because in the meantime, players are placing directional chips around the board in an effort to block your path, open lanes for attacking your jackpot, trapping you between directional chips, and trying to steal your tokens by landing on your game piece.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement
publishers: Game Development Group, Inc., Leslie Games Ltd., Pierre Belvédère

name: EXIT Adventskalender: Der verborgene Mayatempel
description:
In each of the 24 compartments of the Exit Advent Calendar for ages 10 and up, a tricky puzzle challenges the player. To find the right door for the following day, the puzzle must be solved in the room. To do this, clues can be found in the richly detailed illustrated compartments, on a total of 47 puzzle cards with a wide variety of puzzle types. Who cleverly combines, finds the solution, and thus to the symbol of the following door. This is the mission: In a yellowed letter from 1803, which appears in a historical atlas, the explorer Lord Ernest Pickleton reports on a hidden Maya temple in Guatemala. Its exact location, however, is a mystery to be explored. Exploring the hidden temple is a challenge: only one room may be entered each day. The journey was successful if the heart of the temple was found within 24 days.

Now clever powers of deduction and creativity are required. Each family member can contribute his strengths. But don't worry, if you get stuck, a table on the back of the pack with 2 hints per puzzle and a breakdown of the solution will help.

name: Ghost in a Box
description:
From the back of the box:
"There is a Ghost in this box!

Release it into the mortal world and let the adventure begin. Who is the ghost? Where is it from? What does it want to tell you?

Delve into the secrets of the unknown. Every box contains a different Ghost ready to communicate with you. Every roll of the dice brings you one step closer to meeting the ghost.

Ghost-in-A-Box is a unique addition to family game night or any get together with friends. Everyone wins by helping to uncover the Ghost's identity...and it's secrets. Along with learning facts about the Ghost you will also learn interesting things about each other."

Each box contains:
The ghost
Ghost Master's Manual
Audio CD
Ghost identity scroll
Ghost portal
Ghost diary and pencil
The Choosing die
Ghost charm

name: Hönsmamma
description:
The chicken have escaped from the yard to the island where there's more excitement. But now they are lost. The hen mothers have to go and find them and bring them back to the yard.

Up to four hen mothers look for their three chickens, the magnets at heir feet sees to it that they only follow their own mother. The hen mothers move around the island with the help of the colored dice. The player first to bring back three chickens has won.

name: Dire Alliance: Horror
description:
Dire Alliance: Horror is a game of tactical deckbuilding for 1–4 players. Designed by Trevor Benjamin & David Thompson (Undaunted: Normandy, Undaunted: North Africa) and Adam & Brady Sadler (Street Masters, Heroes of Terrinoth), Dire Alliance: Horror is set in a world of classical horror and is the first title in the Dire Alliance series of cross-compatible games.

There are two ways to play Dire Alliance—Battle Mode lets 2 players go head-to-head as you attempt to best your opponent's chosen faction and leader with your own chosen combination of faction and leader, while Raid Mode allows 1 to 4 players to work together to take down an A.I. controlled enemy and its minions before they achieve their nefarious goals. In both game modes, players use a hand of cards to make their fighters move, battle, gain new cards, and perform special abilities. Players can only win by accomplishing the goal as described on the chosen scenario sheet!

Featuring fast, deck-driven gameplay, two ways to play, and the ability to mix and match different fighters and factions from across the product line, Dire Alliance lets players create their own stories of conflict and fragile unions across multiple genres!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stop the Virus
description:
Stop the virus. Will you be the first to get immune from all 4 viruses? Protect yourself properly and move through the dashboard. Overcome situations that can infect you and try to torpedo your rivals advancement with viruses you may leave on the way. Think you know how to protect yourself? Let's check it. Play

Plays roll temperature and normal dice to move around the board. At each space, they turn over a virus card or collect a protection card. if they get a virus card, they must try to cure it, using the protection cards they've collected. The first to cure 4 infections wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Slap 'n Grab
description:
The Party Game That's Survival of the Fastest!

Slap-N-Grab is a fast-paced free-for-all where opponents spring into action slapping down and grabbing cards based on colors, counts and cartoon creatures. All the animal cards are dealt out. Cards have 1, 2 or 3 colored animals on them: elephants, rhinos, kangaroos, monkeys or cows. Two Slap Cards are played face up, for example "Four Cows" and "Three red monkeys." Players then sequentially flip over animal cards until exactly 4 cows or 3 red monkeys appear among them all. At that moment, players race to slap the corresponding Slap Card and win the round, taking the slap card as a prize and turning over another one. If you make a mistake and the required animals are not showing, you must return a previously won card to the bottom of the slap deck. When the slap deck is gone, players count how many they have won and the player with the most wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: X-it!
description: X-it! is simple mix of "Spite and Malice" (aka Skip-Bo) and solitaire mechanics. There are two decks which each have four suits with 20 cards in each suit. One deck is used to establish a large tableau on a circular gameboard which has 26 card slots around the circumference and four slots forming a central "X". The second deck also contains 8 wild cards. Seven cards are dealt to each player from this second deck. The goal is to lay off all the cards in your hand onto one or more of the four "X" cards. The twist is you must be able to dump your entire hand on a single turn. In lieu of this option, a player must try to play a card onto one of the 26 ring cards. Ring and "X" cards must first be "opened" by playing the exact same card on it. After this, cards of any suit may be played on open cards in runs of ascending or descending order. At the end of a turn, a player must play a card even if he was able to discard. If a player puts a card into a run that could have been used to open a card, he loses a turn and must take a penalty card from the player who catches him in the act.

name: Soccer Master
description:
From the Britannia Games website:

The ultimate football card game. Simple to play, easy to learn and has all of the skills and strategies of an actual game. You have total control on how and what formation the team should play.

The box contains 108 cards representing players, a cardboard pitch, a ball token, and two substitution tokens. The cards show a skill rating as an attacker, a midfielder and a defender. Repeatedly, each person draws seven cards, and chooses three to attack, two in midfield, and two to defend. The ball is moved according to the best (lowest) score at each position.

name: Shichi Narabe
description:
Shichi Narabe is a card game closely related to Fan Tan (another card game not to be confused with the gambling game known by the same name); both games are frequently known as "Sevens", adding to the confusion.

In Shichi Narabe, a traditional card deck is dealt out; players place all 7s onto the table. From there, players may play cards higher than the highest card currently on the table, or lower than the lowest card. (Aces are low). The game is described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shichi_narabe.

The primary difference from Fan Tan (the card game) is that in Fan Tan, the 7s are not played to the table to start the game.

name: Lucky Cake
description: Lucky Cake is a children's game that features a cake.

name: The Ashes of Empire: Das Science-Fiction Brettspiel
description:
This is the Boardgame of a (once) popular German play-by-mail science fiction game. You expand from your home planet, build ships and troops, send fleets out into space, battle for control of star systems.
Several resources need to be balanced: population, energy, raw material, technology.

The boardgame has some nice ideas. Once you've set your fleets in motion, they will remain on their course, no calling back. Distances between systems is given on a chart, so it will take your fleet between 1 and 3 rounds to reach its destination. No battle in outer space, only in a system. Combat is done by rolling dice (one per relevant unit) adding the points and dividing by 6. This is the damage done to the opponent, counted out in units.

As pbm / pbem this game may have its merits. To convert a computer managed game to a board game was a bold plan, but one destined to fail. There is to much fiddly detail. Every system has its own little board and there are 42 of them. Plus one central board, plus one per player, all loaded with markers: how many resources, population, fighters, troops, docks ....

It's a sensory overload. It may have succeeded on a smaller scale.

name: Wisst Ihr Noch?: Das 90er Quiz
description: A quiz game of the "Wisst Ihr Noch" series which has 200 questions in 4 categories about the 1990s.

name: SUDOKU: Das Brettspiel
description:
Another game to play SuDoKu - a kind of crossword puzzle from Japan.

In the beginning you have to copy one of many tasks from a small card to the washable boardgame by using a marker.

Now you can start the game.
Every player has 30 seconds to find numbers that match in the cells. The other players have, first to control the time and second, the correctness of the numbers.
To write the numbers on the board, every player uses his own marker in a different color.

After finishing the puzzle, every player has to sum up the numbers he had put in - the player with the highest sum wins.

name: Maul of America: Chopping Maul
description:
Expansion for Maul of America. Adds four new maps, 27 new cards, and rules for fountains and elevators.

Expands:

Maul of America

name: Good Guys 'n Bad Guys
description:
Relive the classic Old West battle between good and evil as four plastic, white-horsed, law-enforcement cowboys pursue four black-horsed lawbreakers. Players roll the dice one by one deciding to which horse the roll should be allocated. After a while the trail splits into three paths, each with its own advantages and disadvantages and the outlaw must choose based on how many and how close the lawmen have come up to their heels. If the outlaws reach the opposite end of the board, they escape and win. If caught, they lose.

May also be played by up to 8 players, each playing a single horseman.

name: Im Rampenlicht
description: In The Limelight, a card driven game in which different actors try to take center stage under the warm glow of the spotlights. The cards show the performers under 1,2 or 3 spotlights.

name: Via Mala
description: Via Mala is one of the most wild and picturesque gorges in Switzerland. In this game player cooperate to help Heinrich IV, (a Holy Roman Emperor) over the Alps and into Italy.

name: Wizard in Training Trading Card Game
description:
To those lucky enough to enter it's doors, the Dragontooth Academy opens up a whole new world - a world filled with magic spells, enchanted items, and warlike wraiths! Are you ready to become the single student worthy enough to graduate from the Academy as a full-fledged Wizard?

[ Object of the game ]
In Upper Deck's Wizard in Training card game, each player takes the role of a Dragontooth Academy student as they prepare for the climactic event of the school year - the graduation battle. Players use their wits and the resources available to them as they race to collect Dragonteeth in order to progress through 5 levels of Wizard proficiency. Along the way, they can cast spells against their opponents to steal Teeth and slow their progress. They can also choose to conjure a beast to battle and win Teeth for their cause. The higher the Wizard level, the more powerful the Spells and Duel Characters available to the players become. The first player to progress through all five Wizard levels graduates and wins the game!

[ "Create Your Own Wizard" Card ]
Each starter deck includes one "create your own Wizard" game card giving players the flexibility to create or bring their own favorite Wizard into play!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: el Juego de las Diez Pistas
description: There are 360 cards divided into 4 categories: Places, People, Nature and Objects with 10 clues each and a word that corresponds to the clues. Each category has their own color. And there are a dice with colors instead of numbers and pawns. First player rolls the dice and get a color. The player on the right takes a card from that color and reads the first 3 clues so other player tries to guess the word if so player advances 3 tiles on the gameboard, if not player reads next 3 clues and tries again, this time if player guesses the word he advances 2 tiles, if not player reads the final 3 and the other player tries to find the hidden word, if so player advances 1 tile if not the other player reads the last clue, if player answers correctly does not advance with his pawn but keeps playing with another card rolling the dice, if not the turn passes to the next player and so on.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Zaromba und der verhexte Wald
description:
The forest is on fire and all its animals and inhabitants are in big trouble. You have to save them and bring them to the dwarven castle.

The way into the dwarven castle is full of obstacles. You have to go through the cursed forest, in which the malicious gnome lives. He drives back all creatures which meet him in the burning forest. And at the end, you must find the right key to open the charmed gate to the dwarven castle.


Ages 6 and up

name: Mystical Circle
description: Players roll a die and move around a board to collect cards which when collected become a life reading
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Arguile
description: Arguile is an abstract strategy game with some similarities to checkers. One color plays red, the other black, and players can jump opposing pieces, including multiple jumps, as in checkers. The twist in Arguile is that each player also holds three cards, unknown to the opponent, which can be revealed on the player's turn to turn over all of the disks on a diagonal. The game is a combination of abstract spatial strategy, combined with timing the playing of one's cards for the optimal moment.

name: O Senhor dos Anéis: A Sociedade do Anel – A Guerra do Anel
description:
Name translates as "The Lord of the Rings - The Fellowship of the Ring - The War of the Ring".

The Fellowship tries to reach Mordor, while the forces of Evil try to stop them. Tiles with arrows determine direction of movement and attack, which may be reversed as long as counter-strike tiles are played by both players. Dummy tiles are used to hide the actual number of counter-strikes a player has.

Either side wins by defeating all enemies, but the Fellowship also wins if any member reaches Mordor.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: The Fonz: Hanging Out at Arnold's
description: The object of the game is to be ready with the right set of cards to meet the Fonz at the door. Spinning the spinner allows you to draw cards, swap a card with another player, or check the door. When you check the door, you open it and see if you have the correct set of three cards that match the Fonz's activity. If the Nerd is behind the door, you lose your set of three cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hornswoggle
description:
"Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to seek out your opponents and devastate them financially. You will assume the disguise of an attorney and the alias of your choice (Scooter Cohooter, Kid Fleece, L. Gotcha, or Sam Boozlebam). The rules and suggestions are only guidelines; you may operate on the principle that anything you can get away with is legal. In order to preserve the spirit of Hornswoggle, I recommend no mercy be extended to those players in dire financial straits."

Hornswoggle was designed to capture the essence and true spirit of the legal system. Certain modifications were necessary to make the game function logically (unlike the real thing)."

"Objective: To have the most money on deposit in the Swiss Bank after the game ends. You will accomplish this by suing your opponents. One third of your profits will be deposited in your Swiss Bank account."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: Tall Stories
description:
Tall Stories involves rolling two dice and moving a counter (shared by all players) around a board according to the result. The board spaces all describe themes. One die is red, the other is white. A card is drawn and the red and white dice specify two words on that card. A one minute timer is turned and you have that long to tell a story covering the theme you landed on and incorporating the two words you rolled.

It is the job of other players to identify which two words you rolled. The words of course bear no particular relevance to the theme and hiding them on the spot involves the creation of the most colorfully chaotic tales with impromptu decoy words thrown in as fast as possible.

The system of reward has gone lost to me, as have the rules, and I'm unsure of how points are scored, except to say that there is a 1-10 scoring bar in the game. How it is used I don't know.

I have written Crown and Andrews but they have been unable to find any records.

name: Fun Funky Fingernails
description: A game targeted at young girls (Ages 6 and up). Players move around the game board collecting fingernails. The first player to collect the gold nail plus 9 funky nails (and no chipped nails) wins.

name: Northwest Passage!
description: Game of bringing oil by ice-breaking tanker from Alaska to Humble City through the Northwest Passage. Whatever happened to the S.S. Manhattan, the world's largest ice-breaking tanker?

name: Monopoly: Betty Boop
description:
The same game-play mechanics as the original monopoly, but the game has been given a Betty Boop themed make-over!

The game includes 6 pewter game tokens. Betty, Pudgy the dog, a lipstick, a pen & ink well, a clapperboard and a motorcycle.
The regular monopoly money is now called 'Betty Bucks' and feature a portrait of Betty.
The properties are different Betty Boop films, comic strips and artwork.
Houses and hotels become art exhibits and museums.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, The Op Games

name: Sir Ring-A-Lot
description: This is a childrens motorized action game. There were 4 different games each packaged separately possessing a different theme. This is the medieval themed game Sir Ring-A-Lot. Collectively, the games were called T.H.I.N.G.S. or Totally Hillarious Incredibly Neat Games of Skill. Ages 5 and up for 1 or more players. Basically, you push on the tower which pushes the knight up allowing the player to "spear" the rings that are picked up by the flying bats rotating around the castle. From the box: "Capture the Rings from the Fly-By-Knight Bats!"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Medieval, Real-time

name: Der Schuh des Manitu: Das Kartenspiel
description: A card game to the famous German movie "Der Schuh des Manitou". Wild West theme. The cards have the design from the movie, very nice to look at. The goal is to earn the most bunny - chips. ( yes - bunny chips, because in the movie one of the Indians wears a bunny costume)

name: Newsmaker
description: 3 different rules for this game. Your are a newspaper publisher. Your goal is to publish a lot of different, expensive newspapers in low time.

name: Fishing
description:
Pepys game in which players compete to land the greatest weight of fish.

The game board represents a stretch of English countryside divided into a grid of 26 x 37 squares. Winding along the bottom end of the board is a river into which the 34 fish counters (of quarter, half and one pound varieties) are placed. The players start the game from the Fisherman's Arms inn and take turns rolling a standard die to move their pawn across the fields to reach the river. Once at the riverbank, a player can announce he is casting for any fish which is in a direct line (including diagonally) from his pawn. If his die roll is equal to the number of squares between his pawn and the fish, the catch is made and the counter is removed from the board and placed in front of him. Many fish, particular the half pound and one pound types, can only be caught by wading in the river, a process much slower than walking.

Any time a six is thrown on the die, a Hazard card is drawn and the instructions followed. These range from missing turns in order to light your pipe or chat with a farmer, to moving your pawn to Parson's Field so you can 'meet a friend'. When the last Hazard card has been drawn, no more fishing is allowed and the players instead make their way back to the inn as quickly as possible. Players score one point for each quarter pound of fish they caught and the first three players back to the inn score an additional three, two and one points respectively.

Although a terribly simple game with little skill involved, the board has a certain charm, evoking images of lazy, summer days in the country.

name: Kubus
description: Kubus is yet another 3D tic-tac-toe game, but with a more interesting set of components than usual. The "board" is a plastic cube divided into nine columns, into which players drop plastic cubes with "O" and "X" each on three sides. This means that you are making several plays at once, some for your opponent. The object is to make the most rows.

name: The Game of Guided Missile
description: The Game of Guided Missile is basically a small box about 8 ½" x 11" with a sturdy and shiny cardboard insert inside, folded to produce a play AND 2 scoring areas. The play area / board has pictures of various planes sitting on the ground at the airport, and there are holes in the board. The object is to spin a small metal top, trying to get it to land on a hole that sits on a picture of one of the planes, "bombing", and thereby eliminating them.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Wargame
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley, Somerville Ltd.

name: Double Dragon
description: The winner is the first player to successfully fight his or her way around the game board to Jimmy's Hideout to rescue Marian. You will pass through the slum section, the industrial section, the forest section and the hideout section on the rocky road to victory.

name: Cabbage Patch Kids: Friends to the Rescue
description: In this game, you must help rescue the kids from the clutches of Cabbage Jack. The delightful Bunny Bees will help you lead the kids to safety. And finally Colonel Casey, the kindly old stork, will help you bring the kids home. Collect 4 kids, each with a different color hair, or all the same color, and you're the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spaghetti Junction
description:
The board is an 8 by 8 checkerboard, with the central four squares blanked out. Each corner has a road bend and is the starting point for each of the players. The objective is to lay tiles, representing sections of road, in such a way as to build a road which starts at one's corner, loops round the center of the board and comes back to the start point.

Inevitably each players road becomes entangled with other players' roads. The trick is to try to co-opt other's road sections while hindering other players. Dead ends and enclosed loops are not allowed so there is always a potential path for all players.

Somewhat similar to Metro and Tsuro.

name: So Sue Me!
description: So Sue Me! is the game where you sue your friends, take their stuff and enjoy the wackiness of today's lawsuits. In So Sue Me! players acquire businesses in order to get income. But just like real life, any business you own also means you are taking a risk of being sued. Spin the spinner, and if you land on your own business you collect money. But if I land on your business, I am likely to SUE YOU! Five decks of lawsuit cards tell me why I might want to sue, and suggest different amounts for lawsuits. The backs of the cards, which are unseen by other players show the odds of winning suits at different levels. So only I know the odds of winning my suit against you. But look out! You may have an Unfair Advantage card, which acts as an odds modifier. Only you know what your UA card says, so we will have to bluff our way to a settlement, or go to trial...
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Match and Spell
description: Children learn which letters go with which word - an important prerequisite for reading. Self-correcting letter/picture cards invite players to sharpen their matching and spelling skills. The various games suit different age-appropriate stages for fun while learning. The first to assemble all his or her assigned animals and spell their names wins.

name: Life in Colonial Williamsburg
description: Step back in time! This exciting game is a virtual visit to Williamsburg. First, choose one of eight characters: merchants, milliner, tavern keeper, slave... Then, with the roll of a die, explore the colonial capital. Stop at points of interest, experience everyday and historic events and collect Colonial LifeTokens along the way. The first to collect all seven wins! Category cards--Meet the People, Colonial Events and Pages in History--add spice to the game with questions and commands. Be careful--you might wind up in the stocks, or even on trial at the Capital. Three levels of play; great fun for Ages 8 and up.

name: Word Trek
description:
Word Trek: An Adventure from Start to Finish!

Inspired by Lewis Carroll

By the creators of Tangoes

Contains two decks of cards in a plastic case (VHS-like, but smaller). Provides 216 word puzzles and solutions. Can be played solo as a puzzle, or with groups (parties, travel -- "Word Trek makes a family trip fun!").

From the publisher's website:

A Word Trek Puzzle is a pair of words with the same number of letters (For Example: dog / cat). The objective is to transform one word into another word, through step-by-step transformations. Using paper and pencil, players either change or rearrange (anagramming) one letter from the first word to make another valid word. (For Example: dog, dot, cot, cat.) WORD TREK develops logical thinking while building vocabulary and improving spelling skills.

name: Himmel und Hölle
description: Very light dice rolling game based on pachisi mechanics, but played on a 15x15 grid. When rolling doubles player must send one of his pieces to hell from where it must be saved by reaching a certain square with another piece.

name: The Right Moves
description: Win by filling all 4 spaces of the inner circle with your pieces, or by eliminating enough of your opponent's pieces so that your opponent cannot complete the inner circle. Players start with 18 pieces each.

name: Nickelodeon SpongeBob Squarepants Game
description: Race around Bikini Bottom with Spongebob, Sandy, Patrick and Squidward. Roll the die and move from your start (pineapple for Spongebob, Easter Island head for Squidward, etc). Move around the board following the instructions printed on each bubble space you land on. The first player to collect 8 gold coins and go to the Krusty Krab wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Klick
description:
From the rulebook:
2-6 persons can take part in this funny dexterity game. It is about gaining points by fishing sticks from a heap by means of a magnetic stick, which requires a steady hand, good memory and a sharp eye.

A simple Pick Up Sticks variant with magnetic sticks. Every stick is magnetic at only one end. You may continue to try to get one of the sticks as long as you can pull a stick out of the heap. You lose your turn either by choosing an nonmagnetic end of a stick or being by having chosen a stick which is too heavy for the magnet to pull out. At the end of the game every stick you got counts points according to its color.
publishers: Kärnan, R.J.M. Exports, Schmidt International, Schmidt Spiele

name: Car Capers
description: There are 12 super performance cars to complete. Players throw the dice to collect parts and piece together as many cars as possible. The player with the most cars wins the game. Players can also steal a car from each other.
publishers: Rocket Toys and Games, Spear's Games

name: Imse Vimse spindel
description:
First players make their spider weave a web by rolling a color die and then turning over a web tile. If the tile has the right color, the player may add it to their web. Once they have six tiles, the spider begins to climb. Each turn, a player rolls a weather die for their spider. If it's sunny it climbs one step. If it rains, the spider is washed to the bottom of the web again.

Contents:
- 24 wooden raindrop and spider web tiles
- 1 spider web game board
- 4 plastic spiders
- 1 color die
- 1 weather die
- 1 measuring rule

name: Name That Tune
description:
Each player takes three cards. One Music Card side up; the others Magic Melody side up. Each card is a Bingo card with song titles in place of numbers. A long-playing record is played and those who can identify each song as it is played should cover that title with a marker if the song is on their card. Any player who can cover five songs in a row on one’s own Music Card wins the round. Certain songs on the record are designed Magic Melody songs. Those songs when identified correctly can take the place of the fifth title when a player has four in a row.

A second edition of the game was released in 1959 with a change in the rules. The Magic Melody cards were replaced with a spinner. This spinner gives each player three random free spaces.

The game is based on the popular television series of the same name. Host George De Witt is pictured on the box of each game.

The 1959 edition includes album, check sheet, 10 bingo music cards, spinner, 100 orange wooden covering pieces.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: The Mansion of Happiness
description:
The first board game commercially produced in the United States however, the distinction is awarded to Travellers' tour through the United Statesof 1822.

The object of the game is to be the first player to travel around the spiral track and reach the Mansion of Happiness at the center of the board. The Mansion of Happiness was based on the Puritan world view. Even game mechanics were influenced by the Puritan view. A spinner or a top-like teetotum, for instance, was utilized in children's board games rather than dice, which were then associated with Satan and gambling.The game track is populated with virtuous deed spaces like Honesty and Temperance (which move players forward to eternal happiness) and vices such as cruelty and ingratitude (that move players backward)

The game's rules note:

"WHOEVER possesses PIETY, HONESTY, TEMPERANCE, GRATITUDE, PRUDENCE, TRUTH, CHASTITY, SINCERITY...is entitled to Advance six numbers toward the Mansion of Happiness. WHOEVER gets into a PASSION must be taken to the water and have a ducking to cool him... WHOEVER posses[ses] AUDACITY, CRUELTY, IMMODESTY, or INGRATITUDE, must return to his former situation till his turn comes to spin again, and not even think of HAPPINESS, much less partake of it."

Board measures 18 1/2" X 15" with split in middle of board (two pieces).
1843 game board copyright Thayer & Co's Lithog Boston

Publishing History

W. & S. B. Ives of Salem, Massachusetts (1843)
Parker Brothers (1894)
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Parker Brothers, W. & S. B. Ives

name: Weg Damit!
description: Weg Damit! is a many-against-one war (& peace) game - one player plays the army, the others the anti-militant women trying to blow up the army base. The anti-militants win if they blow up the army base; the army player wins if the end of game is reached with the base safe.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: His & Hers
description: His & Hers plays off the relationships between men and women. The basic idea is that players are given a letter of the alphabet and an innocent, unbiased question. Players must then think like the opposite sex and create responses that their teammates will be able to guess - all in 30 seconds.

name: Flight Captain
description:
Each player is the Flight Captain of a fleet of 747 Jet-Liners. Can you send them around the world safely and bring them home ahead of the jets racing against you? It's not as easy as you think...Just when you are about to reach your destination, another jetliner overtakes you and back you go. Flight Captain sharpens your wits. To win takes both luck and strategy so fasten your seat belts and let's take off.

-- From inside cover.

This game plays much like the game "Sorry". It has a plastic encased die that determines movement. Each player has 4 planes they move around and race to their destinations. You have to roll a "1" or "6" to get your plane "Departure Area", and when you overtake a plane, you "Bump" them (send them back to start). READ: Sorry set to jetliners.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Initialize: The Game of Initials & Fun
description: From the publisher: You're on the edge of your seat...waiting to stop the timer before time runs out...waiting to steal the answer from your opponent. Initialize (TM). Race against time to guess the meaning of initials like RBI, ELO, MPH, GWTW, SNL. You'll be guessing the names of movies, TV shows and cartoons, musicians and songs, sports figures and teams - and a hodgepodge of abbreviations. The faster you guess, the more you score! But don't despair if you haven't a clue to the answer - cause you'll get one automatically!

name: La Croisière de l'Aphrodite
description:
A magazine game from Jeux et Stratégie #29.

Players try to create couples aboard a luxurious cruise. Of course, there are many people on board that can spoil the fun.

name: Connoisseur
description:
Connoisseur is a game based on the wine industry. Each player takes the part of an international wine shipper.

The players travel round a board using dice, in the usual way, matching GRAPE cards they collect along the way to WINE cards that they have to purchase (52 wines labels, of which only 3 are available at any time(face up)). By obtaining a matching GRAPE and WINE label, and buying a LICENSE, the player can then produce that wine, which earns them money.

The object of the game is to establish monopolies - there are only 2 WINES for each region, and if the player can produce both, they own that region. Target for a short game (90 minutes) is 3 monopolies, while a normal game (2-3 hours) is 6 monopolies.

This is not a simple roll and move game, as there is a certain amount of economics in the game - the value of everybody's wine is dependent on the VINTAGE, which changes periodically.

There is no need to have a knowledge of wine, as the information on what grape makes what wine is provided on the cards. So unlike "The Wine Game", which tests your knowledge of wine, "Connoisseur" actually teaches you about it.

The game is well produced, with a nice board, printed in colour, and very nicely finished cards and playing pieces.

name: TV-Opoly
description:
From the back of the box:

The board game that challenges you to become television's newest and most talked-about mogul! The object is to build your media empire as you buy, sell, trade and produce prime time dramas, daytime soaps, news magazines, game shows and lots more . . . from the classics of early TV to today's hits such as ER, Friends, the Flinstones, Cops, 60 Minutes, MASH, Home Improvement, Sliders, etc

Increase the value of your holdings as players land on your shows! Suffer setbacks from poor reviews! Collect big bucks when your shows go into syndication! Pay out costs when production is delayed! Attract advertising dollars when ratings go up! See what the future holds when you turn over a NEWS FLASH or RATINGS & RUMORS CARD! . . . All that and more awaits you as you face the ups and downs of the world's most exciting business! If you've got what it takes to make a name for yourself in television -- the most money, the highest rated shows and control of the board -- then you win TV*Opoly!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tank Battle
description: Not related to the other Milton Bradley game of the same name, Tank Battle is one of the "Flipsiders" games that resembles an audio cassette until you "flip" the game open. The object is to destroy the other players tank. On a turn you spin the 2 spinners. Spinner A tells you how far you must move. Spinner B indicates how far you can fire. All firing must be done in a straight line (i.e. you can't shoot diagonally). If spinner B points to a number that is greater than the number of spaces between you and your opponent, you score a hit. Each tank has 7 hit points. Blow up your opponents tank to win the game.

name: Gum Guys
description: In this bizarre game, you take a "Silly Putty" like substance and use a mold to shape it into a Gum Guy. Plastic feet, arms and a hook on the head are inserted into the Guy and you hang it from a bar at the back of a plastic desk (gum under the desk, get it?). On your turn, you roll a die which instructs you to either add (or remove) weights to yours, or your opponent's Guy. As weights are added, the Guys begin to stretch downwards. The player whose Guy hits the ground first loses.

name: Visst är Ni sjuk...
description: You are admitted to the hospital where you try to avoid the wrong pills and bad advice from the doctors while your time is divided between rehab and the bed.

name: Monopoly: Dresden
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Dresden, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Hamburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Hamburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Nürnberg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Nürnberg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Stars of Europe
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to visit all the capitals in Europe. Once in the capital you need to answer a question in order to advance. When this is done you gain a star. The first player to collect all the stars wins.

Awards

1991 Årets Voksenspil, Adult Game of the Year Denmark

name: Bolibompa spelet
description: Roll and move game based on Swedish TV character.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokari
description:
Play 25 different games with this special deck and the Pokari die. Games includes variations of Poker, Gin Rummy, Solitare, and games unique to Pokari!

Includes special Pokari deck of 70 cards, Pokari row die, and instructions
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Trading, Trick-taking
publishers: Creative Learning Associates, Warren Paper Products Co.

name: The Puppy Game
description:
From the box: Scooter is all set for a busy day on the farm, discovering all the interesting things to be found there. Scooter sniffs high and low until he finds everything. Sometimes his friend Skippy joins him in the game.

Help Scooter the puppy find the hidden pictures.

Ages 4 - 8

name: Profit$ of the Airwaves
description:
From the Manual (with spelling intact);
"Hallelujah breetheren! Heeere, is your opportunity to aid in the salvation of sowels, and to pockit some cold, hard cash. Ahhlll, at the same time! In this four player game, you wa-ill play thuh pahrt of a Tee Vee Evangelist and attempt to accumulate a vast, personal fortune (and, oh yes, spa-red the good word too!) by reaching out to people's hearts and pocket books over the airwaves."

This game comes with a small booklet containing the rules, the cover of which has the board printed on the inside, counters necessary and a small die.
The players take the roles of TV Evangelists, in a humorous way, to get to the last space on the board while getting the most money.
It has fairly simple gameplay. A player rolls the die to move. If the space the player lands on has a "?" the player then chooses which of a number of choices for that space he gets. Or, if the space doesn't have a "?" he rolls on the chart for that space and takes the effect corresponding to that roll. Once a player gets to the last space "Your Final REWARD!!" on an exact roll (if a roll would move you beyond that, you go back a space) the player with the largest bank account ,counted in billions, wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: QUMERO
description:
The game comes with 4 boards marked with a 50 square grid which has the numbers 1 to 6 going down the board and the letters Q U M E R O going across the board horizontally. Each player has transparent tiles which are used to cover the squares on the boards.

Each player starts the game with 10,000's worth of points tokens.

4 dice are used in the game 2 conventional D6's and 2 further 6 sided dice with the faces depicting the letters QUMERO.

On each player's turn he rolls all 4 dice and then using the combinations that appear covers some of his squares on his board. For example if a player rolls R Q 2 & 3 he can cover one of the following 4 alternatives: R3 & Q2; or Q3 & R2; or Q5 (adding together the 2 numbers); or R5.

Whenever a player is the first to complete a column, row or diagonal he is entitled to receive from all the other players the value of points that relate to it: 500 points for a horizontal row; 750 points for a vertical column; or 1000 points for either of the diagonals.

The game ends either when all combinations on the board are completed, or all but one player has run out of points tokens.

The winner of the game is the player with the most point tokens.

The game is further spiced up by the gaining of "Qumero" cards gained for rolling doubles, and "Double-Double" cards gained when rolling double-double (i.e. 2 identical numbers and 2 identical letters rolled in the same turn).

"Qumero" cards can be used as wild cards to cover a number or letter even though it is not thrown. "Double-double" cards are used to either double, triple or quadruple (depending on how many cards he holds) his score for any completed column.

name: Glücks-Käfer-Baum
description:
Beetles tree putting play game, with several play variants. Good for 2 players. Beetles have to get cherries, but there are not enough for all players. It becomes particularly exciting, if the luck beetles come into the play!

Contents: 1 three-part tree, 12 beetles, 2 luck beetles, 10 yellow and 10 green plugs, to 6 valuation disks (everything in wood)

Ages 3 and up

name: VEX
description:
Vex is a party game in a metal box, which comes with 102 cards and 1 die.

The Vexator (oldest Player) picks a card and manages the game, select another player for the Quest. That player is called the Vexant.

The Quest card has 6 quests. The die is used to select the Quest.

Cards:

Vex Max Cards and Vex Ray Cards - The Vexant must do the quest on the cards. If the Vexant resolves the Quest he gets the Card and becomes Vexator.
Vex Act Cards - The Vexant must act out a term on the card in 60 seconds. If the other players figure out what he portrays, he win the card and becomes Vexator
