Vex Why Cards - All players must give the Vexator a definition of a Thing. Whoever is closest gets the Card and is the new Vexator.
Vex Hero Cards - The player can use this card to select another player that must take the quest. The selected player gets the card.


Winner is the first player to collect 6 Cards.

In 2005 an expansion set of 50 cards was published.

name: Trench Wars
description: Trench Wars; Wargaming the Western Front 1916-1918, is a simple set of miniature rules from Old Glory Corp. The system is very simple, and quite enjoyable. Covers basic squads, tanks, gas attacks, infantry and cavalry, as well as light artillery.

name: Airborne!
description: A tactical game of airborne operations from 1930 to present. A variant of Jagdpanther's Marine! game.
categories: Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Hof
description:
Hof, at its most basic, is a 4-in-a-row game for two or three players, on a 6x6 board, using coloured dice as playing pieces. At its most complex it becomes a game in which players use identical sets of dice that all need to be manoeuvred into a sequential row, using the eyes to determine movement range.

At the start, players roll their own colour dice (6 in a two player game, 4 in a three player one). Then, in turn, players position these dice on an empty board space, one by one, and never altering the face value. When a player manages to create a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of 4 own dice, that player wins the round. The victor scores the total pip count of these dice, or the best dice string if the created row exceeds its required length. When all dice are on the board, and no row has been completed, players may move one own die per turn to an adjacent space, but not diagonally. The aim is to score the most points over a given number of rounds.

Anyone vaguely familiar with placement games won't find this much of a challenge, and for these players a couple of trickier variant rules are suggested. Any combination of these variants can be used, to eliminate randomness and increase complexity as desired.

- (2 player only:) to win, a row of 5 or even 6 is needed.
- players don't start by throwing the dice, but use identical sets instead (1-6 or 1-4).
- a winning row also needs to have the dice in the correct sequence, low to high.
- dice may be moved as many squares as their face value, allowing directional changes too.

The designer isn't credited, but in all likelihood it is Hans-Jörg Nürnberger, as Hanje was the vehicle for Hans-Jörg and Ursula Nürnberger's own designs.

PUBLICATION HISTORY:

1975 Hof Hanje Spiele-Atelier - out of print


As with some other Hanje games, the small box is made out of wood, and the board is printed on its lid.

Game seems to be part of the family called "Miniplays". There are 10 games numbered from 1 to 10 and two games with no number. HOF is one of the not numbered ones.

ADDITIONAL INFO:

language skill needed: language neutral. It comes with German rules.
english translation: none, but the above description should help.
awards won: none.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Polit Poker
description:
144 cards (double-sided) with quotes from the platforms of German political parties (CDU/CSU, SPD, Grüne, PDS, FDP).

In the first round (of three) all the players need to do is guess which quote belongs to which party. If you answer correctly, you get the card. Some rules (like the "Veto" rule) enhance gameplay.

In the second round, all players design a party platform with the cards at their disposal, and the players vote for the best one.

name: Chipmunks Superpopomatic 3-D Action Game
description: From the game box: "Join the Chipmunks and Chipettes in a frantic race to find the lost pirate treasure!" Marketed to take advantage of (or help promote) the Chipmunks' cartoon series from the 1980s.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fore!
description:
From the box: "Fore! is a golf board game everyone can enjoy. Whether your (sic) an avid golfer or have never set foot on the fairway, you'll find this game fun and challenging. Ages 8 and up."

Players roll dice to determine where their golf ball is hit each turn. Like real golf, turn order is determined by the order of hole completion.

name: PrimePak
description:
PrimePak - Four Card Games

Master multiplication, division and factoring skills while having fun playing card games with this unique deck of 171 cards. In all four games players form factor sets. Because 80 = 8 x 10, the numbers 80, 8 and 10 form a factor set. Factor sets can have more than three numbers. For example, the set 42, 3, 2 and 7 is also a factor set. Prime wild cards are used for prime numbers only. Adapts to 6 levels. For 1 to 6 players. Ages 7 to adult.

Prime Challenge - Players in turn form factor sets from a 12-card (or 10-card) foundation. Challenges are made by opponents when a player overlooks factor sets or makes a mistake.

Prime Solitare - To win, a player must clear a foundation by forming factor sets. This must be done before going through the draw pile once, one card at a time.

Factor Rummy - Holding a hand of 11 (or 10) cards, players try to be the first to fill their hand with factor sets.

Prime Canasta - A sophisticated Factor Rummy game. For serious game players.

SIX DECK LEVELS

The PrimePak deck of 171 cards adapts to many levels by removing certain cards. Six deck levels are defined in the rules booklet. Players play with deck level 1 (then 2 and 3) until they have mastered the multiplication facts. They continue playing at level 3 until they learn to think of numbers in factored form. The rules booklet includes important divisibility rules and factoring strategies.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Leximania
description: The dice determine whether players (or teams) i) try to guess a word from its definition and a few other clues or ii) compete in a BOGGLE-style word writing round. In the latter case, four dice with letters are rolled, and the players must write words at least five letters long that each contain all four letters on the dice. As in Boggle, the player (or team) with the most unrepeated words wins the round. The game winner is the first to the top of the pyramid on the playing board.

name: Zeros to Heros
description:
This game is created in Singapore by a training consultant.

(From the website):
Alpha-Plus Training has developed a learning tool, the Zeros-to-Heros Entrepreneurship board game that can ignite your enterprising spirit!

Be Your Own Boss & Achieve Business Success!
You start the game as an employee with ZERO capital and ZERO understanding of business. Take the exciting path to become your OWN BOSS and see whether you survive or become an entrepreneurial HERO.

The world’s 1st board game that engages the enterprising spirit that is based on a robust framework which enables the enterprising spirit.

name: Vampirino
description: The sneaky bats have escaped! Fly to their rescue with Mother Bat and bring them back to the cave! With luck and skill, be the first to catch four bats!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Commando Chess
description:
A chess variant using pieces based off of modern military units. There are seven types of pieces: infantry, calvary tanks, armor tanks, fighter planes, attack helicopters, bomber squadrons and a HQ Flag acting as the king.
The pieces have different movements from the standard chess game. The number of pieces is the same, 16 on each side, and the board is a standard 8x8. However, in living up to its name the game board has a camouflage background.
The ground units move and capture similar to chess pieces, but the three air unit types may jump over other pieces like the knights in chess. The bomber is a partial exception to this rule, it can only jump over pieces on its own side.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Apex
description:
An entry in the 2001 About.com 8x8 Game Design Competition.

Goal of the Game: The player wins who first connects his opposing sides of the board.

Each player 'owns' two opposing sides of the board. It is advised to mark the sides of each player (at least by placing all the pieces of the players on his sides only). The players may decide whether they want to place the board between them with the corners facing to them or whether they want to sit at an right angle with the sides toward them.

At the start of play the board is empty. One player starts the game. The play then alternates.

At each move the player whose turn it is has three options of play:


He can enter one of his pieces onto the board;
Move on of his pieces on the board; or
Capture an opposing piece with one of his own pieces on the board.


The player wins the game who is the first to get an uninterrupted line from one of his own sides of the board to his other (opposing) side.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: The '60s Edition
description:
Stock question card combines with 99 track CD and answer booklet. Some of the songs are British hits instead of American, but many of them are worldwide hits.

Can be played by itself or with a traditional Trivial Pursuit game.

name: Riistavisa
description: A Finnish trivia game about hunting, from hunters for hunters.

name: The Bicentennial Games
description:
A "Spirit of America" game. Three separate games recreating America's rise to independence. Game 1: Birth of a Revolution. Game 2: The Years of Crisis. Game 3: Independence. An officially licensed commemorative of the American revolution bicentennial administration.

There are two variations of play. In the first, the players just move across the board and collect points for being the first person to reach specific squares. In the second version the points are only awarded after the player successfully answers a history question. The paths across the board branch and reconnect allowing the players to choose a path that will offer them more chances for points or a speedier trip across the board. The boards are decorated with scenes from the American Revolution time period as well as historic dates and events.

name: Pairs or Better
description:
From the back of the box:

"The object of the game is to collect cards to form a five-card poker hand by landing on designated squares along the edges of the board, and then to exit the game. The player to exit a hand worth two pairs or better ends the round and wins half the pot; the holder of the highest hand wins the other half."

"Pairs of Better uses the YOUR WAY playing system which provides highly interactive play with all players in competition right to the end."

According to their web site, all the inventor's profits go towards helping emerging opera artists, by way of supporting the Canadian Opera Company Ensemble Studio!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Venerable Destruction
description: This is a simulation of the final battle between the forces of Good and Evil on the planet Venerable. The weaponry is akin to that used in 15th or 16th century earth warfare. A bit of Magic is thrown in occasionally and the units sport somewhat 'colorful' names, e.g. The "Foul" "Lowest of the Low" Fetor and the Sycophant for the forces of Evil AND "Khan" "Harem" and "El Touche" for the forces of Good, among others. Although it is a 2-sided battle, actually many players can participate by being granted control by the supreme leader of each side; so even in excess of 10 players could theoretically participate in the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Africa 1483
description:
Africa 1483 is both a stand alone game and expansion for Europe 1483. Can be combined with Europe 1483 game map to allow up to 46 players in a single game.
Comes with a 40" x 24" color game map, rule booklet, 324 plastic playing tokens, 1D10 and territory control markers.

name: Tarzan to the Rescue
description: A very basic roll-and-move game in which players race through the jungle to be the first to find the Golden Temple. The players roll two dice and move their pawn the number on one of them and an opponent of their choice the other. Red squares on the board block progress unless rescued by Tarzan. This is accomplished by spinning a special spinner on the player's next turn. If Tarzan is visible at all under the window on the spinner, the player can continue on with their turn. If not, they stay put and try again their next turn.

name: Kellogg's Par 3 Golf
description:
From the rules page:

"If you don't know or understand golf, this game will teach you. If you do know golf, this game will be a challenge to your knowledge and ability."

This is a one-page insert that came with a Kellogg's product (Pop-Tarts, I believe) and, despite the name of the publisher, is not a computer game. Play results are determined by drawing cards from a standard deck of cards, instead of using dice.

This is just one in a series of about 6 sports games distributed this way.

name: Man the Lifeboat
description:
From the Game Rules:

"Man the Lifeboat" is an exciting, fast moving Family Game where the players in effect become the Coxswain of the Lifeboat, responding to Mayday Signals of Vessels in Distress. The game also serves as a tribute to the men of the Royal National Lifeboat Institution whose real life endeavors were the inspiration behind this game.

Man The Lifeboat’ is an exciting fast moving game for all the family (player age 7+).

Contents
1 PLAYING BOARD
2 DRIFT DICE (2D10 marked N,S,E,W,NE,SE,NW,SW,Anchor,Sunk)
2 CO-ORDINATE DICE (2D20 in Red,Black)
4 LIFEBOAT DICE (4D6 in Orange,Yellow,Green,Blue)
1 DICE CUP
4 ‘ALL WEATHER’ LIFEBOATS (Orange,Yellow,Green,Blue)
4 ‘INFLATABLE’ LIFEBOATS (Orange,Yellow,Green,Blue)
2 VESSELS IN DISTRESS (One black, One Red)
24 CARDS (Vessels rescued)
4 SERVICES RENDERED HOLDERS (for recoding rescues)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Halcyon Games, San Serif Print Promotions Ltd (Serif)

name: First Strike
description: From the front of the box: "First Strike: A fast action game of superpower conquest. Return to the cold war crisis. Checker style play with dog fights, tank assaults, and infantry combat."

name: Strike It Lucky
description:
Strike it Lucky

FROM THE BOX: Strike it Lucky is the authentic game of ITV's successful quiz show, hosted by Michael Barrymore. In the game, players accumulate money by moving around the board and correctly answering questions. When a player has won E4,000 all the players race across the TV screens trying to get to the other side without hitting too many Hot Spots. The player with the most money is the winner.

Strike it Rich

FROM THE BOX: Strike it Rich blends excitement with risk as you race your way across the board answering questions and avoiding the Hot Spots.

(NOTE: The game includes the original 'Hot Spot' sound module.)

Based on the hit ITV quiz show from the UK of the same name from 1986 to 1996 (and much later as Michael Barrymore's Strike it Rich from 1996 to 1999) hosted by Michael Barrymore, which in turn is based on the short-lived, 1986-87 American game show called Strike it Rich hosted by the late Joe Garagiola.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
publishers: Britannia Games, The Parker Games Co Ltd

name: Fairyland Princess
description:
From the "Shirley Barber's Fairies" world so popular among Australian five year old girls. Players move around a board by rolling dice and then by landing on the correct spaces need to , in order: bring their six butterflies into their garden, move their fairy into the garden and then collect the stars from the Queen Fairy. The player with the most stars wins the game.

The game recommends for ages 4+ although there is some text on the board.

From the game box:

The world of Fairyland comes to life in this fun butterfly game for 2-6 players. Catch all your butterflies and then aim for the golden stars and ultimately The Queen Fairy!

name: Ring Around the Rosy
description:
The "hand in hand" matching game. These cheerful children are making a big circle to play Ring Around the Rosy. Can you help them line up? You can put two children together if their hands can touch and if they're wearing the same color mittens.

To play: Each player takes the same number of children. On your turn, try to add one of your children to either end of the chain that's forming. Try to be the first to get all your children into the chain to win.

Contents: 30 figures of children with mittens, 30 stands, game rules.

name: Piepmatz
description: Players try to move their birds to the top of the tree by drawing their worms from the spaghetti-like pile. From the box: "The exhausted little birds come back from their first flight. Eating some worms will make them strong enough to try and join their nest. But the nest boughs sometimes get overcrowded and the last hop into the nest does not always succeed.

name: Road Race Game
description: Four player game. Game comes with four small race car playing pieces. The playing board is divided into 100 squares with a track running through them. Some squares have advantage, some squares have penalties. Roll and move around this track. First player to the finish line wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Take Away Game
description:
You are a buyer for a Big Building in the States, for example, the Empire State Building or the Pentagon. It is your job to supply the building with beautiful and affordable lounge suites. The aim of the game is to collect Seats and Sofas lounge suites in six different colors for your building. However, to do this, you only have a limited amount of dollars at your disposal. The player who is the first to collect at least one lounge suite token in all six colors for his building is the winner of the game.
It is a game specially developed for a giant seller of furniture: Seats and Sofas.
Rules in Dutch and English.
There is a version with rules and cards in English and French.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Book of Mormon Jungle Journey
description:
From the publisher:

In this exciting board game, you must brave the dangers of the jungle in a race through the lands of the Book of Mormon. Your expedition has set out to find the temple in the land of bountiful, and you never know what dangers or discoveries await you in the mysterious jungles ahead. Wild animals, murmuring natives, wicked kings, and secret combinations could be hiding along the path. Or if you're lucky, you could run into some heroes from the Book of Mormon who will help you on your way. A perfect game for family and friends, Jungle Journey uses familiar Book of Mormon people and events to teach and entertain.

Ages 4 and up.

name: Mickey tovert met vormen
description:
Together with Mickey you have to try to find your way trough the magic forest. But watch out for the magic tower, he can get in your way.
The theme has nothing to do with the game. It is just an abstract game for children.
You have a board with 8*8 squares. They show circles, triangles or squares. These figures are also on the dice. You have to try to move from on corner of the board to the other. Instead of playing your pawn, you can move the tower to an empty space to get in the way of your opponents.
The beginning age on the box is four years.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trap-Em!
description:
Trap-Em - The African Safari Game. Listed and pictured in Malloy's American Games: A Comprehensive Collector's Guide

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

Game where players are professional hunters, trying to make money hunting animals.
Earn more money to take them alive for zoos, dead give less money.
Hunters receive cablegrams from museums and zoos make attactive money offers.
Components:
Twenty wild african animals,board,12 cablegrams,4 plastic hunters,money and roulette for movement.

name: Se og Hør: Det store sladderspil
description:
As paparazzi photographer, you are hunting for the best pictures of famous and/or royal people.
You get points if you can guess who is hiding behind the mustache, hat or sunglasses, and if you can answer questions about them.
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Egmont Litas, Litas Spil

name: Captain Moroni's Spy Game
description:
Taken from the back of the box:

We are Lamanites living in the Ancient American Rainforest, about 74 B.C. We are at war with the Nephites, and in a war strategy meeting to discuss how to defeat our enemy. But the Nephite leader, Captain Moroni, has sent spies to infiltrate our ranks. We must expose this impostor!

SpyWars Captain Mornoi's Spy Game is a fun social LDS cardgame set in Book of Mormon times. It's interactive play will entertain your family and friends for hours. The simple rules and popular theme make it the perfect activity for Family Home Evenings and get-togethers of all ages.

name: Cavaleiros do Rei
description:
The players are the king's knights who attempt to rescue the princess from the Cursed Castle. They must battle the evil Morgana, but Merlin may help them.

It's a basic roll-and-move game, but the paths may change every turn by means of a gear system based on a colored die roll. Players race to be the first to reach the princess imprisoned in the center of the board.

name: Monopoly: University of Newcastle Upon Tyne
description: The classic Monopoly with elements from the University of Newcastle Upon Tyne, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Derbyshire Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Derbyshire, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Geheime Mission
description: Players are spies trying to steal secret plans by playing cards into either the town or one of the embassies. Cards have 3 different values depending on the location /function they're played.

name: Cranium Squawkbox: Pirate's Passage
description: Square cards are used to create a layout of paths through a square "ocean" with the box (which is also the goal square of the game) at the center. The players' home islands/ starting squares are at the corners. The game's box is a molded plastic affair containing a voice chip; in turn, players push a button on top to hear a pirate voice give commands such as Rotate a card, Flip a card, Sail the Seas (move one space if you can), etc. First player to reach the treasure with his or her ship pawn is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Memory, Nautical, Pirates, Puzzle

name: The Ultimate TV Trivia Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Can you tell the time by what TV show is on? Are you more familiar with the floor plan of the Brady Bunch house than your own? Did you fake an illness in order to stay home and watch Luke and Laura's wedding? If so, those countless hours spent vegging out in front of the TV are finally going to come in handy! The Ultimate TV Trivia Game features over 1000 questions from the classic shows of yesteryear right up to Ages 12 the current hits of today. Who coined the phrase, "Kids, do not try this at home?" What do members of the undercover A-Team have in common? On the Anna Nicole show, who is Sugar Pie? The answers? Evil Knievel, They were AWOL Vietnam Veterans, and Anna's dog. Players race to be the first to answer 7 TV trivia questions correctly and reach his or her recliner. If you carefully plot out your turns in Trivial Pursuit to land on "pink" in hopes of answering a Three Stooges question, then it might be time to invest in a game where ALL the questions are on your favorite subject: Television! Game comes with Game Cards, TV Scoring Tokens, Game Board, Moving Piece, Die and Game Instructions. For 2 or more players or teams, Ages 12 and up.

name: My First Alphabet Game
description: From the publisher: This game for 1-4 players Ages 3 - 5 is designed to help preschool children learn the alphabet and recognize the associated letter sounds. Developed in association with early learning consultants, this package contains 4 sturdy game boards featuring photographic images, 36 easy-to-read letter tiles, and an easy-to-follow instruction sheet with a helpful note to parents and teachers.

name: English Soccer Manager: Two Page Wars
description: Pick one of eight fictional teams in England and lead them to a victorious football season. Using two pages, one for counters and one for a map you will have to attempt to manage your team in the most effective manner while keeping an eye on your cash flows.
categories: Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Print & Play, Sports

name: Ritter Kunibert im Zahlenland
description: Children's game (Ages 4 - 7) in which players must help the good knight Kunibert catch the evil Zahlenteufel ("number devil") by solving simple math problems.

name: Monopoly: Super Bowl XXXII
description: This is the first NFL authorized Monopoly edition, and also the first Super Bowl Monopoly game. Comes with 8 football-themed computer tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Battle of the Sexes: Bedroom Edition
description:
This is the adult version of the game battle of the sexes. The object is for foe two teams (Boys vs Girls) to get across the board by answering gender based risque and revealing questions.

A fun party game if you have the right mix for the teams.

name: Trailblazer
description:
Do you know what Canada's motto is? Or how long it takes for the tide to go out at the Bay of Fundy? Where did Percé Rock get its name? What is the provincial flower of Alberta?

These are all questions that you will find the answers to in the game TRAILBLAZER. This game is produced by the Trans Canada Trail Foundation in order to raise funds for the world's longest recreational trail.

TRAILBLAZER is a four player board game that is a great way for families to spend time together. The questions are trivia based and each question card has five questions. The player chooses the difficulty level (1-5) and then the question is read. Points are given according to the difficulty of the question. There are a wide variety of topics covered in the game such as geography, history, flora, fauna, and transportation. There are also adventure and treasure cards.

Related to:

Trailblazer
publishers: Fitzhenry & Whiteside Ltd., Outdoor Adventure Canada

name: The Friendly Farm Domino
description: The Friendly Farm Domino (Domino de la ferme de Foin-Foin, in french) is a domino game for children 3 and up. Dominos have 2 sides: one with horseshoes (instead of dots), and one with farms animal (for younger children). It's played like regular dominos except the farmer is a wildcard (on the other side, there is no zero, but a star, which is also a wildcard).

name: Itsy Bitsy Spider
description: Designed for 4 year olds, the reversible, simple puzzle game board is assembled as a drainpipe. By rolling the die and using either colors or shapes, the winner is the first to get their spider to the top of the drainpipe.

name: Battle
description:
From the Rules: The object of the game is to take the sector of enemy territory by capturing your opponent's men, guns and tanks with the least possible loss of of your own playing pieces.

Each player controls a similar territory and is given 11 men, 2 tanks, 2 anti-tank guns and 1 pontoon bridge (abstract pieces). All pieces are placed in the friendly sector at the closest end of the gameboard and alternately players are allowed to place a game piece on the main map next to a previously placed piece or move one that is already placed.

Pieces may not be placed in enemy territory until the bridge has been placed over the river. Captures are made when an enemy unit is between two friendly units. Alternately the guns and tanks may kill a piece at range (2 or 3 spaces straight ahead depending on the piece). When no more moves may be made, the player to make the last move wins. All-Fair created two games with the same map and pieces but with different covers, the second was called GHQ.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II

name: Fantastic Four Encounter With Doom
description: Choose either the Fantastic Four or Doctor Doom. Use your attack cards to wipe out your opponent's hit points or your strategy cards to attack multiple times. Defend cards are your only way to hold on to those hit points!

name: Vilda vikingar
description:
Vilda Vikingar.

Who will best lead their Vikings on a dangerous trip and defeat other Vikings and bring back the gold? Use your bone to move your Viking and battle with the struggle cards.

A family game that will give you a lot of excitement and action.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
80 goldtiles
12 struggle cards
12 Vikings
4 playing bones
1 rule sheet
mechanics: Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Dice²
description:
Dice² is a collection of 4 small dice games, all based on the same principle:
The dice are successively rolled and placed with one edge adjacent to the smallest die already played. Lines of numbers must develop, increasing from left to right and from top to bottom.

spielbox edition #82, published in issue 6/2007.

name: Kobold & Co
description:
The players discover an unknown island where goblins live. At the and of the island visit they get treasures from the goblins which have to be found around the island. The goblins however have fun trying to disturb the players during their search for the treasure.
The player who has found the most treasures is the winner.

name: Top Of The Pops Game
description:
The object of Top of The Pops is to be the most successful manager by achieving 1 million record sales from your pop acts, and thereby winning the gold disc. The number of acts you get onto the charts and how high they reach establishes your sales levels.

Contents:
Playing board spinner
Top Ten chart
Record contract cards
Record release cards
Chart News cards
Sales cards
Pop Act tabs (plus blanks)
Silver discs
Gold disc
Radio Plug cards

name: Landrush
description:
Your goal is to have the longest, highest value tract of land because the player with the highest score wins. Players draw tokens from a bag to determine where they are allowed to play their pyramids and attempt to take control of a tract of their neighbor's land.

Game System

Piecepack Game System
Icehouse Game System

name: Zen
description:
Zen is a stacking game -- or tower building game -- where players stack inverted funnels on top of one another.

Before placing a new piece, the active player can actually manipulate the stack in the hopes of achieving the proper balance in preparation for the play.

Multiple Zen sets allow for players to race against one another to see who can get the highest stack in the allotted time.

name: Maisy's colourful counting game
description:
The aim is very simple, to help Maisy race along to meet her friends in this colour-matching and counting game. Two ways to play depending upon the players skill level by using either the colour spinner or the number dice to advance. Spin the spinner and get a colour, move to the next square of that coulour. Roll the dice and get a number, move that number of squares, but don't get caught behind the gate!

Ages 3 and up
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wonder Strike: The Game of International Soccer
description:
The game of International Soccer!

Features Hundreds of clubs from all countries rated in offensive & defensive ability. Each club is rated for their performance at home, away and on neutral ground. Teams are also given an overall performance rating.

Game engine utilizes fast action cards.

74 different offense charts provide for a variety of situations.

Score sheet and extra charts: track stats as you play with optional player selection system. If you have real team lineups, the following stats may be tracked: Shots, goals, shots on goal, saves, fouls, yellow/red cards, and tackles. Charts for direct free kicks, corner kicks, loose balls, shot locations, weather effects, and more.

Play matches between different divisions &/or national clubs, using the national ratings system. Rate your own teams with the included simple formula.

name: British Towns
description:
The deck consists of 44 cards depicting full color artwork of attractions and towns in mainland Britain. The game was published around 1960.

This is a set collecting game that has two different variations of play depending on how many players there are. There is one variation for 2 players, and another for 3 to 6 players.

name: Das Big Bobby Car Spiel
description: Typical race game for children with very cute cars and easy rules. Contents two different boards.

name: Pick and Mix People
description:
Laugh at the silly combinations as you mix and match these fun characters (a person is made up of three cards: head, body, and legs).

Contents

36 cards that make 12 complete characters: cook, hiker, clown, policewoman, cowgirl, astronaut, fireman, horse rider, king, knight, rugby player, and pirate.

Object

To make three correctly matched people.

Gameplay

During the game, the players may make any funny characters, but will need to exchange cards to make a correctly matched person.


The cards are shuffled and placed face downwards in a pile.
The youngest player takes a card and places it face upwards in front of them. Play then passes to the next person.
Players can only have one of each sort of card in front of them until they have made up a complete mismatched person. For example, if a player has a head card and a body card and then picks up another head card, they must choose which head card to keep and discard the other.
The discarded cards are placed in a pile face upwards next to the central pile. Players may then choose a card from either pile.
When a player has one complete mismatched person, they can start making a second person. They can only collect two mismatched people at any time. Once a player has two, they have to swap and discard cards in order to make a correctly matched person.
When a player has a correctly matched person, that set is moved to one side and play continues.
If the cards in the central pile run out, the top card from the discard pile is left face upwards on the table and the other cards are shuffled and returned face downwards to make a new central pile.


N.B. for two players - complete four correctly matched people.

The Winner

The winner is the first player to make three correctly matched people.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Uncle Scrooge's Gold Race
description: Playing as Huey, Dewey, Louie or Uncle Scrooge, be the first player to deposit your gold bars in Uncle Scrooge's bank and return to Scrooge's house. Ages 7 - 12.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Rapunzel
description:
Players race to be the first to rescue Rapunzel by climbing up her hair. To do this, players actually climb on the side of the board to Rapunzel, who is sitting on the top. The board depicts four of Rapunzel's braids, one for each player. Players advance up the side of he board by drawing colored tiles that are sitting face down. Each tile pictures the game's hero, a prince, with two different colors in the background. The first tile for each player is placed without restrictions, one color on the bottom and the other on top, but subsequent tiles must match the color facing up on the previous tile.

Players alternate choosing tiles from the face down pile. If they cannot place the tile, they return it after everyone has seen it. There are also witch tiles for use in a version of the game for older children. If a player draws a witch, all other players are forced to discard face-down the tile at the top of stack. The first player to rescue Rapunzel twice wins.

name: Łubudu Goblinowo
description:
Description from box back. Translated from Polish:

Card game about goblin fights. Players build their machines and use cards to defeat opponents and win. Planning and luck are elements which are needed to win.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Kreppuspilið
description:
Players use dice to move clock-wise on the outer rim of the board. They keep moving in circles until they have picked up 4 items and completed 4 tasks. Basically this involves landing on special squares or gaining said items or tasks through event cards. The items include a private jet, a huge house, etc. The tasks include getting a severence package, protesting outside parliament, etc. The game is won when a player has collected all 4 items and all 4 tasks, made his way to the big square in the middle - which is the press conference, where the player promptly resigns.

The heart of the game is found in the action cards. There are three types. "Recession" cards, "Booming Economy" cards and "Uncertain Times" cards. Each card has a heading, some text (event) and a result.

name: Medio-Milenio
description:
Medio-Milenio is a trivia game based on the relationship between Spain and Latin America. Its main theme is the encounter among the two worlds.
In the game, this encounter is reflected as a journey depicted on the board between Europe and America or the other way round. The players can choose where to start their journey and will be answering questions during it.
The questions have four different levels and are all related with the history, arts, tradition and facts of the two continents.

The game was released as a commemoration of the 500th anniversary of Christopher Columbus' reaching landfall in America in 1492.

name: Angeschmiert
description: This game contains unusual (patented by the author, actually) 4-sided dice. With these, the players roll color combinations with certain values (seen in a chart in the middle of the game board) to determine how fast they can move.

name: Obama!  The Game
description:
In Obama! the game, each player is attempting to win over the United States during the election of 2008 to be Obama! There are seven state cards that vary between one and three points. To win a state card, each player must build campaigns based on four areas: political, charisma, financial, and media. When a campaign reaches the cost of the state in each of the four categories, the player wins the state. In the end of the game, the player with the most state points wins.

Additional cards include "Yes We Can" cards featuring special abilities to secretly build a campaign and steal an opponent's state, or take a major supporter from their campaign.

Each card features vibrant colors, punchy political satire, and comical illustrations. Cards include: Hill Re-Clinton Endorsement, Paylin Botches another interview, Win over Bill O'really, and the Two-Headed Stewart Colbert Media Beast!

Home Page: http://www.obamacardgame.com/
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pattern Building

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Een spannend avonturenspel
description:
(translated from the dutch text on the back of the box)

A family game for 2-4 players aged 8 or older.

Story:

The terrible dragon has struck again, this time he has kidnapped 8 beautiful girls and hid them in his cave.

You - as the brave player - have decided to rescue the girls and return them to safety.

But be careful of the dragon or he will surely surpise and hurt you!

Aim:

Be the first to rescue 2 girls from the dragon's cave.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Metamorphosis
description:
Metamorphosis is an abstract strategy game played on a square board that was invented by Gregory Keith Van Patten in 2009.

This game is a unique combination of a connection game and the Reversi-style piece flipping.

Board initially setup like checkerboard pattern of white and black. Two players flip one piece at a turn trying to form a chain of pieces of their colors connecting the opposite edges of the board of the same color. On each turn players must decrease the number of groups on the board.

name: Drachenspiel
description: Known as the "Dragon Game," players attempt to capture the dragon by rolling specific colors that allow them to place control pegs in locations surrounding the dragon. But beware, the dragon can destroy these pieces around him as well. The player who gets his colored pegs in all four areas has successfully captured the dragon winning the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Der Spur nach
description:
Animal Tracks is a game for the whole family. It calls on all wild life friends to find and follow the tracks of the cat, the hare, the squirrel, the boar, the roebuck, and the fox, in the snow-covered forest. This requires attentiveness and accurate observation.
With his "man" each player follows one of the tracks imprinted in the snow. "Home" is the winter feeding-place situated in the middle. The player who reaches the feeding-place first is the winner.

name: Jogo Rapido
description: From the game's box: In Jogo Rapido you never know about what subject you will answer: history, TV, geography, sports, music, science, movies, Portuguese, cartoons or math. Who knows the answer rings the bell. Your team will have to be quick because time is short.

name: Het Ijsberenspel
description:
Do you know the most about nature, the environment, saving energy and durability? Prevent the melting of the ice and bring your polar bear to his food first.

By knowing a lot about nature, climate and durability you will get your polar bear moving fast across the ice. You have to toss the dice and move your polar bear or you will have to face a question card or chance card. If you answer a question wrong, the ice will melt and you will have to "win" the ice back.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: The Great Bug Hunt
description: From the box: Search and find the loveable bugs in this exciting adventure for kids. Race along the game board searching for six pictures that match the scenes from The Great Bug Hunt. In a wacky race for time, players use their memory to collect all six matching pictures in the correct order to win the game.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Svampspelet
description:
"The mushroom-game"
A card game where you are supposed to collect the most set of mushrooms.
The game consists of 53 mushrooms-cards with pictures of mushrooms that grow in Sweden.

name: Viiru ja Pesonen Syntymäpäiväpeli
description: Children's set collection / dice rolling / pulling victory points from bag game themed around characters Viiru and Pesonen (known from books and movies, in Nordic countries at least) having a birthday party. Winner is the one who gets his birthday cake ready first, plus has collected at least two birthday presents.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Overland
description:
By the designer:

Overland- a SMALL solitaire game of the 1864 Virginia campaign. Player controls the Union forces, with a simple reaction/retreat system controlling the Rebs.

Two sets of counters, in two styles, so you wont have to reprint them if you make a mistake when cutting and pasting. Rules look legalistic but I could explain the game in 5 minutes- about how long it takes to play the thing.

With one 8x11 inch map, seven 5/8 inch playing pieces, and four pages of rules, this is obviously meant for the break room, or the plane and train seat tray. So, no grumbling about how simple it is.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pärlspelet
description:
The board forms a miniature version of Chinese Checkers for two players, white and blue. Unlike that game, pieces that get jumped are here flipped over to change colour and allegiance. Each player has a "genuine pearl" (with the same colour on both sides, initially hidden among the other pieces) which must be protected from capture and brought to the opponent's end of the board. The game is a draw if both genuine pearls are eliminated before one of them can reach its goal.

The box sports a patent number as well as the legend "The International Inventors Exhibition Brussels 1967" and a couple of indistinct badges that may or may not represent awards. Rules are provided in Swedish and English.

name: Ab nach Hause!
description:
The bear, owl, cat, dog, mouse, and frog are hungry after a walk in the woods and want to go home as quickly as possible. Which three animals get home the fastest?

Game play: The playing cards in which three animals in different combinations are displayed, are mixed and put face down in a stack.
Then each child draws a card and remembers that the animals depicted. Every child now moves the animal figures forward, but only so many as there are participants in the game. A game ends when a child takes his third animal to the goal.

name: Big Brother Uncut
description: One of the most social games ever! Players must ask questions from one of the 4 categories - Relationships, Romance, Fantasy & Desire - and guess which answer belongs to which player, then move around the board by how well you really know each other. And just like the TV show, each player must nominate 2 players, and the reasons why they should be evicted, in point order. These nominations will be kept hidden until all players are past the eviction stage, at which point ALL will be revealed and the player with the most eviction points will head back to the start (no fun having nobody to play with).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Was ist mein Zoo ohne Tiere?!
description: Tiles are placed on the table (face-down). The meeples move onto those tiles to flip them over; sometimes there are animals shown on them. When this happens, the respective (wooden) animal is put onto the tile and the meeple has to drive it home (to the middle of the playing area). Different rules apply for driving different animals.

name: Slot Dice Game
description: Players roll the dice as if they were using a slot machine. The best combination breaks the bank. Entirely luck-based.

name: Made in the USA the Game
description:
Made in the USA is different than any other game you have ever played; it combines elements of card and board games and dominoes. Players create four lines of play using the four different patriotic suits. Players have the freedom to play as many cards as connect, or unit, to each other. For example, you may play a Seven, Eight and Nine of Stars, then play an Eight of Eagles. Play cards that connect to other players' cards. But when you change lines/suits then you will need to draw a "Changes in the Wind" card - so even when you think you have won, the round might not be finished.

User review: Each player is dealt a hand of cards. The number of cards dealt to each player varies with the number of participants. In turn, a player can add to the cards in the array in the middle of the table. Cards of the same rank are placed in the same row. The cards must be ranked in ascending order from top to bottom. Cards of the same suit must be placed in the same row. Event cards may be played at the beginning or end of one’s turn. The "Changes in the Wind" cards are a separate draw pile. These cards are drawn whenever a player begins a new row.
The hand is over when one player’s hand is depleted. The other players are penalized for cards remaining in their hands. The game is over when someone has been penalized 500 points. The player with the lowest score is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Tech Deck Dare to Skate
description:
In "Tech Deck: Dare to Skate Game", players pretend to be a group of skateboarders competing in the X Games, or just a group of locals showing their stuff in order to be crowned King of the Skatepark. Each player chooses a Tech Deck fingerboard and performs a trick in the special Skatepark
according to the card drawn. This is the way you move around the game board. If you can't perform the trick, you must wait until your next turn and try another.

Landing on a "Wipeout" makes you draw a card from that stack, but you can act goofy and have a lot of fun (plus you get to move a free space).

"Challenge" cards allow you a one time challenge with another player. If you can get to the finish before the other players do, you win!

The manual dexterity is fun, and you can honestly tell your friends you did a 50-50 Grind with a Nosestall this morning, but you wiped out on the Tick Tock after your Wallride!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hop på toget: Danmark rundt
description:
From the publisher:
Train Pillet is a traditional family game where players travel around Denmark crisscrossing and get interesting experiences in different cities. In this exciting game you must compete to be first submitted to the various stations. To change trains entails some risk, and bonus cards affect the game.
You win by getting through your given cities fastest!

name: Dawn of the Dice of the Dead
description:
Dawn of the Dice of the Dead is a cooperative horror survival game for 1-4 players based on the dice system created by Mads Brynnum for Dice of the Living Dead. The game adds an epic storyline and a multiplayer framework, as well as new mechanics. Players represent survivor groups who have a limited time to search through an abandoned mall to find supplies and materials that will help them be rescued, all the while fighting off ravenous zombies.

Dawn of the Dice of the Dead can be played solo by controlling 1-4 survivor groups, or cooperatively by 2-4 players.

As of March 2010, a print-and-play playtest version is expected to be available soon, as well as a Vassal module.

name: One Thing, Two Thing, Red Thing, Blue Thing
description:
From GTM Website:

"The goal of One Thing, Two Thing, Red Thing, Blue Thing is to have the most Victory Points at the end of six rounds. During the game, players collect Things (in four different colors) and have the option to trade Things in for Victory Points through the course of their actions. Each round consists of players placing their Action Chits in turn and one at a time onto eight Action Boxes. After which, each player must carry out the specific action listed on that box [ex: "Take 1 Thing From Any Player", "Discard Up to 4 Different Things Gaining 1 Victory Point Per Thing Discarded"].

To play One Thing, Two Thing, Red Thing, Blue Thing you will need the components listed in the lefthand box (they do not necessarily need to be the listed colors). "

name: Quikopoly
description:
This is a Monopoly game
From the back of outer cover:

Warning:Playing Quikopoly may be addictive. Do not operate heavy equipment while playing the game. Playing Quikopoly while consuming alcoholic beverages may cause severe mood swings, headaches and nausea. Children under 12 should not be allowed to play the game as adults may become depressed when the child wins the game. Quikopoly dollars are not legal tender and may only be used to purchase merchandise at QuikTrip competitors.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sverige-spelet
description:
From the rules:

A family game with both difficult and easy questions about swedish geography, history, culture and nature.

Sverige-spelet is both exciting and educational. Start with dealing out city-cards. Then the players must travel to those cities on the cards they've been dealt. It's important to have a cunning travelplan - and also to be lucky and knowledgable about Sweden - to win the game.

name: Rölli: Nurinkurinen noppapeli
description:
Finnish children's character Rölli and his friends walk in the Rölli forest, trying to stay in the forest as long as possible.

Players roll dice and move their characters accordingly, gaining action cards. The cards help characters to stay in the forest longer. The winner is the last character still in the forest.

Actions in the cards: 5 steps back, 10 steps back, roll dice to step back, stop current move, everyone else roll dice to move forward.

name: Das große Welt der Wunder Wissensspiel
description:
A trivia game as a tie-in of the (in Germany) popular-Science-show "Welt der Wunder" (World of wonders).
Players move arounf the board, answering questions or have to memorize shapes or words.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Top Familiespel
description:
Top Familiespel is a game where players try to obtain all products listed on a shopping list. They do so by rolling a die to move on the board, trying to get to the items they need. The first person to get all the items and return to the cash register is the winner.

The pawns are in the shape of shopping carts, made from plastic.
The items come in the form of thick cardboard pieces which will be randomly placed on the board. Each card has a picture of the product printed on it. (User summary)
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen Robot Heroes Game
description:
From the Box...

"Choose to play as the heroic Optimus Prime or the brutal Megatron in an epic clash of the Cybertron's most powerful leaders. Th action is nonstop as you duel for control of Cairo. Who will prevail in the conflict between Autobots and Decepticons? You decide."

This game include two Transformer figures that are placed on a square board, two 6-sided dice, two decks of cards (one for each players), and the game board. The players take turns moving their Transformer around the board. The spot where the player places their Transformer decides what actions they can take. These include engaging in battle or drawing a card. The cards provide the battle strength and additional special abilities only available to each specific Transformer.

Battle damage is tracked by flipping over tiles that combine to show the image of the Transformer. On one side is the completely damage-free version of the Transformer. Once the Transformer starts to take damage, the tiles are flipped, revealing on the other side the damage portion of the Transformer.

The winner of the game is the last Transformer standing.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schmidts Katze
description:
In Schmidts Katze you want to be the cat who tracks down five mice before any of the other felines in the household.

To set up the game, place seven of the mice tokens – each of which is different – in seven of the eight slots around the game board; place the eighth mouse on the edge of the box, which holds the game board inside it. Give each player a set of eight mouse tokens, then place the six cat paws around the box.

On a turn, roll the die. If you roll a number, move the cat figure around the box, then take whichever action is on the cat paw where you stop moving: Swap two mice, make a mouse go into (or come out of) hiding, or peek at a hidden mouse. If you roll the cat, spin the cat spinner on the game board, then try to be the first to lay out the proper mouse token from the eight in your hand. Whoever is first with the correct answer keeps thattoken cat side up; the first player with five such tokens wins.

name: Highwayman
description:
Cards are divided into 4 colours - green, yellow, blue and red. Each card names a coaching inn so the play of cards will eventually look like a coach route.
More tactical play can be the use of a Highwayman card (which causes a blockage on the route, but can be countered by a Bow Street Runner card).
The first player to play all their cards wins.

name: Action Foreign Legion
description: Another game in the 'Action' series, by A-Toys. A very low-complexity game, it comes with a generic mapboard and 2 sets of plastic miniature soldiers. The aim is to capture squares on the map at the rear of your opponent's lines. But neither player knows the other's objective squares. Dice are used for movement, and cards add variation and random factors.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scramble
description:
Contents
1 Game Board.
4 Cars.
16 Shops(4 Green/12 Red).
8 Traffic Lights.
8 Pedestrians.
4 One Way Street Arrows.
16 Treasury Notes(Two Denominations).
1 Pack of Traffic Control Cards.
8 Conical Obstruction Pieces.
1 Set of Rules.

Each player sets out from their home garage on a shopping expedition by car. They first head for the Bank to draw money sufficient to cover their purchases (Note: No cash machines or credit cards 55 years ago). Then the players proceed to the various shops to spend the money. Finally, the players return to the Bank to draw money to take home.

The first player having made the required value of purchases and arrived back in their garage with the correct amount of money, wins the game.

Look out for traffic lights, pedestrians, one way streets and obstructions as you shop.

name: Jack der Krähenschreck
description: Player are the crows who try to get some corn from the cornfield but they must beware Jack the Scarecrow who mostly sleeps but wakes up if somebody took the wrong corn. He must give back all corns he gathers this round. Who has gathered the required number of cobs, wins. In a variant, you collect all the corn of a color. corn of a color.

name: Poepie Knor
description:
Poepie Knor is a game in which 2-4 player try to rescue their piglets from his dirt bath. But if you hear a fart your piglets sinks deeper in the mud.

Goal of the game:
Be the 1st player to gather 4 cards (1 to 4) so your piglet gets out of his mud bath.

Each player gets a piglet and a bath. On his move he turns the big pig (spinner), depending on the sound the pig makes the player takes an action:
- the pig grunts. The player indicated by the pigs nose takes a card
- the pig honks. The 1st player to press the button on the pigs back takes a card
- the pig whistles. The player indicated by the pigs nose steals a card from another player
- the pig farts. The player indicated by the pigs nose places a card from his bath next to the board.

The 1st player to first collect a set (1-4) in the correct order is the winner.

name: Fußball: Dinos
description:
A memory game for 2 - 4 eager players with dribbling skills.

Soccer heroes move forward! This memory game requires not only excellent footwork but also sharp minds. The player who remembers where his own dinosaurs stand will be able to make the best passes and score the most goals. Hold on! When the referee blows the whistle, the dinosaurs are rearranged causing the players to get into puzzle trouble and test their memories.

(from rulebook)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Sports

name: Survival Camp: Kickstarter Exclusive Threat Cards
description:
This is a set of additional Threat cards for the "Survival Camp" game. These cards were available exclusively to those who pledged to support the "Survival Camp" game project on Kickstarter.

The 5 Kickstarter Exclusive Threat Cards are:

GOLF BALL SIZED HAIL DESTROYS ALL OF YOUR DEFENSE UNLESS GUARDED.
ILLNESS STRIKES YOUR CAMP. DISCARD YOUR TENT IN FEAR OF CONTAMINATION.
RATS INFESTED YOUR CROPS. LOSE 1 COMPONENT OF YOUR GARDEN.
PACK OF HUNGRY DOGS THREATEN CROPS. FEED THEM YOUR GARDEN OR ELSE.
WATER WAS NOT PURIFIED PROPERLY. DISCARD ALL WATER COMPONENTS.


Add these extra threat cards into the deck with the other Threat cards to make the game a little more challenging.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Skill Shot
description:
Action game for two players, related to Basketball or Netball. Each play at opposite ends of the board. In front of you there is a row of buttons. The board has a number of indentations, into which the ball will settle. When it does, if you press the right button, it will be ejected upward and forward. Of course, your opponent is trying to do the same thing, so speed is essential. There Are 10 Different Pitch Positions to Shoot From and the score is kept by a sliding mechanism on each side of the board.

Most 'baskets', wins

name: Was gibt es Neues? Das Spiel
description:
Objective: gain as many points as possible to get 'goodies';
player with most goodies wins;
a player reads the question (quiz/multiple choice...) - all are challenged finding the correct answer...
or being 'creative' or 'humorous' (= additional points);
'faked' answers lead to points considered by others being o.k.

remarks:
recommended minimum age - printed at the box: 8
due to mechanics, questions...: addult

name: Pitch It!
description:
Pitch It! - Who's Got the Million Dollar Idea? is a dynamic and social game requiring blissfully creative nonsense, but also a keen eye and sharp ear for what’s marketable. It is both fun and challenging! You are charged with the task of selling conventional products to unconventional clientele.

HOW TO PLAY
A combination of ‘What?’ card (product) and ‘Who?’ card (target audience) is picked. The goal for you (or your team) is to sell the ‘what’ to the ‘who’. For example, ‘potting soil’ needs to be sold to ‘police officers’, or ‘bath toys’ to ‘bankers’, or ‘sunscreen lotion’ to ‘NASCAR fans’…you get the idea. Summon your creative mojo to come up with a catchy idea for product title, slogan, and logo. Then pitch your best ideas to your friends. After that, sit back and listen to what others have done. Vote for the best idea presented – it may be yours, but nobody can vote for themselves. The winner of the most votes gets the $1 Million prize for that round. Play more rounds until someone reaches the ultimate goal of $5 Million.

name: Travel Monopoly
description:
A travel-sized version of Monopoly, with all of the pieces of the standard game (including Chance and Community Chest cards), just smaller, unlike Monopoly: The Portable Property Trading Game, which has some game play differences, such as using three dice and a chart rather than Chance and Community Chest cards.

Gameplay

On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal

The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele, Waddingtons

name: Quiz Granny o Cywilizacji: część 2
description:
In "Quiz Granny o Cywilizacji: część 2" (Granna's Quiz about Civilization: part 2) players try to answer correctly and reach the place in the middle of the board. The board consist of 6 paths (one for each player). Each path consist of 15 fields/points. If a player answers correctly, he/she rolls the die and move. The players have to stop before barricades, but also have the possibility to move them to stop other players. The first player in the middle of the board is declared the winner.

The surrounding world is changing all the time. New inventions displace old ones. Scientist discover more and more secrets of nature. On movie scenes, workshops and laboratories new work is being done continually. Welcome to fun. Civilization achievments from the Valley of the Kings to the Silicon Valley are just before you.

Let's play! Check your knowledge! Learn new things! Good luck!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hoch Lebe Opa!
description:
Long Live Grandad is a card game appropriately suitable for the different generations within a family to play together.

The 66 cards are shuffled and each player is dealt 6 cards. In a turn a player hopes to lay face-up one card that will add more length to his current family. Each family must begin with an Opa Solo Card. Once started a family can be extended by adding a numbered card. After the Opa card has started the family, any card may increase its length. Subsequent cards must be the same number as the previous card or higher than it.

A family can be made safe by playing a Family Card. The value of your family is thus safe-guarded. Next turn, you can start a new family. When the Draw Pile is exhausted, the round ends and scores are recorded for the value of cards in your protected families and in your current family at the round end.

Oma (Grandma) cards can make another player start a family all over again. Joker cards can represent any card.

The first to 60 points, wins.

Contents
11 Opa-Solo-Cards
Opa-Punktekarten (mit den Wertigkeiten 1 - 3)
11 Oma-Stichkarten
11 Familien-Karten
2 Jokers

name: Top 3: Kultserien
description:
Which TV series has more consequences: Dallas, the Black Forest clinic or Star Trek? And whose rates were better?

The categories are so specific that even players who are very much interested in the given topic (like Cult TVseries in this case), probably will not know the correct answers. Instead, every player has to do the best guess.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Maisy's Big Floor Game
description:
Maisy's Big Floor Game is a game for children from 3 to 8 years old. The gameboard is a big sheet and the game is supposed to be played on the floor. The players are represented by big Maisy Mouse figures and the racetrack is a railway with different colors. There are four special stops at the railway: sea, park, playground and farm, players get a special tile when arriving at each stop. Movement is determined by a spinner and the spinner shows both a color and a number from 1-5. Players can decide themselves to move according to the colors or the numbers (for the bigger children). The first player who arrives at the end-station with the four special tiles wins the game.
The game looks nice for the young children and although it is supposed to play from 3 years old seems that it can easily be played with younger children as well because all materials and figures are from big, thick and strong pieces of cardboard.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Trains
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Deutschland entdecken
description:
Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Deutschland entdecken is a roll-and-move and trivia game in which children learn about Germany and its sixteen states. In fact, the box contains two different games:

1) Bärenstarkes Reisespiel (ages 5 and up)

In this roll-and-move game players visit the regional capital cities. The first player to reach a city wins the state's coat of arms (chips that are placed on designated spaces on the board). Players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn according to the result of the die roll in the direction of their choice. If they reach a yellow space with a red border, they get to take the coat of arms of that federal state. Some cities can also be reached by train or plane, but to use these, the player first has to earn a train or plane action chip. Action chips are collected by landing on action spaces. Apart from train or plane tickets, there are also action chips that gain or lose you a turn or win you a coat of arms. The game ends when all coats of arms have been collected. The player with the most coats of arms wins.

2) Mauseschlaue Wissenstour (ages 7 and up)

The aim of this game is to collect as many cards and coats of arms as possible. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn according to the result of the die roll. If they land on an orange space, one of the other players takes a card and reads the tasks. If the active player succeeds in answering the question or performing the action, she wins the card. Each card also displays the coat of arms of a state. When a player has won two cards assigned to the same state, she gets to take the coat of arms chip of that state as well. Coat of arms chips that other players have won can be taken from them if a player collects more cards about the same state than its current owner. The game ends after one or two rounds (players' choice) as soon as a player reaches her starting space. The player with the highest number of points – with a card being worth one point, and a coat of arms two – wins.

name: Mega Bloks Match and Build
description:
Each player starts with a pawn and a picture of a Mega Bloks creature. The goal of the game is to collect the blocks needed to build your creature.

To do this, you move your pawn around on a board using a spinner. If you land on a blue space, you can flip it over to reveal a picture of a block. If it is part of your creature you can collect the block. If not, return the space face down.

Players continue spinning and moving around the board revealing spaces and collecting blocks until someone collects all the blocks for their creature. Other spaces on the board include grey spaces, which do nothing, spin again spaces which let you take another turn, and 'go-anywhere' spaces which let you place your pawn on any space you want.

name: Math Room
description: In Math Room, you'll do basic addition or subtraction trying to be the first to cover all the windows on your numbered board. Solve the problem on your key that corresponds to the color just rolled on the die. If anyone wants to try a different problem, they race to be first to ring the bell. This lets them flip over their key and do the problem on the back instead. This game is a great way to practice plus and minus with answers ranging from 1 to 10 - perfect for counting on small fingers or toes!

name: Magic Cooking
description:
A long time ago, a little before the Middle Ages, flourished the kingdom of Abraxas. Queen Gourmandine IV ruled the kingdom of gastronomes with an iron fist in a velvet potholder. Each year, the greatest magicians of the known world competed to create new recipes as delectable as they could. It's now Midsummer, and the Abraxians are looking forward to that special tournament day when the most powerful magicians of the kingdom face off before everyone else gets to chown down!

In Magic Cooking, you take the role of one of these magicians and use the available ingredients the best way that you can. Whose cooking will reign supreme?

name: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie
description: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie is a fast-paced card game in which players choose a random character, get some cards and chips, then attack other players to try to win their chips, knocking other players out when their chip supply vanishes. The last player standing wins!

name: Lettermix
description:
Card game from the Dubbel en dwars series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides.

In Lettermix everyone plays simultaneously. You try to play a card with a letter which matches (also in color) a letter of the top card of the discard pile. When you play a card with more equal letters, you may give a card to each other player. The first player that has played all his cards wins the game immediately.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Chikken
description:
Chikken is a game of dice, risk, strategy, and luck. It's designed for two to six players of any age, as long as they can understand how to make matches with dice.

The goal is to get as high a score as possible without losing your turn. To do this, you roll five special dice (four white, one red), each with one side blank. The red die is called the "Danger Die." If at any time you roll all white blanks, or you roll a red blank, your turn ends without scoring.

You score points by making three/four/five-of-a-kind matches or a straight (1-2-3-4-5). After each roll, you can stop and bank your points (gaining bonus points for matches, plus the total of all spots on the dice), or you can set aside dice of your choice and reroll what's left. However, you MUST set aside any blank white dice after each roll.

An added element of risk management comes when you have a bonus score available, such as from four-of-a-kind. When you do, you have the extra choice of hanging onto those bonus points and rerolling all five dice, with the bonus score still in jeopardy if you should roll blanks and lose your turn. This lets you "start over" with a higher starting value, but all the same risks of losing your turn.

Educational Value

Chikken teaches kids to understand and analyze risks. For younger kids, it's a matching game, and for slightly older ones, they can count up spots, or add up the numbers as they go. And it's still fun for everyone!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Sherlock Holmes: The Card Game – Designer Edition
description:
You are the detective. Play your cards. Solve the crime.

Sherlock Holmes: The Card Game was originally published in Europe and sold out very quickly. Now, for the first time, this classic game will be printed and available in North America.

Excalibre Games is proud to release a Designer edition of this game with the highest quality components and enhanced artwork. Included are two decks of linen cards. Rules are in full 4-color and printed on thick gloss stock. The score pad is also on gloss stock. The box is specially UV coated both top and bottom.

This Designer edition contains new cards with capabilities not found in the original game, yielding very different game play from the earlier edition. In addition, there are also promotional cards which are available separately.

Overview

3-8 players play detectives trying to arrest a villain. Secretly, one of the players is the villain, and the other players must try to deduce who it is and play an Arrest card to catch them. The villain's goal is to use all of their cards, and then discard their Villain card to escape. Players earn points for either making and arrest, or escaping as the Villain.

name: Mini Quiz
description:
MINI QUIZ is designed in order to offer knowledge in the most entertaining way. It is charming for kids and adults.

It's a trivia game with 1250 questions. It contains 6 categories of questions: History, Natural environment, Sports, Arts, Geography and General questions.

The game consists of a game board, on which you move forward rolling a dice whenever you answer a question correctly.
The first one to come to the last region of board and answers correctly is the winner.

It's a lot of fun with a great variety of questions and noble competition!

Published ca. 1995.

name: Joko gegen Klaas
description:
Score most bonus points managaging different tasks successfully/eliminate your opponent.

2 players/teams

Move along on a world map; draw appropriate cards and try to fulfill tasks within a given time (can be a bit peculiar like:
eat certain amount of mustard or
place all cards on a table; your opponent must blow them away).

Tools like spinner, egg timer, 6d-coloured die... are integrated.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Paddy O'Shea's Golf Card Game
description:
A variant of the classic golf card game in which each player puts cards before them on the table in a grid. Each player plays new cards striving for a low scoring grid (sets do not count against you) The game is played over 9 rounds, like a 9 hole golf game.

Paddy O'Shea's version of the game introduces special cards to a pair of traditional 52 card decks. The special cards include 19th Hole Wild Cards (worth -5 points) and "Good for Nothing" (0 point) mulligan cards. There are also regular jokers and rules that differ slightly from the classic game.

name: Chuggington Let's Ride the Rails! Game
description:
From the box:

Oh bumpers! The animals have escaped from the Safari Park! Only one has stayed behind. Work together to help Wilson, Brewster and Koko travel around Chuggington as they pick up the remaining animals. Discover who decided to stay with Mtambo in the Safari Park. Guess correctly and you're a winner!

A children's game based on the Chuggington series. This is a cross between a spin-and-move and a very simple Clue type guessing game.

8 animals are in Safari Park. They are tuned face down so no one knows which is which. One animal is marked as the Mystery Animal and will remain unseen until guessed.

Players take turns spinning the dial then moving the appropriate train the spun number of spaces. If a train lands on a station it picks-up one animal from Safari Park.

On a player's turn he can guess the Mystery Animal to win.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains
publishers: I Can Do That Games, Wonder Forge

name: Monopoly: Holiday Property Bond Edition
description:
monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Holiday Property Bond company, located in the U.K..
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Sjov Gennem Europa
description:
Travel from Aalborg to Copenhagen via Norway, Iceland, Scotland, Ireland, Wales, England, France, Spain, Italy, Greece, Austria, Belguim, Holland, Germany, Finland and Sweden.

The first to reach the goal in Copenhagen wins. But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards.
